description: OUR infrastructure is inexcusable, much of our public education is miserable and one of our leading presidential candidates is a know-nothing, say-anything egomaniac who yanks harder every day at the tattered fabric of civil discourse and fundamental decency in this country.

title: Remembrances of Depression Economics
description: A bit more musing inspired by Brad DeLongs decision to repost his old, rather negative review of my 1999 The Return of Depression Economics  which I think he means to imply was a review that got it mostly wrong, while I got it much more right than he realized at the time.

title: Uncertain Economics Influence Brexit Talk
description: LONDON  Britain is one of Europes strongest economic performers, having emerged from the financial crisis of the last decade faster and less burdened by debt than competitors like France, Italy and Spain. Unemployment is at a 10-year low of 5.1 percent. London, vibrant and second only to New York as a global financial hub, hums a siren song to the young and ambitious across Europe.

title: Medicare Is Often Overbilled by Hospices, and Pays Twice for Some Drugs
description: WASHINGTON  Hospices often bill Medicare for a higher level of care than patients need, and Medicare often pays twice for the prescription drugs provided to people who are terminally ill, federal investigators say in a new report. The extra cost to Medicare was put at more than $260 million a year.

title: Are Some Terrorism Deaths More Equal Than Others?
description: KELLY VAUGHAN of Brooklyn, a Times reader, lived in Istanbul for a year, and so has followed the media coverage of the violence in Turkey with great interest.

title: Trombone Shorty
description: Troy Andrews, perhaps better known as Trombone Shorty, is a multi-instrumentalist and music producer from New Orleans. In addition to leading his own band, Orleans Avenue, he has played or recorded with a range of performers, including Dierks Bentley, Lenny Kravitz and the Foo Fighters.

title: Hillary Clinton Appeals to New Yorkers by Going After One: Donald Trump
description: Clinton New York Ad

title: Less Disinfectant, More Rioja
description: NOT long ago, I listened to a couple of radio talk-show hosts taking calls about a study showing that, despite airlines best sterilization efforts, potentially deadly bacteria thrived on plane surfaces. Tray tables, armrests, window shades, the kangaroo-pouch depths of a seat pocket  the very few things I thought I could safely manipulate inside my designated clutch of personal space  could be the death of me or anyone on the plane.

title: Golden States Quest to Break Bulls Record Grows Harder
description: The Golden State Warriors absorbed a blow in their pursuit of history when they lost to the Boston Celtics on Friday night at Oracle Arena. The defeat dropped the Warriors record to 68-8, which means that they will need to win five of their final six games to eclipse the 1995-96 Chicago Bulls, who went 72-10, for the best regular-season record in N.B.A. history.

title: Standings After Puzzle 3
description: SPECIAL POST  The standings after Puzzle 3 are up, and besides Dr. Fill, who is ranked first but doesnt really count because he resides inside Matt Ginsburgs laptop, we have (say it with me now) Dan Feyer in the human lead with a score of 4400, followed by David Plotkin in third place with 4375, Howard Barkin, Anne Ellison and Tyler Hinman tied for 4th place with scores of 4375 (Mr. Plotkin might have had all perfect puzzles).

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Concussions, the N.F.L.s Profits and Priorities

title: Alaska Airlines Said to Be Near $2 Billion Deal for Virgin America
description: Virgin America, founded on the premise of being a cool airline shuttling people from New York to California in style, is near a deal to sell itself to a competitor originally created to ferry people 330 miles across Alaska.

title: Victoria Azarenka Wins Miami Open, Completing a Rare Feat
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Victoria Azarenka captured her third Miami Open title and her first since 2011 with a 6-3, 6-2 victory over Svetlana Kuznetsova on Saturday.

title: Penguins Pour It On Against Islanders
description: There was plenty of palpable playoff race tension Saturday afternoon on top of the heightened atmosphere present whenever the Pittsburgh Penguins and the Islanders meet.

title: Oklahoma Has a Familiar Look, Now Rarely Seen
description: HOUSTON  Its been hard to miss Buddy Hield.

title: Donald Trump Says NATO is Obsolete, UN is Political Game
description: RACINE, Wis.  Donald J. Trump on Saturday went further than ever before in his criticism of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, telling a crowd here that he would be fine if NATO broke up.

title: UConns Seniors Are 2 Wins From a Feat Never Accomplished
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Put aside for the moment the womens sports revolution and its ever-accompanying and sometimes distressing social commentary. On Saturday at the womens Final Four, the day before the national semifinals, it was time to reflect on the 80 basketball minutes impeding Connecticuts bid for an unprecedented fourth consecutive national championship.

title: E.U. Suspects Russian Agenda in Migrants Shifting Arctic Route
description: KANDALAKSHA, Russia  So many decrepit Soviet-era cars carried migrants into Europe from this frozen Russian town in recent months that border officials in Finland, who confiscate the rust-bucket vehicles as soon as they cross the frontier, watched in dismay as their parking lot turned into a scrapyard.

title: Standings After the Infamous Puzzle 5
description: SPECIAL POST  After the nefarious Puzzle 5 by Patrick Berry, Jeopardy! champion Joon Pahk has risen to third place in the 2016 A.C.P.T. rankings.

title: Jumping to Conclusions
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Hi there. No, youre not insane. Ill explain what just happened to you, but first, take the time to read the title of the puzzle.

title: Crime Spike in St. Louis Traced to Cheap Heroin and Mexican Cartels
description: ST. LOUIS  Clara Walker, a mother of nine and grandmother of eight, was peering out the window of her home three years ago after hearing what she initially thought were gunshots from a television crime show.

title: They Cannot Remove Me by Force: A Strongman on Afghan Infighting
description: MAZAR-I-SHARIF, Afghanistan  One of the most powerful players in Afghanistan, Atta Muhammad Noor, says he would be willing to step down from his post as a northern provincial governor  as soon as the central government reappoints him to the spot.

title: Nyquist Wins in Florida, Establishing Himself as the Favorite in Kentucky
description: HALLANDALE BEACH, Fla.  The race was billed as East versus West, an unprecedented clash between undefeated Triple Crown heavyweights from opposite coasts, but it did not quite live up to the hype. It did, however, produce an undisputed favorite heading into the Kentucky Derby on May 7.

title: 2 Republican Senators Revoke Support for Garland Hearings
description: WASHINGTON  The wall of Republican opposition to the nomination of Judge Merrick B. Garland to the Supreme Court has been shored up by two Republican senators revoking their support for holding confirmation hearings.

title: Villanova Wipes Out Oklahoma and a Record to Reach the Title Game
description: HOUSTON  In a 95-51 demolition of Oklahoma on Saturday night, Villanova not only punched its ticket to the national title game but also set a standard for Final Four blowouts. Through 78 Final Fours  dating to the first, in 1939, which also featured the Wildcats and the Sooners  44 points is the largest margin of victory.

title: Jesse Webster, an Inmate Serving Life, Turned to His Last Hope: President Obama
description: Wednesday was another in an endless blur of Wednesdays at the Greenville federal prison in Southern Illinois. An inmate named Jesse Webster, serving a life sentence without parole for a nonviolent first offense, was poised to take a typing test, his fingers hovering over the keyboard  when his name resounded over the intercom.

title: Delegate Fight Casts North Dakota in New Campaign Role: Relevance
description: FARGO, N.D.  North Dakota is not accustomed to being one of the way stations on the path to the White House. Given its meager number of delegates and its tiny, remote media markets, it is rare for a presidential campaign to give this state the time of day.

title: North Carolina Tops Syracuse in Battle of Teams With Stature and Stigma
description: HOUSTON  Renegades, thats what they were, banding together in opposition and commiseration Saturday night, like enemies slowly realizing that their differences were outweighed by what they had in common.

title: Suspicious Truck Prompts Evacuation in Times Square
description: An unattended rental truck with wires protruding from its dashboard and gas canisters behind its seats touched off a brief evacuation in a part of Times Square on Saturday night, the police said.

title: Mikhail Lesins Strange Death in U.S. Follows a Fall From Russias Elite
description: WASHINGTON  As happens sometimes with wealthy Russians, Mikhail Y. Lesin found his business and political fortunes in Vladimir Putins Russia crumbling. Once an influential player in Mr. Putins rise to power, he was abruptly dismissed from his position in the Kremlins powerful media apparatus. Perhaps sensing that things could get worse, he seemed to be preparing for a new life in America.

title: Poised to Celebrate, Rangers Fall to Lowly Sabres
description: Midway through what could have been a happy night for the Rangers, goaltender Henrik Lundqvist, with a gray cap low on his head and a towel around his neck, hunched in the far corner of his teams bench, glumly staring at the floor. His ice time had amounted to less than 21 minutes.

title: Gato Barbieri, Latin Jazz Trailblazer With a Saxophone, Is Dead at 83
description: Gato Barbieri, a saxophonist whose highly emotional playing helped expand the audience for Latin jazz, and whose music for the film Last Tango in Paris won a Grammy Award, died on Saturday in New York. He was 83.

title: Fiance of Sean Bell, Killed in 2006 Police Shooting, Endorses Hillary Clinton
description: Nicole Bell, whose fianc, Sean Bell, became a symbol of tensions between black communities and the police after he was shot and killed by New York officers on the morning of their wedding day, has endorsed Hillary Clinton two weeks before the New York primary.

title: Our Man in Gadgetland
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this piece, Gregory Schmidt, who writes for The Timess Gadgetwise column, explains which products excite him and which he relegates to the trash heap.

title: Prianca Naik, Meelan Patel
description: Dr. Prianca Ashok Naik and Dr. Meelan Nick Patel were married April 2 at Rockleigh Country Club in Rockleigh, N.J. Pandit Prabhakar Sharma, a Hindu priest, officiated.

title: Samantha Baer, Peter Dumoulin
description: Samantha Douglas Baer, a daughter of Carla M. Baer and William L. Baer of Merritt Island, Fla., was married there on April 2 to Peter Charles Dumoulin, a son of Shelley E. Dumoulin and Charles L. Dumoulin of Cincinnati. The brides maternal grandfather, Arthur D. Moore of St. Augustine, Fla., a notary public, officiated at the home of Skippy Lober, a neighbor of the brides parents.

title: Brooke Travis, Warren Geiger
description: Brooke Keller Travis, a daughter of Christine Travis Durham of Bay Head, N.J., and Donald S. Travis of Jupiter, Fla., was married April 1 to Warren Eric Geiger, a son of Martha J. Geiger and Ronald L. Geiger of East Brunswick, N.J. Pastor Glenroy Clarke, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Round Hill Hotel and Villas in Montego Bay, Jamaica, with David Karraker, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, taking part.

title: Jaime Blanc, Derek Feinman
description: Jaime Leigh Blanc and Derek Phillip Feinman were married April 2 at Pier Sixty at Chelsea Piers in New York. Rabbi Dennis Math officiated.

title: Julie Cannold, Michael Biblowit
description: Julie Taylor Cannold, the daughter of Gail Buck Cannold and Scott B. Cannold of Rye, N.Y., was married April 2 to Michael James Biblowit, the son of Myra J. Biblowit and Charles E. Biblowit of Manhattan. Rabbi Angela W. Buchdahl officiated at the Mandarin Oriental in Manhattan.

title: Eleanor Pishny, Justus Meyer
description: Eleanor Rose Pishny, a daughter of Dr. Janice R. Pishny and Lyle D. Pishny of Stilwell, Kan., was married April 2 to Justus Scott Meyer, the son of Elizabeth D. Meyer and Jack R. Meyer of Cambridge, Mass. The Rev. Sally H. Hubbell, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Pauls Church in Healdsburg, Calif.

title: Sydney McCutcheon and Timothy Hirsch: He Married the Girl From Sunday School
description: Sydney Elizabeth McCutcheon, the daughter of Heather L. McCutcheon and the stepdaughter of Daniel P. Hitchcock of Montclair, N.J., was married April 2 to Timothy William Hirsch, the son of Deborah Walsh Hirsch and Peter B. Hirsch, also of Montclair. The Rev. Brenda G. Husson performed the ceremony at St. James Episcopal Church in New York, where she is the rector.

title: Makena Coscarelli and William Marfuggi III: Dancing With the Stars Leads to Their First Dance
description: Makena Kate Coscarelli and William Eugene Marfuggi III were married April 2 at the Fig House, an event space in Los Angeles. P. J. Byrne, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Sabrina Ashjian, Sean Brunton
description: Sabrina Denise Ashjian and Sean Michael Brunton were married April 2 at the Four Seasons Hotel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills. Armand Arabian, a retired justice for the Supreme Court of California, officiated.

title: Allison Magier, Travis Stier
description: Allison Beth Magier, the daughter of Dr. Carol P. Magier and Dr. David P. Magier of Roslyn, N.Y., was married April 2 to Travis Daniel Stier, a son of Shirley A. Stier and Lesley H. Stier of Old Westbury, N.Y. Rabbi Susan Mitrani Knapp officiated at Fresh Meadow Country Club in Lake Success, N.Y.

title: Karen Salva, Benjamin Stern
description: Karen Tongco Salva and Benjamin Josiah Stern were married April 2 at the Mystic Arts Center in Mystic, Conn. Dr. Andrew Engel, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated; Hannah Smotrich, a cousin of the groom, assisted in a ceremony with Jewish influences by reading the wedding contract.

title: Sarah St. Lifer, Kris Yenbamroong
description: Sarah St. Lifer and Kris Yenbamroong were married April 2 at Night & Market, a Thai restaurant in Los Angeles where the bride is the manager and the groom is the chef and owner. Brian Considine, a friend of the groom who became a minister of American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Ebony Allen, Etienne Toussaint
description: Ebony Allen, a daughter of Lisa M. Allen of Charlotte, N.C., and Ronald V. Sumpter Sr. of Ridgeland, S.C., is to be married April 3 to Etienne Clement Toussaint, a son of Bernadette F. Myler of the Bronx, and the late Raymond Toussaint, who lived in Valley Stream, N.Y. The Rev. Alfred A. Owens, Jr., a Pentecostal minister, is to officiate at the Pawleys Plantation Golf and Country Club on Pawleys Island, S.C.

title: Pascale Bibi, Oliver Board
description: Eva Pascale Smith Bibi and Oliver James Board were married April 2 at a private beach residence belonging to Jason Harel, a friend of the bride and her father, in Poste Lafayette, Mauritius. Wahid Lalloo, a principal civil status officer for the Republic of Mauritius, officiated.

title: Kathryn Espiritu, Lauren Philson
description: Kathryn Antoinette Espiritu, a daughter of Gloria U. Espiritu and Antonio A. Espiritu of Teaneck, N.J., was married April 2 to Lauren Fay Philson, the daughter of Patricia A. Philson of Grove City, Pa., and Ronald E. Philson of Mercer, Pa. Matthew Beck, a friend of Ms. Espiritu who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at Deity, an event space in Brooklyn.

title: Mariel Wenzel, Justin Jensen
description: Mariel Anne Wenzel, a daughter of Margaret M. Wenzel and William C. Wenzel of Bay Shore, N.Y., was married there April 1 to Justin Clifford Jensen, a son of Lisa A. Jensen and Herman C. Jensen, also of Bay Shore. The Rev. David Atanasio, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Patrick Roman Catholic Church.

title: Erica Kochi, Gabor Cselle
description: Erica Mae Kochi and Gabor Cselle were married April 2 at the deYoung Museum in San Francisco. Dorian M. Needham, a friend of the couple who was appointed a deputy marriage commissioner for the occasion by the City and County of San Francisco, officiated.

title: Katharine Jackson, Cecyl Hobbs
description: Katharine Elizabeth Jackson and Wilbert Cecyl Hobbs were married April 2 at Old South Church in Boston. The Rev. Nancy S. Taylor, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony.

title: Francesca Gilberti, Ryan Burke
description: Francesca Tobie Gilberti, the daughter of Ellen Tobie Gilberti and Lawrence F. Gilberti of Philadelphia, was married April 2 to Ryan James Burke, a son of Pamela S. Burke and Brendan J. Burke of Salisbury, Mass. The Rev. Claire Dietrich Ranna, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of St. Mary the Virgin in San Francisco, with the Rev. Elizabeth Irvine, a Presbyterian minister and an aunt of the bride, taking part.

title: For the Mets, a Pitching Coach Who Loves Walks
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  It was still dark when Dan Warthen emerged from the Mets spring training complex around 6:45 a.m. Tuesday. He wore a track suit and sneakers and had a Fitbit watch on his right hand. Spring training was winding down, and Warthen thought he should spend his morning walk picking up a treat for the coaches room, something that everyone would enjoy.

title: Corrections: April 3, 2016
description: NEW YORK

title: Quotation of the Day
description: He gets very, very little credit, and I think thats too bad because we got quite a bit of help. I dont know what we would have done without it.

title: The Keys to Happiness
description: There may not be a magic formula, but heres what we know about how to get there, according to recent research and expert advice.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Bernie Sanders, Donald Trump, Nuclear Security Summit
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Malaysian Sailors Abducted Near Philippines in Latest Act of Piracy
description: MANILA  Four sailors from Malaysia were kidnapped off a cargo ship passing close to the southern Philippines on Friday night, less than a week after 10 sailors from Indonesia were abducted nearby, according to police officials from the three countries.

title: Making a Soda Tax More Politically Palatable
description: Mayor Jim Kenney was elected in Philadelphia last year after promising to bring the city universal prekindergarten, but he needed a way to pay for it.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: Shape-Shifting Wind
description: Dear Diary:

title: 1941: Virginia Woolf Believed Drowned
description: LONDON  The disappearance of Virginia Woolf, British novelist, was revealed tonight [April 2] by members of her family, who believed she had drowned.

title: A.C.P.T. 2016: Meet the Judges
description: SPECIAL POST   Even though Im working, its no secret that I come to the American Crossword Puzzle Tournament to see friends, and many of them can be found in the Judgess Room. This is the team that keeps the tournament chugging along, getting the standings up as quickly as humanly possible.

title: A.C.P.T. 2016: Standings After Puzzle 6
description: SPECIAL POST  Would you like to know whats exciting, from a totally nerdy, crossword-solving point of view? Whats exciting is when a competitor  top-shelf for sure, but who hasnt been in the top standings for a while  inches up into second place to nip at the six-time champions ankles. I might have to delete my pre-written Finals headline [Haha! Thats a totally false and humorous joke, Copy Desk. I dont really do that. D.A.]

title: Amtrak Train Crash Leaves 2 Dead, Officials Say
description: CHESTER, Pa.  An Amtrak train, southbound at high speed on Sunday morning, slammed into construction equipment on the tracks near Philadelphia, killing two track workers and wounding more than 30 passengers, the authorities said.

title: 1966: Gromyko Tells U.S. To Get Out Of Europe
description: MOSCOW  Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko told the United States yesterday [Apr. 2] to get out of Europe. In a long, hard-hitting speech that often echoed the words of President Charles de Gaulle, Mr. Gromyko said the United States was a non-European power and must leave Europe to the Europeans.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Work, Life, and Everything
description: Ryan Avent has a lovely essay about the reasons modern professionals tend to put in such long hours. As he says, its not just drudgery: for many people work is satisfying, a source of a lot more than just money. It can, of course, also be a form of avoidance, a way to avoid the messiness of real life. But anyway, for those lucky enough to have the right kind of work, its much more than a paycheck.

title: Sanderss Message Stands to Resonate Long After Election
description: Senator Bernie Sanders, the democratic socialist from Vermont, is waging an improbable presidential campaign, but he wont disappear after this election. Nor will his followers.

title: Investigating the Minds of Mass Killers
description: Actually: These lone killers usually dont fit into an existing category of mental illness, and theres usually little evidence that early treatment would have helped.

title: Caitlyn Jenner to Appear on Transparent
description: Caitlyn Jenner will appear on the next season of Transparent. Jill Soloway, the creator and executive producer of the Amazon series, announced the casting at the GLAAD Media Awards on Saturday, according to The Associated Press.

title: High Winds Leave Thousands Across the East Without Power
description: Fierce winds, snow, lightning and hail stomped across the East on Saturday and early Sunday, downing trees, damaging buildings and cutting power to more than 250,000 homes across 14 states.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: The times they are a-changin on Call the Midwife. Morgan Freeman ponders the meaning of life in The Story of God. And The Walking Dead closes out its sixth season with an extra-long shocker.

title: A.C.P.T. 2016: Missing Merl Reagle and Going Into the Finals
description: SPECIAL POST  The only thing I can think of to say about the loss of superstar constructor Merl Reagle in 2015 is that it was palpable this year at the American Crossword Tournament. There is a Merl-shaped hole in the universe and a gathering like this is where you feel it the most, second to his widow Marie Haleys heart.

title: A Bronx Church Where Landmark Status Would Be More Burden Than Honor
description: The bronze doors of Immaculate Conception Church are always open during the day, a welcoming gesture to the surrounding Melrose neighborhood in the South Bronx. Decorated with figures of the Virgin Mary, the doors are graceful  and heavy. My main issue is trying to open them in the morning, the Rev. Francis Skelly, the churchs pastor, said. They keep me in shape.

title: Azerbaijan Claims to Halt Violence in Nagorno-Karabakh, but Warns Armenia
description: MOSCOW  Azerbaijan announced on Sunday that it had halted combat operations in the sudden, bloody clashes with Armenia over the long-disputed enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh, but it laid the seeds for continued fighting by saying it would keep the slice of territory seized by its forces.

title: A.C.P.T. 2016: And the Winner Is
description: SPECIAL POST  Congratulations to Howard Barkin of New Jersey, first-time winner of the A.C.P.T. and slayer of six-time champion Dan Feyer!

title: Chinas Carbon Emissions May Have Peaked, but Its Hazy
description: BEIJING  A year and a half ago, negotiators from the United States persuaded the Chinese government to commit to a deadline for reversing the growth in greenhouse gas emissions from China.

title: Batman v Superman Stumbles, but Stays at No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES  And then came the superplunge.

title: A Student of Cultural Environmentalism Explores the Many Views of Earths Anthropocene Age of Us
description: Ive found it impossible to keep up with the many books and monographs that have accrued around the emerging idea that Earth and its inhabitants have entered a geological epoch shaped by humans  the Anthropocene.

title: Oscar Isaac to Star in a Hamlet Staged by Theater for a New Audience
description: From Shakespeare to Star Wars and back again: Oscar Isaac will play the title role in a new production of Hamlet, staged by Theater for a New Audience at the Polonsky Shakespeare Center in Brooklyn in June 2017. Sam Gold, who won a Tony for Fun Home, will direct.

title: Martin Puryear to Receive Yaddo Artist Medal
description: The sculptor Martin Puryear will receive the third annual Yaddo Artist Medal. Yaddo, the artist colony in Saratoga Springs, N.Y., will celebrate Mr. Puryear at a benefit on May 18, which will also include a performance from musicians Jason Moran and Alicia Hall Moran.

title: The New Day, a British Upstart, Casts Its Fate to the Newsstand
description: PARIS  The New Day, Britains youngest media start-up, has a little something for everyone: a digest of the days top news, human-interest features, coverage of popular culture, sports, health and travel, and even advice columnists.

title: A Cravath Partner Moves to Paul, Weiss
description: In a move unusual for the highest echelons of American corporate law, one of Wall Streets top deal makers is defecting to a rival after a 25-year career at the white-shoe law firm Cravath, Swaine and Moore.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Continue Back-and-Forth Over Debate Date
description: Hillary Clinton on Sunday sought to put an end to the debate over the debate.

title: The Kentucky Derby Dartboard: Week 1
description: Top contenders for the 142nd running of the Kentucky Derby are listed in order of preference, with comments provided by Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert of The New York Times. Churchill Downs has adopted a points system to determine the Derby field, with points being earned by the top four finishers in designated prep races. The odds are from the Churchill Downs futures pool, and the records are starts-win-place-show. An article on Saturdays Florida Derby can be found here.

title: Israel Expands Palestinian Fishing Zone Off Gazas Coast
description: GAZA  Israel on Sunday expanded the Palestinian fishing zone off the southern portion of Gazas coast to nine nautical miles from six, allowing fishing in areas that had been off limits for a decade.

title: Donald Trump Calls for John Kasich to Drop Out
description: MILWAUKEE  Donald J. Trump called for Gov. John Kasich of Ohio to drop out of the Republican primary contest, saying that Mr. Kasich should not be allowed to run.

title: Review: Mapplethorpe: Look at the Pictures on HBO Gives Context to Controversy
description: Every generation gets its own New York values panic. Mondays HBO documentary on the photographer Robert Mapplethorpe begins in 1989, months after his death, with Senator Jesse Helms decrying his work on the floor of the United States Senate. The senator had started a crusade against the National Endowment for the Arts funding of an exhibition by a known homosexual who died of AIDS, whose work included graphic depictions of sex and S-and-M. Look at the pictures! he cried.

title: Nuclear Winter
description: Carl Sagan and other Cold War scientists once feared that a nuclear war could plunge the world into a deadly ice age. Three decades later, does this theory still resonate?

title: Global Warming Gives Science Behind Nuclear Winter a New Purpose
description: With global temperatures rising inexorably, some scientists and national security theorists have pondered cooling things down by tinkering mechanically with the planets climate.

title: After Loss, Warriors Take Aim at Problems Masked by Victories
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Coach Steve Kerr of the Golden State Warriors could sense what he described as slippage among his players. Loose passes. Undisciplined defense. Wayward focus.

title: Cond Nast Goes Into Show Business
description: The company is aiming to capitalize on the blockbuster success spawned by articles from its glossy magazine pages.

title: Big Ears, a Music Festival With a Rare Vision
description: The festival in Knoxville, Tenn., is presented with purpose and first-rate sound to a growing audience that isnt even close to jaded about it.

title: Big Ears Festival Resists Commercial and Genre Constraints
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn.  At the Big Ears Festival over the weekend here, I heard a great array of music, created by orchestras and groups of electric guitars and single flutes and hard drives, aggressive and enveloping, rhythmic and ambient. Youre probably making an assumption now: O.K., an anything-goes festival. Got it. And your next thought might be: Whod go to that?

title: Rural Area
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  In the NBC television show Blindspot, every tattoo on the body of the protagonist Jane Doe tells a story. Found naked in Times Square, Jane Doe has no memory of who she is or how she got there, but she attracts the attention of the F.B.I., which links her tattoos to a larger crime conspiracy.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of April 4
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Charlie Parkers Yardbird at the Apollo Hails a Bebop Giant
description: Charlie Parker came into his own in the jazz clubs of Harlem, so there was undeniable poetry in his return to the neighborhood in operatic form. But Charlie Parkers Yardbird, given its New York premiere on Friday at the Apollo Theater, evoked none of that masterly saxophonist and composers wild beauty and mesmerizing focus.

title: In TV Ad, Ted Cruz Accuses John Kasich of Cronyism
description: Ahead of Tuesdays primary in Wisconsin, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas is targeting John Kasich with a TV attack ad for the first time, suggesting that Mr. Kasich engaged in cronyism as Ohios governor.

title: In Charles Bocks Alice & Oliver, Cancer Is a Highly Personal Villain
description: After Diana Colbert died of leukemia in 2011, her husband, the novelist Charles Bock, began reading through the journals she kept when she was sick. Ms. Colbert had hoped to write an inspirational book about her experience, and she took notes while she was undergoing grueling chemotherapy and transplant procedures, often through the haze of medication.

title: Review: Verdis Simon Boccanegra at the Met, and a Question of Career Timing
description: When is it time for a great artist to retire? This delicate question hovers over the Metropolitan Operas revival of Verdis Simon Boccanegra, conducted by James Levine and starring Plcido Domingo in the title role.

title: Review: Catastrophic Happiness, a Comedy of Manners About Bumpy Child-Rearing
description: What do you do when a book suddenly, abruptly, becomes a photo negative of itself? When it turns from a thing of beauty into its unlovely obverse?

title: Jim James of My Morning Jacket on Lifting a Wet Blanket Off a 2003 Album
description: My Morning Jacket was an earnest yet mysterious rock band reaching for daylight when it released It Still Moves, its third album, on ATO in 2003. Rich with reverberant guitars and the high, chiming voice of Jim James, it suggested a searching twist on psychedelic rock without settling into a rigid style. But because of a rushed mixing job, the album has never really been heard the way it was intended to be.

title: Review: American Composers Orchestra Concert Tilts Eastward
description: Middle Eastern and Indian traditions filtered through a Western lens were the theme of Eastern Wind, a program heavy in world premieres, which the American Composers Orchestra offered at Zankel Hall on Friday. With sources of inspiration encompassing Ottoman composition techniques, North Indian rhythmic cycles, biblical Hebrew, and the songs of the Egyptian megastar Umm Kulthum, the concert, conducted by George Manahan, made for a refreshingly multifaceted evening of new music.

title: Review: Wynton Marsaliss Spaces, a Kinetic Series of Zoological Portraits
description: The kazoos cropped up in the 10th and final movement of Spaces, an episodic suite by Wynton Marsalis that had its world premiere at the Rose Theater on Friday. The Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra was swinging light and fast as it happened, bzz-bzz-bzz-bzz-bzz, in a busy rush. It was a cute and clever flourish, in a piece titled Bees Bees Bees. And it was also an act of evocation that reflected the larger theme of the suite.

title: Review: Jared Grimes and Lil Buck Embody Their Animal Muses in Spaces
description: Dancing like an animal  a chicken, say, or an elephant, monkey, snake or frog  may sound like a surefire way to look ridiculous in front of a large audience. But not if youre the tapper Jared Grimes or the Memphis jooker Charles Riley (better known as Lil Buck) and youre backed by Wynton Marsalis and the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra.

title: Insiders Account of How Graft Fed Brazils Political Crisis
description: BRASLIA  The silver-haired senator from Brazils western frontier was still in his pajamas when federal police agents banged on the door of his suite at the Royal Tulip, the futuristic luxury hotel that serves as a bastion for much of Brazils political elite. It was 6 a.m.

title: Review: Lucius, a Band Willing to Test Itself
description: Holly Laessig and Jess Wolfe stood at the center of the Webster Hall stage on Friday night, each poised behind a keyboard and a drum in a tight cluster  part face-off, part huddle. They are the duo that anchors the band Lucius, which is built on the intimacy and (occasional) tension they create with their voices.

title: The Detectorists Are Back With Their Existential Divining Rods
description: The BBC series Detectorists is a mournful comedy, a sneakily funny celebration of futility and stasis. But dont get the wrong impression. Its not angsty and serious, in the vein of recent American comedies like Transparent or Togetherness. Its as light and joyous as a show about a pair of melancholy British losers can be.

title: Cartoon Networks Powerpuff Girls Fight Evil on TV and Beyond
description: The Powerpuff Girls have battled a rogues gallery of evil lab monkeys, hillbilly monsters and androgynous devils. But for the first time, they face a new challenge: a fight for relevancy.

title: Brazil Impeachment: The Process for Removing the President
description: Dilma Rousseff, Brazils president, is facing removal from office. Here is a step-by-step explanation of the proceedings.

title: A Contentious Vote by North Dakota Republicans Yields 25 Unaligned Delegates
description: FARGO, N.D.  After a contentious vote on Sunday, North Dakota Republicans elected 25 unaligned delegates to send to the Republican National Convention this summer in Cleveland, offering a presage of the confusion and chaos that seems certain to unfold there if the party remains unable to unite behind a nominee.

title: Outshone by Smaller Screens, PCs Aim to Be Seen as Cool Again
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Dion Weisler, the chief executive of HP Inc., recently held out a bulky laptop that was the pride of 2012. This is the laptop we had when I came here, he said.

title: Overpass Project in Kolkata Made Our Lives Hell for Years Before Collapse
description: KOLKATA, India  When Sonali Mehrotra realized that a hulking overpass would come within arms length of her third-floor balcony, she took refuge in black humor, telling relatives to look at the bright side: Instead of lugging suitcases up the stairs when they came to visit, they could toss them into a bedroom as they drove in from the airport.

title: Technology Upgrades Get White House Out of the 20th Century
description: WASHINGTON  Can you run the country with spotty Wi-Fi, computers that power on and off randomly and desktop speakerphones from Radio Shack, circa 1985?

title: UConn Routs Oregon State to Advance to Title Game
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Twenty-five years ago, when Connecticut began its ascent to the summit of womens college basketball, the program resembled the current Oregon State team, which unexpectedly captured the Dallas Region this season to reach its first Final Four.

title: Largely Forgotten and Hugely Influential: The Race for Marco Rubios Senate Seat
description: MIAMI  Representative Patrick Murphy, a two-term Democrat now running for United States Senate, looked exultant, maybe even a bit star-struck, as he greeted patrons and posed for selfies with Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. at Jackson Soul Food Restaurant in the citys Overtown neighborhood.

title: Months After a Brash Challenge, Noah Syndergaard Is Again Displaying Confidence
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  After last years World Series ended, Mets pitcher Noah Syndergaard spent some time taking in New York in a way he could not during the season. He attended sporting events, tried restaurants and roamed neighborhoods. Mets fans often stopped him and complimented him on one thing: his first pitch in Game 3 of the World Series.

title: In the Path of Nicaraguas Planned Canal
description: Some of the people and places that could be affected if a vast canal is built.

title: Lost in Nicaragua, a Chinese Tycoons Canal Project
description: BRITO, Nicaragua  A Spanish explorer conducted the first survey to connect the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans here in the 16th century. Napoleon III of France dreamed about it. The railroad magnate Cornelius Vanderbilt briefly had rights to do it. Nicaraguas history is littered with dozens of failed canal schemes.

title: Ruling on Coachs Challenge: Inconclusive
description: Among the rule changes that have shaken up the N.H.L. this season, nothing has been as constructive and confounding as the coachs challenge.

title: Weather Could Force Yankees to Wait One More Day for Opener
description: Editors note: On Monday, the Yankees postponed their opening game to Tuesday afternoon.

title: Experts See Risks, and Logic, in Skeloses Appeal for No Prison Time
description: The requests, at once, seemed obvious and yet somewhat counterintuitive: Lawyers for Dean G. Skelos and his son, Adam B. Skelos, suggested that their clients should avoid prison time, despite their convictions on corruption charges.

title: Donald Trump and Ted Cruz Shift Into High Gear as Wisconsin Primary Looms
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  A bastion of Midwestern nice. An opening for Senator Ted Cruz. Swelling doubts about the go-it-alone approach of Donald J. Trump.

title: World Series Rematch Means Reliving Pain
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  It seemed like a sports marketers invention, this opening series between the Kansas City Royals and the Mets. What better way to celebrate the new season than a rematch of the reigning league champions?

title: Dashing Hopes, Study Shows a Cholesterol Drug Had No Effect on Heart Health
description: It is a drug that reduces levels of LDL cholesterol, the dangerous kind, as much as statins do. And it more than doubles levels of HDL cholesterol, the good kind, which is linked to protection from heart disease. As a result, heart experts had high hopes for it as an alternative for the many patients who cannot or will not take statins.

title: With Victory at Miami Open, Djokovic Adds to His Records
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  As tenniss Big Four (Djokovic, Nadal, Federer, Murray) has been reduced to the Big One (Djokovic), the measures of that ones greatness have become ever more striking.

title: Victim in Wall St. Scheme Was a Classmate of Its Accused Architect
description: When Andrew Caspersen sought money for an investment that federal authorities said duped investors out of tens of millions of dollars, one of the people the former Wall Street executive turned to was a college classmate at Princeton University.

title: Strategy on Garland: Act as Though Hell Get Senate Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  Merrick B. Garland, chief judge of the United States Court of Appeals here, has been sequestered in a kind of alternate reality in a small conference room in the Eisenhower Executive Office Building next to the White House, cramming for questions from senators as if hearings on his nomination to the Supreme Court will happen this year.

title: A New Libor Trial, Trade Data and Fed Leaders Onstage
description: Five former Barclays employees are expected in court in London on Monday as their trial begins over criminal charges that they conspired to manipulate the London interbank offered rate, a global benchmark interest rate known as Libor. Chad Bray

title: In Five Months, Villanova Wildcats Have Matured Beyond Their Years
description: HOUSTON  Daniel Ochefu, Villanovas senior forward, learned the game before there were nylon nets, when peach baskets were fastened to trees. Ryan Arcidiacono, a senior guard, has been playing since the Wildcats home court was the Palestra. One of Villanovas walk-ons was a teenager in 1985 when Villanova won its only (so far) national title in mens basketball.

title: Chinas Companies Poised to Take Leap in Developing a Driverless Car
description: Gansha Wu was a veteran engineering manager at Intel Corporation and director of Intel Labs China when two events upended his world last year.

title: Brothers Prepare for N.C.A.A. Title Face-Off
description: HOUSTON  North Carolina guard Nate Britt said he had no idea where his parents were going to be seated inside NRG Stadium for the national title game Monday night, or what colors they intended to wear. It will be a carefully thought out decision.

title: Panama Law Firms Leaked Files Detail Offshore Accounts Tied to World Leaders
description: WASHINGTON  A group of news media outlets published articles on Sunday based on what they said were 11.5 million leaked documents from a Panama law firm that helped some of the worlds wealthiest people  including politicians, athletes and business moguls  establish offshore bank accounts.

title: Drawing the Line on Gossip After the Gawker Trial
description: The brand-new Gawker Media offices in downtown Manhattan are the bomb, as in great. Theyre all glass and steel, clean lines and modern fixtures. They were paid for in secrets, exposed with a joyful ferocity that enriched Gawkers founders and helped redefine how far our reality-TV culture could go to satisfy its appetite for gossip and news about the famous, the powerful and, increasingly, just the mildly interesting.

title: A Workhorse on the Hudson River, Now Retired From Fighting Fires, Chugs Toward a Second Act
description: ABOARD THE JOHN D. McKEAN, in Tarrytown, N.Y.  On a gleaming Thursday morning in March, a candy red fireboat rattled awake and set forth from its station in the Brooklyn Navy Yard. As the ship voyaged north along the Hudson River at nine knots, it left more than half a century of history in its wake.

title: A Fireboats Second Life on the Hudson
description: After being bought by restaurateurs, the John D. McKean, a former New York City fireboat, is being prepared for a new role: that of floating museum.

title: Washington Metro, 40 and Creaking, Stares at a Midlife Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  Jack Evans was a summer intern here in 1976, the year Metro, the capital regions subway system, opened to rave reviews. It was an architectural triumph, with escalators that plunged into clean, well-lit stations  a mass transit marvel like The Jetsons,  he says  a far cry from the graffiti-scarred, decrepit system of that era in New York.

title: No Corrections: April 4, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its a system thats maybe safe, somewhat unreliable, and that is being complained about by everybody.

title: With New Effort, Group Hopes to Show Donald Trump Has a Multicultural Appeal
description: Donald J. Trump, criticized for months for his comments on race, is about to be bolstered by a multi-cultural network of supporters hoping to tell a different side of his story.

title: Ryan Arcidiacono May Talk Villanova to a Title
description: HOUSTON  At halftime of their national semifinal game against Oklahoma on Saturday, the Villanova Wildcats huddled together, leaning close, some on their tiptoes, to hear their team preacher, Ryan Arcidiacono.

title: Yankees Brian Cashman and Joe Girardi Are Opposites Who Agree
description: When the Yankees played at Toronto in August, their general manager, Brian Cashman, took a trip up the CN Tower, which rises like a giraffes neck above the downtown skyline. His purpose: to lean out over a ledge, 1,168 feet above terra firma, tethered only by a cable and a sense of adventure.

title: Armies Used by U.N. Fail Watchdog Groups Test
description: The militaries of the 30 countries that provide the most soldiers and police officers to United Nations peacekeeping operations also are among those most susceptible to corruption, according to a study released Sunday by an anti-corruption monitoring organization.

title: 2 N.B.A. Prospects, 2 Competing Visions
description: HOUSTON  Marcus Paige and Jalen Brunson represent two sides of college basketballs most vexing issue: How old should a college player be before having an opportunity to play in the N.B.A.?

title: TBS Acquires N.C.A.A. Final and Fewer Eyeballs
description: Major sports events have been televised by broadcast networks for so long that when a title game moves to cable, it registers a small jolt, but no longer much surprise. The College Football Playoff is entirely an ESPN affair, as are the N.C.A.A. womens basketball tournament and the tennis majors Wimbledon and the United States Open, from the opening match to the finals.

title: Vinyl Season 1, Episode 8: The History of Rock
description: Vinyl has featured lots of rock history lessons, but none as good as the moment when Lester decides to strap on a guitar and give the Nasty Bits a succinct history of the E-A-B chord progression. The Bits desperately need to write some new material, having gotten becalmed in the recording of a proto-punk sea shanty, but singer Kip Stevens complains that theres no more notes!

title: Review: Death for Five Voices, About a Vanguard Composer
description: You cant fault the composer Peter Mills or the director and Mr. Millss co-writer Cara Reichel for lacking ambition. It took nerve to write the new musical Death for Five Voices, playing at the Sheen Center, about a vanguard composer, and it took further brio to begin that work with the line, It is finished, Jesuss final words on the cross. And as members of the Prospect Theater Company, Mr. Mills and Ms. Reichel also demonstrate no little audacity in producing elaborate musical theater works on what seems to be a negligible budget.

title: Syracuse Defeats Washington; Connecticut Awaits in Title Game
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Dapper in a navy blue vest and pants, with the collar unbuttoned on his striped blue dress shirt, Syracuse Coach Quentin Hillsman watched his team play swarming defense against Washington, throwing his arms up, hunching low to the ground and looking ready to jump on the floor for every loose ball that his team caused.

title: Skating Slowly Tries Regaining Its Edge
description: BOSTON  Figure skating is not nearly what it used to be  not globally, not in the United States.

title: Early Missteps Seen as a Drag on Bernie Sanderss Campaign
description: The morning after he lost the Nevada caucuses in February, Bernie Sanders held a painful conference call with his top advisers.

title: A New Yorker, Long Caught in Immigration Limbo, Comes Home to Start His Job
description: Angelo Cabrera was offered a job administering a program for Mexican immigrants at Baruch College in Manhattan more than two years ago.

title: Billions Season 1, Episode 11: The Doctor Is In
description: So weve reached the penultimate episode of Billions (oh, that special time in every season when TV critics get to bust out the word penultimate) and it turns out to be an atypically somber affair for a show that might be expected to step on the gas before the finale. In the wake of Donnies death and the resultant dissolution of the case against Bobby Axelrod, however, we instead get a dark-night-of-the-soul episode, filled with somber reflection, scenes of regret and reconciliation, and the crossing of a new set of lines. A few literal fireworks were set off this week; the metaphorical ones are sure to follow.

title: The Walking Dead Season 6 Finale: Negan Arrives, and Then... ?
description: So now The Walking Dead is just messing with us.

title: As Messaging Apps Boom, Brands Tiptoe In
description: Gatorade owns one of the iconic television moments of the Super Bowl, the dousing of the winning coach with a huge bucket of the sport drink, ice included. For the 2016 game, though, the brand wanted to reach more younger people, who tend to watch less TV.

title: Federal Housing Officials Warn Against Blanket Bans of Ex-Offenders
description: Private landlords who have blanket bans on renting to people with criminal records are in violation of the Fair Housing Act and can be sued and face penalties for discrimination, the federal Department of Housing and Urban Development said.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | monotony
description: monotony \m-n-t-ne, -nt-ne\ noun

title: Royals Recreate History, Stifling the Mets in a World Series Rematch
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The first time the Mets took the field for the 2016 season, they lined up along the third-base line and were forced to watch a replay of the way their previous season had ended. They fidgeted and rocked back and forth, holding their hands behind their backs, as the Kansas City Royals played highlights from the 2015 World Series.

title: Anthony Vaccarello Succeeds Hedi Slimane at Yves Saint Laurent
description: The fashion worlds game of musical chairs continues. Anthony Vaccarello, most recently the creative director of Versus Versace  the younger, funkier sibling brand of Versace and, of late, an incubator of up-and-coming designers  has been named the new creative director of Yves Saint Laurent.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: Mapplethorpe: Look at the Pictures sheds light on the life of Robert Mapplethorpe and his sexually frank photographs. The Powerpuff Girls grow up. And Nova streams its exploration of what could be a new Viking site in North America.

title: The Rolling Stones on the Brink of Stardom
description: A new book looks at the early years of the Rolling Stones, capturing the navet and  yes  innocence of that era.

title: The Rolling Stones on the Brink of Stardom
description: When two fledgling British photographers, Terry ONeill and Gered Mankowitz, got their respective jobs shooting the Rolling Stones in the mid-1960s, the group itself was an emerging act: a raw-sounding, roguish-looking blues band whose repertoire was stacked with cover songs.

title: How to Rely Less on Philanthropy
description: To the Editor:

title: Citizens United and the Foreign Question
description: To the Editor:

title: Cities for Everyone
description: Remember when Ted Cruz tried to take Donald Trump down by accusing him of having New York values? It didnt work, of course, mainly because it addressed the wrong form of hatred. Mr. Cruz was trying to associate his rival with social liberalism  but among Republican voters distaste for, say, gay marriage runs a distant second to racial enmity, which the Trump campaign is catering to quite nicely, thank you.

title: MetLife and the Threat to Dodd-Frank
description: The federal court decision last week to remove the too big to fail label from MetLife, the insurance giant, may or may not turn out to be a factor in a future financial crisis. But it is a setback to regulation intended to protect the economy from the inherent risks of an undersupervised financial system.

title: Remembering a 1916 Irish Uprising
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Trumps Antiwar Message Resonates with White America
description: MY grandma  we called her Mamaw  loved her country. Born in eastern Kentucky coal country at the beginning of the Great Depression, she credited so much of the good in her life to Americas bounty. When I interviewed her about her life for a school project, she spent most of the time talking about World War II: her dads love letters from the Pacific; how her younger brother lied about his age in an effort to enlist. We did it, she told me, still beaming with pride more than a half-century later. We freed the whole world from tyranny.

title: Gay Pride and Prejudice in Dominican Republic
description: Shortly after taking up his post as American ambassador to the Dominican Republic in November 2013, Wally Brewster got a bit of unsolicited advice from the Vaticans envoy to the Caribbean nation.

title: Teenage Sexting Is Not Child Porn
description: TEENAGERS who sext are in a precarious legal position. Though in most states teenagers who are close in age can legally have consensual sex, if they create and share sexually explicit images of themselves, they are technically producing, distributing or possessing child pornography. The laws that cover this situation, passed decades ago, were meant to apply to adults who exploited children and require those convicted under them to register as sex offenders.

title: The (Un)Democratic Party
description: There are two prominent features of the Democratic Partys presidential selection process that are thoroughly undemocratic and undermine faith in the party: superdelegates (which favor Hillary Clinton) and caucuses (which favor Bernie Sanders).

title: A Renewable Energy Boom
description: Some world leaders, especially in developing countries like India, have long said its hard to reduce the emissions that are warming the planet because they need to use relatively inexpensive  but highly carbon-intensive  fuels like coal to keep energy affordable. That argument is losing its salience as the cost of renewable energy sources like wind and solar continues to fall.

title: Socrates, Cynics and Flat-Nailed, Featherless Bipeds
Is Anti-Zionism Merely Anti-Semitism in Disguise?
News Qs | Hearing the Music of Vanishing Languages
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Vanishing Languages, Reincarnated as Music.

title: Teaching Men to Be Emotionally Honest
description: Last semester, a student in the masculinity course I teach showed a video clip she had found online of a toddler getting what appeared to be his first vaccinations. Off camera, we hear his fathers voice. Ill hold your hand, O.K.? Then, as his son becomes increasingly agitated: Dont cry! Aw, big boy! High five, high five! Say youre a man: Im a man! The video ends with the whimpering toddler screwing up his face in anger and pounding his chest. Im a man! he barks through tears and gritted teeth.

title: For a Golf Tinkerer, a Strategy Just Crazy Enough to Work
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  How to improve ones game? It is the eternal question for golfers, as predictable as their next shank. When planted in Bryson DeChambeaus fertile mind, the query flourished like the grape vines climbing vines from the rich soil of the San Joaquin Valley in California, where he grew into one of the worlds top amateurs.

title: Undercover Officers Ask Addicts to Buy Drugs, Snaring Them but Not Dealers
description: The 55-year-old crack addict counted his change outside a Harlem liquor store. He had just over a dollar, leaving him 35 cents short of the cheapest mini-bottle.

title: Fractivists Increase Pressure on Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders in New York
description: A nasty row that erupted between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders over oil and gas industry donors last week is catapulting the issue of climate change into the race for the Democratic presidential nomination as it moves to New York, where an army of activists upstate is driven by opposition to drilling.

title: Health Scare at Malibu School Sets Off Media War
description: MALIBU, Calif.  The high school here is ranked among the best in the country, with students each year moving on to Ivy League colleges. The location, on a hill down the block from the beach where Baywatch was filmed, offers a multimillion-dollar view of the Pacific Ocean.

title: Student Question | Where Do You Think You Will Live When You Are an Adult?
description: When you are on your own, where do you see yourself living?

title: E.L.L. Practice + Prompt | Presidential Debates
description: Note: We invite any English-language-learner student 13 years or older to post comments in response to the writing prompts in this post.

title: Perfect Strangers | Chelsea Handler & Leon Wieseltier
description: A game of free association between the critical comedian and the comedic critic ricochets between kale, the Kardashians and presidential hopefuls.

title: When Chelsea Handler Met Leon Wieseltier
description: In this new column, T brings together two people for the very first time  to see what happens.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | April 4, 2016
description: Updated: April 8, 2016

title: A Teachable Moment on the Need for Colon Cancer Screening
description: As an alumna of Cornell who had been thrilled by the selection of the universitys first female president, Elizabeth Garrett, last fall, I was deeply pained to learn of her untimely death from colon cancer at age 52 last month. May it be a teachable moment that could save many from a disease that will be diagnosed in an estimated 134,000 people and claim 49,000 lives in the United States this year.

title: When Parents Have a Favorite Child
description: To my own mother, it was an article of faith to show no favoritism. If two of us asked her whose drawing she liked best, the answer was predetermined: I like them just the same. When I tried to trick my mother by saying I had done both drawings myself, she saw right through me; she understood that children are constantly trying to elicit evidence of who is ahead and who is behind. And to the end of her life, if someone tried to draw my mother out in public praise, by saying, with reference to some particular milestone or achievement, oh, you must be so proud of your child, she would respond, firmly, yes, Im proud of all my children.

title: Chaos of Cultural Revolution Echoes at a Lonely Cemetery, 50 Years Later
description: CHONGQING, China  During Chinas traditional festival for honoring the dead, Zheng Zhisheng usually visits a vine-draped cemetery where pillars declare the deads eternal loyalty to Mao Zedong. He walks among the mass graves, sharing memories, and sometimes tears, with mourners who greet him as their corpse commander.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Panama Papers, Amtrak, Kansas City Royals
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Yankees Opening Day Rescheduled
description: Updated, 10:40 a.m.

title: Handcrafted Sausages to Take Home
description: Yes, Jake Kleins bratwurst has snap, but it was some of his other sausages, including one from brisket burned ends and a Tokyo chicken version with spice to spare, that impressed Pete Wells, the New York Times restaurant critic, at Jakes Handcrafted, Mr. Kleins Park Slope tavern, last year. Now the sausages are available by the pound to take home. There is a lamb sausage seasoned with cumin, and a Cubano featuring the ingredients youd expect in a Cuban sandwich. The accompanying banana mustard will make you forget any honey mustard you have ever tried: Sausages, $12 to $18 a pound, Jakes Handcrafted, 559 Fifth Avenue (15th Street), Park Slope, Brooklyn, 718-788-0789, jakeshandcrafted.com.

title: To Herald Spring, Nettle Bread From Bien Cuit
description: Stinging nettles suggest spring as much as ramps or fiddleheads. They are featured in an unusual bread from Zachary Golper, who owns the bakery Bien Cuit with his wife, Kate Wheatcroft, collaborating with Justin Binnie, the executive chef. The loaf is pointy at the ends with a sturdy crust verdantly streaked with pulverized dried nettles. Moist and earthy, the deep beige crumb has an alluring tang from the goats milk used in the dough: Nettle Bread, $6 at Bien Cuit, 120 Smith Street (Pacific Street),  Boerum Hill, Brooklyn, 718-852-0200, biencuit.com.

title: A Spice Rub Better Than What Youd Make Yourself
description: Premade spice rubs mostly belong in some dark, forgotten corner of the pantry, alongside bottled salad dressings. Ill make my own, thank you. But every now and then, an exception shows up, like this piquant mixture of ground coffee, Turkish cumin, smoked paprika, garlic and brown sugar to give heft and depth to pork chops caramelizing on the grill. Dust it on bacon or add it to the darkening jus for a slab of ham. The recipe comes from Vivian Howards restaurant, Chef & the Farmer, in Kinston, N.C.: Vivian Howards Rub It In Red Eye Coffee Rub, $10.95 for 3 ounces, williams-sonoma.com.

title: Allowed to Visit Her Babys Grave After 12 Years, a Woman Is Told: Your Son Isnt Here
description: The baby boy lived only 90 minutes after he was born on Oct. 23, 2003. Without money to bury him, his mother, Katrina DeJesus, reluctantly signed papers letting New York City lay him to rest. She would not be allowed to visit the city cemetery where the baby was buried, officials told her, because it was off limits, under the jurisdiction of the Correction Department.

title: DEET Seen as Safe for Pregnant Women to Avoid Zika Despite Few Studies
description: This summer, some yellow-fever mosquitoes carrying the Zika virus are expected to arrive along the Gulf Coast and elsewhere in the continental United States. Health officials are urging people to use insect repellents with DEET to avoid being bitten.

title: ScienceTake | Wings That Sing
description: Male African broadbills use their wings, not their voices, to make sounds that attract females.

title: For African Broadbills, Seduction to the Sound of Feathers
description: Its called wing song. And it is not new age harp music or the latest calming aromatherapy. It is, oddly enough, a song that a bird makes with its wings.

title: On Mondays at Btard, No Corkage Fee
description: In May 2003, Drew Nieporent started letting customers bring their own wines to his TriBeCa restaurant, Montrachet, on Monday nights with no corkage fee. It was a resounding success that also helped the restaurant recover from Sept. 11. Now at Btard, his second replacement for Montrachet, he has restored the policy. Many guests asked about it, he said. People collect wines and want to drink them with friends but not necessarily at home. The idea has been hanging around for some time. At Montrachet on Mondays, there was almost a party atmosphere as prized bottles were shared from one table to the next. At the end of the evening, the empties were lined up on the bar. The sommelier in charge these days, Jason Jacobeit, will have his work cut out for him. My sommeliers hate it, Mr. Nieporent said: No Corkage Mondays, Btard, 239 West Broadway (White Street), 212-219-2777, batardtribeca.com.

title: Goat Cheese Bathed in Sour Beer and Loving Care
description: So much time, care and attention have been lavished on this single tiny cheese, a 4-ounce goat button from Coach Farm in Pine Plains, N.Y., that has a velvety rind enclosing a creamy layer with a soft paste inside. It graduates from the farm to the Crown Finish caves in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, where it is gently bathed in Finback Red Shift, a sour beer brewed with cranberries and yuzu in Queens, giving it a tart, briny complexity. Then it goes to Mekelburgs, a food store and bar in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, where it is lovingly wrapped and labeled. Worth the trip, as they say in Michelin, but Mekelburgs will also ship the cheese: MekelMaster, $12.95 at Mekelburgs, 293 Grand Avenue (Greene Avenue), Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, 718-399-2337, mekelburgs.com.

title: When Only Snail Mail Will Do
description: A collection of 100 postcards pretty enough to use as gift inserts or notecards includes paintings of ramen bowls, old-school illustrations of fruits and vegetables, and even a nice dose of whimsy, with a spaghetti-infused picture from the movie Hell Bent for Leather. This one comes from a graphic design collective called Brest Brest Brest. All the cards are packaged in a bright box indexed by the 10 artists, mostly women, who designed them. An accompanying booklet profiles the artists, taking note of what they have in their refrigerators: Curious Feast edited by Naz Sahin Ozcan (Princeton Architectural Press, $19.95).

title: Judi Dench Wins Eighth Olivier Award in London
description: LONDON  Judi Dench and Imelda Staunton were among the winners Sunday night at the Olivier Awards, the London equivalent of the Tony Awards for theater.

title: Despite Meetings With Merrick Garland, Senate G.O.P. Sees Little Give in Stance
description: The Senate is back on Monday after a two-week break, and the Supreme Court vacancy, which dominated much of the recess, will return to center stage in Washington this week.

title: Morning Agenda: Alaska Airlines to Buy Virgin America
description: ALASKA AIRLINES TO BUY VIRGIN AMERICA | Alaska Airlines said on Monday that it would be buying Virgin America in a deal that values Virgin America at $57 per share, or $2.6 billion,  The Financial Times reports. As of Fridays market close Virgin was valued around $1.5 billion,  Michael J. de la Merced and Leslie Picker report in DealBook.

title: Alaska Air Sees Virgin America as Key to West Coast
description: In agreeing to buy Virgin America for $2.6 billion, Alaska Air Group is betting that the airline industry is so consolidated after years of mergers that what it needs is another takeover.

title: Donald Trump Met Secretly With Interest Groups
description: Donald J. Trumps private meeting in Washington on Thursday featured nearly a dozen industry leaders, including a veteran lobbyist and the chief executive of a major airline trade organization, attendees confirmed.

title: Sicker Patients Seem at a Disadvantage With Medicare Advantage
description: New evidence suggests Medicare Advantage may not serve some sicker Medicare beneficiaries as well as it does healthier ones.

title: Trumps Troubles and Democratic Sparring Precede Wisconsin Vote
description: Donald J. Trumps rough week was followed by a rough weekend, as he suffered potentially consequential losses at party events related to precious convention delegates in two states.

title: Drones Marshaled to Drop Lifesaving Supplies Over Rwandan Terrain
description: HALF MOON BAY, Calif.  From a bluff overlooking the Pacific Ocean, a loud pop signals the catapult launch of a small fixed-wing drone that is designed to carry medical supplies to remote locations almost 40 miles away.

title: China News Blackout as Ten Years Takes Hong Kong Best Film Award
description: HONG KONG  In an Oscar-like spectacle on Sunday night, the Hong Kong Film Awards announced 21 movie prizes. Or 20  if you consulted only reports in the mainland Chinese news media.

title: Q. and A.: Xujun Eberlein on the Legacy of the Cultural Revolution
description: Half a century has passed since Mao Zedong set in motion the Cultural Revolution, his chaotic attempt to purge the Communist Party and Chinese society of compromise and capitalist tendencies. The movement unleashed widespread violence, some of it led by Red Guards, young students who organized themselves into militant units to enforce Maos revolutionary vision. Some of the most intense fighting was in Chongqing, where in recent days some residents mourned at Chinas only surviving sizable Red Guard cemetery.

title: Could There Be a Terrorist Fukushima?
description: The attacks in Brussels last month were a stark reminder of the terrorists resolve, and of our continued vulnerabilities, including in an area of paramount concern: nuclear security.

title: Website Seeks to Make Government Data Easier to Sift Through
description: For years, the federal government, states and some cities have enthusiastically made vast troves of data open to the public. Acres of paper records on demographics, public health, traffic patterns, energy consumption, family incomes and many other topics have been digitized and posted on the web.

title: Tamara Wilson Wins 2016 Richard Tucker Award
description: The prestigious Richard Tucker Award, which comes with a $50,000 cash prize and a starry gala concert in New York, will be given this year to the soprano Tamara Wilson, the foundation that administers the prize announced on Monday morning.

title: Greece Starts Deporting Migrants to Turkey as E.U. Deal Takes Effect
description: MYTILENE, Greece  They had braved risks and hardships to get to Greece, having crossed the narrow strait from Turkey in flimsy rafts like nearly a million others last year  with hundreds dying along the way.

title: BATS Global Markets Plans to Price Shares at $17 to $19
description: BATS Global Markets, the electronic exchange operator that tried to sell shares to the public four years ago, only to withdraw the offering after technical flaws halted trading, is at it again.

title: False News From the Sisi State
description: CAIRO  My friend Mostafa Massouny has one of the most eclectic music collections of anyone I know. I initially typed had and knew, because I fear Mostafa is dead.

title: Valeant Is a Reminder of the Peril of Outsize Executive Pay
description: There is no shortage of reasons for the spectacular rise and fall of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International.

title: Securing Airports While Protecting Democracy
description: It was inevitable in the aftermath of the terrorist attacks at the Brussels airport that security would be sharply increased at airports across Europe and tough questions would be raised about Belgian security precautions. There is no question that the Belgian government needs to improve its security procedures, especially with the growing evidence in recent weeks of jihadist plotting in some of the citys neighborhoods. But the demands for greater protection also revive fundamental questions about the balance of security and freedom: How much security is achievable, affordable and bearable in a democratic society?

title: 1941: Yugoslavia Mobilizes
description: BELGRADE  All observers here agreed tonight [April 4] that the question was no longer whether, but when, Yugoslavia would be attacked. The official gazette published late tonight a royal decree issued last Tuesday but not made public at the time for fear of provoking Germany.

title: Mets Yoenis Cespedes Takes the Good With the Ugly
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Alex Gordon has played most of his nine-year career in left field at Kaufmann Stadium, catching hundreds of balls in the exact spot where Yoenis Cespedes dropped an eminently catchable line drive Sunday night, the latest of his numerous lightning rod moments.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow Shares Beauty Advice, Even Though Her Daughter Is the Expert
description: These days, the actress Gwyneth Paltrow, 43, is perhaps better known for her website, Goop.com, where New Age meets wellness meets urban bourgeoisie. Not content with, well, just content, she has been developing makeup products with Juice Beauty and has introduced her Goop skin-care line. Ms. Paltrow, who is also mom to Apple, 11, and Moses, 9, lives in Los Angeles. Here, she shares beauty, hair and life advice.

title: Yankees Get an Extra Day to Prepare for Dallas Keuchel
description: The weather did on Monday what the Yankees were unable to do all of last season: leave Dallas Keuchel disappointed.

title: Grand Jury Report on Sexual Abuse by Clergy
description: Grand jury findings on child sexual abuse in the Altoona-Johnstown diocese, and religious leaders' failure to address it or report it.

title: As Pennsylvania Confronts Clergy Sex Abuse, Victims and Lawmakers Act
description: LORETTO, Pa.  By the age of 12, Maureen Powers, the daughter of a professor at the local Roman Catholic university, played the organ in the magnificent hilltop Catholic basilica here and volunteered in the parish office. But, she said, she was hiding a secret: Her priest sexually abused her for two years, telling her it was for the purpose of research.

title: Book Review: The Finest Traditions of My Calling
description: Medicine is full of young recruits writing veterans books, war stories full of hopes and fears for the next in line. As in the military, a couple of years service provides fodder for a thick volume, a decade enough material for a boxed set.

title: Princeton Board Votes to Keep Woodrow Wilsons Name on Campus Buildings
description: PRINCETON, N.J.  The board of trustees at Princeton University said on Monday that it had voted to keep Woodrow Wilsons name on campus buildings and programs, despite student protests last year that led to a review of Wilsons legacy here.

title: China Moves Into Position to Develop Self-Driving Cars
description: The technology industries in the United States and China have rarely developed in lock step with one another. For years, the United States was ahead in chips, software and the web. China was largely a manufacturing engine, but lately it has been doing more innovative things in mobile and messaging.

title: Adding Links to the Windows 10 Start Menu
description: Q. Im getting more used to Windows 10, but I miss having those links on the Start menu that went right to my Documents and Pictures folders. Can I get those back?

title: Kim Philby, Lecturing in East Berlin in 81, Bragged of How Easy It Was to Fool MI6
description: LONDON  Kim Philby, the double agent whose betrayal of his country to the Soviet Union still marks British life, boasted in a 1981 lecture that was recently discovered by the BBC and broadcast on Monday of the ease with which he fooled a complacent establishment.

title: Michael C. Fina, Park Avenue Wedding Retailer, Bets on Amazon.com
description: Michael C. Fina helped popularize bridal registries, and its Park Avenue store was a destination for Manhattan elites. It provided silver for John F. Kennedys inauguration festivities and catered to the likes of Frank Sinatra and Lennox Lewis.

title: 2 Libyan Guantnamo Inmates Are Transferred to Senegal
description: WASHINGTON  The United States military has transferred two Libyan detainees to Senegal from its wartime prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, government officials said on Monday, the first time Senegal has resettled a Guantnamo prisoner.

title: Shadows of Smears Past
description: The Times has a sort of pre-mortem in which people associated with the Sanders campaign wonder if they might have pulled it off if theyd made personal attacks on Hillary Clinton earlier. Id say, probably not.

title: Lingering Lessons from a Cold-War Climate Peril  Nuclear Winter
description: I discuss the Retro Report piece and nuclear winter on The Takeaway.

title: Nothing Smells Rotten in Leslie B. Vosshalls Compost Pail
description: I am Americas worst chef, said Leslie B. Vosshall, a molecular neurobiologist who specializes in olfaction, the sense of smell.

title: 1966: Beatniks Barred From France
description: PARIS  France has declared war on foreign beatniks, it was learned today [April 4]. With the arrival of Holy Week and the spring tourist season, the government has ordered French border police to turn back foreigners presenting an incorrect appearance and lacking resources, Agence France-Presse reported. The order is aimed at long-haired young visitors, mostly from the Anglo-Saxon and Nordic countries. They arrived and camped under the bridges of the Seine in force last summer.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, April 5, 1966

title: Your Whiny Wintry Weather Questions Answered
description: Just as people in the Eastern United States thought it was safe to put away their puffy coats, another wave of wintry weather is spreading from Maine to New York. It has prompted many to shield their flowers, pull out windshield scrapers and mumble a familiar refrain each time April rolls around:

title: Youre Unfired: Kathleen Battle Is Returning to the Met After 22 Years
description: It may be the biggest unfiring in opera since Maria Callass New York comeback: Kathleen Battle, a prima donna whose dismissal by the Metropolitan Opera more than two decades ago made front-page news, will return to the Met next season to sing a recital of spirituals.

title: A Supreme Court Decision on Freezing Assets Bolsters the Right to Hire a Lawyer
description: It seems clear that you get to spend your money any way you see fit, as long as what you are buying is legal.

title: 17 Recipes for April 4
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: 6 Talk Radio Hosts, on a Mission to Stop Donald Trump in Wisconsin
description: MILWAUKEE  Charlie Sykes, a popular talk radio host here and leader of the Stop Trump movement, had spent months hammering Donald J. Trump on his show, calling him a whiny, thin-skinned bully and dismissing his supporters as Trumpkins.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Challenge on One Person One Vote
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court  unanimously ruled on Monday that states may count all residents, whether or not they are eligible to vote, in drawing election districts. The decision was a major statement on the meaning of a fundamental principle of the American political system, that of one person one vote.

title: Why Some Societies Practiced Ritual Human Sacrifice
description: One thing thats definitely gotten better over time: not as much ritualistic human sacrifice.

title: Dynamics Are Shifting in an 8-Member Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON  It was February, and Justice Antonin Scalia had just died. Responding to a question about how the Supreme Court would cope with just eight members, Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. was sanguine. We will deal with it, he said.

title: Saying Good-Bye to the Minors
description: John Scotts crazy year took another twist when the Canadiens called him up to the N.H.L.

title: Coming In From the Cold: John Scott Is Joining the Canadiens
description: ST. JOHNS, Newfoundland  Past midnight on another rainy, windswept night at the farthest edge of the continent, inside a sports bar called Jack Astors, the exiled winner of the Most Valuable Player Award at the N.H.L. All-Star Game sat at a high-top table with his minor league teammates. They had just lost to a team called the Lehigh Valley Phantoms.

title: Chris Stapleton Dominates A.C.M. Awards
