description: Katy Perry, dressed as a cowgirl with a sparkly magenta microphone, made a cameo to duet with Dolly Parton, while Chris Stapleton had yet another successful night collecting trophies on Sunday at the 51st Academy of Country Music Awards.

title: Yeo-Person? One Title Vexes Navys Push for Gender Neutrality
description: WASHINGTON  Days after the Defense Department opened all combat roles to women last year, the secretary of the Navy, Ray Mabus, decided that a more subtle change was also needed to signal gender equality.

title: The Average Puzzle
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by a regular contributor to Numberplay, Daniel Finkel, a Seattle-based educator out to transform the way math is taught and learned. (Check out Math for Love for more.) Daniels challenges often hinge on a key insight that makes the complicated simple. Lets give it a try. Heres

title: When Feelings of Comfort Trump Spreadsheet Math
description: Carl, my friend told me, in a heated moment of financial debate, You need a new truck like you need a bullet in the head.

title: A Trio of New Products for Soft, Natural Eyebrows
description: This spring, new eyebrow products combine all the best qualities of traditional formulas  theyre matte like a powder, precise like a pencil and firm like a gel  but thanks to the addition of beeswax, have an added softness, too. Glossiers Boy Brow, recently reintroduced alongside the brands new makeup collection, goes on like a creamy gel  its small, mascaralike applicator softly fills in arches with precision  without the goop. This month, Bobbi Brown unveiled Long-Wear Brow Gel, in eight different shades of buildable color that gets darker and bolder with each application. And Dior just released All-In-Brow 3D palettes, inspired by the fashion houses backstage beauty. Each kit contains two shades of powder  to achieve organic-looking ombr color that tapers off towards the ends  and a soft wax topcoat to keep it all in place.

title: Plus-Size Superhero Gets Her Own Series
description: Diversity has come to the comic-book universe. There are now super-heroes who are Muslim, Hispanic, gay, lesbian and more. But all those characters still have something in common: athletic, even godlike bodies. Not so Faith Herbert, a plus-size heroine, who will be getting her own monthly series beginning in July, published by Valiant Comics.

title: What, Reserve a Table? Cubans Confront a New Dining Culture
description: HAVANA  Cubans sometimes joke that of all the lessons living under three generations of communism has taught them, by far the most important is learning how to wait.

title: Families in Flint Cope With the Impact of Lead
description: The crisis presents an especially daunting challenge to pregnant women and the parents of young children.

title: For Families in Flint, a Daily Struggle to Avoid Tap Water
description: FLINT, Mich.  Shanice Ollie is 18 weeks pregnant with her third child, so shes not taking any chances. No matter what city health officials say, she will not drink, cook, do dishes or wash with lead water, which is how people here now refer to the tap water delivered to their homes.

title: John Quincy Adams: Militant Spirit, by James Traub
description: JOHN QUINCY ADAMSMilitant SpiritBy James Traub620 pp. Basic Books. $35.

title: Before Eagles Fly, They Must Hatch
description: Q. When do hatching eaglets start to breathe? Is there air in the egg before they energetically work their way out?

title: Louisa: The Extraordinary Life of Mrs. Adams, by Louisa Thomas
description: LOUISAThe Extraordinary Life of Mrs. AdamsBy Louisa Thomas500 pp. Penguin Press. $30.

title: What to Know About Saint Laurents New Creative Director, Anthony Vaccarello
description: On Monday, Saint Laurent announced that it had appointed Anthony Vaccarello as creative director, following the exit of Hedi Slimane. Heres what to know about the 33-year-old designer, who will present his first collection for the house in October.

title: How Election Results Really Work
description: With 13 more Election Days, the primary season still has a long way to go. Here we answer your questions about how live election results are reported and published on the New York Times website and apps.

title: Holocaust Survivor Recalls Brundibar, a Childrens Opera
description: MADRID  Dagmar Lieblova was 14 in 1943, when she sang in the childrens opera Brundibar at the Terezin concentration camp near Prague. The performance was part of a Nazi effort to present the camp as a model ghetto rather than a transit point to Auschwitz and the gas chambers.

title: Best Team, in One View, May Not Be the Warriors
description: You almost cant go too far in praising the Golden State Warriors this season.

title: Trumps Very Predictable Problems
description: The conventional wisdom on Donald Trumps candidacy is a strange thing to watch shift. Trump has had a rough two weeks, no question: Losing out in backstage delegate battles all over the map,saying a dozen contradictory things about abortion, seeing Ted Cruz risepast him in the Wisconsin polls, plus the daily drumbeat of strange statements and wildly-uninformed interview answers that we all now take for granted. But have the two weeks been so bad, compared to everything that we knew and could reasonably expect about Trump already, to justify this kind of plunge in his betting-market odds of being the nominee from eightypercent to fifty percent in a matter of a week? Have they been bad enough to justify as perspicacious a pundit as E.J. Dionne arguing that this time, it really is the end of Trump, and that the Donalds looming loss in Wisconsin could cascade into losses in New Jersey, Pennsylvania and even New York?

title: Horace and Pete, Keeping You on the Edge of Your Seat, Right Up to Last Call
description: Horace and Pete began as a complete surprise. Its only fitting it should end the same way.

title: Donald Trumps Struggle in Wisconsin Is About Demographics, Not Momentum
description: Donald Trump has had a rough couple of weeks. He said he supported punishing women for abortion and then walked it back; his campaign manager was arrested on a charge of battery; he retweeted an unflattering picture of his main opponents wife, Heidi Cruz.

title: Insane Car People Pay $22 Million for Seinfelds Fleet
description: AMELIA ISLAND, Fla.  On a steamy March day, Jerry Seinfeld stood before a group of men, most of them in polo shirts and loafers, in a muggy tent here at the Omni Amelia Plantation Resort.

title: To Beat Go Champion, Googles Program Needed a Human Army
description: Nearly 20 years ago, after a chess-playing computer called Deep Blue beat the world grandmaster Garry Kasparov, I wrote an article about why humans would long remain the champions in the game of Go.

title: Its Actually Not That Complicated: On Nancy Meyerss Instagram
description: Welcome to Social Capital, a series devoted to analyzing the social-media presences of celebrities.

title: Aggregate Supply and Depression Economics (Wonkish)
description: Robert Waldmann follows up on the question of who got what wrong in the late 1990s analysis of Japans liquidity trap. As he says, the extremely stripped-down nature of the model I used may have led some readers  like, surprisingly, Brad DeLong  to suppose that I had forgotten about the supply side. Actually, though, I still dont really understand the confusion  I explicitly began with a flexible-price model, then considered the effects of temporarily fixed prices, so how could that have been unclear?

title: Joseph Medicine Crow, Tribal War Chief and Historian, Dies at 102
description: Joseph Medicine Crow, the last living war chief of the Crow Tribe of Montana and a renowned Native American historian and anthropologist, died on Sunday at a hospice in Billings, Mont. He was 102.

title: Ted Cruz Insists Only He, or Donald Trump, Should Be Nominee
description: MADISON, Wis.  Senator Ted Cruz of Texas on Monday warned the Republican Party against pushing an uber-Washington lobbyist as a possible nominee at a contested convention, insisting that only he or Donald J. Trump should be chosen.

title: Who is Anthony Vaccarello, the New Designer of Yves Saint Laurent?
description: On Monday, Anthony Vaccarello was announced as the new creative director of Yves Saint Laurent, assuming the design position vacated by Hedi Slimane. For those in the fashion industry, where rumors of Mr. Vaccarellos appointment have been front-row chatter for months, the news was no surprise; to those outside the industry slipstream, a little more explanation may be helpful.

title: Alaska Airs Premium Deal for Virgin America
description: Alaska Air is paying through the nose cone for Virgin America. The airline secures some coveted airport slots with its $2.6 billion deal for Richard Bransons American carrier. Cost cuts fall way short of the deals premium to Virgins share price, however. Its a risky bet that the airline industry has changed its destructive ways.

title: Cooking Inside the Box
description: A new crop of meal kit services sells the idea of fast weeknight dinners with Instagram-worthy results.

title: Its Dinner in a Box. But Are Meal Delivery Kits Cooking?
description: If you drew up a list of people likely to hate home-delivered meal kits like Blue Apron, Sara Moulton would be on it. She is one of the nations most enduring recipe writers and cooking teachers, a former food stylist for Julia Child and a dean of food television and magazines in her own right, whose new book is called Home Cooking 101.

title: Israeli Militarys Spring-Cleaning Call: Return Our Gear, Please
description: RAMAT GAN, Israel  The bearded man placed three overstuffed shopping bags on a table at the entrance of a military base here, his expression turning to embarrassment as he emptied them, as if dropping off dirty laundry.

title: U.S. Officials Met With Belgians on Security Concerns Before Attacks
description: WASHINGTON  A foreign fighter surge team of experts from the F.B.I., the State Department and the Department of Homeland Security met with their Belgian counterparts a month before the Brussels terrorist attacks to try to correct gaps in Belgiums widely criticized ability to track terrorist plots, American officials said.

title: Nielsen and Dish Network Reach Deal on Set-Top-Box Data
description: Nielsen announced Monday that it would start incorporating set-top-box viewing data into its TV ratings system after striking a multiyear agreement with the satellite provider Dish Network.

title: Anthony Vaccarellos Designs
description: A look back at designs by the new creative director at Yves Saint Laurent.

title: NASA Is Facing a Climate Change Countdown
description: KENNEDY SPACE CENTER, Fla.  The concrete block perches absurdly atop a piling, elevated about 10 feet above the beach sand. Is it art? A bulky milepost?

title: Global Warming Linked to Public Health Risks, White House Says
description: WASHINGTON  Global warming could lead to an increase in allergies and asthma, deaths by extreme heat and the proliferation of insect-borne diseases such as the West Nile virus, according to a scientific report released Monday by the White House.

title: My Reservations About Hillary Are Real: Readers on Bernie or Bust
description: Some supporters of Bernie Sanders explained why they have pledged never to vote for Hillary Clinton if she becomes the Democratic nominee for president, while others implored die-hard Sanders voters to work with the party, in response to a column by Charles Blow.

title: Flatiron Building, Admired but Rarely Copied, Inspires Developers
description: New York is awash with architectural imitators: the rows of identical 19th-century brownstones, the spires and setbacks of the Art Deco era, the Seagram Building knockoffs strewn around Midtown Manhattan in the 1960s and 70s, the luxury fishbowls rising now.

title: Profile in Style: Olga of Greece
description: A private window into the colorful world of the artist, photographer, filmmaker and real-life princess.

title: Zayn Starts Off His Solo Career With a No. 1 Album
description: Zayn, the first member of the superstar boy band One Direction to release a solo album, has reached No. 1 on the Billboard chart.

title: Inside Princess Olga of Greeces Colorful, Art-Filled World
description: The artist and filmmaker shares with T personal images of her greatest influences.

title: Hillary Clinton Roundly Criticized for Referring to the Unborn as a Person
description: Hillary Clinton faced criticism from both sides of the abortion debate on Monday after she waded into the fraught argument about when life begins by describing the unborn as a person.

title: A Jewelers Ode to His Glamorous Grandparents
description: These brilliant orbs of hand-cut Jaipuri crystal atop 1920s Japanese pearls, held aloft by delicate talons of diamonds, represent the latest chapter in the designer Hanut Singhs familys obsession with jewels. His great-grandfather, a maharajah famous for his taste in stones, fancied ornate turban pins and ropes of pearls. His grandmother Princess Karam  a celebrated beauty photographed by Cecil Beaton and dressed by Mainbocher  was never without custom pieces made for her by Van Cleef & Arpels and Cartier. Singh, 43, who works between Los Angeles, Mumbai and his native New Delhi, recalls playing in her well-stocked jewelry box as a youngster. Thus inspired, these exquisite earrings, dubbed The Emperors Cap, take the form of his great-grandfathers turbans, while also winkingly referencing the shape of toys  those spinning tops beloved by Indian children.

title: 25th Anniversary of 1991 Kuwaiti Oil Fires
description: In April of 1991 following Iraqi military setting the Kuwait Oil Fields aflame, photographer Sebastio Salgado documented the environmental disaster

title: Yes, Marry for the Sake of the Children
description: To the Editor:

title: Brooklyn Man Pleads Guilty in Transgender Womans 2013 Death
description: A Brooklyn man who fatally beat a transgender woman after a chance encounter in Harlem in 2013 pleaded guilty on Monday to manslaughter in exchange for a sentence of 12 years in prison, prosecutors said.

description: To the Editor:

title: Funny Stuff at the Tribeca Ball
description: An exhibition on view at the New York Academy of Arts spring gala features paintings that involve humor in a variety of ways.

title: A Presidential Historians View
description: To the Editor:

title: United Auto Workers: Reject the TPP
description: To the Editor:

title: Six (Very) Funny Paintings From Tonights Tribeca Ball
description: Gala season in the New York art world can rightfully conjure thoughts of stuffy seated dinners, with dry chicken and even drier speeches. Not so at tonights Tribeca Ball to benefit the New York Academy of Art, where something new is on the menu: a little wit and whimsy. The works on display in Funny Stuff, a new exhibition of paintings being mounted for tonights festivities, involve humor in a variety of ways  from Monica Cooks semi-grotesque Extra Body, which depicts the grooming rituals of a pair of Siamese twins conjoined at the head, to Jaclyn Browns riff on Tinder, Tender, to Ken Johnsons Untitled, which sets up a joke  a duck and a sphere walk into a bar  but leaves its punch line unsaid. An exclusive preview of some of the canvases that will be on view runs here.

title: Dave Eggers Journeys Into Alaska in Heroes of the Frontier
description: If there is anything resembling a pattern in Dave Eggerss fiction, it is that he does not repeat himself much. Mr. Eggerss eclectic body of work includes novels about a sinister, all-powerful technology company (The Circle); a Sudanese refugees flight from a war-torn village (What Is the What); an American salesman seeking to reinvent himself in Saudi Arabia (A Hologram for the King); and a boy who sails to a land full of wild, magical beasts (The Wild Things).

title: Paying Library Fines
description: To the Editor:

title: Officials React to Panama Papers
description: Many international officials who were listed in papers revealing the offshore accounts of wealthy individuals, including associates of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia, defended themselves on Monday.

title: Allen Iverson Stands Tall in New Hall of Fame Class
description: Some big names, and big men, were announced as the newest members of the Basketball Hall of Fame on Monday.

title: A Jewel in Syria Where Ruins Have Been Ruined by ISIS
description: PALMYRA, Syria  As my Hezbollah escort and I entered the modern city around Palmyra, we were greeted by the mangled body of an Islamic State fighter left to rot in the sun. He looked as if dogs might have gotten to him after Syrian government forces, backed by loyal militiamen, routed him and his comrades from the ancient city after almost a year of Islamic State control.

title: You Could Actually Snooze Your Way Through an Asteroid Belt
description: Actually: If you were in the middle of an asteroid belt, you probably wouldnt see any asteroids at all.

title: Panama Papers Leaks Put Iceland Prime Minister Under Pressure to Quit
description: LONDON  Icelands prime minister faced calls for his resignation and a large demonstration outside Parliament on Monday in one of the first repercussions of an enormous leak of documents about offshore shell companies and tax shelters from a secretive Panamanian law firm.

title: Panama Papers: Why No Big Splash or Times Participation?
description: Updated, 2:19 p.m., Tuesday, to add comment from the consortiums deputy director, Marina Walker, and The Timess executive editor, Dean Baquet, at the bottom of the post.

title: Hillary Clinton Raises Less Than Bernie Sanders for Third Month in a Row
description: Hillary Clinton raised $29.5 million in March, her campaign announced on Monday, far less than the $44 million raised by Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont during the same period.

title: Bernie Sanders Makes Progress Courting Nevadas Delegates
description: Senator Bernie Sanders is holding out hope that a strong showing at the Clark County convention in Nevada over the weekend could help him top Hillary Clinton in the race for the states delegates.

title: Republicans and Voter Suppression
description: Its become an accepted truth of modern politics that Republican electoral prospects go up as the number of voters goes down. Conservatives have known this for a long time, which helps explain their intensifying efforts to make it harder to vote, or to eliminate large numbers of people from political representation entirely.

title: 1878 | Adolph Ochss First Times (The One in Chattanooga)
description: Times Insider shares historic insights from The New York Times. In this piece, David W. Dunlap, a metro reporter, looks back at The Timess Tennessean roots.

title: Winston Moseley, Who Killed Kitty Genovese, Dies in Prison at 81
description: Winston Moseley, who stalked, raped and killed Kitty Genovese in a prolonged knife attack in New York in 1964 while neighbors failed to act on her desperate cries for help  a nightmarish tableau that came to symbolize urban apathy in America  died on March 28, in prison. He was 81.

title: Thomas Staggs, Disneys Heir Apparent, Is Stepping Down
description: LOS ANGELES  Thomas O. Staggs, the favored contender to lead Disney after Robert A. Igers retirement, unexpectedly announced his departure on Monday, throwing succession at the worlds largest entertainment company into disarray.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Review: Grace McLean, Whose Songs Skip Across Boundaries
description: Metamorphosis: Everything is changing into something else in the music of Grace McLean, the phenomenal young singer, songwriter and actress, who closed this season of Lincoln Centers American Songbook series on Friday evening with a concert of pure joy. With her band, Them Apples, she transformed the Stanley H. Kaplan Penthouse into a playground for exploring musical connections in a fluid program of songs that gleefully skipped across traditional boundaries. Swing, hip-hop, electronica, jazz and modern theater styles flowed into one another in a musical stream of consciousness.

title: Review: Vivian Reed, Serenading With Theatrical Power and Spirituality
description: The pop-gospel singer Vivian Reed isnt the first performer to explore the emotional extremes of the great Sondheim torch song Losing My Mind, from Follies. But she is the first I can remember to make it the platform for a flailing, semi-operatic mad scene. Ms. Reed is a fiercely elegant performer who holds nothing back. Like Lena Horne at her most imperious, she can be a little scary. On the few occasions she cracks a smile, you sigh with relief.

title: Review: Joe Iconis and Family Join in Effervescent, Talky Tunes
description: Time was when children, entranced by Barnum & Bailey magic, dreamed of running away and joining the circus. For those of us who were born with a musical-theater gene, the troupe known as Joe Iconis and Family exerts a similar allure. Their irresistibly jolly 90-minute revue, which opened at Feinsteins/54 Below on Sunday evening, is the kind of show that deserves a long-term theatrical residency. The performers seem to be having such a good time that you want to jump onstage and join them.

title: Review: Kronos Quartet Fosters Contemporary Works for Strings
description: For over 40 years, the Kronos Quartet has been reimagining what a string quartet can be and fostering new music from diverse composers, more than 850 works and arrangements so far. So what is the quartet up to these days? Commissioning more pieces, naturally.

title: What Do Millennials Want? Hotels Have Some Ideas
description: Hotels are concluding that millennial travelers want three things: customized experiences, digital convenience and relevant information on social media.

title: People to Know: A Creative Couple that Does It All Together
description: Almost three years ago, a curious video appeared on YouTube. Called Kerous Lament, it featured strobing, mysterious footage of the ocean and of a little girl self-immolating, set against a sweeping postrock anthem that vowed resistance to the powers of old, to the powers that be.

title: California Enacts $15 Minimum Wage
description: Gov. Jerry Brown of California signed a bill on Monday that would raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour by 2022, placing the state at the center of a closely watched economics experiment.

title: Marshall Miller, Former Federal Prosecutor, Joins Wachtell Lipton
description: Marshall L. Miller, a former high-ranking Justice Department official who handled a number of prominent Wall Street prosecutions, has joined Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz as a white-collar defense lawyer, the firm said in a statement on Monday.

title: Review: Royal Shakespeare Companys King and Country at BAM
description: Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown.

title: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Angola Strains Health Organizations
description: Angola is experiencing a major urban yellow fever outbreak that threatens other countries, including China, and is exposing how poorly prepared the world is to fight two mosquito-borne epidemics at once.

title: Gunfire Ends Post-Election Calm in the Republic of Congo
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Gunfire rang out for hours in Brazzaville, the capital of the Republic of Congo, early Monday as armed men attacked police stations and a mayors office.

title: Review: Wrestling Jerusalem, a Solo Show and Act of Faith
description: Aaron Davidmans Wrestling Jerusalem, at 59E59 Theaters, is an act of faith. A smartly written solo show about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, it trusts in the power of the human voice and the capacity of the human heart. It believes that listening to one anothers stories can change the way we move through the world. That, really, is its reason for being.

title: A Cloud Atlas Provides Clues to Life on Earth
description: After countless years of daydreamers being told otherwise, theres now a good reason to keep your head in the clouds. Scientists combed through satellite photographs of cloud cover taken twice a day for 15 years from nearly every square kilometer of Earth to study the planets varied environments.

title: Review: Suzanne Farrins Imaginative La Dolce Morte at the Met
description: Through its MetLive Arts series, the Metropolitan Museum of Art strives to present concerts in spaces that suit the music. That mission was accomplished over the weekend with the premiere of Suzanne Farrins La Dolce Morte, a dramatic cantata in the form of a song cycle for countertenor and small chamber ensemble. As a text, Ms. Farrin chose love poems by Michelangelo written to Tommaso de Cavalieri, a young Roman nobleman the artist met in 1532.

title: Review: Roman Rabinovich Brings Melody to His Art, at Walter Reade Theater
description: Mussorgskys Pictures at an Exhibition and Rachmaninoffs Isle of the Dead are among the most well known examples of compositions inspired by visual art. More recently, the pianist and composer Michael Brown wrote Surfaces after studying the abstract art of the pianist and painter Roman Rabinovich. Mr. Rabinovich gave the premiere of the piece on Sunday morning at the Walter Reade Theater, part of Lincoln Centers one-hour Coffee Concerts series.

title: Review: Golf Channel Drama and Adult Swim Duffers
description: Attention, golf fans. For your viewing pleasure this week: something so right and something so very, very wrong.

title: Breanna Stewart Is a Syracuse Fan but a UConn Star
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Few players on the Syracuse womens basketball team have as long a history with the program as Breanna Stewart does.

title: Review: Eric Fairs Consequence, a Memoir by a Former Abu Ghraib Interrogator
description: The infamous photos of torture at Abu Ghraib prison in Iraq that became public in the spring of 2004  a pyramid of naked prisoners, a hooded man forced to stand in a crucifixionlike pose, a cowering man on a dog leash  were evidence not of just a few bad apples among the prison guards but, as an Army investigation found, documentation of a systemic problem: Military personnel had perpetrated numerous incidents of sadistic, blatant, and wanton criminal abuses. The abuses had roots in decisions made at the highest levels of the Bush administration, which asserted that the United States need not abide by the Geneva Conventions in its war on terror.

title: 13 Noteworthy Watches from Baselworld
description: Despite a wobbly world economy, the appetite for luxury watches showed no signs of slowing at this years Baselworld.

title: Three Days at Baselworld, the Worlds Biggest Watch Fair
Columbia Students Protest a Henry Moore Sculpture
description: Sculptures by Henry Moore, one of the most influential and celebrated British artists of the 20th century, are on public display in parks and plazas around the world. They reside in major museums like the Tate and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. But plans to install one of Moores works at Columbia University has made students angry.

title: Black Girls Rock! Holds Up an Unapologetic Mirror
description: NEWARK  Shonda Rhimes held hands with Cicely Tyson. Kelly Rowland gushed over Tracee Ellis Ross. Rihanna doled out hugs and snapped photos with young girls.

title: Wanted: Cruise Lecturers Who Mingle and Take Good Selfies
description: Mark P. Hertling, a retired three-star Army general, now gives speeches on corporate leadership. So when a friend suggested he try giving lectures to passengers on a cruise ship, it seemed like a good way for him and his wife to take an affordable vacation.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Bernie Sanders, Kansas City Royals, Donald Trump
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Man Who Stole Jazz Pianist Cecil Taylors Prize Money Is Sentenced
description: A Long Island contractor was sentenced on Monday to one to three years in prison for stealing nearly $500,000 in prize money awarded to his friend, the jazz pianist Cecil Taylor.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Brass Foundry Is Closing, but Debate Over Degass Work Goes On
description: The Valsuani foundry, whose bronze sculptures by Edgar Degas have roiled the art market for more than a decade, is closing, by order of a French judge who ruled that its business, just outside Paris, should be liquidated to pay off creditors.

title: Ethnic Conflict Between Armenia and Azerbaijan Flares Anew
description: STEPANAKERT, Azerbaijan  The old soldiers spilled out of buses into a square, fired up by a desire to fight, and to die if necessary, in a new war with an old enemy: the Azerbaijanis.

title: New York Observer, Whose Editor Helped Donald Trump With Speech, Vows No More Such Input
description: The New York Observer, which is owned by Donald J. Trumps son-in-law, said Mondaythat its editorial staff would no longer aid or advise Mr. Trumps presidential campaign, after areport that the papers editor had helped write a major foreign policy speech Mr. Trump gave two weeks ago.

title: N.C.A.A. Championship: Villanova Beats North Carolina on Buzzer-Beater
Helicopter Crash Kills Five in Tennessee
description: ATLANTA  At least five people were killed Monday when a sightseeing helicopter crashed in east Tennessee, the authorities said.

title: Despite Fears, Affordable Care Act Has Not Uprooted Employer Coverage
description: The Affordable Care Act was aimed mainly at giving people better options for buying health insurance on their own. There were widespread predictions that employers would leap at the chance to drop coverage and send workers to fend for themselves.

title: Brooklyn Man Charged in Shooting and Robbery of Knicks Cleanthony Early
description: A Brooklyn man has been charged by federal prosecutors with taking part in the robbery and shooting of the New York Knicks forward Cleanthony Early late last year outside a strip club in Queens, court papers say.

title: N.B.A. Games of the Week: Spurs vs. Warriors
description: Longtime N.B.A. observers will tell you that Spurs Coach Gregg Popovich only cares about the regular season insofar as it affects his teams chances in the playoffs. Individual accolades, particularly his own, seem to mean little to him. When he was asked, last February, about getting his thousandth career win, he responded in characteristic Pop fashion: Give me a break, he said.

title: Crippling Strike in France May Have Been About More Than Labor Law
description: PARIS  It was published several years ago, but a cartoon on the front page of the French newspaper Le Monde roughly summed up the situation across the country last Thursday when several hundred thousand public employees and students went on strike.

title: Modern-Day Bullfighting
description: When Alex Quesada met a teenager who was training to become a bullfighter, he wondered why a child of privilege would embrace a medieval blood sport.

title: The Marketing Power of Sports Stars
description: With only four months left before the start of the Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, marketing executives throughout the world are well along in their hunt for the next big stars in sports  and in advertising.

title: Hedge Funds Sue to Freeze Puerto Rico Banks Assets
description: A group of hedge funds asked a federal court in San Juan on Monday to freeze the assets of Puerto Ricos powerful Government Development Bank, claiming it was insolvent and appeared to be spending what cash it had left to prop up other parts of the islands troubled government.

title: Ukraine: Conflict Brings Hunger Crisis
description: The two-year-old conflict in eastern Ukraine has left about 1.5 million people hungry, including nearly 300,000 in need of immediate help, the World Food Program, the main anti-hunger humanitarian agency of the United Nations, said on Monday. As the conflict continues, we need to reach these people urgently, the agencys representative in Ukraine, Giancarlo Stopponi, said in a statement. The numbers of hungry Ukrainians have multiplied since the agency first intervened late in 2014 to help feed people upended in the conflict, distributing emergency rations and cash. Ukraine was historically known as Europes breadbasket for its rich soil and agricultural output. As of the first quarter of 2016, Ukraine is the only country in Europe to require and receive assistance from the World Food Program.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Set Date for Next Debate
description: The debate about the next Democratic debate is, finally, settled.

title: Amtrak Trying to Determine if Workers Were Authorized to Be on Tracks
description: The Amtrak train that slammed into a backhoe on Sunday morning in Chester, Pa., leaving two workers dead on the tracks, was barreling along at 106 miles an hour seconds before the crash, federal investigators said on Monday.

title: U.S. Moves to Thwart Use of Foreign Inversions as Tax Dodge
description: The Treasury Department took new steps on Monday to further curtail a popular type of merger in which an American company buys a foreign counterpart, then moves abroad to lower its tax bill.

title: What Are the Panama Papers?
description: The Panama Papers have exposed how some of the worlds most powerful people may have used offshore bank accounts and shell companies to conceal their wealth or avoid taxes.

title: After Petition, Greg Louganis Gets His Wheaties Box
description: Eight months after a documentary about the diver Greg Louganis inspired an online petition asking that he be belatedly featured on the cover of a Wheaties box, the cereals maker is announcing that it will do just that.

title: U.S. Sues ValueAct, Saying Hedge Fund Violated Antitrust Law
description: Not long after Baker Hughes and Halliburton announced a merger agreement in November 2014, ValueAct, led by Jeffrey W. Ubben, started acquiring stakes in both energy giants.

title: Supreme Court Is Working Hard to Avoid Deadlocks, Kagan Says
description: The Supreme Court, facing the prospect of an extended stretch with an eight-member bench, is working really hard to reach consensus and avoid deadlocks, Justice Elena Kagan said on Monday.

title: Big East Finds Respect Is More Elusive Than Success
description: HOUSTON  A man dressed in Oklahoma crimson and cream walked in the hot Texas sun outside a mammoth football stadium on Saturday and told the person on the other end of his cellphone, Basketballs just what you do to kill time before football season, but it would be fun.

title: Ted Cruz Is Fuming Because John Kasich Wont Bow Out
description: MADISON, Wis.  Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, eyeing a victory here that could reshape the race for the Republican presidential nomination, has appeared most vexed by a rival he views as more of a long-term nuisance than a short-term threat: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio.

title: Brooklyn Businessman Is Killed With His Own Stolen Truck, Police Say
description: A 63-year-old man was killed in Brooklyn on Monday after he pursued a man who had stolen his truck and then ran him over with the vehicle, the police said.

title: Ted Cruz, Sensing Victory in Wisconsin, Strolls Through a Castle of Cheese
Donald Trump, Stumbling With Women, Enlists Wife to Campaign
description: MILWAUKEE  Donald J. Trump  he of the glamorous wives and high-profile romances  likes to boast of his prowess with women.

title: U.N. Strives for Transparency in Picking New Secretary General
description: UNITED NATIONS  For the first time in the history of the United Nations, those vying to be the next secretary general have to post their rsums, subject themselves to open hearings and declare publicly why they want this plummy  and thankless  job.

title: Our Young Man Reframes a 19th-Century Work in the 1980s
description: Edmund White is one of the pre-eminent chroniclers of modern gay life, yet he often follows assured comments with self-deprecating caveats. Earned wisdom comes with But why should you listen to my advice?, and he is quick to say that plot isnt his strong point.

title: Review: Antlia Pneumatica, With Voices in the Dark
description: Audiences for Anne Washburns Antlia Pneumatica, which opened on Monday night at Playwrights Horizons, could be excused for wondering if its title might be ancient Greek for The Big Chill. Like that popular Lawrence Kasdan movie from 1983, this brow-furrowing work from the author of Mr. Burns reunites a group of scattered friends on the cusp of middle age when one of their old gang dies abruptly.

title: Celebrity Guest Solver Neal Pollack
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Its not often that Wordplay acts as a trigger for solvers, so you can imagine my surprise to learn that crossword puzzles make author Neal Pollack sick. In his notes below youll learn why, but Id like to publicly apologize to him for triggering any sinking feeling, nausea and  fear of fiery death this puzzle might have invoked.

title: With a Stand-Alone App, Starz Looks Beyond the Cable Bundle
description: And then there was Starz.

title: Prosecutors Seek Prison Sentences for Dean Skelos and Son in Corruption Case
description: If prosecutors have their way, Dean G. Skelos, the former majority leader of the New York State Senate, will be sentenced to about 12 to 15 years in prison for his conviction on federal corruption charges in December.

title: A Spot at Augusta, Finally, and a Comrade in Trump
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Donald J. Trump jumped at the opportunity to make Jim Hermans game great. Trump, the front-runner for the Republican presidential nomination, peeled away from the campaign trail last month to play a round of golf with Herman, whose PGA Tour career he has helped finance.

title: District Fight May Persist in Texas After Supreme Court Ruling
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  With a long-running legal struggle raging over one of the nations strictest voter identification laws, Texas was already a prime battleground in a war between conservatives and liberals over voting rights. And on Monday, experts here and elsewhere say, the Supreme Court may have opened a second front.

title: Islanders Offense Awakens After Coachs Scolding
description: The Islanders were scolded by their coach at the morning skate, and they responded with a spirited 5-2 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Monday at Barclays Center.

title: Meeting Merrick Garland to Tell Him Why G.O.P. Wont Hold Hearings
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Charles E. Grassley, the chairman of the Judiciary Committee, on Monday invited President Obamas Supreme Court nominee to breakfast to explain, face to face, why Republicans have no intention of holding hearings on his appointment.

title: U.S. Seeks Answers to Delays at Phoenix-Area Polls on Primary Day
description: PHOENIX  The Justice Department has opened an investigation over the decisions that led to the chaotic presidential primaries in Arizonas most populous county, where thousands of voters waited up to five hours to cast ballots and thousands more were barred from participating because of mistakes and confusion over party registration.

title: Better Call Saul Season 2, Episode 8: Touch of Evil
description: Apparently, it was arts and crafts week on Better Call Saul. Jimmy deploys an X-acto knife, some glue and a pair of tweezers to sabotage legal documents stacked in his brothers house. Mike uses a hammer, a hose and some nails to make  actually, Im not sure what hes making, but it sure looks as if it could inflict pain. Or destroy tires. It could inflict pain, then destroy tires.

title: What Hulk Hogans Gawker Lawsuit Means for Our Privacy
description: HULK HOGANS lawsuit against Gawker Media, heard in a Florida courtroom last month, had the surreal quality of, well, a professional wrestling match. Mr. Hogan sued the company after Gawker posted a video clip showing the wrestler having sex with the then-wife of his then-friend, the radio personality Bubba the Love Sponge.

title: Villanova Wins N.C.A.A. Championship on Last-Second Shot
description: HOUSTON  They run the play so often in practice that Villanova Coach Jay Wright hardly needed to draw it up in the huddle. It is instantly recognizable by a simple name: Nova.

title: 3 Boys at Manhattan School Arrested After One Threatens Student With Gun, Police Say
description: Three teenagers were in police custody on Monday night after one of them threatened another student with a handgun at a public school on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, the police said.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | recurrent
description: recurrent  \ri-kr-nt, -k-rnt\  adjective

title: Brexit: Explaining Britains Vote on European Union Membership
description: Britain will hold a referendum on Thursday on whether to leave the European Union, a decision nicknamed Brexit.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I just felt like now, someone will believe me.

title: Corrections: April 5, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: The youth mentoring organization Black Girls Rock! celebrates women in high places. American Idol takes a walk down memory lane. And Fandor streams Summer With Monika, Ingmar Bergmans once-shocking 1953 ode to young passion.

title: AccorHotels of France Buys Onefinestay for $169 Million
description: AccorHotels, one of Europes largest hotel groups, announced on Tuesday that it had bought Onefinestay, a London-based short-term vacation rental company, for 148 million euros, or $169 million.

title: Magnifying the World of Beauty That Lives Under a Microscope
description: In the 1920s, before matter could be magnified millions of times under electron microscopes, a German graphic designer was developing his own techniques for capturing the minute wonders of organic life.

title: Modern-Day Bullfighting
description: Bullfighting was something Alex Quesada watched on television when he was growing up in Spain. Not because it was interesting. But because as a young man, its what you do. The big corridas are just like the Super Bowl, he said.

title: How Covenants Make Us
description: When you think about it, there are four big forces coursing through modern societies. Global migration is leading to demographic diversity. Economic globalization is creating wider opportunity but also inequality. The Internet is giving people more choices over what to buy and pay attention to. A culture of autonomy valorizes individual choice and self-determination.

title: Donald Trump and the Nice People of Wisconsin
description: DONT call me a cheesehead.

title: Making Way for Wind Power
description: If the United States is going to get serious about cutting carbon emissions from oil and gas, it will have to find ways to scale up its use of renewable energy. Converting wind and solar power into electricity is, in some ways, the easy part. The bigger challenge is developing the infrastructure to transmit that electricity across the country.

title: What Is This Thing Called Populism?
description: Arthur Brooks: Hi, Gail. All eyes are glued to Wisconsin this week, which looks to be a dead heat on both sides. Whatever happens, it cant be as confusing as North Dakota last Saturday, where the Republican caucus apparently descended into chaos.

title: The Border Patrols Bizarre Choice
description: Turn away, for a moment, from the generalized idiocy of the presidential campaign to consider a specific instance of monumental dimness. It happened Wednesday.

title: Walking Together for Health and Spirit
description: In early 2013, the Rev. Theresa S. Thames stumbled upon a Facebook page titled GirlTrek: Healthy Black Women and Girls.

title: A Case of Polish-Jewish Relations
description: When George Nowicki, a prospective therapy patient, called for an appointment, it wasnt just the name but the heavy accent that identified him as Polish. The accent was familiar to me: I, too, was born in Poland, in a region that is now a part of Ukraine. In anticipation of working with him, I felt both excitement and a sense of foreboding.

title: Donald Trump, Despite Bashing Beijing, Is Not Without Fans in China
description: BEIJING  Last month, as Donald J. Trumps lead in the Republican presidential primaries widened and his feud with the party establishment intensified, Ding Qiushi, a chemist in Nanjing and founder of the online Trump Fan Club, sang his praises: A political outsider is taking the country by storm, with unflinching courage.

title: A Conversation With Asian-Americans on Race
description: Asian-Americans confront stereotypes about their community.

title: A Conversation With Asian-Americans on Race
description: In this installment of our Conversations on Race series for Op-Docs, Asian-Americans talk about how stereotypes unfairly confine them  particularly the one that brands them a model minority. As the subjects of our film explain, this perception not only devalues the experiences of other racial minorities, but it also renders the diverse experiences of Asian-Americans invisible.

title: News Qs | Drones Marshaled to Drop Lifesaving Supplies Over Rwandan Terrain
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Drones Marshaled to Drop Lifesaving Supplies Over Rwandan Terrain.

title: Trips Not Toasters: Wedding Registries for Travel Lovers
description: Spring wedding season is here. Why register for china when you can register for a trip to China?

title: In Case You Missed It: March's Top Real Estate Stories
description: Catch up on the most popular stories of the month.

title: Whats Driving Trump and Clinton Voters to the Polls
description: Exit polls from the primaries and caucuses show which issues and presidential qualities voters value  or dont value.

title: Challengers Need Big Wins in Wisconsin Primary to Keep Nomination Within Reach
description: Wisconsins highly engaged voters routinely post some of the highest turnout numbers in presidential elections. On Tuesday, they will play an important role in both major-party nominating contests. Check out some of the things we will be watching.

title: German Economy, Once Europes Leader, Now Looks Like Laggard
description: FRANKFURT  China is cutting back on mining machinery as its economy slips. The United Arab Emirates and other Middle Eastern countries are no longer awash in oil money, putting luxury car brands at risk. Russia, still facing Western sanctions, cannot buy as much high-tech energy equipment.

title: Fashion Statements at the Armory Show
description: At the V.I.P. preview, a stylish gathering of collectors, gallerists and artists check out the works on sale.

title: Will You Sprint, Stroll or Stumble Into a Career?
description: At the age of 18, G. Stanley Hall left his home in the tiny village of Ashfield, Mass., for Williams College, just 35 miles away, with a goal to do something and be something in the world. His mother wanted him to become a minister, but the young Stanley wasnt sure about that plan. He saw a four-year degree as a chance to explore.

title: Student Question | Do Female Athletes Get Short Shrift?
description: The United States womens soccer team has won three World Cup tournaments. Still, its players argued in a federal complaint that they get paid significantly less than players on the United States mens team.

title: Local Politics Take an Uncivil Turn, Roiling a Suburb of New York
description: SPRING VALLEY, N.Y.  Like characters out of Looney Tunes, the mayor of this village and his political nemesis, a fellow trustee on the Village Board, seem engaged in a constant effort to sabotage one another.

title: Nurturing Orangutans Left Orphaned and Homeless by Blazes
description: Efforts to rehabilitate the apes native to Borneo and Sumatras rain forests have been imperiled by fires, which have reduced the potential habitat.

title: Indonesias Orangutans Suffer as Fires Rage and Businesses Grow
description: NYARU MENTENG, Indonesia  Katty, a docile, orange-haired preschooler, fell from a tree with a thump. Her teacher quickly picked her up, dusted off her bottom, refastened her white disposable diaper and placed her back on a branch more than seven feet off the ground.

title: Lin-Manuel Miranda: By the Book
description: The star and creator of the musical Hamilton says Things Fall Apart was his favorite book to teach at Hunter College High School: The kids walk out of the classroom as different people.

title: Love in the Time of Monogamy
description: Its hard to say how many people in the United States practice polygamy  estimates vary widely, from 20,000 to half a million  but its clear most of their fellow Americans disapprove. In a 2013 Gallup poll about morally controversial issues, a mere 14 percent of the public said they accepted polygamy (only adultery and cloning humans had lower approval rates). An earlier poll found two-thirds of the public felt the government had a right to outlaw the practice, which typically takes the form of a married man also living in a marriage-type relationship with other women. So dont read too much into the popularity of TV shows like Sister Wives and Big Love. The country is not ready for plural marriage.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Wisconsin, Panama, Villanova
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Gucci Calls for End to Separation of the Sexes on the Runway
description: The move toward mixed gender fashion shows is getting a big-name boost  from Gucci. On Tuesday at The New York Times International Luxury conference in Versailles, France, Marco Bizzarri, chief executive of the brand, called for an end to separation of the sexes, or at least to their collections. From 2017, he said, the anchor brand of the Kering group will no longer hold different shows for mens and womens wear, but will rather combine the two into a single show, to be held each season.

title: New York Today: Testy Times
description: Updated, 12:02 p.m.

title: Some G.O.P. Names Missing From Brief Accusing Obama of Immigration Overreach
description: Forty-three Republican senators signed on to a new Supreme Court filing accusing President Obama of grossly overstepping his executive power when he created programs to prevent the deportation of millions of undocumented immigrants. Just as interesting are some of the 11 senators who did not sign on to the politically charged legal document.

title: Ask Well: How Do You Die From Alzheimers?
description: Question:

title: Morning Agenda: U.S. Moves to Restrict Foreign Deals Intended to Avoid Taxes
description: U.S. MOVES TO RESTRICT FOREIGN DEALS INTENDED TO AVOID TAXES | The Treasury Department took additional steps on Monday to discourage American companies from making foreign acquisitions so that they can move overseas for a lower tax rate,  Leslie Picker and Michael J. de la Merced report in DealBook. The Treasury Department had issued rules in September 2014 and in November to restrict this type of acquisition, known as a corporate inversion, but the measures announced on Monday are aimed at what the government calls serial inverters, or foreign companies that have bulked up through multiple deals with American companies in a short period. The new rules threaten Pfizers proposed $150 billion takeover of Allergan, a drug maker based in Dublin. Though the Pfizer-Allergan deal is not structured as an inversion (technically Allergan is the acquirer and Pfizer is the target), it still achieves the same goal of a lower tax rate abroad.

title: Why Germany Slips When China Swoons
description: The German export machine has been fueled by the growth of emerging markets. As developing countries like China now pull back, it is leaving Germany more vulnerable, and by extension Europe.

title: Parents With Sleep Problems Think Their Children Have Them, Too
description: If you tell your childs pediatrician that your child is having trouble sleeping, she might respond by asking you how well you sleep yourself.

title: In Panama Papers, Finding the Good News in Widespread Tax Cheating
description: The war on rampant tax evasion may not be hopeless after all.

title: The C.E.O. of Hamilton Inc.
description: As the lead producer of the hit musical Hamilton, Jeffrey Seller straddles a divide between art and commerce. In his appearance and manner, he takes pains not to come across as a suit, the money guy in a bohemian world of waiters and food runners who have scraped, sweated and auditioned their way onto Broadway. Trim and fit from a regimen of swimming and yoga, he naturally folds himself into his surprisingly small Midtown office, which has room for a desk, a couch and not much else. Most days, Seller shows up in jeans (or shorts in warmer weather) and an untucked button-down shirt with a bicycle helmet clipped to his backpack. I told him once that its nice he doesnt have to care too much about how he dresses for work. Oh, believe me, he said, I do care. At the musicals opening night on Broadway and the over-the-top party that followed (live music by the Roots, fireworks over the Hudson River), he wore a whimsical black suit from the Band of Outsiders label; the white stripes on the jacket lapels made him look a little like a bellhop.

title: The Dark History of Defending the Homeland
description: In 2010, the screenwriter and producer Alex Gansa finished the script for a political thriller involving a deeply troubled C.I.A. agent and a soldier who had been turned by the Taliban, and began thinking about a title. He recalls that he wanted a word or phrase to conjure an atmosphere of creepy subversion  something sinister, xenophobic, un-American. Shadowland? No, not quite. Homeland? Perfect.

title: Wisconsins Time in the Campaign Spotlight
description: Wisconsin is upon us.

title: Does My Family Own a Painting Looted by Nazis?
description: For decades, it hung near the dining room inside a family home: a genre painting by a Dutch old master depicting an old man and his wife weighing and counting their gold coins. Judged a genuine work by Jan Steen and dated to the 1660s, it was once valued at $400,000.

title: In Paris Bakeries, Libert From Gluten
description: Pariss ubiquitous corner boulangeries have long been temples to gluten, with their baguettes, croissants and decadent patisseries. And yet, of all food trends, it is gluten-free that is taking hold. In Paris, you can now find bakeries selling breads and sweet creations made, as the French say, sans gluten. Specialized cafes offer gluten-free sandwiches, and gluten-free goods have taken over their own aisle at the supermarket.

title: Weekly News Quiz | March 29-April 4, 2016
description: Have you been following the news?

title: China Censors Mentions of Panama Papers Leaks
description: HONG KONG  The release of the Panama Papers is setting off a political firestorm the world over, prompting protests calling for the resignation of Icelands prime minister and drawing stern replies from the Kremlin.

title: 1966: Premier Backs Down
description: DA NANG  Premier Nguyen Cao Ky backed down tonight [April 5] from a military showdown with anti-government forces at Da Nang. He flew back to Saigon after apologizing for calling the city Communist dominated. But the political crisis spread when the military leaders of Hue rose against him.

title: Rejected by Colleges, SAT and ACT Gain High School Acceptance

title: The Politics of Bangladeshs Genocide Debate

The conflict culminated in the birth of a new nation, Bangladesh. The war, which lasted nine months, was a brutal one: Depending on the source, some 300,000 to three million people were killed, and millions were displaced.

The newly created role could give her authority exceeding the presidents.

title: 1941: Yugoslavia to Resist Germany
description: BELGRADE  With the zero hour at hand, Yugoslavia waited calmly tonight [April 5] for the German army to move. Military preparations were being completed. Diplomatic activity had virtually ceased. Yugoslavia is assuming more and more the aspect of an armed camp.

title: Digital Paper in China Covers Contentious Issues, Now in English

It covers contentious issues  such as official corruption and a recent scandal involving improperly stored vaccines  with a clutch of digital bells and whistles. Its smartphone app, it says, has been downloaded about 10 million times.

The dilapidated building sits on several acres of fallow land, a sharp contrast to its state in 1914, when it was just one piece of the American inventors formidable manufacturing operation.

title: Former Top Military Official in China Took Huge Bribes, Inquiry Finds
description: HONG KONG  Prosecutors in China have completed an investigation of the former top military officer in the country, finding that he and his relatives took huge bribes, the official state news agency Xinhua reported on Tuesday.

description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  Islamist rebels in Syria shot down a government fighter jet and captured its pilot in the countrys north on Tuesday, anti-government activists said.

title: HTC Vive Is Latest Virtual Reality Product in a Growing Market

title: Clearing Space on the Apple TV

title: Air France Faces Backlash Over Veil Policy on Route to Iran

Raised in Stevenage, England, and now based in Monaco, he is defending his title this season, which kicked off March 20. Mr. Hamilton, a phenom who first got behind the wheel at age 8, is  a frequent presence at fashion shows, and sports a look much like his racing style: sleek and occasionally flashy.

description: On the eve last month of Nowruz, the Persian New Year, there was no parking to be had on Westwood Boulevard in Los Angeles. Nicknamed Little Tehran, it is one of the main thoroughfares of the Persian-American community. The sidewalks, grocery stores and restaurants were packed with shoppers getting ready for the holiday.

title: Momentum for Pacific Trade Deal Sapped in Election Year
description: For the most part, the 2016 campaign spectacle has benefited President Obama.

title: At Le Turtle, a French New Wave You Can Eat
description: The premodern look in restaurants and bars that has prevailed for the last decade or so is marked by salvaged wood; fireplaces that may or may not function; bare electric bulbs dimmed to mimic gaslight; warrens of small rooms hung with framed lithographs and, sometimes, taxidermy; servers in humorless aprons or lumberjack shirts or both; wine drunk from pickle jars; and short, historically minded cocktails stirred by men who trim their facial hair into antiquated contours.

description: On the calendar, there are official days for cream puffs and science fiction, but rarely one that encourages exploration, whether at home or abroad, a gap that Obscura Day aims to fill.

title: Icelands Prime Minister Steps Down Amid Panama Papers Scandal

title: International Criminal Court Drops Case Against Kenyas William Ruto
description: PARIS  The International Criminal Court dropped its case against the deputy president of Kenya, William Ruto, on Tuesday, marking another setback for the court and ending a long, tortuous case that tangled Kenyas relations with the West and rearranged Kenyan politics.

description: BRISBANE, Australia  Jason Days rise to No. 1 in the world began with a rusted golf club retrieved from a Queensland junkyard.

title: James Hannaham Wins PEN/Faulkner Award for Fiction
description: James Hannaham has won the 2016 PEN/Faulkner Award for Fiction for his second novel, Delicious Foods. The book tells the story of Darlene  a woman forced into slave labor in Louisiana by the company of the books title  and her son, Eddie.

title: In Sumner Redstone Case, Settlement Is Said to Be Discussed
description: Lawyers for the ailing media mogul Sumner M. Redstone have entered settlement talks over a lawsuit brought by a former companion who has challenged his mental capacity, according to three people with knowledge of the discussions.

title: Politician in Louisiana Wants Cut of Hollywood Hits Filmed There
description: LOS ANGELES  Weve had the Square Deal, the Fair Deal and the New Deal.

title: Del Posto Doubles Down on Luxury
description: Deep beneath the dining room of Del Posto, the palatial Italian restaurant on 10th Avenue, stands a 50-gallon steel caldron that is employed for a single purpose: making chicken soup.

title: Bernie Sanders Targets New York Voters With I Cant Breathe Ad
description: It was a moment that embodied the tension for New Yorkers in African-American communities toward the police and made I cant breathe a nationwide rallying cry. Now, the daughter of Eric Garner, the Staten Island man who died during an arrest after he was placed in a chokehold by police officers, lends her support to Senator Bernie Sanders in a 30-second recut version of an ad first released in January.

title: Pfizer and Allergan Are Said to End Merger as Tax Rules Tighten
description: Pfizer plans to abandon its $152 billion merger with Allergan  the largest deal yet aimed at helping an American company shed its United States corporate citizenship for a lower tax bill  just days after the Obama administration introduced new tax rules, a person briefed on the matter said late Tuesday.

title: Momosan Ramen & Sake Moves Into Murray Hill
description: Momosan Ramen & Sake Masaharu Morimoto has used his nickname for this relaxed ramen restaurant, a new direction for the chef, who has a global empire of Morimoto restaurants. On the ramen front, hes breaking new ground: There are four varieties on the menu, all available in two sizes. His long-simmered pork chashu, the basis of many ramen dishes, is cut into thin ribbons using a classic red Italian hand-cranked ham slicer on the bar. And with Sun Noodle, his supplier, he developed a noodle that does not become soggy as quickly as most. Some of the ramen bowls are classic, like the tonkotsu, though Mr. Morimotos executive chef, Jae Lee, is Korean, and was given the liberty to indulge his taste for chiles and kimchi in a number of dishes. Morimoto likes the fusion approach, Mr. Lee said. That means Peking duck tacos, and a complex take on bibimbap, called chashu bop, that comes sizzling in a stoneware bowl with crispy rice on the bottom. Sake, beer and wine are poured, and mixed into cocktails with Asian fruits. The white brick restaurant is simply furnished, with high and low dark wood tables and effective lighting. (Opens Friday): 342 Lexington Avenue (39th Street), 646-201-5529, momosanramen.com.

Its sufficiently subterranean to give it a comforting burrow atmosphere, but with windows big enough to make it spacious and light.

description: The state tests for New Yorks third- through eighth-grade students that began on Tuesday are shorter this year. Students will now be able to take them without the strain of a time limit. And the results will no longer affect the job ratings of teachers.

title: An Activism-Shy BlackRock Throws a Surprise Punch
description: BlackRock, the enormous American asset manager with over $4.6 trillion of assets under management, has waged its first significant activist campaign around the G-Resources Group, a Hong Kong company that owned a gold mine. It may be Hong Kong, and it may be only one campaign, but companies should be fearful.

title: Can Economies Rise as Emissions Fall? The Evidence Says Yes
description: Throughout the 20th century, the global economy was fueled by burning coal to run factories and power plants, and burning oil to move planes, trains and automobiles. The more coal and oil countries burned  and the more planet-warming carbon dioxide they emitted  the higher the economic growth.

title: Thomas Jefferson, Neither God Nor Devil
description: Thomas Jefferson has long been a lightning rod, but the past year has been tougher on him than usual. Protesters on college campuses have plastered Jefferson statues with Post-it notes reading racist and rapist. And on Broadway, the musical Hamilton has deliciously skewered him as a flamboyantly scheming hypocrite.

title: A Team Sets a High Bar, and Then Surpasses It Yet Again
description: On the eve of the womens Final Four, Connecticuts Geno Auriemma was paid what sounded like the highest compliment a coach could receive from a peer and an opponent.

title: A British Designer Creates an Art Show Around the Bathroom
description: In February, the 25-year-old British fashion designer Claire Barrow staged a London Fashion Week presentation called The Retro-Spective, which placed her knitwear and sculptural garments inside a mock museum  complete, even, with captioned plaques and a fake gift shop. It demonstrated that Barrow  who has garnered positive attention since she debuted her line two years ago  has a strong interest in art.

title: De Blasio Postpones Work on Crucial Water Tunnel
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has postponed work to finish New Yorks third water tunnel, a project that for more than half a century has been regarded as essential to the survival of the city if either of the two existing, and now aged, tunnels should fail.

title: Public Outcry in Utah After Four Men Are Accused of Raping 9-Year-Old
description: Four men accused of a vicious rape. A victim who is just 9 years old. And a mother who had left her alone so she could smoke methamphetamine nearby.

title: Jackie in Rolling Stone Rape Article Must Testify in Defamation Suit

title: China and Myanmar Ease Relations
description: Chinas foreign minster, Wang Yi, met with Myanmars foreign minister, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, in Naypyidaw to congratulate Myanmar's new government and to build better relations.

title: Calpers Rethinking Policy Banning Investment in Tobacco Stocks
description: Calpers is learning that social responsibility can have a cost.

title: File Yankees Season Opener Under P, for Protest
description: The sunny, blue skies that welcomed the Houston Astros and the Yankees to Yankee Stadium on Tuesday afternoon provided a picturesque tableau for opening day.

title: Taliban Leader, Trying to End Infighting, Appoints Critics to Senior Posts
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In a compromise bid to unite the ranks after months of infighting, the Talibans new leader has appointed the brother and son of Mullah Muhammad Omar, the movements deceased founder, to senior leadership posts, a spokesman for the insurgent group said on Tuesday.

title: Dont Send Your Kids to College. At Least Not Yet.
description: In the past few weeks, anxious high school seniors across the country have received admissions decisions from colleges. Some might feel like theyve won the lottery; others have dashed hopes and diminished confidence. Few in either category realize how little these outcomes matter in the long run; that, as Frank Bruni puts it, where you go is not who youll be.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: A Very Short Story by Lydia Davis  on a Bottle of Mouthwash
description: It hasnt exactly been my dream to see my work printed on a bottle of mouthwash, admits the writer Lydia Davis  but tonight, shell see just that. At its annual Spring Revel this evening, The Paris Review will honor Davis with the Hadada, its lifetime achievement award, and has partnered with Aesop to create a limited-edition bottle printed with Daviss short story Spring Spleen for the events gift bags. I wasnt even aware there was such a plan in the works, Davis said in an email. I was very surprised and amused.

title: Photos from Carrie Mae Weemss Kitchen Table Series
description: The project is now contained in a stand-alone book.

title: Revisiting Carrie Mae Weemss Indelible Series  Almost Three Decades Later
description: When they think of Carrie Mae Weems, most people picture a black-and-white image of the artist seated under a hanging lamp playing solitaire or a snapshot of her swooping down to embrace her partner as he reads the newspaper, both from her Kitchen Table Series  some of her most iconic work. Photographed from 1989-90, Kitchen Table earned labels like career-making and is considered the moment when Weems, 62  who has received the MacArthur genius grant and U.S. Department of States Medal of Arts  found her artistic voice. Institutions including the Museum of Modern Art, the Guggenheim, the Philadelphia Museum of Art, the Seattle Art Museum and the Los Angeles County Museum of Art have exhibited part of, or the entirety of, the 20 photos and 14 text panels during the last three decades. But, despite the series significance, and its total adaptability, it hadnt been published on its own  until now. The idea came about when the graphic designer Takaaki Matsumoto approached Weems several years ago. Kitchen Table has been printed many times, but never as a stand-alone book, she says. This is the first time that anyone has asked to focus on the series as its own entity. I am grateful to him for both designing and publishing the work, because it needed to stand on its own.

title: In Search of a New State Slogan
description: When Rhode Island announced its new state slogan, Cooler and Warmer, reaction was swift  and scornful. Readers can make their own suggestions.

title: Review: Locusts Have No King, a Love Triangle Comedy
description: Reading the script before I saw a performance of J. Julian Christophers Locusts Have No King, I wondered how big a spoiler it would be to mention in this review a central fact of the play that the publicity materials skirt. A love-triangle comedy with a supernatural streak, the show unfolds in the course of an evening at the home of Marcus and Jonathan, who have invited another couple, Lucus and Matthew, over for dinner.

title: Five New Fashion Books Out This Spring
description: Several tomes  on subjects including Issey Miyake and John Galliano  for your coffee table.

title: Review: In Ta Julia y el Escribidor, a Student Is Smitten
description: Romance meets boisterous farce in Ta Julia y el Escribidor (Aunt Julia and the Scriptwriter), Caridad Svichs lively adaptation of Mario Vargas Llosas autobiographical novel, at the Gramercy Arts Theater. And in that intersection, its the romance that triumphs.

title: Review: In Love Und Greed, Mad Jenny Doffs Her Hat to the Have-Nots
description: History does repeat itself, announces a postcard advertising Love und Greed, the provocative political and historical cabaret created by Mad Jenny, a.k.a. Jenny Lee Mitchell, who appeared at Pangea on Monday evening. Most of its songs, sung in a mixture of German and English, date from the Weimar era and are interspersed with modern pop standards whose sarcastic attitude echoes the cynicism of that period in Berlin, before Hitler took power.

title: Documentary Film Festivals Feel Push on Accuracy
description: Doctors and other public health professionals may be relieved that the controversial documentary Vaxxed, about the long-discredited link between autism and vaccines, was yanked from the Tribeca Film Festival. But its expulsion has also highlighted consternation among other festival organizers, who have been feeling the burden of extra scrutiny. As documentarians multiply, pointing their cameras at ever more esoteric, provocative and sometimes contentious stories, there is increasing pressure on programmers to act not just as quality control but also perhaps as judges of fairness and accuracy. Especially since the films themselves are more picked apart.

title: Review: In Vita Activa: The Spirit of Hannah Arendt, a Thinker More Relevant Than Ever
description: Hannah Arendt, who died in 1975, was a prolific and unclassifiable thinker, a political theorist, moral philosopher and polemicist of unmatched range and rigor. At least outside academic circles, her posthumous fame  or notoriety  rests on Eichmann in Jerusalem, a piece of extended reportage she wrote for The New Yorker in 1963, and on a single phrase associated with it: the banality of evil.

title: Ford, Building a Plant in Mexico, Draws Fire From Trump
description: DETROIT  Ford Motor said on Tuesday that it would build a new assembly plant for small cars in Mexico, continuing a trend of automakers increasing production there because of lower wages and favorable trade laws.

title: Yes, Bernie Sanders Knows Something About Breaking Up Banks
description: Bernie Sanders probably knows more about breaking up banks than his critics give him credit for.
