description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Frankie Michaels, Who Won a Tony Award at 11, Dies at 60
description: Frankie Michaels, the youngest person to win a Tony Award  which he earned in 1966, at 11, for his featured role in the Broadway musical Mame  died on March 30 at his home in Chittenango, N.Y. He was 60.

title: How a Cryptic Message, Interested in Data?, Led to the Panama Papers
description: PARIS  The leak of millions of private financial documents linking scores of the worlds rich and powerful to a secretive Panamanian law firm peddling in shell companies and offshore bank accounts began more than a year ago with a cryptic message to a German newspaper from an anonymous whistle-blower.

title: Kazuko Hirabayashi, Choreographer and Dancers Mentor, Dies at 82
description: Kazuko Hirabayashi, a Japanese-born modern-dance choreographer who was even more widely known as an exceptional teacher and mentor to many leading dancers, died on March 25 at her home in Harrison, N.Y. She was 82.

title: Office of Congressional Ethics Cites Possible Violations by Alan Grayson
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Alan Grayson, Democrat of Florida, may have improperly used his House office and staff to handle personal financial matters involving a family-run hedge fund as well as political activities related to his bid for the United States Senate, the Office of Congressional Ethics concluded in a 986-page investigation released Tuesday.

title: Lawyers for Peter Liang Allege Jury Misconduct in Manslaughter Trial
description: Lawyers for Peter Liang, the former New York City police officer convicted of manslaughter  in the shooting of an unarmed man in a public-housing project stairwell, asked a judge on Tuesday to set aside the verdict after they learned, through a newspaper article, that a juror in the case might have lied during jury selection about his fathers criminal past.

title: N.H.L. This Week: Playoff Spots at Stake as Season Winds Down
description: With the N.H.L. regular season in its final week, The New York Times looks ahead to the playoffs, highlighting hot  or not so hot  teams and players. (All times Eastern.)

title: Flashes of Cards and of Brilliance as Surezs Barcelona Edges Torress Atltico
description: BARCELONA

title: Donald Trump Wont Leave Us Alone
From Occupy Wall Street to the Arab Spring
description: A chance encounter with young Egyptians during the Occupy Wall Street protests led Matthew Connors to Cairo, where he documented the uprising. His new book, Fire in Cairo, showcases that work.

title: Wisconsin Goes to Cruz, Raising Chance of Fight at Convention
description: Senator Ted Cruz soundly defeated Donald J. Trump in the Wisconsin primary on Tuesday, breathing new life into efforts to halt Mr. Trumps divisive presidential candidacy and dealing a blow to his chances of clinching the Republican nomination before the partys summer convention.

title: Bernie Sanders Wins Wisconsin Democratic Primary, Adding to Momentum
description: Senator Bernie Sanders defeated Hillary Clinton in the Wisconsin primary on Tuesday, his sixth straight victory in the Democratic nominating contest and the latest in a string of setbacks for Mrs. Clinton as she seeks to put an end to a prolonged race against an unexpectedly deft and well-funded competitor.

title: Nonprofit Executive Attacked With Drain Cleaner in Embezzlement Cover-Up, Officials Say
description: One evening in August, an executive director of an arts nonprofit in Queens was leaving her office for the day when a man holding a cup approached her, the authorities said. The cup was filled with a chemical drain cleaner, and he flung the liquid at her, severely burning her face.

title: Noah Syndergaard Steadies Mets as Royals Temper Emotions
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  As Noah Syndergaard took the mound in the first inning Tuesday at Kauffman Stadium, just the mere sight of him prompted Royals fans to boo. He dug his cleat into the dirt, and tried blocking it out, but he could not help hearing American Woman playing, presumably a nod to his long, blond hair.

title: Pennsylvania: Bill Extending Deadlines in Abuse Cases Advances
description: The State Legislature,under pressureafter the release of agrand jury reportdocumenting an extensive cover-up of clergy sexual abuse in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Altoona-Johnstown, took actionon Tuesdayto give victims more time to seek justice. Many child abuse victims do not speak up until later in life, citing shame or fear. The House Judiciary Committee passed a bill that would change the states statute of limitations in child sexual abuse cases, eliminating the time limit for bringing criminal charges and extending the deadline for victims to file civil lawsuits to age 50 from age 30. The bill was amended to include child sexual abuse cases against schoolteachers and government officials. The legislation is scheduled to be brought to the full Houseon Monday.

title: F.B.I. Lawyer Wont Say if Data From Unlocked iPhone Is Useful
description: WASHINGTON  The epic fight between the F.B.I. and Apple over a locked iPhone is now over, but a central question in the case has remained unanswered: What secrets did the phone, used by one of the attackers in the San Bernardino, Calif., rampage, actually hold?

title: Mike Sandlock Dies at 100; Was Oldest Living Big Leaguer
description: Mike Sandlock, a catcher and infielder for three National League teams who achieved his foremost baseball distinction decades after his playing days were over when he became the oldest living former big league ballplayer, died at his home in Cos Cob, Conn., on Monday, the day after opening day. He was 100.

title: Florida Agrees to Improve Poor Childrens Access to Health Care, Settling Suit
description: MIAMI  Florida health officials, in a settlement announced Tuesday, agreed to improve access to health care for poor children, ending a long-running class-action lawsuit that had accused the state of shortchanging doctors and leaving low-income families to trek long distances to visit specialists.

title: Wisconsin Primary: Highlights and Analysis
Red Wings Playoff Streak Is in Danger
description: DETROIT  Stephanie Dziad, a Detroit Red Wings season-ticket holder, can recount clearly what she has been up to every spring and early summer for nearly a quarter-century. Her agenda borders on a permanent ritual: Wear her Wings apparel and cheer for her beloved hockey team in the N.H.L. playoffs.

title: Robert Igers Success at Disney Makes Him a Tough Act to Follow
description: LOS ANGELES  On Monday night, as a stunned Hollywood scrambled to understand why Disneys heir apparent, Thomas O. Staggs, had abruptly decided to step down, the company held a lavish premiere for its Jungle Book movie.

title: The Panama Papers Sprawling Web of Corruption
description: The first reaction to the leaked documents dubbed the Panama Papers is simply awe at the scope of the trove and the ingenuity of the anonymous source who provided the press with 11.5 million documents  2.6 terabytes of data  revealing in extraordinary detail how offshore bank accounts and tax havens are used by the worlds rich and powerful to conceal their wealth or avoid taxes.

title: Live Model: Wisconsin Republican Primary Results
description: Live estimates of the April 5 Republican Primary in Wisconsin.

title: Live Model: Wisconsin Democratic Primary Results
description: Live estimates of the April 5 Democratic primary results in Wisconsin.

title: Inge Hardison, Actress and Sculptor of Heroes, Dies at 102
description: Inge Hardison, whose bronze sculptures immortalized black historical figures, innovators and ordinary people she characterized as Our Folks, died on March 23 in Manhattan. She was 102.

title: A Wall Street Familys Charmed Life Is Thrown Into Turmoil
description: Andrew Caspersen violated a circle of trust that included colleagues, a Princeton classmate and even his wealthy family when he raised tens of millions of dollars for what authorities have called a fraudulent investment scheme that has rattled Wall Street.

title: In the Bleachers, Few Starry-Eyed Views
description: Out beyond the right-field wall in Section 203, the Bleacher Creatures at Yankee Stadium believe they know the difference between a proper title contender and a mere placeholder.

title: Italian Official Warns Egypt Over Inquiry Into Students Death
description: CAIRO  The foreign minister of Italy said Tuesday that his government would take immediate and proportional measures against Egypt if it failed to help uncover the truth behind the death of an Italian graduate student in Cairo two months ago.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $17.35 million

title: Armenia and Azerbaijan Halt Fighting on Border
description: JABRAYIL, Azerbaijan  Armenians and Azerbaijanis agreed on Tuesday to a cease-fire after four days of fighting along the border of a disputed region, putting to rest, at least for now, fears that the outbreak of ethnic strife might spiral into a wider war.

title: Yankees Lose on a Play They Couldnt Have Prepared For
description: Baseball is a funny game, said Joe Garagiola, the old catcher and raconteur who died last month. That was the title of Garagiolas book, and it explains so much about this fascinating and frustrating show, now playing daily for the next six months at a ballpark near you.

title: Jordan Spieth, Humbly, Gets Ready to Defend Masters Crown
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  The question posed Tuesday to the reigning Masters champion was about winning four majors in the same year. Is a mens calendar Grand Slam achievable? With his response, Jordan Spieth humorously addressed how his life changed in 2015 when he became only the second golfer in the last 43 years to win the first two legs.

title: Some Yankees Tickets Require a Long Walk
description: After Mondays rainout, Tuesdays rescheduled Yankees home opener had the look of perfect baseball weather. But the temperature was in the mid-30s, with a slicing wind that the Arctic would envy. This fact was felt most acutely by the numerous fans who had bought their tickets from StubHub, a website for ticket resales.

title: Wisconsin Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Republican voters exiting voting locations throughout Wisconsin on Tuesday.

title: Wisconsin Exit Polls
description: Surveys of Democratic voters exiting voting locations throughout Wisconsin on Tuesday.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The overall price trend is upward.

title: Brazils Congress Must Consider Impeaching Vice President
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A justice on Brazils high court ruled on Tuesday that an impeachment request made against the countrys vice president, Michel Temer  who had been expected to take over the presidency if Dilma Rousseff were to be ousted  must also be considered by the countrys Congress while it holds hearings about removing Ms. Rousseff.

title: Rolling Stones to Release First Studio Album Since 2005
description: Since the Rolling Stones released their last studio album, A Bigger Bang, in September 2005, the group seems to have been working full throttle  mostly as a road act playing packed stadiums.

title: What Is It?
description: Administrivial Music and Puzzle Lovers Alert! Pete Mullers Muller Monthly Music Meta is a fun and free award-winning monthly crossword, published at noon Eastern time on the first Tuesday of each month. To finish the puzzle, solvers need to figure out the meta, which is usually a song or band. Solvers have until that Sunday at 11:00 p.m. Eastern time. to submit their answer to the meta. In addition to these metas, the 12 monthly puzzles include a mega-meta. The 13th and final puzzle of the year is published on the last Tuesday of December, and gives hints for the mega-meta. Click here for more information.

title: Whitney Museums New Home Named After Leonard Lauder
description: Leonard A. Lauder, the Whitney Museum of American Arts chairman emeritus, initially opposed the museums move downtown to its new home in the Meatpacking district from the Breuer building on Madison Avenue.

title: For Masters, Waiting Is the Hardest Part
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Adam Scott had to go two extra holes of sudden death with ngel Cabrera to become the first Australian to win the Masters. Scott said he was less nervous before the start of that 2013 playoff than he will be Thursday when he stands at the No. 1 tee box for the first drive of his 15th Masters.

title: Donald Trump Settled a Real Estate Lawsuit, and a Criminal Case Was Closed
description: For Donald J. Trump, it is a long-held legal strategy, if not a point of pride, to avoid knuckling under to plaintiffs in court.

title: Mets Decide They Are Done Reliving October
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Finally, after a second day of watching the Royals rub their World Series victory in the Mets faces with another pregame victory celebration, one Met took umbrage.

title: UConn Wins Record Fourth Straight Title
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Before Breanna Stewart had even played a game for Connecticut, she said her goal was to win four national titles in her four years.

title: The Breakout Star of The People v. O.J. Simpson on the Emotional Finale
description: Tuesdays finale of American Crime Story: The People v. O. J. Simpson on FX wrapped up an addictive, multifaceted look at the trial of the century and how its lessons on race, gender, celebrity and social class still haunt the country more than 20 year later. It also brought a blessed end to the weekly torments visited upon Christopher Darden, the co-prosecutor who, along with Marcia Clark, fails to convict Mr. Simpson of double homicide in the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman.

title: Wisconsin Goes to the Polls
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas and Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont earned victories in the states Republican and Democratic primaries on Tuesday.

title: New York Attorney General Begins Inquiry Into Sale of Nursing Home to Developer
description: The New York State attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, has opened an investigation into a series of transactions surrounding the lifting of a deed restriction on a Manhattan nursing home that enabled its purchase by a luxury condominium developer for $116 million.

title: Police Leaders Questioned Amid Inquiry of Businessmen Linked to de Blasio
description: The visits, unannounced and in the early morning hours, began several weeks ago at houses and apartments in and around New York City. They followed a pattern: Two agents from the Federal Bureau of Investigation would approach the front door and ring the bell. They would be invited in. Then the questions would come.

title: How Donald Trump Lost Wisconsin
description: Ted Cruz thumped Donald Trump in Wisconsins Republican primary on Tuesday, beating him by 13 percentage points. On the Democratic side, Bernie Sanders, who has won seven of the last eight state contests, racked up an important win against Hillary Clinton, a native Midwesterner, in a heartland state known for its progressive traditions.

title: Law School Renamed for Antonin Scalia, Again. Blame Acronym.
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Antonin Scalia could be caustic in his dissents, but he was also known for a sharp wit that often drew laughter from Supreme Court audiences.

title: The People v. O.J. Simpson Finale: Still Not Guilty
description: O.J. Simpson was found not guilty for the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ron Goldman. Everyone knows that, but this episode found a way to infuse that fact with tension. The evidence against O.J. was overwhelming, but this countrys history of racism helped produce a complex cultural moment in which a man accused of murder was set free in order to condemn a corrupt police force. In this episode, Chris Darden told Johnnie Cochran that this was the first time in history a black defendant got off because he was black. The only problem is that the acquittal doesnt feel like justice.

title: The People v. O.J. Simpson Creators on the Finale, the Kardashians and the Race Card
description: Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski are not television writers  theyre known more for eccentric biopics like Ed Wood, Man on the Moon and The People vs. Larry Flynt. But they didnt hesitate when they were asked to develop a series about the O.J. Simpson trial.

title: A Quieted Donald Trump Quickly Turns on Lyin Ted
description: There was no news conference, there were no Twitter posts. There was no steak, no wine, no bottled water.

title: Rangers Stay in Hunt for Home-Ice Advantage
description: Henrik Lundqvists 24th save was a beauty, lunging from one post to another to deflect a shot by Tampa Bay Lightning forward Tyler Johnson with his glove. The only problem was that Lundqvist was merely eight seconds past the midway point of his work night.

title: Bitcoin Start-Up Gets an Electronic Money License in Britain
description: The British government has pushed through its first licensing of a virtual currency company, underscoring its desire to make London a hub for the development of financial technology.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | impalpable
description: impalpable  \()im-pal-p-bl\  adjective

title: Donald Trump to Hold Large Rally on Long Island
description: Donald J. Trump will pad over his loss in Wisconsin with a large rally on Long Island on Wednesday night, where some 18,000 people have requested tickets and where he will be standing with a number of supporters, organizers said.

title: Ferguson Voters Give Split Result on Funding Police Overhaul
description: Residents of Ferguson, Mo., the St. Louis suburb that became known two years ago as a focal point of racial upheaval, voted on Tuesday to reject part of a tax increase package that city leaders had described as essential for carrying out a legal settlement with the Justice Department. The voters turned down a proposed property tax increase, but they also voted to raise the sales tax, leaving city officials with a mixed, uncertain result.

title: What to Watch Wednesday
description: The Real Housewives of New York City revs up for Season 8 with a new cast member and a bus tour. Nova explores what could be a Viking site in North America. And Alicia Vikander and Mads Mikkelsen heat up Denmark in A Royal Affair.

title: Azzedine Alaas (Long-Germinating) Cornucopia for Fall
description: Just over a month ago, during the wilds of fashion month, when the trendiest subject was whether brands should move to a see-now/sell-now system and offer consumers clothes direct from the runway, Azzedine Alaa (the brand, not the person) sent out a statement delineating a somewhat different approach.

title: Architect of Chinas Great Firewall Bumps Into It
description: HONG KONG  Anyone who tries to scramble over Chinas Great Firewall knows the feeling of frustration when those attempts fail. So, too, does the man credited with developing the system, which blocks access to unapproved foreign websites.

title: Corrections: April 6, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: From Occupy Wall Street to the Arab Spring
description: Matthew Connors spent much of 2012 in Lower Manhattan making portraits of the protesters in the Occupy Wall Street movement. But a chance encounter during the course of that project made him do a 180-degree turn after meeting some Egyptian activists who had participated in a different uprising: the Jan. 25 revolution that led to the ousting of President Hosni Mubarak. They convinced Mr. Connors that there was a more important struggle worth covering.

title: Mosquito vs. Mosquito in the Battle Over the Zika Virus
description: GENETICALLY modified mosquitoes are in the news for good reason: They may be our best hope for controlling the mosquito-borne Zika virus. The Food and Drug Administration has issued a preliminary finding of no significant environmental impact and is seeking public comment on a plan to test them in a field trial in the Florida Keys.

title: The Militarys Transgender Policy, Stalled
description: Defense Secretary Ashton Carter announced last July that the Pentagon intended to allow transgender people to serve openly in the military within six months, calling the decades-long ban outdated and an impediment to attracting and retaining top talent.

title: Impossible Missions
description: I just read a book that Barack Obama and Donald Trump would both enjoy.

title: A Better Way to Get to $15
description: To their credit as trailblazers, both California and New York are now headed for a minimum wage of $15 an hour, but they are taking different paths to get there. Californias is more direct and offers a better model for other states and the federal government.

title: Say No to Fight Club, New York
description: AFTER last months vote by the State Assembly to approve mixed martial arts fighting, the bill only awaits signature by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo for New York State to join the rest of the country in permitting this form of professional combat.

title: News Qs | Rejected by Colleges, SAT and ACT Try High Schools
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Rejected by Colleges, SAT and ACT Try High Schools.

title: America's Responsibility for Friends in Afghanistan
Flyboy Style: How to Wear a Bomber Jacket
description: Once worn exclusively by military pilots and now a staple of mens fashion shows, the flight jacket (also known as the bomber jacket) has over the years made the transition from the runway to, well, the runway.

title: A Tour of William Wegmans Studio in Chelsea
description: Name William Wegman

title: Augusta Presents a Steep Challenge (So Wear the Right Shoes)
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Note to self and all other Masters rookies: Do not wear loafers to Augusta National.

title: Why Upperclassmen Lose Financial Aid
description: A few weeks before Ashley Hurst was supposed to commit to college, an email arrived that she thought would change her life. An honors graduate from a magnet high school, Ms. Hurst had been accepted into several colleges with a few good financial aid offers. But they included about $8,000 in loans, and she was dead set against borrowing any money. She kept hoping to snag a free ride somewhere at the last minute.

title: How Long Should a Man Go Between Haircuts?
description: A good haircut lasts long after you leave the barbershop.

title: Nordic Food Court Rises at Grand Central, With an Order to Leave No Trace
description: Under the halo of gold-plated chandeliers and upon imperial carved-oak benches in the main waiting room at Grand Central Terminal, travelers gathered before boarding the 20th Century Limited, Empire State Express and Wolverine, their anxious feet scuffing gentle hollows into the pink Tennessee marble floor.

title: Living in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn
description: The three-square-mile community overlooking New York Harbor provides the convenience of the city and the feel of a village.

title: Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, a Small Town in a Big City
description: Barbara Noone has been filling her prescriptions at Bridge Pharmacy for the 18 years that it has been in business on Third Avenue in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn.

title: Student Question | Do We Need to Teach Boys and Men to Be More Emotionally Honest?
description: Are the lives of men and boys limited because society teaches them they cant show any strong emotion but anger? Do bro codes that govern how boys act keep them from being their true selves?

title: American Amnesia, by Jacob S. Hacker and Paul Pierson
description: AMERICAN AMNESIAHow the War on Government Led Us to Forget What Made America ProsperBy Jacob S. Hacker and Paul Pierson455 pp. Simon & Schuster. $28.

title: A Twist in Her Plot
description: I arrived at the Writing Seminars at Johns Hopkins in September 1985, bearing a box of books, a Kaypro word processor and a long blond wig I kept hidden in a box in the closet. I wasnt out as transgender in those days, not by a long shot, but I did have the tools I needed to slip out of the house, once in a while, and prowl around Baltimore en femme. Then Id head home, wash off the makeup and get ready for the workshop, taught by the writer John Barth.

title: Wisconsin Takeaways: Donald Trump Stumbles and Bernie Sanders Soars, for Now
description: Can a single state make any real difference in a chaotic and unpredictable presidential primary season? Tuesday nights dual Wisconsin primaries suggest so. The Republican field was down to three candidates, and the Democrats down to two. All were focused on the same state on the same day. The result was a clarifying glimpse into where Trumpism falters, where Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont can succeed, and whether each partys establishment has the power to steer its own nomination.

title: Flyboy Style: How to Wear a Bomber Jacket
description: The flight jacket has become a standard of wardrobes and runways.

title: Does Exercise During Pregnancy Lead to Exercise-Loving Offspring?
description: Mice born to mothers that run during their pregnancies grow up to be rodents that love to run as adults, according to a thought-provoking new animal experiment, while pups with sedentary moms had a less-enthusiastic attitude toward exercise. Though its a long way from mice to people, the studys findings hint at the possibility that to some extent our will to work out may be influenced by a mothers exercise habits during pregnancy, and begin as early as in the womb.

title: A Tour of William Wegmans Studio in Chelsea
description: The 72-year-old artist and author opens up his favorite room, the Manhattan studio where he created some of his well-known dog portraits.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Ted Cruz, Bernie Sanders, Panama
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Brooklyn on the Court
description: Updated, 10:30 a.m.

title: Customers First to Become the Law in Retirement Investing
description: The rules governing how financial professionals handle the trillions of dollars they invest on behalf of Americans saving for retirement are about to get a lot tougher.

title: F.A.A. Reauthorization Bill in Senate Could Snag on Unrelated Tax Provisions
description: Senate Republicans must feel mildly giddy that they may have an actual bill to pass on the Senate floor, where activities have been a tad limited as of late. But a measure to reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration and keep airports running and planes in the air may get gummed up by unrelated tax provisions.

title: Edinburgh Festival to Feature Shakespeare and a Menagerie Return
description: The august Edinburgh International Festival is not immune to an epidemic of Shakespeare fever that seems to be erupting worldwide in 2016, the 400th anniversary of Shakespeares death. Productions in German, Russian and French (all presented with supertitles) are to be included in this years festival, a popular international cultural attraction since 1947. The program was announced in Edinburgh on Wednesday morning.

title: Glencore Agrees to Sell Minority Stake in Agriculture Business
description: LONDON  The Swiss commodities and mining company Glencore said on Wednesday that it had agreed to sell a 40 percent stake in its agriculture business to Canada Pension Plan Investment Board for $2.5 billion in cash.

title: Morning Agenda: Pfizer Said to Call Off Merger With Allergan
description: PFIZER SAID TO CALL OFF MERGER WITH ALLERGAN | Just a day after the Treasury Department announced tougher rules to discourage American companies from moving overseas for a lower tax bill, Pfizer decided to abandon its $152 billion merger with Allergan, a person briefed on the matter  told Michael J. de la Merced and Leslie Picker of DealBook late Tuesday. The two drug companies could announce their decision as early as Wednesday morning, said the person, who was not authorized to speak publicly.  CNBC earlier reported the news of Pfizers decision.

title: Michael Botticelli Is Not in Favor of Legalization
description: As the first drug czar who is himself in recovery from alcohol addiction, do you think your approach is different from those of your predecessors? Looking back over the history of the office, it has typically been led by generals and police officers. It was really geared toward supply reduction and interdiction. We want to focus on public-health strategies.

title: Airports, Designed for Everyone but the Passenger
description: One morning in 1977, Brian Eno, the electronica pioneer and former synthesizer player for the band Roxy Music, was sitting in an airport in Cologne, Germany, and was deeply disturbed.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Opening Numerous Bottles of Wine
description: Andrea writes: My husband insists on opening numerous bottles of wine at one time. I think you should finish one bottle before you open another because it doesnt taste as good after its been open for a couple of days.

title: Should a Nephew Be Told Who His Real Father Is?
description: My sister has told me that her son is not the biological son of her husband. His sperm count was very low; she was having an affair and became pregnant. The son looks not like his father but like the other man. Her son (he is now middle-aged) doesnt know, and her husband (theyre now divorced) doesnt, either. Recently, when my sister had a health crisis, she told the other man for the first time, asking him not to tell anyone. He told her that was his decision. He has no other children. Now he knows he has a son and a grandchild.

title: The Unbearable Whiteness of Baseball
description: By instinct, honed reflex and general contrarianism, I root for all flashy showboats who are disgraces to the game. It has been this way since I left Boston at age 10 to move to North Carolina, a state with no notable baseball team save the minor-league Durham Bulls, who, at least when I was growing up, seemed more a Hollywood relic than a ball club. Freed from having to like the Red Sox, I began to root for Rickey Henderson of the Oakland Athletics, mostly because I liked how deeply he squatted while taking a lead off first base. He seemed as if he were taunting the pitcher. As I grew older and started feeling alienated from my white classmates, I gravitated toward athletes who, in some way, flouted the white, stoic traditions of American sports  Allen Iverson, Ken Griffey Jr., Rasheed Wallace, Pedro Martinez. I felt as if this was a moral choice.

title: A $1,000 Day in San Francisco for $100
description: Tom Wolfe, chief concierge at the Fairmont San Francisco, greeted me in the lobby of the palatial hotel, which opened in 1907 atop the expensive Nob Hill enclave. Impeccably dressed in a three-piece suit festooned with decorative pins, Mr. Wolfe claims to be first concierge in the United States  the concept didnt exist in American hotels until the 1970s, he said. Richard Swig, who was then the owner of the Fairmont, asked Mr. Wolfe to create a concierge program in the image of hotels he had seen in Europe, where the service concept of one-stop shopping, as Mr. Wolfe put it, already existed.

title: The New Europeans
description: Read in German

title: North Korea May Roll Out Rocket System With Greater Reach, South Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea could deploy a new rocket system as early as this year that would expand its ability to strike South Korean and American military forces in the South, South Koreas defense minister said on Wednesday.

title: E.U. Migrant Proposals Aim to Overhaul Asylum Rules
description: BRUSSELS  Days after a wave of deportations of migrants arriving in Europe from Turkey, the European Unions executive arm proposed a new quota system for members accepting asylum seekers to ease the burden on the nations confronted with an overwhelming influx.

title: Pfizer Faces Limited Options After Its Dead Deal With Allergan
description: Pfizer needs a Plan C.

title: Warriors Have No Room for Error, or Spectacle
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The game was just minutes old when Coach Steve Kerr sensed that it was beginning to slip away from the Golden State Warriors. They had played so well through the first six minutes of the first quarter against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Tuesday, but Kerr observed some of the same problems that had hindered his team in recent weeks.

title: Risk of Collapse at Jesus Tomb Unites Rival Christians
description: JERUSALEM  It was a typical day at the shrine around what many believe is the tomb of Jesus in Jerusalems Old City. A Greek Orthodox choir sang inside a room facing the baroque structure. But the voices were drowned out when chanting Armenian priests and monks circling the shrine raised theirs.

title: A Plan to Change a Beloved Stamp Is Ruffling Feathers
description: BOMBAY HOOK NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE, Del.  Is it political correctness, or a shrewd way to clean the scales off an 82-year-old federal program? Will it secure more money for wildlife, or wreck one of the better things the United States government has going?

title: A New Rhode Island Slogan Encounters Social Medias Wrath
description: The idea was simple enough  to create a logo and slogan that cast the long-struggling state of Rhode Island in a fresh, more optimistic light to help attract tourists and businesses. A world-renowned designer was hired. Market research was conducted. A $5 million marketing campaign was set. What could go wrong?

title: Moshe Katsav, Jailed Ex-President of Israel, Loses Bid for Early Release
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli prison parole board rejected a request on Wednesday by Moshe Katsav, the former president of Israel who is serving a seven-year term for rape, for a conditional early release from prison.

title: Carnyx and Horn Duet: Liadain and Cuirithir by John Kenny
description: A duet between the Deskford carnyx and the 1st-century BC Loughnashade horn, found in a bog in 1794 in what is today Northern Ireland. The track is named after a doomed love affair between two Irish poets.

title: Hummus Swirled With Harissa: A Poem
description: (Inspired by the line hummus swirled with harissa in an article by Sam Sifton, food editor at The New York Times.)

title: Cambodia to Bring Wild Tigers From Abroad in Fight Against Extinction
description: A plan to fight the extinction of wild tigers in Cambodia would require importing the big cats from abroad, in what conservationists say would be the first transnational tiger reintroduction.

title: Barnaby Brown Plays the Vulture Bone Flute
description: Mr. Brown plays an ancient Scottish tune on a replica of a 30,000-year-old instrument. The wing bone for the four-holed instrument was supplied by a Spanish wildlife protection agency that conducts post-mortems of dead vultures.

title: Improvisation on Hornpipe and Drums, by ke and Jens Egevad
description: The Swedish instrument maker ke Egevad plays a replica of a hornpipe  made of a cowhorn with fingerholes  from 1,050 and found near Lund. The tune is based on Swedish folk motifs.

title: Pedro Almodvar Cancels Publicity for New Film After Link to Panama Papers
description: MADRID  The Oscar-winning Spanish director Pedro Almodvar has canceled publicity events linked to Fridays release of his latest movie, Julieta, after reports that he and his brother, a movie producer, were named in the so-called Panama Papers, leaked documents from a law firm that documented offshore bank accounts and corporations.

title: What You Get for  $1,225,000
description: A beach house in Alabama, a Spanish colonial in Los Angeles and a compound in Vermont

title: $1,225,000 Homes in Los Angeles, Vermont and Alabama
description: POINT CLEAR, ALA.

title: Uber Driver Napped as His Passenger Led Highway Chase, Police Say
description: A passenger who got behind the steering wheel of an Uber car so that the driver could nap led the police on a highway chase in central New York, the State Police said.

title: Signing Up Organ Donors in China Can Be an Uphill Battle
description: BEIJING  When Cao Yanfang left her nursing job to become a full-time human organ donation coordinator, someone who asks families to donate their just-deceased relatives organs, she set herself the goal of persuading one in 100 families to give. That was in 2010, when China set up a nationwide voluntary donation system.

title: Model in Gucci Ad Is Deemed Unhealthily Thin by British Regulator
description: LONDON  The model in the Gucci ad is young and waiflike, her frail body draped in a geometric-pattern dress as she leans back in front of a wall painted with a tree branch that appears to mimic the angle of her silhouette.

title: If Cruz Keeps This Pace, Trump Wont Get a Majority of Delegates
description: Donald Trumps loss in Wisconsin  his biggest defeat in a primary so far  is being interpreted as a sign that he lost ground after several prominent miscues on abortion and other issues.

title: A Restored Farmhouse on Two and a Half Acres in West Cork
description: The property, with four bedrooms and two and a half baths, is on the market for $678,000.

title: House Hunting in ... Ireland
description: A FOUR-BEDROOM RESTORED FARMHOUSE ON TWO AND A HALF ACRES IN WEST CORK

title: F.B.I. May Have Put Down Sword, but Privacy Debate Goes On
description: The immediate fight between Apple and the Federal Bureau of Investigation over opening a locked iPhone used by one of the attackers in last years San Bernardino, Calif., rampage is over. But the effects of the case linger.

title: Customizing Android Contacts With Photos
description: Q. How do I add my own photos to the blank entries on the Android Contacts app?

title: 1941: British Troops Now in Balkans
description: LONDON  As war swung south into the Balkans, Great Britain welcomed tonight [April 6] a new ally in the Yugoslavs and pledged to support them with the full strength of the British Empire by land, sea and air, and it was officially announced at Whitehall that a British army was already in Greece.

title: When Spring Comes, by Kevin Henkes
description: WHEN SPRING COMESBy Kevin HenkesIllustrated by Laura Dronzek40 pp. Greenwillow Books/HarperCollins Publishers. $17.99. (Picture book; ages 3 to 8)

title: Phife Dawg Is Celebrated at Memorial at the Apollo
description: At its peak in the early to mid-1990s, A Tribe Called Quest was a bridge. It showed genre elders how hip-hop was capable of aesthetic evolution while reminding young people of the value of digging in the crates for inspiration. It placed bohemian spirituality and street-corner smack talk on the same level. It made music that was utterly modern and also flawlessly in step with the genres traditions.

title: The Art of Reading Russian Obituaries
description: A journalist was killed in St. Petersburg last week, but no one called for an immediate and full investigation. No one seemed to suspect that he was killed because of his work. In a country of frequent and varied violence, this was a different kind of crime, a murder that dare not speak its name.

title: Matthew Bourne to Stage a New Version of The Red Shoes
description: He has reworked all the Tchaikovsky ballets. Now the choreographer Matthew Bourne will stage a different kind of classic: the 1948 British film The Red Shoes. Mr. Bournes new version  his first new piece since his 2013 Sleeping Beauty  will be designed by his regular collaborator Lez Brotherston, and set to music by Bernard Herrmann, who composed scores for films by Alfred Hitchcock, Orson Welles and Martin Scorsese.

title: Revamped Metropolitan Home Sets Its Sights on Millennials
description: It was the shelter magazine that asked Tom Wolfe and Alice Waters to design rooms for a show house, photographed an openly gay couple at home years before it was standard practice and covered the Milan Furniture Fair with the seriousness National Review brings to politics.

title: Protests in Baseball Are Seldom Upheld
description: When Yankees pitcher Dellin Betances overthrew first baseman Mark Teixeira, allowing the Astros to score a run on Tuesday afternoon, Manager Joe Girardi was incensed. The Astros 6-foot-4 Carlos Correa had caused the errant throw by running on the field side of the first-base line, Girardi believed, and not in the running lane.

title: Justice Dept. Sues to Block Halliburton-Baker Hughes Merger
description: The Justice Department sued to block the pending merger of Halliburton and Baker Hughes on Wednesday, the latest instance of the Obama administration taking a tougher stance on big-ticket deals.

title: The People v. O.J. Simpson: Why the Trial Matters Now
description: I was dubious, before I watched FXs The People v. O. J. Simpson: American Crime Story, that I could find the mini-series anywhere near as absorbing as I did the trial, which I watched every chance I could over two decades ago. Id seen this show already; I knew how it ended; I remembered how it got there.

title: Verizon and AwesomenessTV to Form Mobile Video Service
description: Verizon Communications is trying to get a little more awesome.

title: A Deal That Puts Lives at Risk
description: It has begun. Despite condemnations from human rights groups and a warning from the United Nations refugee agency, the European Union is deporting people from Greece to Turkey as part of a deal it signed with Turkey last month. When Turkey takes back a Syrian who entered Europe illegally, the European Union, under the terms of the deal, is to accept one registered Syrian refugee.

title: Nora Chipaumire Explores Identity in the Boxing Ring
description: As part of her research for Portrait of Myself as My Father, the Zimbabwe-born choreographer Nora Chipaumire learned to box, or at least picked up a few tips. In the new work, presented by Montclair State Universitys Peak Performances series, she explores African masculinity and the black male body with a boxing ring as her stage and the Senegalese performer Pape Ibrahima Ndiaye, better known as Kaolack, as her opponent. Their relationship, while tangled  and further complicated by a third performer, Shamar Wayne Watt  is not just about winning or losing. A magnetic dancer and audacious thinker, Ms. Chipaumire is less interested in binaries than in the spectra along which we negotiate identity. Adding to this complex look at heritage, gender, language, religion and power, Ms. Chipaumire offers a new film, Afro Promo #1: Kinglady, created at Montclair State. (April 14- 17, Alexander Kasser Theater, Montclair, N.J.; peakperfs.org.)

title: John Prine Endures, With a Half-Smile and a Song
description: A man in search of a pint found one in an Irish establishment in Midtown. He was short and everyday, save for his spikes of gray-white hair and a sizable indentation in his neck  the mark of something endured. He looked like a guy whod been around, and was grateful to still be.

title: On HBOs Girls, a Kitty Genovese Plot Proves Eerily Timed
description: It was one of those rare moments on television when a sitcom anticipates the morning news.

title: The Best Salmon Recipe Is Wild
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: A Cocktail Shot Company Looks Beyond Beer Pong
description: Mention the word shots and visions of frat boys from the cult movie Animal House often come to mind, with the Delta Tau Chi boys chugging Jack Daniels. They didnt care about quality, health or taste. The aim was to get drunk as quickly as possible at the cheapest price.

title: Updating Tradition: Jackie McDowell, Tim Hecker and More
description: NEW BLOOD MEDICINE

title: The Girlfriend Experience: Dont Call It a Remake
description: In his 2009 film The Girlfriend Experience, Steven Soderbergh focused his gaze on Chelsea, a high-end New York escort (played by the porn star Sasha Grey) grappling with the waning of her career during the financial crisis. But the new Starz series of the same title, on which Mr. Soderbergh is an executive producer, isnt exactly a remake. Now, Chelsea (the alluringly dispassionate Riley Keough, Elvis Presleys granddaughter) is a Chicago law student and intern who undertakes prostitution for money, control and, not incidentally, sex without attachment.

title: Asaf Avidan, Folk-Rock and Pithy Poetry
description: Asaf Avidan, a well-known musician in Israel, writes songs that pull together widely disparate impulses. He often leans toward American-style folk-rock, but he also has a streak of 1960s kitsch and a fondness for electronic loops: His most widely known song is One Day/Reckoning Song (Wankelmut Remix), an EDM-meets-folk concoction.

title: Gabriel Mascaro: Ebbs and Flows, a Young Directors Views of Brazil
description: Play and hard work among working-class people living close to nature is a dominant theme for the Brazilian filmmaker Gabriel Mascaro, whose second fictional feature, Neon Bull, a study of the rugged lives of Brazilian rodeo riders, opened on April 8. That sensual film, which shows couples making love outdoors among cattle, typifies the work of this documentarian turned feature film director, who is having a retrospective, Gabriel Mascaro: Ebbs and Flows, at the Walter Reade Theater in Lincoln Center, from April 15 through 19. It includes his 2014 film, August Winds, whose central love affair between a city girl and a country boy takes place on a coconut farm in coastal Brazil during stormy weather. For the documentary Housemaids, Mr. Mascaro gave seven teenagers cameras to film their live-in maids for a week. In High-Rise, he interviews residents of a modern building about class, privilege and inequality. This compassionate, socially conscious filmmaker is a major emerging talent. (filmlinc.org.)

title: Janet Jackson Postpones Unbreakable Tour Again, Citing Family
description: Janet Jacksons comeback has not gone exactly as planned.

title: Orchestras From San Francisco and Baltimore Come to Carnegie
description: It is a challenging time for classical music, with orchestras under pressure to shake things up. But two American conductors have been innovators for years, and both are leading their orchestras at Carnegie Hall.

title: Exit Strategy, a Theatrical Import From Chicago
description: Chicago has sent many theatrical gifts to New York over the years, including Tracy Lettss August: Osage County and some great plays by the Chicago native David Mamet (in general, if not lately). A notable import of the moment is Ike Holters Exit Strategy, in previews in a Primary Stages production. Mr. Holter, named Chicagoan of the Year in Theater by The Chicago Tribune in 2014, received a rave from Chris Jones of The Tribune when Exit Strategy ran there. Mr. Jones described the play, about the final days of a failing urban high school, as at once poetic, political, sad, funny, timely, complex and compassionate and went on to compare the linguistic excitement with Mr. Mamets feisty early work. (Opens Tuesday, April 12, Cherry Lane Theater; primarystages.org.)

title: Yael Kanarek Has Her Fifth Show at Bitforms
description: Composed of simple materials  steel, hand-drawn ink on parchment, a burning candle  Yael Kanareks Feedback-Loop might not seem to be the work of a new-media artist. But Ms. Kanarek has spent the last 20 years moving between digital and analog, virtual and real. Starting Tuesday, the Lower East Side gallery Bitforms will host Kisses Kisses, Ms. Kanareks fifth show there, which looks back at her career exploring life in the information age.

title: At Paris Exhibition, Tracing the Roots of the Velvet Underground
description: PARIS  The Velvet Underground could have probably only come together in 1960s New York, where artists, musicians and filmmakers mingled in a freewheeling scene that went largely unnoticed by mainstream pop culture.

title: 3 Things School Counselors Want You to Know About Their Jobs
description: Over the years, this column has offered up 3 Things Students Wish Teachers Knew, 3 Things Parents Wish Teachers Knew, and 5 Things Teachers Wish Parents Knew. Recently, it was called to my attention that I have never written about what school counselors might like readers to know about their profession.

title: Meg Rosoff Wins Astrid Lindgren Childrens Book Prize
description: LONDON  The author Meg Rosoff has won the Astrid Lindgren Memorial Award, a childrens book award that comes with a prize of 5 million Swedish krona, or about $613,000.

title: Interview With a Fed Dissident: The Sole Vote to Raise Interest Rates
description: Esther George is a dissident, at least by the standards of the Federal Reserve. Since becoming president of the Kansas City Fed in 2011, she has repeatedly cautioned that the central bank is trying too hard to stimulate growth, and that its policies may cause lasting economic distortions instead. Last month, at the most recent meeting of the Feds policy-making committee, she cast the sole vote in favor of raising interest rates. It was her 10th time voting on policy, and the eighth time she has opposed the consensus of her colleagues.

title: Sidelined by Panama Papers Scandal, Iceland Premier Says Hes Not Quitting
description: LONDON  Icelands already fragile coalition government was thrown into further uncertainty on Wednesday after the countrys prime minister said he had not formally resigned but had stepped aside for an unspecified period after leaked documents linked him to an offshore company.

title: Obama Will Be Interviewed on Fox News Sunday
description: President Obama will join Chris Wallace on Fox News Sunday this weekend for a televised interview from Chicago.

title: 1966: Auto Industry Under Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Departments antitrust division revealed today [April 6] it was investigating charges that the nations auto makers conspired to suppress installation of antipollution devices on car engines.

title: Donald Blankenship Sentenced to a Year in Prison in Mine Safety Case
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va.  Donald L. Blankenship, whose leadership of the Massey Energy Company catapulted him from a working-class West Virginia childhood into a life as one of the wealthiest and most influential men in Appalachia, was sentenced on Wednesday to a year in prison for conspiring to violate federal mine safety standards.

title: Donald Trumps Trial-and-Error Campaign
description: Last week, Donald Trump said women should be punished for getting abortions. Then he said they shouldnt. Now he appears to regret taking back his ill-considered (or, more likely, not considered at all) remark, because some people liked it.

title: The Underrated Pleasure of Wearing Jewelry Made Just for You
description: I am not embarrassed to say that one of the great benefits to publishing a book is jewelry. When my first novel, The People in the Trees, came out in 2013, I bought just one thing with my advance: a deep-blue enamel ring that I had lettered with the first line  Kaulana na pua a o Hawaii/Famous are the flowers of Hawaii  of one of the most resonant Hawaiian protest songs, Famous Are the Flowers, written in 1893 to voice support for the overthrown Queen Liliuokalani, the islands last monarch. My book was an allegory of Pacific colonialism, and it seemed right that I should wear this reminder of Hawaii, what it had been and what it had lost, on my hand.

title: A Dead Child, a Ghostly Photo and a Mother Charged With Murder
description: It was 3 a.m. when Sunny Jos smartphone began insistently sounding with Facebook notifications, alerting him that his name was being mentioned.

title: Williams Companies Sues Energy Transfer, Citing Breach of Deal
description: Adding fuel to an increasingly contentious deal, the Williams Companies on Wednesday said it was suing Energy Transfer Equity and its chief executive, Kelcy Warren, for breaching their merger agreement.

title: Earth to Audience: How Andrew Revkins Blog Built a Digital Conversation About Climate Change
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this piece, Andrew C. Revkin, The Timess Dot Earth blogger, explains why his beat is less a noun  environment, climate, science  than it is a question.

title: Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Look to Rebound in New York
description: Setting their sights on the next big delegate prizes, the presidential candidates descended on New York and Pennsylvania on Wednesday afternoon, with Senators Ted Cruz and Bernie Sanders looking to extend the momentum from their Wisconsin victories while Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton work to regain their footing after stinging defeats.

title: What New Rules on Retirement Savings Mean for Investors
description: The Labor Department introduced new rules on Wednesday that will help protect Americans saving for retirement. While investors often assume those handling their savings are providing advice in their best interest, that is not always the case. Here is how things will change.

title: Susanna Malkki Named Principal Guest Conductor of Los Angeles Philharmonic
description: The sought-after Finnish conductor Susanna Malkki will become the principal guest conductor of the Los Angeles Philharmonic in 2017, the orchestra said on Wednesday  making her its first principal guest conductor in a generation, and the first woman to hold the post.

title: Reddit Steps Up Anti-Harassment Measures With New Blocking Tool
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Since 2005, Reddit has been a veritable wonderland for the most extreme forms of free speech on the Internet.

title: Donald Trump Maintains Strong Lead in Latest New York Poll
description: Donald J. Trumps Republican rivals will be playing catch-up ahead of the New York primary, according to a new poll released on Wednesday that shows the Manhattan businessmanholding a substantial lead in his home state.

title: Technology Transforms How Insurers Calculate Risk
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The world is a dangerous, unpredictable place  not a bad thing, perhaps, if youre in the business of selling insurance, making loans or figuring out ways to prevent mishaps.

title: Brooklyn Girl, 17, Dies 4 Days After an Attack Outside Her Home
description: The blows flew through the early-spring chill on Friday night, landing with so much force on TaJae Warners face that she fell to the ground.

description: To the Editor:

title: College Admissions: Stop The Madness!
description: Columnist Frank Bruni: You do NOT have to go to a college with less than a 10% acceptance rate in order to succeed, or, to have the destiny you want.

title: Start-Ups Aim at Overlooked Demographic: The Unbanked
description: Last summer Jimmy Chen walked the streets of San Francisco trying to do simple financial transactions without a bank account, a task millions of Americans face.

title: Ripple Aims to Put Every Transaction on One Ledger
description: Chris Larsen started with a vision of making it possible for, say, a goatherd in Central Asia to do business efficiently with a fisherman in Africa or a merchant in London.

title: Patriots Fans Sue Over Top Draft Pick Lost in Deflategate
description: Some Patriots fans will just not let it go.

title: The Evolution of Fintech
description: 1865 The pantelegraph, invented by Giovanni Caselli, starts operation between Paris and Lyon, France. It is most commonly used to verify signatures in banking transactions.

title: Womens Emotions Do Not Cause Their Migraines
description: [This article is from our archives. Like the Science Times page on Facebook ors ign up for the Science Times newsletter for our latest stories.]

title: A Bulls Rescue in Queens
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Switch to iPhone From Android: Patience and Persistence
description: WHEN Apple first released the iPhone in 2007, I wrote a blog post with the headline: Why my phone wont be an iPhone. I laid out several reasons I would not be giving up my Palm Treo 700p for Apples gadget, including the poor voice and data service of Apples lone wireless partner, AT&T, and the lack of third-party apps.

title: Ackman Defends Pershing Squares Large Stake in Valeant
description: The billionaire investor William A. Ackman defended his large holding in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International in a conference call on Wednesday, arguing that the stock was drastically undervalued after its sharp decline last quarter.

title: Panama Papers Tie More of Chinas Elite to Secret Accounts
description: HONG KONG  At least three of the seven people on the Chinese Communist Partys most powerful committee, including President Xi Jinping, have relatives who have controlled secretive offshore companies, the organization that has publicized a trove of leaked documents about hidden wealth reported on Wednesday.

title: An Old Paris Arcade, for Innovative New French Food
description: Pariss oldest covered passageway, Passage des Panoramas in the Second Arrondissement, has taken shape as a gastronomic incubator of sorts over the past decade. Stone-paved and glass-roofed, the pedestrian arcade opened in 1799 and has housed stationery stores, printers and specialty shops ever since. In 2007, the serial restaurateur Pierre Jancou put it on the map as an innovative food destination when he opened the still hugely popular Racines bistrot  vins there. At the time, Racines was one of the first tables to champion la bistronomie, as produce-driven contemporary French bistro cooking has come to be known, and was an early proponent of organic and vins nature, or unsulfured wines. The Passage des Panoramas is a beautiful space with a very particular atmosphere. Its also sort of an intimate time capsule, says Jancou, who is well-known for bringing new life to forgotten corners of the city. The passage was the sort of venue I was looking for: a place with history that tells a story. (Today, Racines belongs to the restaurateur David Lahner.)

title: Super PAC Emerges to Support Donald Trump, Who Criticizes Such Groups
description: Donald J. Trump has made his disdain for super PACs a central part of his stump speech. He criticizes candidates who get support from these outside groups, and his campaign sent a cease-and-desist letter to one super PAC that used his campaign slogan, and whose strategist had ties to his campaign manager.

title: Students Say Free Speech Is Alive, With One Big Exception
description: The college campus, long a home to spirited protests and expressions of provocative opinions, can also be home to safe spaces, trigger warnings, news media restrictions and rules about what can be written in chalk on the sidewalks.

title: Fed Still Waving Caution Flag on Resuming Interest Rate Increases
description: WASHINGTON  Federal Reserve officials not only decided against raising interest rates at their most recent meeting in March, but they also came close to ruling out an increase at their next meeting this month.

title: Merle Haggard, Country Musics Outlaw Hero, Dies at 79
description: Merle Haggard, one of the most successful singers in the history of country music, a contrarian populist whose songs about his scuffling early life and his time in prison made him the closest thing that the genre had to a real-life outlaw hero, died at his ranch in Northern California on Wednesday, his 79th birthday.

title: MetLife and Dodd-Frank
description: To the Editor:

title: Child Sex Abuse in the Catholic Church
description: To the Editor:

title: Move Over, Rat Pack and Brat Pack: Here Comes the Snap Pack
description: On a warm-for-March night, a foursome led by a 23-year-old fledgling fashion designer named Andrew Warren shimmied themselves into an Uber S.U.V. They were heading from a pajama-themed party at the Dolce & Gabbana store on Fifth Avenue to dinner at a new restaurant, Vandal, on the Bowery.

title: Wayne Gretzky Has a Few Points to Make About a Decline in Scoring and Creativity
description: With 102 points through 80 games, Patrick Kane of the Chicago Blackhawks is poised to win the Art Ross Trophy as the N.H.L.s top point scorer. His superlative season has evoked achievements from an earlier era. He is the first American-born player with a 100-point season in 20 years. His 26-game point streak earlier in the season was the longest since 1992-93.

title: Pfizer and Allergan Advisers Lose Out on $200 Million in Fees
description: A collective sigh  and most likely some profanity  echoed across Wall Street on Wednesday after Pfizer and Allergan terminated the biggest deal in 15 years and federal regulators sought to break up another large deal on antitrust grounds.

title: The Political Picture, After Wisconsin
description: To the Editor:

title: Long Island High School Student Sweeps All Eight Ivies
description: As a Long Island high school student checked her phone for the results of her college admissions applications, she was overcome by disbelief.

title: Text to Text | The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian and On the Reservation and Off, Schools See a Changing Tide
description: Youre born into one place and culture, but feel pulled toward a different life.

title: Review: Rumer Willis Poignantly Makes the Lyrics Her Own
description: The Billie Holiday classic God Bless the Child has inspired so many singers to trample over this wounded reflection on poverty, need and the humiliation of the have-nots that it was a shock to hear it persuasively delivered on Tuesday evening at Caf Carlyle by the offspring of Hollywood royalty. That would be Rumer Willis, the 27-year-old daughter of Bruce Willis and Demi Moore, who refrained from the style of declamation that many pop singers nowadays adopt to demonstrate a bogus empathy. With an excellent band led by her musical director and pianist James Sampliner, Ms. Willis dug into its hurt feelings and made you feel that this child of privilege has known more than her share of woe.

title: Your Suitcase Is Texting
description: On a recent Tuesday evening in SoHo, under a flag recently unfurled, the doors of Raden opened, provided you had the right name to drop to the forbidding doorman stationed before them.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Park and Bryant Park Offer Free Arts Programs
description: As the weather turns nicer, New York City parks are rolling out an array of free performances to be enjoyed in the sunshine. The Brooklyn Bridge Park Conservancy and Bryant Park Presents announced their spring and summer programming on Wednesday, including movies, concerts, dance and theater.

title: Ex-Amtrak Executive to Lead New Jersey Transit
description: As New Jersey Transit and Amtrak prepare to work together on building a new rail tunnel under the Hudson River, a former Amtrak executive has been named to lead the state agency.

title: Woodrow Wilson and the Klan
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Plans to Require Banks to Identify Owners of Shell Companies
description: The United States government is close to issuing a rule that will for the first time require banks and other financial institutions to find out the identities of people hidden behind shell companies.

title: Finger-Pointing Abounds in Failed Pfizer Deal
description: Pfizers abandoned deal leaves all sides tainted.

title: Obama Administration to Transfer Ebola Funds to Zika Fight
description: In an effort to break the two-month deadlock over funding to fight the encroaching Zika virus, Obama administration officials announced on Wednesday that, as congressional Republicans had demanded, they would transfer $510 million originally intended to protect against Ebola to the Zika battle.

title: After Panama Papers, a Raid at UEFA and New Questions for FIFA
description: Swiss authorities raided the headquarters of the European soccer association in Nyon, Switzerland, on Wednesday, seizing information on television rights contracts with Argentine business executives implicated in the FIFA corruption scandal.

title: Corrupt Combatants Fight for Control of Lucrative Afghan Drug Trade
description: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan  Afghans have an expression: Well, whatever has happened, we are still skinny. In other words, they have not gotten rich yet, try as they might.

title: Conjoined Twins, a Trip to Saudi Arabia and a Risky Operation
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  The doctor told the parents to say goodbye. With wet eyes, they held out their palms in prayer and bent over the hospital bed to kiss their daughters tiny foreheads.

title: What the Apple Watch Does, One Year Later
description: A YEAR ago this month, Apple made its Apple Watch available for sale. In the 12 months since, the smartwatch has received mixed reviews, and many people are still uncertain about what the device can do.

title: From Wall Street Banking, a New Wave of Fintech Investors
description: Finance is where they built their careers. Now some of bankings former stars are pouring millions of dollars  and in some cases staking their careers  into new technologies that are shaking up everything from lending to payments to investing.

title: Homeland Security Dept. Struggles to Hire Staff to Combat Cyberattacks
description: WASHINGTON  At a time of increasing threats of cyberattacks on critical infrastructure, the Department of Homeland Security is having trouble recruiting much-needed computer experts because it cannot match the pay of the private sector and does not have the same allure as intelligence agencies.

title: Ranking the Top Fintech Companies
description: Over the last decade, financial technology has gone from a boring niche in Silicon Valley to one of the fastest-growing sectors in the tech industry.

title: Live Reading of Martha Graham Memoir (All of It)
description: So-called marathon readings of famous  and famously long  books like Moby-Dick and Ulysses have become familiar occurrences in the literary world. Now the dance world is getting in on the act.

title: Humans Take Up Air Horns To Confront Gangster Turkeys
description: The resurgence of wild turkeys from near extinction has become increasingly familiar in suburban America where flocks strut Main Street quite fearlessly and occasionally chase like galloping raptors after frightened humans. They are a protected species and seem to know it, intruding in flocks of a dozen or more wherever they please. Cute at first sight, then annoying, the birds are about to face humane harassment in the town of Teaneck, N.J., where officials plan to arm concerned residents with 20 air horns in self defense.

title: Why We Are Still Reaching for Wallets, Not Phones, at the Checkout
description: Sammy Yuen, a graphic designer who lives on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, was standing in line at Whole Foods Market one morning waiting to pay. He used the Starbucks app on his phone to order coffee in advance and then bought his Whole Foods items with Apple Pay by holding the phone in front of the register.

title: Inside Three Rarely Seen Renzo Mongiardino-Designed Homes
description: The Italian architect and set designer created imagined worlds full of layers  of color, pattern, artifice and history  that have succeeded at being timeless.

title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Banker Revamps 401(k) Accounts in New Job
description: KANSAS CITY  Greg Smith was making his pitch, just as he did back in the day when he was a striving young sales trader at Goldman Sachs.

title: Why Parental Leave Policies Are Changing
description: A news article posted on Tuesday, San Francisco Approves Fully Paid Parental Leave, by Thomas Fuller, described a groundbreaking law that will give parents six weeks of fully paid leave when they have a new baby. Readers responded vigorously on Facebook, some to applaud the law and others to chide the United States for not offering such benefits as a matter of course.

title: Fintech Loses Some of Its Attraction for Investors
description: When Elevate Credit sought an initial public offering of stock in January, its pitch went like this: Elevate uses big technology to approve nonprime borrowers for loans quickly.

title: The World of Renzo Mongiardino
description: On the centenary of his birth, a look back on the life and work of the Italian architect and set designer, who designed for the wealthiest international elite.

title: For Fintech Start-Ups, Efforts to Rethink Rules That Cramp Innovation
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Getting a financial start-up off the ground is tough enough.

title: Investing With a Conscience, but Done by a Robot
description: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store, the company behind a chain of down-home restaurants, might not seem an obvious model for advanced financial technology. Its specialty is vintage: vintage food, and in its gift shops, vintage toys and vintage music in the form of hymnal CDs.

title: Catastrophe Adds a New Wrinkle to Its Ribald Love Story: Children
description: Love is a mess. Its awkward and clumsy and can lead to the uncomfortable gestation of a small human.

title: Renzo Mongiardino, the Architect of Illusion
description: With a scholars erudition and an artists imagination, the Italian architect and set designer liberated late 20th-century interior design from staid authenticity and historical correctness. His groundbreaking work, here in three rarely seen homes, is as powerful now as ever.

title: Fintech Firms Are Taking On the Big Banks, but Can They Win?
description: Banking has long been viewed as one of the last traditional, old-school, stuck-in-the-past industries. When you think of banking, you might still think of wood-paneled walls and pinstripe suits.

title: Senator Mark Kirk Urges Republican Colleagues to Meet With Judge Merrick Garland
description: What if the Senate were actually considering Judge Merrick B. Garlands nomination to the Supreme Court?

title: 1964 | How Many Witnessed the Murder of Kitty Genovese?
description: Thirty-eight.

title: Review: Jane Monheit Tries Ella Fitzgerald on for Size
description: The Songbook Sessions: Ella Fitzgerald

title: Marina Abramovic, Swizz Beatz and Al Pacino at Tribeca Ball
description: Can you guess the party based on the celebrity guest list: Marina Abramovic, Swizz Beatz and Al Pacino? This unlikely mix helps to separate the New York Academy of Arts annual Tribeca Ball, held on Monday night, from a more predictable rubber-chicken event.

title: Review: The Lumineers Return, Weary and Disillusioned
description: Cleopatra

title: Review: Tuesday Nights in 1980 Offers Bright Lights, Big Strivers
description: In her debut novel, Tuesday Nights in 1980, Molly Prentiss sets an almost impertinently high bar for herself. Shes determined to write a love letter in polychrome to a bygone Manhattan; to recreate the squalid exuberance of Jean-Michel Basquiats and Keith Harings art scene; to explore all the important, hairy themes  love, creativity, losing your innocence in one cruel swoop.

title: Anxious About College Decisions? Frank Bruni Has Comforting Words for You.
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights from New York Times staff. In this podcast the Times columnist Frank Bruni weighs in on college acceptance madness.

description: Junk

title: Merle Haggard Through the Years
description: Mr. Haggard, one of country musics most successful artists, died on Wednesday at 79.

title: Review: Ballet Hispanicos Oldies but Goodies
description: In recent years, Ballet Hispanico has been steadily commissioning new work, but for its 45th-anniversary season at the Joyce Theater, the company is focusing on existing repertory. Aside from a family-oriented matinee on Saturday, the Joyce season includes just one program, consisting of three tried-and-true pieces: Ramn Ollers Bury Me Standing (1998); Pedro Ruizs Club Havana (1990); and Gustavo Ramrez Sansanos Flabbergast, new to the troupe this year but created for the Luna Negra Dance Theater in Chicago in 2001.

title: Stars With Publishing Imprints of Their Own
description: Stars are just like us. Except theyre richer, and now many of them have their own publishing imprints.

title: Jacob Zuma, Under Siege, Finds Political Refuge in Rural South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  In his first public appearance after South Africas highest court found that he had breached the Constitution, President Jacob G. Zuma visited one of his rural strongholds, where he received a heros welcome.

title: Gay Talese Goes Through the Twitter Wringer
description: On Friday, April 1, the 84-year-old writer Gay Talese made his way from New York to Boston, where he was scheduled to speak at Boston Universitys Power of Narrative conference.

title: DeVotchKa Adds an Indie Touch to Sweeney Todd
description: DENVER  Seventeen performers stand in a half-ring behind a nine-piece orchestra in a rehearsal studio at the Denver Center for the Performing Arts. They are belting out the menacing notes of the opening number in Stephen Sondheim and Hugh Wheelers tale of revenge and madness, Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.

title: Tiger Woods Is Missing, but So Is Dominance in Golf
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Four of the six amateurs in the Masters field this week were born after Tiger Woods made his Augusta National debut in 1995. They grew up in a world in which Woodss contending in a major was a given, like spring following winter.

title: Facebook Groups Act as Weapons Bazaars for Militias
description: A terrorist hoping to buy an antiaircraft weapon in recent years needed to look no further than Facebook, which has been hosting sprawling online arms bazaars, offering weapons ranging from handguns and grenades to heavy machine guns and guided missiles.

title: Heres Why Bill Cosbys Wife May Have to Testify in the Case Against Him
description: It is among the core perceptions that many Americans embrace about their legal system: Spouses never have to testify against spouses.

title: Modern Love: The Podcast | Maddy Just Might Work After All
description: In the 13th episode of Modern Love: The Podcast, the transgender activist, author, New York Times Op-Ed writer, Barnard and Columbia English professor and, last but not least, I Am Cait co-star Jennifer Finney Boylan reads her own Modern Love essay, 'Maddy Just Might Work After All.

title: Not-So-Plain White Tees Are In for Spring
description: Plus: Two former Vogue editors introduce the La Ligne label; stylish protection from the elements from Blunt Umbrellas and watches from Uniform Wares have the right fit for women.
