description: The Islanders knew they would be starting the playoffs on the road. The question heading into their next-to-last game of the season against Buffalo on Saturday night was whether they would travel to Pittsburgh or Florida.

title: Warriors Pursuit of Record Remains Intact With Another Win
description: The Golden State Warriors drew one victory closer to basketball nirvana by escaping Saturday night with a 100-99 victory against the host Memphis Grizzlies at FedEx Forum.

title: Exaggerator Carries Brothers to Kentucky Derby
description: ARCADIA, Calif.  The trainer-jockey dynamic in horse racing can be volatile enough without the added variable of common parentage.

title: Europeans Masters Title Drought Looms Large in Rory McIlroys 77
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  The photos of past Masters champions are on a wall just inside the clubhouse entrance at Augusta National, and at this stage, you have to do some searching to find the last European champion.

title: William Hamilton Dies at 76; New Yorker Cartoonist Lampooned the Comfortable
description: William Hamilton, a cartoonist whose work for The New Yorker over more than 50 years was known for skewering the wealthy and the powerful, died on Friday in a car crash in Lexington, Ky. He was 76.

title: Allison Bollert, Christian Torres
description: Allison Jean Bollert and Christian Alberto Torres were married April 9 at the Harold Pratt House in Manhattan. The Rev. Annie Lawrence, an interfaith minister, officiated.

title: Spencer Cantrell, Andrew Kachor
description: Spencer Marlowe Cantrell and Andrew Saul Rebhan Kachor were married April 9 at the Jepson Center for the Arts in Savannah, Ga. Canon Frank Logue, an Episcopal priest, officiated, and Rabbi Rachael Bregman assisted.

title: Alison Jonas, Robert Sullivan III
description: Alison Jonas and Robert Sullivan III were married April 9 at the Gramercy Park Hotel in New York. Rabbi Allen Block officiated.

title: Ran Lee, Jeffrey Borja
description: Ran Lee, a daughter of Kyung Hwa Chang of Bayside, Queens, and the late Sang Chul Lee, was married April 9 to Jeffrey Nguyen Borja, the son of Kim N. Borja and Jacinto Borja of Verona, N.J. The Very Rev. Thomas J. Ciba performed the ceremony at Our Lady of Czestochowa Roman Catholic Church in Jersey City, where he is the pastor.

title: Corinne Snow, David Denton Jr.
description: Corinne Virginia Snow, a daughter of Cynthia D. Snow of Houston and Philip F. Snow Jr. of Hockley, Tex., was married April 9 to David William Denton Jr., the son of Judge Reena Raggi of Brooklyn and the late Mr. Denton Sr. The Very Rev. Michael A. Carrano, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Pauls United Methodist Church in Houston with the Rev. Gail Williford, a United Methodist minister, assisting.

title: Lawson Caldwell, Curt Sowers
description: Lawson Harrill Caldwell and Daniel Curtis Sowers were married April 9 at their home in Charlotte, N.C. Eleanor C. Moore, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, led a ceremony incorporating Christian traditions.

title: Reneau Skinner, Nicholas Piesco
description: Reneau Elizabeth Skinner and Nicholas Austin Piesco were married April 8 at the Umlauf Sculpture Garden and Museum in Austin, Tex. Heather Davis, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Addie Downing, Marc Bidder
description: Frances Adelaide Downing, a daughter of Frances von Stade Downing and John O. Downing of Green Pond, S.C., was married April 9 to Marc Adam Bidder, a son of Veronica Sweet Bidder and Steven R. Bidder of Parkland, Fla. Robert J. Lodge, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the home of the brides parents.

title: Elyse Schoenfeld, Alex Moyer
description: Elyse Mara Schoenfeld, a daughter of Cindy R. Schoenfeld and Dr. Mark H. Schoenfeld of Woodbridge, Conn., was married April 9 to Alex Jason Moyer, the son of Dr. Gayle S. Moyer and Bruce S. Moyer of Ann Arbor, Mich. Rabbi Richard Berman officiated at the Willard InterContinental, a hotel in Washington.

title: Julie Gordon, Jason Bleck
description: Julie Gordon and Jason Ross Bleck were married April 9 at the Ryland Inn in Whitehouse Station, N.J. Rabbi Faith Joy Dantowitz officiated.

title: Christina LoNigro, Patrick Butler
description: Christina Marie LoNigro and Patrick Clifford Butler are to be married April 10 at the Caramel Room at the Bissingers Chocolate Factory in St. Louis. Michael Van Nimwegen, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate.

title: Bridget Coyne, Aaron Myers
description: Bridget Colleen Coyne, a daughter of Christine E. Coyne of Downers Grove, Ill., and Raymond F. Coyne III of Elmhurst, Ill., was married April 9 to Aaron Evan Myers, a son of Laurie L. Myers and Jack A. Myers of Philadelphia. Clare R. Palace, a Universal Brotherhood minister, officiated at Eastern Market in Washington.

title: Gabriella Janowitz, Jonathan Widder
description: Gabriella Mara Janowitz, the daughter of Dr. Audrey Jane Woolrich and C. Michael Janowitz, both of Manhattan, was married April 9 to Jonathan Cooper Widder, the son of Barbara Cooper Widder and Kenneth H. Widder of Pleasantville, N.Y. Rabbi Robert Weiner officiated at the Roundhouse, a hotel in Beacon, N.Y.

title: Mariloly Orozco and Michael Casas: A Roadside Attraction
description: Mariloly Orozco and Michael Edward Casas were married April 9 at Epiphany Catholic Church in Coral Gables, Fla. Msgr. Jude ODoherty, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony with the Rev. Nicholas Monco, also a Catholic priest and a cousin of the groom, taking part.

title: Chloe Leavitt, Michael Fabiani
description: Chloe Gabrielle Leavitt, a daughter of Lauren L. Leavitt and Todd P. Leavitt of Santa Monica, Calif., is to be married April 10 to Michael S. Fabiani, a son of Marcy Sonneborn Fabiani and John V. Fabiani of White Plains. Rabbi Gordon Tucker is to officiate at Belmond El Encanto, a hotel in Santa Barbara, Calif.

title: Jefferson McCarley, Gary Keener
description: Jefferson Scott McCarley and Gary Allan Keener were married April 7 at San Francisco City Hall. Thomas M. Reardon, a judge of the Alameda County Superior Court, officiated.

title: Oladele Akinsiku, Abayomi Fabunmi
description: Oladele Sara Akinsiku and Abayomi Emmanuel Fabunmi were married April 9 at the Holy Trinity Episcopal Church in Gainesville, Fla. The Rev. George Holston, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Christina Sumpio, Demian von Poelnitz
description: Christina Marie Sumpio and Demian Hieronymus Christoph Freiherr von Poelnitz were married April 9 at St. Patricks Cathedral in New York. Msgr. Robert T. Ritchie performed the ceremony.

title: Jennings Culver, Ross Cameron
description: Jennings Lee Culver, a daughter of Susan Chase Culver and Edward H. Culver Jr. of Wayland, Mass., was married April 9 to Ross Edward Kies Cameron, a son of Lynne H. Cameron and Peter B. Cameron of Reading, Mass. The Rev. S. Marshall Huey Jr., an Anglican priest, officiated at Lowndes Grove Plantation in Charleston, S.C., a historic site now used as an event space.

title: Corrections: April 10, 2016
description: SPORTS

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Mr. Hastert acknowledges that as a young man, he committed transgressions for which he is profoundly sorry.

title: Pacquiao Defeats Bradley by Decision, and Says Farewell to His Sport
description: LAS VEGAS  Manny Pacquiao made a name for himself with a delicious mix of ferocious punching power and shifty speed.

title: Fireworks Disaster at Kerala Temple Kills 106 in South India
description: MUMBAI, India  A series of explosions early Sunday caused by a fireworks display during a religious festival at a temple left 106 people dead and hundreds more injured in the southern Indian state of Kerala, the local authorities said.

title: Revelation on Brussels Attackers Fuels Fears of New Assaults
description: BRUSSELS  The announcement on Sunday that the plotters of last months Brussels terror attacks had originally intended to hit Paris again only heightened the concern among police and intelligence agencies that shadowy Islamic State networks could unleash new attacks at any time, not only in France and Belgium but in other European capitals.

title: Your Weekend Briefing: Masters Tournament, Bernie Sanders, Pope Francis
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: 1941: Roosevelt Takes Steps to Head Off Hitler
description: WASHINGTON  In a bold move to keep the Nazis out of the Danish colony of Greenland, President Roosevelt announced today that Greenland, the worlds largest island, had been placed formally under the protection of the United States government, which will establish air bases, naval facilities and other fortifications there as part of the system to protect the whole Western Hemisphere against invasion.

title: 18 Philippine Soldiers Killed in Firefight With Militant Group
description: MANILA  At least 18 soldiers were killed and more than 50 wounded in a gun battle in the southern Philippines between government forces and the militant group Abu Sayyaf, military officials said Sunday.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: 1966: U.N. Authorizes Blockade of Rhodesia Oil
description: UNITED NATIONS, New York  The Security Council last night [Apr. 10] authorized Britain to enforce a blockade against tankers carrying oil to Beira for pipelining to Rhodesia. Britain promptly took advantage of the authorization to board the tanker Manuela and divert it from Beira. The Security Council vote was 10-0.

title: Before Dating Apps, There Was Lincoln Center
description: Dear Diary:

title: Despite Risks, G.O.P. Seeks to Stop Trump Before Convention
description: When House Speaker Paul D. Ryan released a video laying out his familiar theme that politics should be fought on ideas and issues, the Drudge Reports headline was: Paul Ryan launches his first campaign ad.

title: Capturing, and Changing, the Breezes Blowing Through New York
description: In the last few weeks, 10 of the cast-iron lampposts in Madison Square Park in Manhattan have grown a bit taller. Micah Silver was responsible. He is the one who put the little thingamajigs on them, on the tippy-tops. The finials, to those in the know.

title: Pint-Size Crystal Dunn Reaches New Heights With U.S. Soccer
description: In the 72nd minute of an exhibition game against England last month in Tampa, Fla., Crystal Dunn executed a sublime spin on the left side of the box, making her defender look as if she were clamped to the Raymond James Stadium grass.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: On the Trail: The Week of April 3
description: The Wisconsin primary, and then the campaign descended on New York.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: The Girlfriend Experience, loosely based on the 2009 Steven Soderbergh film, explores the concept of valuelessness. President Obama appears on Fox News Sunday for the first time since he was elected to the White House. And Togetherness comes to an end.

title: Review: In Dice, Andrew Dice Clay Plays a Character He Knows Like Himself
description: Note to whoever has custody of the red flag that is raised whenever a once-fresh television idea is in danger of being run into the ground: Another past-his-prime figure has turned up playing a fictional version of himself.

title: Obama Says Hillary Clinton Wouldnt Intentionally Endanger U.S. With Emails
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said in an interview broadcast on Sunday that while Hillary Clinton had been careless in managing her emails as secretary of state, she would never intentionally do anything to endanger the country.

title: Will Smith, Ex-Saints Player, Is Fatally Shot in New Orleans
description: Will Smith, a former defensive end for the New Orleans Saints who played on their Super Bowl championship team in 2009-10, was shot and killed in New Orleans late Saturday, the authorities said.

title: Billing by Millionths of Pennies, Cloud Computings Giants Take In Billions
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Imagine building an enormous beach resort, maybe the best in the world. Instead of renting the rooms, you charge guests based on the grains of sand they touch. You charge very little per grain, but if they lie on enough of them, it adds up.

title: Murder Trial Plumbs Gang Violence, Adding to a Familys Pain
description: In the Grant Houses, a public-housing project in West Harlem, he was known simply as Bam, short for the superstrong cartoon baby Bamm-Bamm in The Flintstones. He had a reputation as a fierce street fighter. At 15, he posted a video in which he knocks a man out cold in a hallway.

title: Powerful Earthquake Strikes Pakistan, India and Afghanistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A powerful earthquake rattled parts of Pakistan, India and Afghanistan on Sunday, shaking buildings and houses and causing panic in several cities.

title: Arseniy Yatsenyuk, Ukraines Premier, Quits Amid Splits in Post-Revolution Alliance
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Arseniy P. Yatsenyuk, the prime minister of Ukraine, announced his resignation on Sunday in a surprise move that opened a new period of political uncertainty here.

title: Melissa McCarthy Is The Boss at the North American Box Office
description: Melissa McCarthy succeeded at the box office in The Boss, but just barely, with opening-weekend ticket sales for her latest vehicle on the low end of prerelease analyst expectations and audiences giving the film a C-plus grade in CinemaScore exit polls.

title: Hillary Clinton Defends Bill Clinton on Criminal Justice
description: Hillary Clinton on Sunday played down the clash that her husband, former President Bill Clinton, had with protesters who criticized his record on criminal justice at a campaign event last week and said that if she was elected she would work to reduce unnecessary incarcerations.

title: Gridlocked Jakarta Becomes Even Worse, at Least for a Week
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Even on the best of days, it looks like an invasion, though a very slow one: Troops of motorbikes, like a disorganized cavalry, try to slice through enormous, honking lines of buses, trucks, private cars and taxis that are locked in a crawling war of attrition on sclerotic highways and roads.

title: Macedonian Police Use Tear Gas to Stop Migrants at Border
description: ATHENS  The Macedonian police used tear gas and rubber bullets on Sunday to disperse hundreds of migrants who tried to break through a border fence in a large refugee camp in the northern Greek town of Idomeni. It was the latest in a series of increasingly frequent uprisings by migrants stuck in Greece after countries sealed the main route they had been using to get to Germany.

title: Bernie Sanders Says Something Is Clearly Lacking in Hillary Clintons Judgment
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont continued his squabble with Hillary Clinton over her qualifications to be president on Sunday, saying something is clearly lacking in Mrs. Clintons judgment.

title: In Minefield of Gifts, Some Police Leaders Tread More Lightly Than Others
description: Everybody wants to give you a plaque.

title: Donald Trump Aide Accuses Ted Cruzs Campaign of Gestapo Tactics
description: Donald J. Trumps new convention manager accused Senator Ted Cruzs campaign on Sunday of employing Gestapo delegate-wrangling tactics and said Mr. Trump still had several paths to winning the nomination before the July convention.

title: Cheesecake and Turnstiles: Hillary Clintons New York Weekend
description: Hillary Clinton tried to highlight her New York City credentials this weekend, bouncing from shaking hands at Juniors Cheesecake in Brooklyn to holding a rally in the boroughs Sunset Park neighborhood and making a cameo at a black-tie roast with the citys voracious press corps.

title: Twyla Tharp to Present New Work at the Joyce Theater
description: Less than a year after taking two new dances on tour for her careers 50th anniversary, the restless choreographer Twyla Tharp is back to present her latest work: a dramatic piece set to a late Beethoven quartet.

title: Bernie Sanders Did Not Disappoint at Coney Island
description: Bernie Sanders came to Coney Island Sunday afternoon and did what 99 percent of people might have expected: He ate a hotdog at Nathans.

title: At Paramount Pictures, the Family Tree Is Still Growing
description: It might be easier to trace the genealogy of an alley cat than of the typical Hollywood studio: Over the last century or so, most have accumulated a tangled list of owners and corporate forebears  and none more so than Paramount Pictures.

title: Matt Harvey and Mets Search for Answers During Uninspiring Homestand
description: Fashionably, the Mets recalled 1986, wearing throwback jerseys on Sunday at Citi Field. Athletically, they more closely evoked their pre-trade-deadline 2015 incarnation, when runs were at a premium.

title: Review: From Tease to Payback, Skin Me Examines the Politics of Touch
description: Three dancers  two women and one man  scurry around the stage, circling one another and periodically striking poses. So far, so ordinary, except for their transitory points of contact: a hand on a breast, a face in a crotch. This touching of private parts receives no special emphasis, but it does escalate, along with everything else, until the three bodies join in a promiscuous pile.

title: Uncertain Future, for Manny Pacquiao and Boxing
description: LAS VEGAS  He had stuck well to the script all night.

title: Review: New Jersey Symphony Orchestra Gives Xian Zhang a Handy Introduction
description: NEWARK  The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra began its concert on Friday at the New Jersey Performing Arts Center here by tuning, as usual, to a common A. But there was one other thing that needed fine-tuning before the performance, of music by Tchaikovsky and Barber, could begin: the audiences intonation and diction.

title: Review: Six Characters (A Family Album) Excavates Past and Present, Inspired by Pirandello
description: Theodora Skipitaress 25th play, Six Characters (A Family Album), a puppet-filled multimedia investigation of family, creativity and home, takes its main inspiration from Luigi Pirandellos Six Characters in Search of an Author. But his orphaned little troupe has a lot of company onstage at La MaMas Ellen Stewart Theater.

title: John Kasich and Ted Cruz Hunt for Votes in Upstate New York
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y.  Gov. John Kasichs first visit to upstate New York last week was moved twice to accommodate a crowd larger than anticipated.

title: Review: Jason Jones Offers Clues to Bad Parenting on the Road in The Detour
description: The Detour, which begins Monday night on TBS, is a comedy for people who find one particular spectacle funny: parents talking and behaving inappropriately in front of their young children. Its a joke that can be told a thousand different ways  Mom and Dad explain oral sex too graphically, Mom lectures about alcohol while drinking some, and so on  but its essentially the same punch line.

title: Review: At Carnegie Hall, Brahms Piano Quartets, With a New Baby as a Coda
description: Sometimes troubling events cause an artist to withdraw from a performance at the last minute. But last week the superb violinist Christian Tetzlaff pulled out of an important concert at Carnegie Hall for a very happy reason, as the pianist Leif Ove Andsnes, the violinists good friend and frequent collaborator, put it on his website.

title: Review: Sarasota Ballet Blends Oddity and Englishness in a Double Bill
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  Florida has two excellent and endearing ballet companies that both visit New York this year as part of anniversary celebrations. Miami City Ballet  30 years old and always one of Americas foremost exponents of the ballets of the Russian-American choreographer George Balanchine  opens at the David H. Koch Theater this week. Sarasota Ballet, which visits the Joyce Theater in August and has become an exemplary exponent of the ballets of Balanchines British contemporary Frederick Ashton, reached the climax of its 25th anniversary season this weekend with a double bill of the most English of all ballets, Ashtons Enigma Variations, and the most American of all ballets, Balanchines Stars and Stripes.

title: David Cameron Releases Tax Data After Panama Papers Uproar
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, admitting that he had made a mess of responding to questions about his inheritance from his father, who had an investment company offshore, on Sunday released information from his tax returns for the past six years.

title: Pushing Myanmar Toward Full Democracy
description: It has been a long, hard road, but Daw Aung San Suu Kyi is finally set to assume the role of Myanmars top civilian leader. Her National League for Democracy party won a landslide victory last November in the countrys first free election in a quarter century. But a provision in Myanmars military-drafted Constitution barred Ms. Aung San Suu Kyi, a Nobel Peace Prize laureate, from becoming president because her children are British citizens.

title: Review: In Hunters, Another Hero Roots Out Planetary Aliens in Our Midst
description: Apparently the extraterrestrials-among-us problem is bigger than just one secret government agency can handle. The Men in Black people have been grappling with it for years, but on Monday night Syfy gives us the Exo-Terrorism Unit, which also has been battling the malevolent fake humans in our midst.

title: Israels Unsung Protector: Obama
description: WASHINGTON  With the Obama administration in its final year, several officials have said that the president has grown so frustrated with trying to revive Middle East peace talks that he may lay down his own outline for an Israeli-Palestinian two-state peace agreement, in the form of a resolution in the United Nations Security Council.

title: A Roomful of Funny Women, Bonding Over the New York Comedy Life
description: The idea was simple but novel: Take one picture of as many women in New York Citys varied comedy scenes as possible.

title: Phylicia Rashad, Finding Joy in Tribulations of Her Role in Head of Passes
description: Phylicia Rashad was hoping for Medea. Instead, she found Shelah.

title: Review: The Vanishing Velzquez Tells of Art Obsession
description: In 1845, a humble English bookseller named John Snare purchased a painting of King Charles I at an auction for 8 pounds, roughly the same cost as a horse. The painter was identified as Van Dyck, but Snare, with an art lovers instincts and an autodidacts ravenous literacy, was certain it was painted by Diego Velzquez. He became besotted with it in the way a monarch does his mistress. The difference is that this love affair lasted decades. Also, it destroyed his life.

title: Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Hold Strong Leads in New York and Pennsylvania
description: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton have struggled during a recent stretch of primary contests, but big wins could be in store for both candidates in New York and Pennsylvania, according to two surveys released on Sunday that show them holding wide leads.

title: Remembering Kitty
description: More than 50 years after the murder of Kitty Genovese became a symbol of urban apathy, her partner, Mary Ann Zielonko, remembers Kittys life and impact.

title: Remembering Kitty Genovese
description: In death, Kitty Genovese has cast a long shadow over Americas psyche, far more than she probably would have had her life not been brutally cut short at age 28. Across the decades since her murder in 1964, she has endured as a symbol of urban disconnection and apathy, a victim not only of a knife-wielding killer but of bystanders unwillingness to get involved in resisting evil.

title: Keeps For Oneself
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  As a public service to those of us still raising children, Id like to pose a question: Why is it that when you do laundry that involves the clothing of small human beings, what comes out of the washing machine is often less about the clothing and more about wads of disintegrated paper, rocks, small toys, melted candy and other trinkets?

title: Carli Lloyd: Why Im Fighting for Equal Pay
description: Ive worn a U.S. Soccer uniform for 12 years and have done so proudly. Ive had some of the greatest moments of my life  winning two Olympic gold medals and the 2015 Womens World Cup  wearing that uniform. So when I joined four teammates in filing a wage-discrimination complaint against U.S. Soccer late last month, it had nothing to do with how much I love to play for my country.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of April 11
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Danny Willett Wins Masters as Jordan Spieth Folds
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  After 63 holes of the 80th Masters, Jordan Spieth was five strokes clear of the field. The last nine holes at Augusta National lay before him like a lush green carpet in a coronation ceremony.

title: Michelle Obamas Graduation Speeches Show Her Personal Side
description: WASHINGTON  Michelle Obama, stung by criticism during her husbands first campaign that she was too outspoken, arrived at the White House and took on a careful role promoting health and fitness as Mom in Chief. In the seven years since, she has slowly shed that early reticence and has been more forceful about issues of race, gender and class.

title: The Kentucky Derby Dartboard: Week 2
description: Top contenders for the 142nd running of the Kentucky Derby are listed in order of preference, with comments provided by Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert of The New York Times. Churchill Downs has adopted a points system to determine the Derby field, with points being earned by the top four finishers in designated prep races. The odds are from the Churchill Downs futures pool, and the records are starts-win-place-show. An article on Saturdays Santa Anita Derby, Wood Memorial and Bluegrass Stakes can be found here.

title: Republicans Hijack an Election Agency
description: For 10 years, the Election Assistance Commission, the bipartisan federal agency created after the 2000 election debacle to help make voting easier and more standardized, has made it clear that prospective voters do not need to prove that they are American citizens before they may register.

title: For Staff on Naked and Afraid, Work Is Just a Blur
description: SHERMAN OAKS, Calif.  At first blush, it is a perfectly normal modern production office: standing desks, an indoor putting green, a casual dress code. There is a Whole Foods right around the corner.

title: Paul Ryan, a Mirage Candidate, Wages a Parallel Campaign
description: WASHINGTON  As the Republican candidates for the White House battled in Wisconsin last week, Speaker Paul D. Ryan was conspicuously absent from his home state  but he was very much on the political stage.

title: Behind Fake Degrees From Pakistan, a Maze of Deceit and a Case in Peril
description: In the year since Pakistani investigators raided Axact, a Karachi-based software company accused of raking in hundreds of millions of dollars with a vast Internet degree scam, Pakistani and American investigators have been busy dismantling its operations.

title: G.M. Begins Prevailing in Lawsuits Over Faulty Ignition Switches
description: DETROIT  After two years of heavy legal and financial consequences, General Motors has finally turned the tide and started winning lawsuits related to the gravest safety crisis in its history.

title: Spring Has Arrived, but the Yankees May Beg to Differ
description: DETROIT  If the conditions the previous two days were not inhospitable enough for the Yankees, hovering around freezing with blasts of Arctic air, they awoke Sunday morning to snowflakes fluttering down from the gray skies. The weather warmed enough so that the snow turned to hail and then to rain, but it was miserable enough for long enough that their nationally televised game against the Detroit Tigers was postponed about four hours before the scheduled first pitch.

title: Egypt Gives Saudi Arabia 2 Islands in a Show of Gratitude
description: CAIRO  Since King Salman of Saudi Arabia arrived in Cairo on Thursday for a five-day visit, the leader of the oil-rich kingdom has lavished his Egyptian allies with promises of aid and investment.

title: Panama Papers Leak Signals a Shift in Mainstream Journalism
description: WASHINGTON  Four years passed between The New York Timess first article based on the Pentagon Papers and the end of the Vietnam War.

title: Keiko Fujimori, Ex-Presidents Daughter, Heads to Runoff in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru  Presidential elections in Peru were headed to a second round of voting on Sunday with the daughter of an imprisoned former president in the lead over a centrist former prime minister, Peruvian officials said.

title: Duane R. Clarridge, Brash Spy Who Fought Terror Networks, Dies at 83
description: Duane R. Clarridge, a pugnacious American spy who helped found the C.I.A.s Counterterrorism Center, was indicted and later pardoned for his role in the Iran-contra scandal, and resumed his intelligence career in his late 70s as the head of a private espionage operation in Afghanistan and Pakistan, died on Saturday in Leesburg, Va. He was 83.

title: Hamilton and History: Are They in Sync?
description: As Hamilton fever has swept America, historians have hardly been immune. The megahit Broadway musicals creator, Lin-Manuel Miranda, has won prestigious honors from the profession, including the 2015 George Washington Book Prize. More than one scholar has marveled at the shows detailed presentation of the founding periods complicated politics  not to mention the way Mr. Mirandas dazzling rap lyrics pull off rhymes like line of credit and financial diuretic.

title: Prison Rate Was Rising Years Before 1994 Law
description: Gangs and drugs have taken over our streets, President Bill Clinton said in 1994 as he signed a far-reaching anti-crime bill to bipartisan acclaim.

title: An Intense Competition at the 18th, No Golfers Involved
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  It was 8 a.m. on a Sunday at the 18th green. The leader of the Masters, Jordan Spieth, was not scheduled to tee off for nearly seven hours and was not expected to complete his round for more than 11 hours.

title: Intuit Sheds Its PC Roots and Rises as a Cloud Software Company
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Three decades ago, at the dawn of the personal computer age, Intuit shook up the financial software world with its first product, Quicken. The program, which was centered on the simple notion of a virtual checkbook, suddenly made the PC a very useful tool for people to manage the chores of paying bills and tracking personal finances.

title: Charles S. Hirsch, New Yorks Chief Medical Examiner on 9/11, Dies at 79
description: Dr. Charles S. Hirsch, the New York City chief medical examiner who raced to the World Trade Center on Sept. 11, 2001, and returned to the morgue with every rib broken to face the monumental forensic challenge of identifying the 2,753 victims of the attacks, died on Friday in Westwood, N.J. He was 79.

title: Trans-Atlantic Data Deal and Oil Prices at Stake
description: This is what to expect from the week ahead:

title: Ad Agency Enlists Comedians to Get the Creative Juices Flowing
description: THE SCENE was beginning to take shape, a Walter Mitty-like fantasy about a schlub taking out the garbage. A small team was imagining how the mundane task might be suddenly transformed. After briefly considering an action sequence, they landed on a number with a lift straight out of Dirty Dancing.

title: Warriors Equal Mark for Most Victories in a Season
description: SAN ANTONIO  Of course, it had to be the San Antonio Spurs  the same Spurs who had defeated them here last month, the same Spurs who had not lost a game at home all season, the same Spurs with the same cast of legends and the same winning approach and the same unassailable confidence. It was not going to be easy for the Warriors.

title: Racist Drinking Game Causes Uproar at High School in New Jersey
description: At first, Jamaica Ponder, 17, was confused by the image on her phone screen: It depicted some of her classmates at Princeton High School in New Jersey playing Jews vs. Nazis, a variation of the drinking game known as beer pong.

title: Review: Timo Andres and Gabriel Kahane Redefine Mixtape in Moving Concert
description: Back in the days of audiocassettes  Google that word if you must  a mixtape was a popular gift among friends, capable of kindling a romance or cementing a brotherhood. At the same time, such a compilation of carefully chosen music could be a kind of heraldic device that announced its makers allegiance and cultural pedigree.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I dont think he would use his position as the stick in the eye of Trump or taunt him. But I dont think Ryan would be at all shy about laying out the agenda of the Republican Party, because, remember, there are a lot of people voting against Trump out there.

title: Bronx Ice Center Plan Hangs in the Balance
description: For two decades, the vast Kingsbridge Armory in the Bronx has been a place where proposals  for schools, homeless shelters, entertainment centers or shopping malls  go to die.

title: Vinyl Season 1, Episode 9 Recap: Bats and Tennis Rackets
description: This episode features two different versions of Hey Joe, neither of them Jimi Hendrixs. But when Richie goes to confront Devon, although hes full of bile, he doesnt have a gun in his hand: he ends up wielding a tennis racket.

title: A Town Nourished by Mickey Mantles Legacy, if Not Yet Prosperity
description: COMMERCE, Okla.  The Mickey Mantle name is worth millions, but you wont find that kind of money in the town where Mantle learned to switch-hit by hitting tennis balls, using the side of a metal shed as a backstop.

title: Fear the Walking Dead Season 2 Premiere Recap: Smoke on the Water
description: Los Angeles is burning.

title: Man Arrested in Fatal Stabbing at Bronx Party
description: After a brief chase outside a South Bronx housing project, the police arrested a 35-year-old man early Sunday morning and charged him with fatally stabbing another man during a house party.

title: Federal Prosecutors Cast a Wider Net in New York City Hall Inquiry
description: Signs of a sprawling municipal investigation in New York City have emerged in a seemingly random fashion over the last week. Four senior police officials were abruptly transferred or put on modified duty. A Manhattan restaurateur was arrested and charged with operating a Ponzi scheme. Among his investors were two men who had raised money for Mayor Bill de Blasio, and one of the men was also a generous campaign donor.

title: Dead Ringer for Mets 86 Team Searches for a Pulse
description: The racing stripes were back in Flushing on Sunday, just as they were in 1986, on the shoulders and sides of the Mets V-neck uniforms. That was the style when the Mets last won the World Series, and they will wear it every home game on Sundays of this 30th anniversary season.

title: Firm to Pay AIDS Activist for Denying Him Housing
description: In the 10 years since he tested positive for H.I.V., David Goode has grown weary of the stigma and the ostracism that have accompanied his diagnosis. Among the most searing rejections were those from landlords and realtors, who told him time and again they would not accept rental subsidies from New York Citys H.I.V./AIDS Services Administration, in violation of city and state law.

title: Pacers In and Bulls Out as Playoff Picture Sharpens
description: It would be a stretch to describe a game between the Indiana Pacers and the Nets as a marquee matchup, but on a day when most fans were focused on a relatively meaningless game in San Antonio, the Pacers quietly clinched the final playoff spot in the Eastern Conference.

title: Billions Season 1 Finale Recap: A Wendy, Scorned
description: Francis Ford Coppolas The Conversation ends with Harry Caul, the surveillance agent played by Gene Hackman, blowing his saxophone amid the wreckage of his own guilt and paranoia. Hes made a vocation out of inserting himself into other peoples lives  hes the best at it, in fact  but now, the wall hed so carefully maintained between the personal and the professional has been irrevocably breached. He took action intended to prevent a tragedy, but wound up duped by more powerful forces, who had turned the tools of his trade against him. And now, hes torn through the walls and floorboards of his own apartment, searching for a bug that may or may not exist. Hell never know for sure.

title: Fittingly, Knicks Fall in Home Finale
description: A few minutes before halftime in the Knicks game on Sunday night, Carmelo Anthony scrapped through a thicket of Toronto Raptors players to execute a tough layup.

title: Englishman Rises in the Late-Afternoon Augusta Sun
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  It had been two weeks of joyful, life-changing whirlwind and with one short putt left to finish off his sparkling 67 in the late Sunday sunshine, Danny Willett removed the white sweater he had worn all day to reveal a green shirt.

title: Islanders Settle for the Top Wild-Card Spot
description: Even though the Philadelphia Flyers had virtually nothing to play for on Sunday, they still wore T-shirts under their white sweaters with Every Day printed across the back for their regular-season finale against the Islanders. The Flyers then won by 5-2.

title: Poor New Yorkers Tend to Live Longer Than Other Poor Americans
description: New York is a city with some of the worst income inequality in the country. But when it comes to inequality of life spans, its one of the best.

title: Live Nation Adds Governors Ball to Its Music Festival Lineup
description: With this years music festival season starting up, there is another jewel in the crown of Live Nation Entertainment, the company that has come to dominate live music through its concert and ticketing businesses. To its collection of top festivals like Lollapalooza, Electric Daisy Carnival and Bonnaroo, it has now added Governors Ball in New York.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | equinox
description: equinox \e-kw-nks, e-\ noun

title: Where the Poor Live Longer: How Your Area Compares
description: Explore life expectancy in your area.

title: The Rich Live Longer Everywhere. For the Poor, Geography Matters.
description: In some parts of the country, adults with the lowest incomes die on average as young as people in much poorer nations like Rwanda, and their life spans are getting shorter.

title: Pilot and Passenger Are Injured in Plane Crash on Long Island
description: A single-engine plane crashed in the intersection of two residential Long Island streets on Sunday night, taking down power lines and leaving the pilot fighting for his life, the Suffolk County Police Department said.

title: Corrections: April 11, 2016
description: SPORTS

title: Employees Only, a New York Cocktail Bar, Has Global Plans
description: Employees Only has been one of New Yorks most popular cocktail bars since it opened in the West Village in 2004. By the end of this year, it will be an international brand.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: In The Detour, Samantha Bee and her husband, Jason Jones, conjure up a road trip from hell. Ken Burns chronicles the life of Jackie Robinson. And Jake Hurwitz and Amir Blumenfeld of CollegeHumor fame spoof the art of the pickup.

title: Kerry Visits Hiroshima Memorial and Underlines U.S.-Japan Alliance
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan  Secretary of State John Kerry attended a memorial ceremony in Hiroshima on Monday for victims of the American atomic bombing 71 years ago, becoming the highest-ranking United States administration official to visit the site of one of the most destructive acts of World War II.

title: A Brussels Mentor Who Taught Gangster Islam to the Young and Angry
description: BRUSSELS  He lived under the rafters in a small attic apartment in the Molenbeek district of Brussels, and became known to some followers as the Santa Claus of jihad. He had the bushy beard and potbelly, and generously offered money and advice to young Muslims eager to fight in Syria and Somalia, or to wreak havoc in Europe.

title: Malick Sidib: Creative Force of African Culture
description: Update, April 15, 2016: The son of Malian photographer Malick Sidib says Mr. Sidibe died late Thursday. He was 80 years old.

title: Jobs and Infrastructure
description: To the Editor:

title: The Persistence of Racial Bias and Inequality in America
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Do Some Vote Against Their Best Interests?
description: To the Editor:

title: Parental Leave Policies
description: To the Editor:

title: Dont Dilute CUNYs Urban Mission
description: The New York State Legislature rebuffed Gov. Andrew Cuomo last year when he proposed that the State University of New York, which has 64 campuses, and the City University of New York, which has 24, develop a plan for combining their administrative functions.

title: Dont Blame Panama. Tax Evasion Is a Global Problem.
description: Panama City  DESPITE their name, the Panama Papers are not mainly about Panama. They are not even primarily concerned with Panamanian companies. The more than 11 million documents, illegally hacked and released last week relating to previously undisclosed offshore corporations, is roiling the world with revelations of the vulnerability for rampant abuse of legal financial structures by the wealthy.

title: Americas Place in the Executioners Club
description: What do Texas, Missouri, Georgia and Florida have in common with China, Iran, Pakistan and Saudi Arabia? All are outliers in their continued use of the death penalty, which is being abandoned in most of the rest of the United States and the world.

title: Snoopy the Destroyer
description: Has Snoopy just doomed us to another severe financial crisis? Unfortunately, thats a real possibility, thanks to a bad judicial ruling that threatens a key part of financial reform.

title: Penalize Companies That Export Jobs
description: THE heating and air-conditioning equipment maker Carrier Corporation recently announced plans to transfer its Indianapolis plants manufacturing operations and about 1,400 jobs to Monterrey, Mexico. It became clear that the best way to stay competitive and protect the business for long term was to move production, an executive told employees, who were volubly and understandably upset by the looming loss of good, family-sustaining jobs.

title: A Terrorism Threat at Nuclear Plants
description: To the Editor:

title: Can Liberals Frack?
description: AS the Democratic presidential campaign comes to New York, the candidates are competing to dance on the grave of fracking, even though the oil and gas extraction technique of hydraulic fracturing has been banned in the state since 2014. The anti-fracking rhetoric seems to be rooted in the assumption that liberalism is as inherently antithetical to fracking as it is, say, to the Defense of Marriage Act  or monarchy. That assumption, however, does a disservice to liberals claims to be on the side of empiricism and climate science.

title: Philosophizing With Guns
description: In a matter of months, the offices, libraries and classrooms where I work, study and teach at the University of Texas at Austin will become concealed carry zones  areas in which people with concealed handgun licenses may carry their weapons. The campus carry bill that brought about this situation represents a 50th anniversary gift of sorts from Texas state legislators. For when the law comes into effect on August 1, it will be 50 years to the day since a heavily armed young man ascended the clock tower on campus and shot 45 people, killing 14 of them, in the first mass shooting at an American college.

title: HNA Group of China Offers to Buy Gategroup for $1.5 Billion
description: LONDON  Gategroup Holding said on Monday that HNA Group of China had offered to buy the Swiss provider of catering and logistics services to airlines for 1.4 billion Swiss francs, or about $1.5 billion.

title: Colonel in North Koreas Spy Agency Has Defected to South, Seoul Says
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A colonel belonging to North Koreas spy agency recently defected to South Korea, the South announced on Monday. He is one of the highest-ranking North Korean military officers known to have defected to South Korea in recent decades.

title: News Qs | Beloved Author Beverly Cleary Talks About Writing, Reading and Turning 100
description: The following lesson activities are based on the Op-Ed Happy Birthday, Beverly Cleary!.

title: Job 1: Putting the Knicks Before the Coach
description: With another playoff-less season concluding in Indiana on Tuesday night, Phil Jackson has the always contentious chore of anointing yet another Knicks head coach. But before he dwells on whos got next, he may well want to heed an experienced voice of the not-too-distant past.

title: New York State Corrections Dept. Takes On Guards Union Over Brutality
description: ALBANY  The job of an internal affairs investigator in New York States corrections department can be thankless work. So it was a rare occasion last month when officials summoned all 150 members of the unit to the departments training academy here for a pep talk.

title: Student Question | Is a Sorority a Good Place for a Feminist?
description: What are your experiences with or perceptions of sororities?

title: Fashions New Radicals: Alessandro Michele and Demna Gvasalia
description: How two unlikely designers are changing the course of fashion.

title: E.L.L. Practice + Prompt | Favorite Travel Destinations
description: http://int.nyt.com/data/videotape/finished/2015/11/10/places-to-go-2016/coralbay-1200.mp4

title: These Two Guys Are Changing How We Think About Fashion
description: RULE-BREAKING IS A PHRASE thrown around in fashion a lot. But who makes these rules? And arent rules what fashion is based on? After all, fashion isnt just the clothes on your back. Its the form of those clothes at a given moment, adhering to certain codes that define them as forward-thinking, as now, as  la mode. Which often, as on a menu, translates simplistically to a lump of something fancy plopped on top of an existing offering, as opposed to tinkering about with the guts or really changing anything. Rules in fashion are made by the industry: the editors, the designers, the corporations who fund the whole thing. And so, genuine rule-breakers dont come along that often. Fashion enjoys the status quo. It sells clothes, it makes money.

title: Colm Toibin Reviews The North Water by Ian McGuire
description: THE NORTH WATERBy Ian McGuire255 pp. Henry Holt & Company. $27.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | April 11, 2016
description: Updated: April 15, 2016

title: Millions With Leg Pain Have Peripheral Artery Disease
description: More than eight million older Americans have a condition that can cause leg pain when they walk even short distances. Yet half of those who have the condition dont know it and consequently dont get treated for it, putting themselves at risk for a heart attack, stroke or worse.

title: Your Monday Briefing: David Cameron, Masters Tournament, Golden State Warriors
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Suicide Bombers Thwarted Outside Police Station in Southern Russia
description: MOSCOW  Three suicide bombers tried to attack a small police station in southern Russia on Monday, but they were thwarted without causing any casualties, the investigations department for the region said in a statement.

title: New York Today: A Primary on the Horizon
description: Updated, 11:34 a.m.

title: ScienceTake | A Crayfish in Trouble
description: The Murray crayfish, the worlds second largest, is sensitive to changes in habitat. But populations can come back from current declines.

title: A Big Australian Crayfish, Pretty and in Trouble
description: The enormous Murray crayfish, the second largest in the world, is also one of the prettiest. It has bright white claws and a shell with blues, greens and hints of red, depending on the light.

title: Fear of Crying: The Problem of Babies and Airplanes
description: First of all, nobody takes a small child on an airplane for the fun of it. I have been there and I know. Dont get me wrong, Im no airplane saint; you wont generally catch me offering to hold someone elses kid, or making friends around the seatback. I dont usually admit to being a pediatrician, for fear of hearing a medical saga. But I have put in my time on airplanes with my own infants and toddlers and small children, and I certainly know how it feels.

title: GE Capitals Czech Business to Pursue I.P.O.
description: LONDON  GE Money Bank, a business of GE Capital in the Czech Republic, said on Monday that it planned to list its shares on the Prague Stock Exchange.

title: Morning Agenda: How Valeants Missteps Derailed Female Viagra
description: HOW VALEANTS MISSTEPS DERAILED FEMALE VIAGRA | In August, Sprout Phamaceuticals was flying high: It had finally received regulatory approval for its drug Addyi to treat low sex drive in women, and a day after the Food and Drug Administration approved the drug, Valeant Pharmaceuticals International bought Sprout for $1 billion, twice its value only two months earlier. But a series of missteps after the deal, combined with problems at Valeant that have depressed its stock by 85 percent, derailed what was once hailed as the female Viagra,  Katie Thomas and Gretchen Morgenson write in The New York Times.

title: The Islamic State of Molenbeek
description: BRUSSELS  There are military trucks parked in Molenbeek, and soldiers with submachine guns patrol the jittery streets of the Brussels district that has been the epicenter of European terrorism in recent months. On the Place Communale idle youths loiter, shooting glances at the police. This is where the Paris and Brussels attacks, with their 162 dead, overlap.

title: Democracy Left Out in the Cold
description: This week, United Nations talks meant to chart a path toward a peaceful, democratic future for Syria are set to resume in Geneva. But, in an absurd twist, the legitimate representatives of a large, democratically governed area in the country will not be invited to attend.

title: Ted Cruz Sees Milk and Honey in Blue California
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas has made clear his feelings about New York values. So hes trying California.

title: DeRay Mckesson Wont Be Elected Mayor of Baltimore. So Why Is He Running?
description: DeRay Mckesson will not be the next mayor of Baltimore. Hes a 30-year-old with no experience in city government who registered less than 1 percent in a recent poll. He has no clear local support network and has been rejected by his most likely constituency  the citys young black activists. At least one competing candidate has been embedded in Baltimore politics nearly as long as Mckesson has been alive.

title: CaixaBank Set to Take Over Portugals BPI After Shareholder Drops Opposition
description: MADRID  The Spanish lender CaixaBank is set to proceed with a takeover offer for BPI, a Portuguese bank, after reaching an 11th-hour agreement with an Angolan investor who had blocked its bid.

title: Are Public Universities Neglecting In-State Students?
The Obamacare Replacement Mirage
description: Hype springs eternal  certainly when it comes to Paul Ryan, whose media image as a Serious, Honest Conservative and policy wonk seems utterly impervious to repeated demonstrations that he is neither serious nor honest, and that he actually knows very little about policy. And here we go again.

title: In California, Marijuana Is Smelling More Like Big Business
description: ADELANTO, Calif.  After decades of thriving in legally hazy backyards and basements, Californias most notorious crop, marijuana, is emerging from the underground into a decidedly capitalist era.

title: Rural Water, Not City Smog, May Be Chinas Pollution Nightmare
description: BEIJING  More than 80 percent of the water from underground wells used by farms, factories and households across the heavily populated plains of China is unfit for drinking or bathing because of contamination from industry and farming, according to new statistics that were reported by Chinese media on Monday, raising new alarm about pollution in the worlds most populous country.

title: Afghan Sesame Street Introduces Zari, a Muppet and Role Model for Girls
description: Sesame Street has introduced its first Afghan Muppet, and she has a mission. The hope is that the Muppet, called Zari, will become a strong role model for girls in a country with a poor record of promoting womens rights, according to the production company Sesame Workshop.

title: Howard Marks, Drug Smuggler Turned Author, Dies at 70
description: Howard Marks, an Oxford-educated drug trafficker who at his peak in the 1970s controlled a substantial fraction of the worlds hashish and marijuana trade, and who became a best-selling author after his release from an American prison, died on Sunday. He was 70.

title: Jordan Spieth Absorbs a Tough One With Dignity
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  More important than golf, Jordan Spieth said Sunday night as a preamble to publicly congratulating the new Masters champion, Danny Willett. And with those words, Spieth showed that he would live to laugh about his Masters meltdown.

title: 8 Taiwanese Are Deported to China After Trial in Kenya
description: HONG KONG  The government of Taiwan criticized Beijing on Monday after eight people from the island were deported to mainland China following a trial for fraud in Kenya.

title: The Incredible, Escalating Resort Game
description: The endless game of fashion show one-upmanship continues. On Sunday, Nicolas Ghesquire unveiled  via Instagram  the venue for the next Louis Vuitton Cruise show, to be held on May 28 outside Rio de Janeiro, in the run-up to the Olympics: the Niteri Contemporary Art Museum, designed by Oscar Niemeyer.

title: Daily Mail Considering Bid for Yahoo Assets
description: LONDON  The Daily Mail, a British tabloid newspaper and website, confirmed on Monday that it had discussed with other investors a potential bid for assets of Yahoo.

title: Donald Trump and New York Tabloids Resume Their Elaborate Dance
description: As New York City newspaper assignments go, this was a delicate one. Fly to Florida. Walk into Donald J. Trumps hospital room. Witness the birth of his second daughter.

title: The New Shape of Long Nails
description: After years of short and boyish manicures, women are growing their nails to make a fine point.

title: A Murder Taps Into Germanys Conflicted Relations With Migrants
description: CELLE, Germany  An immigrant from Iran, Mehdi Hushmand was a beloved high school science teacher known for his devotion, and for going out of his way to help settle some of Germanys newer immigrants  the more than one million migrants and refugees who arrived en masse last year.

title: Intuit, a True Survivor, Relocates to the Cloud
description: Intuit is still one of the tech industrys best-known names. Famous for its personal finance and tax software, the Silicon Valley company rose to prominence more than three decades ago as one of the first and most popular makers of PC software.

title: Marking Up Web Pages in Windows 10
description: Q. I see that Windows 10 now lets you write on web pages. How does this work, and who can see what youve written?

title: The Paradox of Finding Motivation Through Fear
description: I was driving with a friend recently and telling him about some projects that really excited me. I mentioned a new book Im working on, an article Im writing and this new hobby of adventure motorcycling in the desert.

title: Navy May Charge Officer With Giving China and Taiwan Secrets
description: WASHINGTON  The Navy is weighing charges of espionage against an officer who is a naturalized American citizen and has been under investigation since last year on suspicion of providing secret information to China and Taiwan, United States officials said.

title: Liqueur From Rhubarb
description: Rhubarb seems like a good fit for an Italian-style bitter liqueur, or amaro, a category that has taken off at trendy bars. Back in 1845, Ettore Zucca, an Italian industrialist, made rhubarb amaro from a tincture his wifes doctor concocted to cure her indigestion. In 1919, a descendant, Carlo Zucca, refined the recipe and bottled and sold the amaro. It became scarce but now has been revived and is being imported: Zucca Rabarbaro, $31.99 at the new Morton Williams Wine & Spirits, 270 Park Avenue South (21st Street), 212-477-5490, mortonwilliamswine.com.

title: A Sweeter Frog for Passover
description: Very sweet and very cute: Such are the marzipan frog pops made by the confectioner Dahlia Weinman. Her Passover assortments include 10-plagues pops and marzipan matzos in various shapes and sizes. The marzipan is made with only ground almonds and cane sugar, no corn syrup: Passover assortments, $15 to $38, marzipops.com.

title: The Texture Is Delicate. The Flavor Is Bold.
description: Delicate is the word that best describes these Spanish cookies. The flavors, however, are anything but. Rich cocoa balanced with a touch of salt, apple seasoned with cinnamon, and lime with bits of candied peel are some of them. All the ingredients are organic: Paul and Pippa Biscuits, $7 for 5.2 ounces ($6 each for six or more containers), marxpantry.com.

title: A Cookbook That Educates as Well as Inspires
description: The New Mediterranean Jewish Table by Joyce Goldstein not only inspires you to cook, it also educates. She dismisses the notion that there are two styles of Jewish food, one Ashkenazi, from Eastern Europe, and another Sephardic, from southern Europe and the Middle East. Its not so simple, she says. She parses more than 400 recipes from her own repertoire and other sources and discusses how Jewish food has changed. Passover recipe inspirations include leek fritters, Italian soup with chicken dumplings and a lamb tagine with raisins, almonds and honey: The New Mediterranean Jewish Table by Joyce Goldstein (University of California Press, $39.95).

title: Matzo Overseen From Harvest Through Baking
description: Theres supermarket matzo, and then theres shmura, or guarded matzo, which is often preferred by observant Jews for Passover and which is supervised at every step, from before harvest to the baking. A new, organic shmura matzo is made from wheat and spelt grown on a Yiddish Farm in Goshen, N.Y. Yisroel Bass, the founder and director of the nonprofit farm and learning center, cultivates the grain on 40 acres, mills the flour and takes it to a kosher bakery in nearby Kiryas Joel: Shmura Matzo, $39.99 a pound (about 8 pieces), $42.99 for spelt from organicpassover.com and $50 a pound at Elis Manhattan, Elis Vinegar Factory and Elis Bread and Pastry at Grand Central Market, elizabar.com.

title: Wines From the Loire and a Respected Sommelier
description: Pascaline Lepeltier, one of New Yorks star sommeliers, has been somewhat out of the picture since Rouge Tomate, her restaurant base of operations, closed in 2014 and has yet to reopen in its new location. But you can enjoy her expertise at a wine dinner at Racines NY that will feature 18 chenin blancs from the Loire. The vintages will take you from 1989 to 2014. The chef Frdric Ducas four-course menu will include monkfish with white asparagus and chicken with morels: Chenin blanc dinner, April 19, 7 p.m., $175, Racines NY, 94 Chambers Street (Church Street), 212-227-3400, info@racinesny.com, racinesny.com.

title: Will the Fervor of Bernie Sanderss Legions Endure?
description: PHILADELPHIA  People with lip rings, dreadlocks and tattoos; multitudes of clean-cut types; longhaired men clutching copies of the Marxist magazine Socialist Appeal or the Sartre play No Exit; black women intrigued by college-debt relief; gay and transgender supporters; young women in burlappy wear normally seen in Bali; and at least one older guy who said that until recently he had been a Republican.

title: David Cameron Questioned After Panama Papers Uproar
Vassars Powerhouse Season to Include Taylor Mac
description: Before Hamilton and Bright Star arrived on Broadway, they made pit stops at Vassar College as part of its 2013 Powerhouse Theater season of works-in-progress, organized with New York Stage and Film. A host of new projects hope to follow their path at this years event, from June 24 to July 31, which features Taylor Mac, Josh Radnor and Santino Fontana.

title: Donald Trump Calls Colorados Process for Choosing Delegates Crooked
description: Donald J. Trump on Monday criticized the system for selecting delegates in Colorado, where he was shut out last week, insisting that people in the state were marching and going crazy over a crooked system.

title: Portuguese Supreme Court Upholds Extradition of C.I.A. Agent to Italy
description: The Portuguese Supreme Court has upheld a decision to extradite to Italy a former C.I.A. officer who was convicted in absentia in connection with the kidnapping of an Egyptian cleric in 2003, as the administration of George W. Bush ordered renditions after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.

title: As Oil Nations Consider a Freeze, Looking for Tensions to Thaw
description: LONDON  When officials from OPEC, Russia and some other oil-producing countries meet this weekend in Doha, Qatar, to discuss freezing petroleum production at current levels, the sessions significance might have more to do with style than substance.

title: Job Discrimination Case Raises Questions of Transgender Rights in China
description: BEIJING  A labor arbitration panel in the southern province of Guizhou held a hearing on Monday in what is being described as Chinas first transgender job discrimination case. A ruling is expected this month in the case, brought by a man born a woman, who said his former employer fired him for wearing mens clothes.

title: Social Support of Marriage May Improve Cancer Survival
description: Several studies have found that being married improves survival in cancer patients. Now a new study suggests that it may largely be the social and emotional support of marriage, rather than any economic advantages, that produces the effect.

title: People Who Avoided Illness Could Be Key in Treating Those Who Didnt
description: Somewhere in the world are 13 incredibly lucky people. Although they do not know it, each inherited a mutated gene that causes a fatal or terribly debilitating disease in infancy or childhood  but these people are adults, and healthy.

title: Scientists Unveil New Tree of Life
description: A team of scientists unveiled a new tree of life on Monday, a diagram outlining the evolution of all living things. The researchers found that bacteria make up most of lifes branches. And they found that much of that diversity has been waiting in plain sight to be discovered, dwelling in river mud and meadow soils.

title: Sesame Extends Its Sweet Reach Beyond the Middle East
description: When the chef Danielle Oron was growing up in the New Jersey suburbs, she knew that her Israeli familys habits of dousing vanilla ice cream with tahini and spreading halvah on toast would be considered odd. Sesame was for cold Chinese noodles, bagels and not much else.

title: Virgin America Fans Ask if Alaska Airlines Takeover Will Mean Loss of Cool
description: For younger business travelers like Nicole Bansal, Virgin Americas mood lighting, customer service and technology have filled a niche not found on legacy airlines.

title: Shushu/Tongs Fall 2016 Collection
description: The year-old brand debuts its Adult Baby collection.

title: Fashion Brand to Know: The Year-Old Label Inspired by Adult Babies
description: Liushu Shushu Lei and Yutong Tongtong Jiang, the designers behind the new womens wear brand Shushu/Tong, cite the Japanese singer Kyary Pamyu Pamyu as one of their greatest inspirations. For the uninitiated, shes a star of the colorful J-pop scene  cartoonish, lurid, hyper-cute.

title: Some Like Them Hot. She Likes Them Homegrown.
description: Working at a farm in upstate New York after college, Annie Novak was startled to see people carrying vials of hot sauce like lucky charms. It was winter, she said. They were putting drops in their hands and licking them to stay warm.

title: Sometimes Pain Is a Puzzle That Cant Be Solved
description: My elbow is killing me.

title: Canadian Pacific Ends Bid for Norfolk Southern
description: After five months of pressure, three merger offers and one rejection from regulators, Canadian Pacific Railway said on Monday that it had abandoned efforts to combine with its American railroad counterpart Norfolk Southern.

title: Ed Snider, Flyers Owner Who Made Philadelphia a Hockey Town, Dies at 83
description: Ed Snider, who co-founded the Philadelphia Flyers of the National Hockey League and owned the team for nearly 50 years, and who was chairman of a sports management company that provided services to hundreds of arenas, stadiums and convention centers in North America, died on Monday at his home in Montecito, Calif. He was 83.

title: Common Application Saturates the College Admissions Market, Critics Say
description: As the news rippled across the web last week that a Long Island student had won admission to all eight Ivy League universities, thousands of people reacted with messages of praise.

title: Is the Worlds Best Croissant Made in Australia?
description: Kate Reid, the founder of Melbournes Lune Croissanterie, studied aerospace engineering and spent several years working for a Formula One racing team before apprenticing at the famed Paris boulangerie Du Pain et des Idees. Her background in precision machines might help explain why she recently moved production of her ethereal, exceptionally flaky pastries to a climate-controlled glass cube that looks straight out of a James Bond film, inside a brick warehouse in the Fitzroy section of the city. Here, Reid and her brother Cameron hand-laminate, shape, proof and bake as many croissants, kouign-ammans and cruffins as their obsessive devotion to the craft will allow  about 3,000 a week, sold Thursday through Sunday.

title: The Wedding Ring
description: This weeks challenge was suggested by regular Numberplay contributor Sunil Singh, a math consultant with Scolab, a creative and effervescent educational technology laboratory based in Montreal. The puzzle is a seemingly simplequestionabout a would-be bride. Is marriage in her near future? Lets find out. Heres Sunil:

title: A New Zealand Penguin, Hard to Spot, Is Harder to Preserve
description: DUNEDIN, New Zealand  Only a keen-eyed observer can spot the rare yellow-eyed penguin in the impenetrable forest hills that hug New Zealands South Island beaches.

title: How a North Pole Chat with Readers Led to an Online Sustainability Quest
description: The editors who run Times Insider, which offers readers a look behind the journalism process, recently asked me to recount a bit of my journey from conventional news reporting to this Dot Earth blog. I launched Dot Earth in October, 2007, as a way to explore complex, prismatic questions that didnt fit well into conventional news coverage. When I left the staff for Pace University, the blog moved to the Opinion section, but my prime mission remains the same: examining ways to smooth the human journey and make information matter in a noisy age.

title: Wall Street Earnings: A Grim Quarter for Big Banks
description: It is shaping up to be another grim year for the nations biggest banks. They were hit hard by a bad environment for trading and deal-making.

title: Brooklyn Condo Inspired by a Gas Station
description: Can a former gas station inspire the design for a new home? It sounds far-fetched, but to those who drew the blueprints for a new condominium in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, it did.

title: Cook With Passion
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: In Settlements Fine Print, Goldman May Save $1 Billion
description: State and federal officials said on Monday that Goldman Sachs would pay $5.1 billion to settle accusations of wrongdoing before the financial crisis.

title: Rutgers Student Killed in Shooting Near Newark Campus
description: A Rutgers University student was killed and his roommate, a recent graduate, was seriously injured in a shooting at their apartment near the schools campus in Newark, the authorities said on Monday.

title: Suicide Bomber Kills at Least 12 Afghan Army Recruits on Bus
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber struck a bus of army recruits in eastern Afghanistan, killing at least 12 people and wounding dozens, officials said on Monday.

title: Marines Death in a Secret Iraqi Base Reflects a Quietly Expanding U.S. Role
description: WASHINGTON  On a Saturday morning three weeks ago, American radar detected rockets headed for a secret fire base of about 100 Marines in northern Iraq.

title: Its Probably Not the Cat Eating Too Much Fat
description: Q. Are animals susceptible to cholesterol problems?

title: Panama Papers Show How Lawyers Can Turn a Blind Eye
description: During the savings-and loan-crisis in the early 1990s, the question Where were the lawyers? was asked about the wrongdoing taking place at numerous banks.

title: John Kasich Sees Path to Nomination Despite Low Delegate Count
description: He received fewer votes in one state than a candidate who was no longer in the race. He has not added a single delegate since March 15. And outside of his home state  the only one he has won to date  he has been the top vote-getter in just four counties.

title: 1916: German Offensive at Verdun
description: The desperate German offensive against the French positions guarding Verdun continues with unabated vigor and on Monday night and yesterday General Ptains troops had to withstand a series of furious assaults supported by every deadly contrivance that the enemy could muster.

title: Where to Find the Fantastic Beasts Trailer? Here
description: That suitcase that the magizoologist Newt Scamander brings to New York City isnt just filled with scarves and waistcoats.

title: Out of Left Field, Rookie Shortstop Sets a Home Run Record
description: Trevor Story was drafted 45th over all out of Irving High School in Texas in 2011. Baseball America ranked him just the eighth best prospect on his team, the Rockies, last fall.

title: For Polio Vaccines, a Worldwide Switch to New Version
description: Starting on Sunday, more than 150 countries and territories will switch to a new oral polio vaccine. It will be the first worldwide vaccine change ever attempted.

title: Race and the Death Penalty
description: To the Editor:

title: Hamilton Isnt All True. Got a Problem With That?
description: To the Editor:

title: Kanye Wests Life of Pablo Is No. 1 on Billboard Chart After a Wild Ride
description: The release of Kanye Wests The Life of Pablo has been the messiest and most fascinating album rollout in recent memory. And now, with a historic arrival on the Billboard chart, it has only gotten more interesting.

title: Bernie Sanders Proposes Fracking Ban and Attacks Hillary Clinton on the Environment
description: BINGHAMTON, N.Y.  Bernie Sanders, campaigning across New York State on Monday, called for a nationwide ban on fracking and pointedly criticized Hillary Clinton for her record and stances on environmental issues.

title: Questioning Americas Role in Yemen
description: Who is to blame when bombs kill civilians?

title: Sentencing Delayed for Man Convicted in Gay-Bias Killing
description: The sentencing of Elliot Morales, who was convicted last month of murder as a hate crime after shooting a gay man in the West Village, was delayed on Monday, as the defense requested additional time to review a series of issues surrounding the case.

title: A Scottish Connection?
description: To the Editor:

title: Saving Young Pitchers Arms
description: To the Editor:

title: Canadian Pacific Demonstrates How Not to Pull Off a Merger
description: Canadian Pacific Railways $28 billion bid for its rival Norfolk Southern pushed all the wrong deal buttons. The offer, unsolicited and now abandoned, managed to alienate nearly every ally the railway needed: American regulators, the targets board, customers, lawmakers and even the American military.

title: The Next U.N. Leader
description: To the Editor:

title: The Defense of Catholic Marriage
description: I hope to write something later this week rounding up the conflicted and conflicting reactions from conservative Catholics to Pope Franciss apostolic exhortation on marriage and the family, Amoris Laetitia. (My own provisional reactionappeared in Sundays paper.) But first I thought Id respond to my friend Alan Jacobss bafflement at conservative agita over the idea of giving priests formal discretion (informal, they will always have) to admit divorced and remarried Catholics to communion in the absence of an annulment.

title: Mario Conde, Ex-Bank Chief in Spain, Arrested in Money-Laundering Inquiry
description: MADRID  A disgraced former Spanish banker, Mario Conde, was arrested here on Monday as part of an investigation into whether he fraudulently repatriated the equivalent of nearly $15 million in money he had hidden offshore while presiding over the collapse of one of Spains largest banks, Banesto, more than two decades ago.

title: Number of Tigers in the Wild Is Rising, Wildlife Groups Say
description: The estimated number of tigers living in the wild rose this year for the first time in more than a century, conservation organizations said. New technology, including hidden cameras, are helping to track and count the animals, which may account for some of the increase.

title: David Cameron Clashes With Rivals Over Tax Havens and His Wealth
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain clashed with the opposition Labour Party in Parliament on Monday over tax havens and his inherited wealth, and, in a spirited debate over economic fairness set off by the disclosures in the Panama Papers, defended the right of Britons to make money lawfully as long as they paid their taxes.

title: New Evidence on When Bible Was Written: Ancient Shopping Lists
description: TEL AVIV  Eliashib, the quartermaster of the remote desert fortress, received his instructions in writing  notes inscribed in ink on pottery asking for provisions to be sent to forces in the ancient kingdom of Judah.

title: Chris Jackson to Lead One World Imprint at Random House
description: The editor Chris Jackson, whose work with the author Ta-Nehisi Coates, the civil rights lawyer Bryan Stevenson and the hip-hop star Jay Z, among others, has made him a rare public star in the world of book publishing, has been named the vice president, publisher and editor-in-chief of the One World imprint of Random House.

title: Paul Ryans Mixed Presidential Messages
description: After denying a presidential campaign, Speaker Paul D. Ryan on his website released a series of campaign-themed videos offering a message of unity between Republicans and Democrats.

title: Annenberg Grants to Aid a Range of Emerging Artists
description: Robyn Bollinger made her debut playing the violin with the Philadelphia Orchestra at age 12. David Pegram was one of the actor-puppeteers in Lincoln Center Theaters recent production of War Horse. Devon Teuscher became a soloist with American Ballet Theater in 2014.

title: Some Warriors Are Happy to Pass Up a 3-Pointer. Really.
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Amid their record-breaking march, the Golden State Warriors have made more 3-pointers this season than any other team in N.B.A. history. The ability to launch shots from intergalactic ZIP codes seems like a requirement for employment. Stephen Curry has gotten so good at it that he has somehow made the halfcourt heave look pass.

title: The Trump Rally
description: Faces of the movement.

title: Sweeter Off the Vine: A Cookbook Made for Instagram
description: Sometimes a cookbook comes along that seems designed specifically for the Instagram generation, a book that conjures a world of handsome ceramic platters, rustic linens and food that dances around the world, drawing inspiration from the flavors of the Middle East, Southeast Asia and Mexico. The dishes are perfectly imperfect, an edible I woke up like this, and easy to picture cropped square in your feed.

title: Texas Officer, Caught on Video Throwing Girl to the Ground, Is Fired
description: A law enforcement officer who was shown on a phone video slamming a 12-year-old student to the ground at a San Antonio middle school has been fired, an official said on Monday.

title: Hormone Therapy for Prostate Cancer Tied to Depression
description: Hormone therapy for prostate cancer may increase the risk for depression, a new analysis has found.

title: Review: Game of Silence, a Thriller, Grows Out of a Troubled Past
description: Every story about a group secret needs a loose cannon, and the one in NBCs Game of Silence is frighteningly loose. His name is Gil, and Michael Raymond-Jamess portrayal of him injects a sense of ominous unpredictability into this well-made revenge thriller.

title: Former Concacaf Chief Admits Guilt in FIFA Corruption Case
description: Alfredo Hawit, a top world soccer official until December, pleaded guilty on Monday to racketeering conspiracy, wire fraud conspiracy and conspiracy to obstruct justice.

title: Highlights from Spencer Sweeney
description: The artist chose some favorite pictures from his new self-titled monograph, and told T their stories.

title: Two Decades of Downtown Art (and Club) Antics, in Pictures
description: When the Swiss artist Urs Fischer couldnt find a book on his friend Spencer Sweeney, he decided to take matters into his own hands: Fischer proposed the two work together on a retrospective monograph for his own publishing imprint, Kiito-San.

title: What the Panama Papers Reveal About the Art Market
description: The so-called Panama Papers  the leak of 11.5 million files from the Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca  have given us a deep look into the many ways offshore shell companies are used to conceal the ownership of art. Leaked initially to Sddeutsche Zeitung, a German newspaper, the documents have been pored over by a consortium of journalistic outlets, which released a series of articles last week, several about the art market.

title: Bernie Sanders vs. Hillary Clinton, New York-Style
description: To the Editor:

title: Letting Patients Tell Their Stories
description: Friday night in the emergency department is about what youd think.

title: A Tiny Home Takes Shape in Brooklyn, but It May Not Stay
