description: Miko Mercer would seem to be a good candidate for a tiny house  single, tidy, 5-foot-3. And indeed she has joined the Tiny House Movement that has swept the country the last several years.

title: The Park Service Maps Americas Natural and Human-Made Soundscapes and Silences
description: I was drawn to a fascinating analysis by the National Park Service, Mapping Sound on a National Scale, by a pair of Twitter posts this morning from Max Roser, an Oxford University economist and director of the schools invaluable Our World in Data project:

title: In Mexico City, Exploring a Volcano Sacred to the Aztecs
description: At the end of each 52-year cycle that governed their calendar, the Aztecs would put out all the fires they burned for everyday use, and as night descended, priests would use a friction rod to ignite a new blaze atop a sacred volcano that soared over the surrounding shimmering lakes. The event involved the burning of a human sacrifice and culminated in runners carrying torches lit by the fire back down the mountain to relight hearths in temples and in every home.

title: Review: Venice and Vivaldi, Center Stage at the Metropolitan Museum
description: It almost amounts to a festival before the festival. The program Venice Baroque Orchestra Performs Vivaldi, presented in the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on Saturday night, is to be followed on Wednesday by an evening of Vivaldi performed by another Italian group, Accademia Bizantina, at Alice Tully Hall.

title: Dressing Up for the Met Opera
description: To attract a new generation of sophisticates, the Metropolitan Opera has a new series, Fridays Under 40, that offers tickets to people under 40 for $60 and $100. On March 18, young operagoers dressed up (and down) for the occasion.

title: Review: American Contemporary Music Ensemble at the Kitchen
description: Despite the composers wishes, the Kitchen didnt quite turn into an aquarium on Sunday evening when the American Contemporary Music Ensemble performed a new transcription of Charlemagne Palestines Strumming Music. In program notes for the event, Mr. Palestine, a minimalist composer known for immersive soundscapes and eccentric performance rituals involving stuffed animals and alcoholic libations, expressed his hope that his music would create a liquid sonority that would inundate this performance space in Chelsea.

title: Light Turnout for Vote in Darfur on Regions Future
description: EL FASHER, Sudan  After years of crisis, displacement, turmoil and bloodshed, the people of Sudans Darfur region had a chance on Monday to participate in a referendum on their future.

title: Talking with Dena Blizzard: How She Became One Funny Mother
description: The day before beginning previews of her new Off Broadway show, One Funny Mother, Dena Blizzard was taking cold medicine and tending to her 11-year-old daughter, who had recently received nine stitches in her knee after falling in a creek.

title: Review: Wringer, a Musical Adaptation of Jerry Spinellis Book
description: Wringer, Jerry Spinellis award-winning 1997 childrens novel, is suspenseful, poignant and sometimes disturbing. I wouldnt call it fun. Wringer, the musical adaptation by New York City Childrens Theater, is fun from beginning to end. Is that a problem?

title: Sierra Nevada Snow Wont End Californias Thirst
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  Thanks in part to El Nio, snowpack in the Sierra Nevada is greater than it has been in years. With the winter snowfall season winding down, California officials said that the pack peaked two weeks ago at 87 percent of the long-term average.

title: Curtis Sittenfelds Eligible Updates Austens Pride and Prejudice
description: It is a truth universally acknowledged that many a writer in want of a good romantic comedy plot has turned to Jane Austen. Pride and Prejudice alone has countless progeny  from the classic 1995 BBC adaptation, to more fanciful variations like Pride and Prejudice and Zombies and Twilight (Pride and Prejudice and Vampires).

title: Judge Orders Release of Gawker-Hulk Hogan Trial Documents
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  A judge agreed on Monday to release a trove of previously sealed documents related to the Hulk Hogan sex tape trial against Gawker Media, which concluded in March with a jury awarding the former wrestler $140.1 million in damages after three and a half years of litigation.

title: Humana Festival, Turning 40, Looks at Mortality, Dystopia and Change
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The Humana Festival of New American Plays, which concluded on Sunday, celebrated its 40th anniversary this year. But the plays themselves didnt feature much in the way of cork-popping. Most offered dark views of our passage through life, perhaps appropriately. Once youve turned 40, the road forward has fewer forks, scars from the past have settled into the skin, and existence begins to feel more precarious.

title: Stan Douglass The Secret Agent Offers a Refracted Vision of History and Terrorism
description: Henry James once described Joseph Conrads writing as a prolonged hovering flight of the subjective over the outstretched ground of his stories.

title: All the Kings Men, Now 70, Has a Touch of 2016
description: Southern political personalities, like sweet corn, travel badly, the journalist A. J. Liebling wrote. They lose flavor with every hundred yards away from the patch.

title: Arms Control Groups Urge Human Control of Robot Weaponry
description: Two international arms control groups on Monday issued a report that called for maintaining human control over a new generation of weapons that are increasingly capable of targeting and attacking without the involvement of people.

title: Racially Charged Joke by Hillary Clinton and Bill de Blasio Leaves Some Cringing
description: In less than three minutes, a comedy routine between Hillary Clinton and Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York managed to cause a storm of controversy over a racially charged joke.

title: Body Recovered 2 Months After Plane Lands in a Long Island Harbor
description: Nearly two months after a single-engine plane made an emergency landing in Setauket Harbor, the body of the missing passenger was found on Monday, the Suffolk County Police Department said.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: John Kerry, Donald Trump, Will Smith
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Comedians Takedown of Turkish President Tests Free Speech in Germany
description: BERLIN  Germanys comics love President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey. Or at least to make fun of him mercilessly. And for Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, that is no laughing matter.

title: Henrik Lundqvist, Rangers Rock in Net, Has Been Wobbling
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The sight was surely unnerving to the Rangers, who have come to rely, tactically and psychologically, on Henrik Lundqvist at this time of year.

title: Indonesias Library on Horseback
description: An Indonesian man who takes books to children in a remote village  on horseback  has become the Don Quixote of literacy.

title: After Loss in Colorado, Donald Trump Supporters Give State Chairman an Earful
description: It has been two days since Senator Ted Cruz of Texas swept Colorados delegates, and Steve House, the chairman of the states Republican Party, is feeling the wrath of Donald J. Trumps supporters.

title: Texas Attorney General Faces Federal Securities Fraud Lawsuit
description: HOUSTON  Attorney General Ken Paxton of Texas, who was indicted last year on state securities fraud charges, faced a new round of legal troubles on Monday after federal regulators accused him of misleading investors in a technology company.

title: Tesla Recalls Model X S.U.V.s
description: Tesla Motors said on Monday that it was recalling its Model X sport utility vehicles after testing revealed that the backs of the electric cars third-row seats could give way in a crash.

title: Chicago Set to Pay $6 Million in Deaths of 2 Men After Arrests
description: CHICAGO  This city moved Monday toward paying more than $6 million in settlements to the families of two men who died after being taken into police custody, frustrating City Council members who said such cases showed the need for urgent changes to police training and discipline.

title: Activists Push to Continue a Libel Suit Against Them
description: Dennis Paustenbach, a top consultant to companies facing lawsuits over products or environmental practices, has long been eager to put a stop to accusations that his company, ChemRisk, slanted scientific findings to suit its clients.

title: New York City Combining Agencies for Homeless and Welfare Services
description: Citing duplication, inefficiency and the need for a new vision to combat homelessness, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Monday that the New York City agencies for homeless services and welfare will consolidate under a single commissioner.

title: Zika Fight Requires More Money, Congress Is Told
description: WASHINGTON  Two senior Obama administration officials said on Monday that the government did not have enough money to effectively combat and treat the Zika virus, which they called a more profound threat to the United States than experts once believed.

title: Puerto Rico Aims to Appease Congress With New Debt Proposal
description: Puerto Rico proposed a new plan on Monday to restructure its debt, offering some creditors better terms than an earlier plan but falling well short of winning broad support.

title: Suicide Attempts Plague Attawapiskat First Nation in Canada
description: OTTAWA  She was bullied relentlessly. She suffered from asthma, diabetes and other ailments. Her living conditions were unbearably cramped: 20 relatives taking refuge in a two-bedroom government nursing station for more than a year after a sewage backup made their home uninhabitable.

title: Two Unions Set Strike Deadline for 36,000 Verizon Workers
description: Two unions representing roughly 36,000 Verizon workers in the eastern United States have set a strike deadline of Wednesday morning, saying they have made little progress with management in the more than eight months since their most recent contracts expired. The announcement sets up what would be one of the largest strikes in recent years.

title: For Indian Start-Ups, Tenacity Beats High Tech
description: BANGALORE, India  On a hot afternoon in a two-story house here, as dogs barked and auto-rickshaws sputtered outside, a venture capitalist grilled three entrepreneurs.

title: Europes Urgent Security Challenge
description: It took two weeks after the devastating attacks in Brussels for officials to discover that the plotters originally intended to hit Paris again or that the two attacks were carried out by a single network. Even now, authorities dont know the full scale of the Islamic States operations in Europe, which involve criminal elements as well as terrorists.

title: Frequent Victories Can Make Room for Two Goalies
description: Dallas Stars goaltender Kari Lehtonen admits he was not entirely thrilled when he first heard that his team had acquired his fellow Finnish goalie Antti Niemi last summer.

title: The Mayor Offers Hope for the Homeless
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced an overhaul of New York Citys services for the homeless on Monday, the result of a 90-day review that he promised when the homelessness crisis reached a crescendo late last year.

title: De Blasio Donors Took Pride in Connections With Top Police Officials
description: Jona S. Rechnitz, the scion of a wealthy Los Angeles family, came to New York City about a decade ago to make his mark. A brash young man eager to fund philanthropic causes, he cultivated connections with the Police Department  posing with top officials, and once arranging for police bagpipes at a party  and became a fixture at fund-raising events for Mayor Bill de Blasio.

title: For a Generalist, Too Big to Fail May Be Too Tricky to Judge
description: About two years ago, I was speaking with an executive at MetLife who floated the idea that the company should sue the government to overturn its designation as a firm that was too big to fail. The company believed that it was being unfairly labeled, and that the regulations that came with the designation were hindering its business.

title: Effort to Impeach Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff Clears Congressional Panel
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The effort to impeach President Dilma Rousseff cleared a congressional panel on Monday, setting up a cliffhanger vote on her ouster in the coming days in Brazils Chamber of Deputies.

title: Obamas Latest View on Secrecy Overlooks Past Prosecution of Leaks
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama defended Hillary Clintons email practices in a television interview over the weekend by saying, theres classified, and then theres classified, he was only repeating what critics of government secrecy have long contended: that most of what is classified is merely sensitive, a little embarrassing or perhaps a policy debate still in progress.

title: Getatchew Mekurya, 81, Ethiopian Saxophonist With Global Reach, Dies
description: Getatchew Mekurya, a saxophonist with an ardent, full-throated style who worked predominantly in Ethiopia for decades before being embraced by a worldwide audience, died on April 4 in Addis Ababa. He was 81.

title: Rights Law Deepens Political Rifts in North Carolina
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  North Carolina has been pummeled with boycotts, criticism and cancellations in the wake of its new law on gay and transgender rights. Now liberals and conservatives in the state have turned to pummeling one another.

title: Barrage of Attack Ads Threatens to Undermine Donald Trump
description: More than half of the record spending on negative advertising during the 2016 presidential primary has been directed at a single candidate, Donald J. Trump, a barrage that threatens to undermine his candidacy even as he continues to march toward the Republican nomination.

title: Thieves Take $280,000 From Brooklyn Bank After Carving Hole in Roof
description: In a scene more often seen in a Hollywood caper than in Borough Park, Brooklyns sedate shopping district, employees arrived for work at a bank on Monday morning to find a tunnel through the ceiling straight into the vault, with hundreds of thousands of dollars missing, the police said.

title: National Briefing
description: Two more deaths from Legionnaires disease in the Flint area were identified on Monday by health officials, bringing the death toll from the disease in 2014 and 2015 to 12. Eden Wells, the chief medical executive for the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services, said officials counted 91 cases of Legionnaires in Genesee County, which includes Flint, during those years. Most were not fatal. We remain vigilant in identifying any potential case associated with the outbreak, she said in a statement. Officials in Michigan suspected a link between a spike in Legionnaires disease, a form of pneumonia caused by bacteria that multiply in water systems, and the Flint water supply as early as 2014. The switch from Lake Huron water to water from the Flint River was made in April 2014. Flint residents are still using filters before drinking or cooking with their tap water. Marc Edwards, the Virginia Tech researcher whose testing identified lead in the water, plans on Tuesday to release results of an eight-month study of Flints water. JULIE BOSMAN

title: Does the Pope's Message on Divorce Weaken the Church?
Yankees Set to Spruce Up Steinbrenner Field
description: TORONTO  The Yankees and the Tampa Sports Authority announced plans Monday for a $40 million improvement project at Steinbrenner Field that would be financed equally among the State of Florida, Hillsborough County and the Yankees.

title: Cuomos Tax Cuts, Boon for Middle Class, Come With Risk
description: ALBANY  It has become a phenomenon as common in Albany as Monday night fund-raisers or legislators under indictment: a new year, and a new round of tax cuts from Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

title: Common Deli Order
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Is anybody hungry? Alan Derkazarian has delivered five HAM ON RYE sandwiches (and a CLUB sandwich, if anyone is finicky) and I figure that if I cut them into tiny little pieces, there may be enough for everyone.

title: Full Text of the Hiroshima Declaration
description: Here is the full text of the joint statement made by Secretary of State John Kerry and the top diplomats from other Group of 7 industrialized countries commemorating their visit to Hiroshima.

title: National Politics Shines on Albany as Candidates Nearly Cross Paths
description: ALBANY  No one could remember the last time this city received so much love in a presidential campaign, let alone when it had three national candidates all appearing a few blocks from the State Capitol as they did on Monday.

title: Documents Detail Scene of Planned Parenthood Shooting in Colorado Springs
description: DENVER  Robert L. Dear Jr., his pickup truck loaded with rifles, handguns and propane canisters, had to stop several times to ask for directions to the Planned Parenthood center in Colorado Springs. Eventually, he found the clinics address after calling Planned Parenthood itself, and once there, the police say, he carried out an hourslong shooting rampage that left three people dead and nine people wounded.

title: Better Call Saul Season 2 Episode 9: The Brothers McGill
description: If you have ever wondered what Shakespeare would sound like translated for a serialized television drama, circa 2016, wonder no more. The answer arrives 18 minutes into this gloriously fraught episode, when Chuck summons Kim to his home and accuses Jimmy of murder most foul. O.K., that overstates it. He accuses Jimmy of fraud, but were talking about the white-collar law part of the show, so thats bad enough.

title: Marlins Channel Bonds, a Rookie Coach, in Bashing the Mets
description: Giancarlo Stanton had just belted a second-inning home run deep over the left field wall at Citi Field  chasing the Mets Steven Matz from his first start of the season  when a familiar foe cheered from inside the Miami Marlins dugout.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: In California, especially in Humboldt, we have a code of conduct: Respect the land and respect the people. I dont want that culture to be replaced by guys in $5,000 suits.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | hindmost
description: hindmost  \hin(d)-most\  adjective

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: Some childhood friends take down those who wronged them in Game of Silence, a satisfying new revenge thriller. Wayne Newton croons along with the Roots on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. And The Mindy Project resumes, with new episodes on Hulu.

title: Corrections: April 12, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: A Quixotic Mission: Indonesias Library on Horseback
description: Who doesnt remember the magic of libraries, where new wonders awaited on each shelf, ready to take young minds to far-off places? Of course, if you live in a far-off place, a library may be something youd only read about in books. That is, if you had books to begin with.

title: Dad, the Ant Killer
description: New Orleans  I AM a father; my superpower is worry.

title: How to Fix Politics
description: In the middle of this depressing presidential campaign I sometimes wonder, How could we make our politics better?

title: What States Can Do on Birth Control
description: Dover, Del.  DURING my years of working in public life, I have witnessed countless ways in which unplanned pregnancy disrupts peoples lives. So one of the best ideas Ive seen for how to help everyone reach the next rung on the ladder is providing access to effective contraception. Enabling women to become pregnant only when they want to is a shortcut to prosperity.

title: Making the Most of Clinical Trial Data
description: Data from past clinical trials can be used to draw new conclusions about diseases and treatments long after a trial is over.

title: The Not So Super Delegates
description: The paradox of a strong system of superdelegates in the 2016 primary season is that a significant section of the Democratic Party, which has them, wishes it didnt, while the leadership of the Republican Party, which doesnt have them, may well wish it did.

title: Tensions at the Syrian Border
description: Today we traveled along the Syrian border to a security checkpoint with King Abdullah II and some of his military advisers. Jordan has many borders, all potentially porous: 365 kilometers (about 227 miles) facing Syria, 180 kilometers (about 110 miles) facing Iraq, and the rest facing Saudi Arabia, Israel and the Palestinian territories. Their vulnerabilities are clear and visible from the air. But the Jordanian military is vigilant, using very sophisticated surveillance equipment and poring over digital video feeds in real time to spot problems.

title: Grieving My Patients Friend
description: Isabella left a package for each of her children to open after her death. Her youngest was only 5 months old, and the other three were ages 2, 4 and 7. She had always wanted a big family, and when she learned, after the birth of her third child, that she carried BRCA1, the so-called breast cancer gene, she and her husband decided to rush to have their last child. Then she would have the surgery that she believed would save her life, a double mastectomy.

title: Bono: Time to Think Bigger About the Refugee Crisis
description: IVE recently returned from the Middle East and East Africa, where I visited a number of refugee camps  car parks of humanity. I went as an activist and as a European. Because Europeans have come to realize  quite painfully in the past year or two  that the mass exodus from collapsed countries like Syria is not just a Middle Eastern or African problem, its a European problem. Its an American one, too. It affects us all.

title: Shopping for Health Care: A Fledgling Craft
description: Four years ago, Dave deBronkart spoke at a medical conference, with his face displayed on a giant screen. Afterward, a doctor told him that a spot on his face looked like basal cell carcinoma.

title: The Permanent Temporary Solution
description: Words ... I love words and phrases, maybe because Im a songwriter. Absurdities are a personal favorite. Today I will always remember as the day of permanent temporary solutions.

title: A Home, but Not Home
description: I arrived in Jordan, a country where about one in five people is a refugee. The Jordanian governments figure is 1.2 million refugees, mostly Iraqis and Syrians  and the true number is probably larger. When we think of refugees at all, most of us think of people living in camps. But here in Jordan a vast majority of these transitory souls are living in the community.

title: Refugees in ISIS Shadow
description: Turkey is the largest host country of refugees, with about three million people who have fled conflicts in Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan and elsewhere. But what is striking here in old Anatolia, where the prime minister says Irish people have their ancestry, is that while the Turkish people in and around the refugee camp I visited seemed incredibly welcoming of their neighbors, there was also a sense that something was not quite right.

title: Debate Over Prison Population Turns to the States
description: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders are backpedaling from their support of a 1994 anti-crime law that some blame for the large number of people in prisons.

title: News Qs | As Campaigns Seek Delegates, Ordinary Voters Feel Sidelined
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article As Campaigns Seek Delegates, Ordinary Voters Feel Sidelined.

title: Chinese Scions Song: My Daddys Rich and My Lamborghinis Good-Looking
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Andy Guo, an 18-year-old Chinese immigrant, loves driving his red Lamborghini Huracn. He does not love having to share the car with his twin brother, Anky.

title: Thoughtful and Diligent Judge to Decide Penalty in Akai Gurleys Death
description: In the past few weeks, there has been a lot of talk around the Brooklyn courts about what Justice Danny K. Chun will do when he takes the bench on Thursday to sentence Peter Liang, the former police officer convicted two months ago in the fatal shooting of Akai Gurley in a housing project stairwell.

title: Roger Federer, $731,000; Serena Williams, $495,000: The Pay Gap in Tennis
description: DANIEL ISLAND, S.C.  With renewed scrutiny on the disparate compensation paid to male and female athletes after a wage discrimination lawsuit filed by the United States womens soccer team, tennis has been cited as a leader in gender equality among major sports.

title: With Justin Williams, Mr. Game 7, Capitals Look to End Playoff Failures
description: ARLINGTON, Va.  The words tumble from Justin Williamss mouth, and these could be any words  forechecking, composure, watermelon  and Karl Alzner, whose locker is beside Williamss at the Washington Capitals training facility, will inch closer. The next sentence Williams utters could be a skeleton key, a thought or phrase that slides open the tumblers.

title: Boko Haram Using More Children as Suicide Bombers, Unicef Says
description: DAKAR, Senegal  As it torments West Africa, Boko Haram is increasingly turning to children to carry out its crimes.

title: Why the Russian Economy Is Tumbling
description: Russia has been operating at a deficit since 2012, and its Reserve Fund is slated to run out by 2017.

title: Student Question | Are Models Too Skinny?
description: Does the model in the Gucci ad above look unhealthily thin? Do the fashion and advertising industries project an unhealthy body image for girls and women?

title: Ghetto, by Mitchell Duneier
description: GHETTOThe Invention of a Place, the History of an IdeaBy Mitchell DuneierIllustrated. 292 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $28.

title: Rare Loan of Clyfford Still Paintings to Join Royal Academy Show
description: In his lifetime, Clyfford Still demanded that his stark, monumental Abstract Expressionist canvases be exhibited in museum shows only in a separate gallery, and explicitly restricted institutions from lending paintings he donated. But his will, bequeathing the vast majority of his output to an American city that would retain the works of art in exclusive and permanent quarters, is somewhat ambiguous and doesnt expressly prohibit loans, said Dean Sobel, director of the Clyfford Still Museum in Denver, where the artists estate now resides. (Mr. Still died in 1980.)

title: The Regional Office Is Under Attack! by Manuel Gonzales
description: THE REGIONAL OFFICE IS UNDER ATTACK!By Manuel Gonzales400 pp. Riverhead Books. $28.

title: Ask Well: Why Is Arthritis More Common in Women Than Men?
description: Question:

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Dilma Rousseff, David Cameron, Zika Virus
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Tips for Tax Day
description: Updated, 11:26 a.m.

title: Charles Grassley Is Set to Meet Merrick Garland for Breakfast
description: Senator Charles E. Grassley of Iowa, a Republican and the chairman of the Judiciary Committee, will host Judge Merrick B. Garland, President Obamas Supreme Court nominee, for breakfast in the Senate dining room on Tuesday morning.

title: Morning Agenda: $5.1 Billion Fine for Goldman Sachs Less Than Meets the Eye
description: $5.1 BILLION FINE FOR GOLDMAN SACHS LESS THAN MEETS THE EYE | Goldman Sachs became the last of the big American banks to settle a government investigation into how Wall Street banks exacerbated the mortgage bubble and the financial crisis, with state and federal officials announcing that Goldman would pay $5.1 billion  but thats just on paper,  Nathaniel Popper writes in DealBook. A closer look at the conditions of the settlement shows that the bank will be able to significantly reduce its bill through government incentives and tax credits. The details in the various annexes suggest that Goldman could end up paying over $1 billion less than the $5 billion than was announced on Monday, he writes.

title: John Kasich to Lay Out Two Paths: His and Driving Into a Ditch
description: Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio has tried to stand out through his sunniness. Now he plans to warn about the danger of embracing a candidate who takes a different approach.

title: Eye on China, U.S. and Philippines Ramp Up Military Alliance
description: MANILA  After a rocky patch of 25 years, the United States and the Philippines will solidify a new, increasingly complex military relationship this week, driven partly by Chinas assertive actions in the South China Sea.

title: Latest Phase of Trump Campaign Faces a Test in a Public Forum
description: The Donald J. Trump news media reboot will face a crucial test on Tuesday night, as he and his family members are interviewed in a town-hall-style forum hosted by CNN before the New York primary.

title: How to Earn Miles and Points Without Leaving Home
description: Not a frequent traveler? Not a problem. You can still rack up miles and hotel points.

title: Donald Trump, American Preacher
description: Its coming, said the woman beside me, her face flushed beneath her flowing white hair. The long rectangle of the open hangar doors seemed to thrum, space waiting to be filled. And then, slowly, unstoppably, the plane nosed into view  a giant T, a giant R, a U and an M and a P, the plane swelling from its tip to its girth to its wings, filling completely the field of our vision.

title: How Empowerment Became Something for Women to Buy
description: At my day job as an editor at a womens website, I receive a daily mess of emails promoting random products and activities as empowering. Recent offerings include the Pure Barre workout, divorce, Miley Cyrus, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, ancient Egyptian sex rites, leggings, sending nude photos, receiving nude photos, declining to send or receive nude photos, doing stand-up comedy and purchasing full-bottomed lingerie. The mix of things presumed to transmit and increase female power is without limit yet still depressingly limiting.

title: Deadpool Isnt the Only Solution. But Batman v Superman Is the Problem.
description: Like a lot of people last weekend, I spent some time catching up with Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice.

title: British Regulator Bars Former R.B.S. Trader in Libor Case
description: LONDON  The Financial Conduct Authority of Britain said on Tuesday that it had barred a former Royal Bank of Scotland trader from the financial services industry for misconduct related to the manipulation of a global benchmark interest rate known as Libor.

title: Weekly News Quiz | April 5-11, 2016
description: Have you been following the news?

title: Documentary Stirs French as Officials Weigh a Labor Overhaul
description: PARIS  A satirical documentary film that pits a pair of unemployed garment workers against the billionaire head of the luxury giant LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton has emerged as a sleeper hit in France, where it has become a rallying cry against a government proposal to overhaul the labor code.

title: Taiwan Denies Role in Spy Case Involving U.S. Navy Officer
description: Taiwans military denied any involvement on Tuesday in the case of a United States naval officer under investigation on suspicion of providing secret information to Taiwan or China.

title: In Wyoming, Hard Times Return as Energy Prices Slump
description: WRIGHT, Wyo.  For 17 years, Scott Pearce worked as a mechanic here in the Powder River Basin, a Saudi Arabia of Western coal deposits. But about a week ago, he became a casualty of the declining local economy, one of nearly 500 people laid off from the Black Thunder and North Antelope Rochelle mines. It was among the latest and worst rounds of job losses to hit Wyoming.

title: Chinas Top Lawyer in Hong Kong Says Secession Advocates Could Face Prosecution
description: HONG KONG  The Chinese governments top lawyer in Hong Kong said on Tuesday that British colonial legislation could be used to prosecute those advocating that the territory secede from China, but he also said that mainland Chinese security agencies have no authority to detain suspects in Hong Kong.

title: Former Top Schwab Executive Joins Betterment Board
description: Less than one month after an investment round that doubled its private valuation to around $700 million, the robo-adviser Betterment is adding a former top executive from Charles Schwab, John S. Clendening, to its board.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Question: Short Shrift for the Mets?
description: With the baseball season underway, New York Citys longstanding and grudge-filled Subway Series rivalry rears its head again. A reader, Wayne Robins, who teaches journalism at St. Johns University in Queens, sees a definite Times bias toward pinstripes and against not only the Mets, but also all of Queens.

title: The Undeniable Convenience and Reliability of Retail Health Clinics
description: My wife and I both work. When one of our children wakes up complaining of a sore throat, we could begin a ritual stare-down to determine which of us is going to have to wait for the doctors office to open, make the phone call, wait on hold, schedule an appointment (which will inevitably be in the middle of the day), take off work, pick up the child from school, sit in the waiting room (surrounded by other sick children), get the rapid strep test, find out if the child is infected and then go to the pharmacy or back to school, before returning to work.

title: Foster Families Share Their Stories of Love and Loss
description: Foster care changes a person, wrote Stephanie Bennington, a former foster child from Fremont, Neb., after we asked readers to send us their foster care stories. The stories came in response to Losing a Foster Child, the most recent essay by Meghan Moravcik Walbert, who chronicled the time her family spent with the foster child she nicknamed BlueJay.

title: 13 Arrested in India in Connection With Fireworks Blasts at Kerala Temple
description: NEW DELHI  Thirteen people have been arrested in connection with the explosions that killed more than 100 during a fireworks display at a temple in southern India over the weekend, The Press Trust of India said on Tuesday.

title: MadTV to Return With 8-Episode Run
description: MadTV," the Saturday sketch comedy series that left the airwaves in 2009, is coming back for an eight-episode network run, its producer said on Monday.

title: An Uber Driver From Far Away
description: Dear Diary:

title: James Taylor Retires From Cricket at 26 With Heart Condition
description: The cricket star James Taylor retired on Tuesday at age 26 after he was found to have a serious heart condition.

title: European Union Calls for Big Companies to Disclose More Tax Data
description: BRUSSELS  European Union officials on Tuesday waded into the fight against international tax dodging, calling for the worlds biggest companies to disclose more data about their tax arrangements with the blocs member governments and to share information about offshore havens where they shelter money.

title: The Reason for Public Schools Show Rethink: Not What You Expect
description: On Monday, the fashion label Public School joined the club and announced it was uniting its mens and womens wear shows, just like Gucci, Tom Ford and Burberry, and moving them to December and June from the traditional womens dates of February and September, just like, well, nobody else.

title: Belgium Charges 2 More Men in Inquiry Into Terrorist Attacks
description: BRUSSELS  Two more people were detained and charged on Monday as part of the investigation into the deadly attacks in the Belgian capital last month, bringing to more than 20 the number of people charged in Belgium in connection with the assaults in Brussels, Paris or both, the federal prosecutor said on Tuesday.

title: Australian Mother and 8 Others Face Charges in Lebanon Custody Dispute
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A bitter custody dispute between an Australian mother and a Lebanese father. A crew of sympathetic Australian television journalists. A grandmother who was clubbed on the head as the children were put into an S.U.V. that sped off.

title: Deutsche Bank Freezes North Carolina Expansion, in Protest of Bias Law
description: Deutsche Bank, the German financial giant that has a significant business in the United States, said on Tuesday that it would freeze its plans to add jobs in North Carolina, a response to the passage last month of a state law that, among other things, eliminates antidiscrimination protections based on sexual orientation.

title: Nomura to Shrink Its European and Americas Businesses
description: LONDON  Nomura said on Tuesday that it planned to close several parts of its business in Europe and to shrink its operations in the Americas, as the financial firm looks to reduce costs and improve the profitability of its operations outside its home market, Japan.

title: 1891: King Humbert Incensed
description: NEW YORK  It is stated at Washington that it is untrue that the Marquis di Rudini demands a reply to the Italian protest within a specified time; but in spite of this denial persistent reports confirming the story come from Rome, and they gain credence in some quarters. King Humbert, it is alleged, is incensed at the caricatures in the American comic papers which have been sent to him by an Italian editor here. His Majesty is said to take exception to one notable caricature in which he appears as a monkey. The New York Herald, European Edition, April 13, 1891

title: Fannie in a Sustainable Profitability
description: In a deposition taken last July Susan McFarland, Fannies former chief financial officer, said she told high-level officials at the Treasury on Aug. 9, 2012, that the company was, in fact, now in a sustainable profitability, that we would be able to deliver sustainable profits over time.

title: Documents Undercut U.S. Case for Taking Mortgage Giant Fannie Maes Profits
description: On a Friday in August 2012, the federal government changed the terms of its bailout of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, sending all the mortgage finance giants profits to the Treasury. The surprise decision prompted a lawsuit from shareholders, who argued that the collection of profits was an improper taking of private property without compensation.

title: Taiwan Accuses Kenya of Illegal Deportations as More Are Sent to China
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Usually prisoners want to get out of jail. But on Tuesday, a group of Taiwanese citizens did all they could to stay in  barricading themselves in a small cell as Kenyan police officers tried to storm in with assault rifles.

title: Facebooks Developer Conference Kicks Off
description: The event to watch in Silicon Valley this week is Facebooks annual developer conference, which starts on Tuesday.

title: Freeing Lonely iPad Apps From Almost Empty Folders
description: Q. After removing old apps I never use from my iPad, I find I have a few folders that contain only one app. How do I get rid of the folder enclosures and put the app back out with the others on the home screen, or move it to a different folder with other apps?

title: Seeking Bold Tax Overhaul, Texas Lawmaker to Test Congress
description: HOUSTON  Over two decades in Congress, Representative Kevin Brady has always been popular with colleagues. Now that the genial Texas Republican has become chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, Mr. Brady has got real power, too.

title: The Composer Kate Soper and the Makers of Life Is a Dream Win Awards
description: The composer Kate Soper won the Virgil Thomson Award in Vocal Music, while the composer Lewis Spratlan and librettist James Maraniss won the Charles Ives Opera Prize for their work Life Is a Dream, the American Academy of Arts and Letters, which awards the prizes, announced on Tuesday.

title: Alan Dershowitz and 2 Other Lawyers Settle Suit and Counter Claim
description: The noted defense lawyer Alan M. Dershowitz and two lawyers who had sued him claiming defamation have dropped court actions against each side, ending  a prominent dispute that included accusations of sexual misconduct against Mr. Dershowitz.

title: Haider al-Abadis Dangerous Gamble
description: WASHINGTON  Iraq is facing major financial pressure, and the war against the Islamic State grinds on. The last thing the country needs is a major political crisis. But thats exactly what appears to be in the works  unless the United States and Iran work together to help the prime minister avoid it.

title: International Monetary Fund Forecasts Slow Growth in Developing Nations
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund warned on Tuesday about persistently slow growth in developing economies, highlighting a growing concern that these countries will not soon regain the high rates of growth that distinguished them in the past.

title: 1941: British Destroy Nazi Column
description: CAIRO  The British Royal Air Force, aided by Australian and Free French pilots, was reported in a British communiqu today [April 12] to have destroyed an estimated 100 Nazi tanks and motorized units on the road from Ain el Gazala to Tobruk, Libya, toward which the Germans are advancing.

title: Which Subjects Are Underrepresented in Contemporary Fiction?
description: In Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Ayana Mathis and Siddhartha Deb discuss joy, class and other subjects missing from too much fiction these days.

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 17: Bachelorette Party
description: If Jane the Virgin has one consistent flaw, its that the shows writers seem to get so excited about introducing various plotlines that they have trouble spacing them out. Instead, episodes are packed to the brim  meaning that sometimes these plots dont get as much time as they should. Fortunately, Jane the Virgin depicts such good stories that any one of its half-baked plots are better than many multi-episode arcs on other shows.

title: Senator Grassley and Judge Garland Meet, and Rehash the Obvious
description: WASHINGTON  It was a balance-of-power breakfast.

title: Is Staying In the New Going Out?
description: I first noticed it at work. On Monday mornings a deathless ritual unfolds in offices across the land: the posing of the question, How was your weekend? A few years ago, my coworkers and I exchanged happy highlight reels of ambitious urban activities before cracking open our laptops and pouring ourselves a tall, refreshing glass of work. One of us went to an off-Broadway play. One of us went to a Beyonc concert. One of us went on a date. We had fun!

title: How to Save Nigerias Economy and Stop Corruption
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  The collapsed price of oil is putting pressure on oil exporters around the world, from Canada to Kuwait. But perhaps no country is less prepared to survive prices at about $30 a barrel than Nigeria, which until a few years ago relied heavily on petroleum exports for its revenue. While countries like Saudi Arabia and Russia have saved past oil profits for rainy days, Nigeria has no such insulation. Whats worse is that Nigeria is especially dependent on imports of basic goods.

title: Milk Jumps Onto the Small-Batch Bandwagon
description: CHICAGO  Standing in the dim basement of a meatpacking plant in the West Loop neighborhood, a 35-year-old start-up founder named Travis Pyykkonen conjured up a wholesome vision that was almost bucolic.

title: E.U. Delays Decision on Requiring Visas of Americans and Canadians
description: BRUSSELS  European Union authorities discussed a provocative proposal Tuesday to require that United States and Canadian citizens obtain visas to travel to Europe, but they delayed a decision on the matter until summer.

title: Beverly Cleary Turns 100
description: Happy 100th birthday to Beverly Cleary from The New York Times Book Review! Heres a look at some highlights from our coverage of Cleary and her work over the decades.

title: John Kasich Channels Ronald Reagan in New York Speech
description: John Kasich, the Republican primarys most moderate candidate, worked to expand on promising poll numbers in New York with a speech this morning sharply criticizing Donald Trump and Ted Cruz, without mentioning them by name.

title: Warhol Soup Can Prints Are Stolen From a Missouri Museum
description: The F.B.I. is offering a $25,000 reward for the recovery of seven screen prints of Andy Warhols Campbells Soup cans after they were snatched from an art museum in Springfield, Mo.

title: Chappatte on the Panama Papers Furor
description: The worldwide fallout from the leak of financial documents continues.

title: Swiss Widen Inquiry Into Malaysian Fund to Include 2 Emirati Officials
description: GENEVA  The Swiss authorities said on Tuesday that they had started a criminal investigation into two officials in charge of a sovereign wealth fund in Abu Dhabi, in the United Arab Emirates, as part of an inquiry into the financial transactions of the troubled Malaysian state investment fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad.

title: I Am Not the Decorator: Female Architects Speak Out
description: For a woman to go out alone in architecture is still very, very hard, the architect Zaha Hadid said. Its still a mans world. Ms. Hadid often stated that she did not want to serve as a symbol of progress for women in her profession. But, inevitably, she did. A study on diversity in the profession released this year by the American Institute of Architects  found that women strongly believe that there is not gender equity in the industry; that women and minorities say they are less likely to be promoted to more senior positions; and that gender and race are obstacles to equal pay for comparable positions. Since Ms. Hadid won the Pritzker Prize in 2004, the percentage of female architects in the United States has barely grown, increasing to 25.7 percent from 24 percent, according the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Daniel Radcliffe to Star in Privacy at the Public Theater
description: As a onetime child actor who has lived much of his life in the public eye, Daniel Radcliffe knows a thing or two about privacy.

title: Reaching for the Stars, Across 4.37 Light-Years
description: Can you fly an iPhone to the stars?

title: I Sodi
description: Rigorous devotion to tradition at the chef Rita Sodis Tuscan restaurant.

title: The Laws of Tuscan Eating at I Sodi in the West Village
description: Medium-rare is how I ordered my tagliata, a grilled sirloin that is, like almost everything else at I Sodi, prepared the way it would be in Tuscany. Right away I changed my mind and asked for it rare. I wanted the sliding smoothness of nearly raw beef.

title: Brian Wilson Memoir Coming in October
description: Brian Wilson of the Beach Boys is finally ready to tell his own complicated story.

title: Shoes That Are Made for Walking
description: A good pair of walking shoes is a must on vacations where sightseeing by foot is on the agenda, and travelers today have their pick of footwear thats both comfortable and stylish.

title: John Kasich Urges Republicans to Reject Rivals Negativity
description: Presenting himself as an uplifting alternative in a Republican race filled with fear mongering and negativity, Gov. John Kasich of Ohio urged voters on Tuesday to reject what he called the path to darkness in this years election.

title: Paul Ryan Rules Out Run for President
description: WASHINGTON  After a month of speculation and pleas ranging from comic to mildly desperate, Speaker Paul D. Ryan held an unusually formal news conference Tuesday afternoon to rule out what he has always said he would not do: serve as the Republican nominee for president in 2016.

title: U.S. and India Agree to Strengthen Military Ties
description: NEW DELHI  The United States and India on Tuesday agreed in principle to a series of initiatives between their militaries that the Obama administration hopes will strengthen American ties in the region as it seeks to counter Chinas growing influence.

title: Blanc Vermouth, a Third Party for Cocktail Lovers
description: For a very long time in America, choosing a vermouth was simple. Like political parties, there were really just two: the sweet red ones, which originated in Italy, and the dry white ones associated with France. You used the sweet in manhattans, the dry in martinis. Done.

title: The Next Generation of Artists Studios
description: Once, an artist holed up in her paint-spattered loft and created in solitude. These days, the idea of where an artist makes her work has changed  and so, too, the very nature of art itself.

title: Jazz at Lincoln Center Gala to Have a Broadway Theme
description: More than a few jazz standards got their starts on the stages of the Great White Way, so it may be fitting that Jazz at Lincoln Centers annual gala in May, which was announced Tuesday, will be called Jazz and Broadway.

title: Why Stop at One Pop of Color?
description: Some of the spring 2016 fashion shows suggested a colorful counterpoint to no-makeup makeup. Chanel models wore dusted-on masks of icy blue. Makeup at Roksanda and Alexis Mabille relied on a sea-foam palette. And at Giambattista Valli, the makeup artist Val Garland popped neon pink, green and blue onto the brow bone.

title: Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump Win in Missouri, Officially
description: Hillary Clinton pulled out a tight victory over Senator Bernie Sanders in the Democratic primary in Missouri, officially sweeping the states that held primary contests on March 15, while Donald J. Trump was declared the winner in a close race with Senator Ted Cruz on the Republican side.

title: A Sky Tells a Story for The Few
description: There is no scene in the play The Few that takes place in front of a giant truck in the middle of a field under a strikingly cloudy blue sky. But thats the visual direction CoHo Productions, a theater company in Portland, Ore., took for artwork promoting its production of Samuel D. Hunters drama, which is set inside a trailer that doubles as the office of a newspaper in rural Idaho.

title: As Lead Levels Dip, Flint Residents Are Urged: Run Your Water
description: The water supply in Flint, Mich., is showing signs of improvement, but is still not safe enough for its nearly 100,000 residents to stop using bottled water and lead filters for drinking, researchers said.

title: Conflicting Conclusions Drawn After Officers Enter a Brooklyn Apartment
description: After three police officers without a warrant entered a Brooklyn apartment in March 2013 and questioned those inside, two separate investigations of the matter arrived at starkly different conclusions.

title: Cleaner Air Tied to Fewer Lung Problems in Children
description: Air quality regulations in Southern California have led to large reductions in air pollution over the past two decades. A new study reports that the cleaner air has been accompanied by a significant decrease in childhood lung problems.

title: Goldman Should Expect Its Stock to Stay in a Rut
description: Goldman Sachs executives once boasted of being long-term greedy: They would rather wait for riches than make a quick buck. They may no longer have a choice.

title: New Plays From Baker and Eno to Be in Signature Theater Season
description: The Signature Theaters final season under its founding artistic director will include new plays by Annie Baker, Will Eno and Branden Jacobs-Jenkins and feature the work of Suzan-Lori Parks in its yearlong playwright-in-residency program.

title: Benefits of Study Abroad: My Students Return Transformed
description: To the Editor:

title: The Short, Turbulent Life of Al Jazeera America
description: Thirty-two months ago, Al Jazeera America made its debut with ambitious plans (and a big budget) to become a leading voice in cable news. And though the network has garnered a number of prestigious awards, it never attracted a meaningful audience, often failing to draw 30,000 viewers in prime time.

title: Long Island Is Both Hostile Territory and Fertile Ground for Donald Trump
description: BETHPAGE, N.Y.  On Long Island, many remember Donald J. Trump from before he was a reality television star, a presidential candidate or a serial provocateur. He was the builder of shining towers just west over the horizon in the city. The shrewd buyer of New Jersey casinos. The can-do tycoon who fixed up Central Parks ice skating rink when the chuckleheads downtown could not.

title: Loathe Gefilte Fish? Not After Youve Tried This
description: Next Thursday, the day before the annual ritual of our Seder, I celebrate what has become another annual ritual: our gefilte fish-in.

title: Baltimore After Freddie Gray: The Mind-Set Has Changed
description: A year ago on Tuesday, Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old black man, was arrested in West Baltimore. His death a week later, from a spinal cord injury he sustained while in police custody, set off looting and violence, and political uncertainty. Now Baltimore is about to pick a new leader  the primary election in a crowded mayoral race will be held April 26  and on May 10, the long-stalled trials of six police officers charged in Mr. Grays death are scheduled to resume.

title: David Gest, Music Producer and Reality TV Star, Dies at 62
description: David Gest, a concert promoter and television producer who gained fleeting fame for his brief marriage to Liza Minnelli and went on to become a reality television star in Britain, died on Tuesday in London. He was 62.

title: When Campaigning for the U.N. Job Was Gauche
description: To the Editor:

title: Facebook Bets on Bots for Its Messenger App
description: SAN FRANCISCO  To browse for a pair of brown loafers on Facebook Messenger, you can now text a message to the service to begin a conversation with the mobile shopping start-up Spring. Spring will ask you for a preferred price range for the shoes and show a smattering of what it thinks you might like. If the selection elicits yawns, Spring will try some different options.

title: Yale Advances in Shaping Portfolio to Address Climate Change
description: Yale University has made progress in minimizing its endowment portfolios exposure to less environmentally sound investments such as stocks of companies that contribute to climate change, a letter released on Tuesday showed.

title: At LAppart in Battery Park City, Youll Feel at Home
description: LAppart This well-upholstered 28-seat enclave within Le District, the sprawl of markets and restaurants in Battery Park City, is designed to suggest an informal dinner party  hence the name, a shortening of the French for apartment. When guests enter, the headwaiter, George Thomas, whom you may recognize from his many years at Bouley, offers an aperitif or a glass of Champagne. Its like what happens when you go to someones home, he said. The room is fitted with an open kitchen where the chef, Nicolas Abello  who worked with Grard Vi in France, Pierre Gagnaire in London and Daniel Boulud in New York  prepares a six-course French-accented tasting menu. (He has access to the more than 2,500 ingredients that Le District carries.) Jordi Valls, Le Districts culinary director, oversees the restaurant. There are options for expanding the number of courses and matching them with wines. (Opens April 20): Brookfield Place, 225 Liberty Street (West Street), 212-981-8577, lappartnyc.com.

title: Rembrandt Portrait Denied Export License Will Be Shown in Britain
description: AMSTERDAM  A Rembrandt portrait that the British government had temporarily prohibited from leaving the country after it was bought by a foreign collector will remain on display in Britain for three years.

title: Rise of Institutional Investors Raises Questions of Collusion
description: BlackRock, Vanguard and other big institutional investors own roughly 70 percent of the public stock market, according to some reports. People are starting to ask whether this allows companies  now having the same owners  to compete less and raise prices.

title: N.C.A.A. Extends Basketball Deal With CBS Sports and Turner Through 2032
description: The N.C.A.A. announced a new agreement on Tuesday with CBS Sports and Turner that extended the broadcast rights deal for the Division I mens basketball tournament another eight years, through 2032, at a rate that will eventually increase to more than $1 billion per year.

title: Wielding Paintbrushes, Not Spray Cans, at Bronx Housing Project
description: Many residents of the Castle Hill Houses, a sprawling housing development in the Bronx, live with windows that are old and drafty, interior doors that no longer close and kitchen appliances that have seen better days.

title: Mission to Alpha Centauri
description: The cosmologist Stephen Hawking and the entrepreneur Yuri Milner released a simulation that shows how a project called Breakthrough Starshot aims to send small robots to the nearest star system, Alpha Centauri.

title: Ts Salone del Mobile Party at Palazzo Crespi
description: We celebrated the biggest week in design  and the 100th birthday of Renzo Mongiardino  Monday night in Milan.

title: T Celebrates Salone del Mobile in Milan
description: What better way to spend a beautiful evening in Milan than on the terrace of a grand palazzo, taking in the scent of wisteria in full bloom? T was lucky last night to do just that, at a party hosted by editor-in-chief Deborah Needleman along with Roberto Peregalli and Laura Sartori Rimini of the design firm Studio Peregalli in celebration of this years Salone Internazionale del Mobile  the design worlds biggest week. Guests including Camilla Guinness, Tom Dixon, Teresa and Margherita Missoni, Francesco Bonami and Maurizio Cattelan milled about the Palazzo Crespi and its backyard, enjoying drinks, conversation, spring weather and a ballroom piano performance by Michele Sganga.

title: Puerto Ricos Prosperous D.C. Power Couple
description: WASHINGTON  As Puerto Rico has spiraled toward possible bankruptcy, the islands sole representative in Congress has seen his family wealth swell, thanks in part to Wall Street companies that have sought to capitalize on the islands financial crisis and have hired his wife to advise them.

title: Lawyers Again Question Prosecutions Conduct in 2003 Murder Case
description: Lawyers for John Giuca, a Brooklyn man convicted more than a decade ago of murdering a 19-year-old college student, continued their assault against the verdict on Tuesday, filing papers that  again  claim prosecutors withheld important evidence and misled jurors at his trial.

title: Maduro on Rejected Amnesty Law
description: President Nicols Maduro of Venezuela made a statement after the countrys Supreme Court declared unconstitutional legislation to free politicians who are foes of his socialist government.

title: Climate Change Hits Hard in Zambia, an African Success Story
description: LAKE KARIBA, Zambia  Even as drought and the effects of climate change grew visible across this land, the Kariba Dam was always a steady, and seemingly limitless, source of something rare in Africa: electricity so cheap and plentiful that Zambia could export some to its neighbors.

title: Wildfires, Once Confined to a Season, Burn Earlier and Longer
description: The first Alaska wildfire of 2016 broke out in late February, followed by a second there just eight days later.

title: Did Led Zeppelin Steal Stairway to Heaven? A Jury Will Decide
description: The Led Zeppelin song Stairway to Heaven is one of the most ubiquitous (some might say overplayed) songs on classic rock radio. Next month, a jury will decide whether the songs opening was stolen from another band.

title: How Mens Bathing Suits Changed Over 100 Years
description: Reigning Men: Fashion in Menswear: 1715-2015, an expansive new show of mens fashion through the years, opens at LACMA this week. The exhibition (which took the museum almost five years to produce) features everything from sans-culotte trousers of the French Revolution to mid-50s Varsity jackets and the Jean Paul Gaultier mens corsetry of the early 1990s. One section focuses on the development of mens swimwear  from the cumbersome, two-piece bathing suits of the mid-19th century to Tom Fords skimpy thong for Gucci in 1997. As Kaye Spilker, curator of LACMAs Costume and Textiles department, put it, mens suits go from totally dressed to almost totally nude  and then back to almost totally dressed again. Roll over the images above and below to trace the evolution of mens swimsuits over more than 100 years.

title: Lifting the Patent Barrier to New Drugs and Energy Sources
description: Malaria has preyed on humans for centuries. Hundreds of thousands of children die each year from the disease. Considering the markets size, why havent pharmaceutical companies rushed to develop a vaccine against the deadly parasite that causes it?

title: Settlement Talks Impeded in Redstone Mental Health Suit
description: Settlement negotiations have hit a snag in the lawsuit challenging the mental competence of the ailing media mogul Sumner M. Redstone, reviving the possibility that the case could proceed to a messy public trial.

title: New York 101: Pulling Back the Curtain on What Powers the City
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, the Metro reporter Emily S. Rueb explains how the multimedia, multi-platform New York 101 series  about everything from how water gets to the citys taps to how a single book moves through its public library system  was conceived and brought to life.

title: North Carolina Governors Order Restoring Some Anti-Bias Protections
description: Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina signed an executive order altering the equal employment policy for state workers to cover discrimination claims related to sexual orientation and gender identity.

title: Judge Rules Camille Cosby Must Testify Again in Civil Case
description: Camille O. Cosby will have to testify again in a civil case filed against her husband, Bill Cosby, by seven women who say he defamed them, a federal judge in Massachusetts ruled Tuesday.

title: North Carolina Governor Tries to Step Back From Bias Law
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Gov. Pat McCrory of North Carolina, whose state has been the subject of withering criticism since he signed legislation limiting bathroom access for transgender people and eliminating anti-discrimination ordinances based on sexual orientation, announced Tuesday that he would strengthen workplace protections for state employees and urge the General Assembly to modify part of the law.

title: Controlled Burn on the Rio Grande
description: One of the only ways to remove giant cane on the Rio Grande in Big Bend National Park in Texas is by intentionally burning it. A group of American and Mexican firefighters burned 110 acres of it in a remote stretch of the border, as part of a river conservation project.

title: Shabab and East African Front Militants Compete for Notoriety
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Apparently there is no brotherly love among East Africas Islamist militants.

title: 2016 N.H.L. Playoffs: East to West, the Chase for the Cup Begins
description: Few teams in the N.H.L. have had a more dominant regular season than the 2015-16 Washington Capitals. They were a juggernaut, posting 120 points and losing only 18 games in regulation. Braden Holtby tied Martin Brodeurs N.H.L. single-season record for wins (48), and Washingtons lead atop the Metropolitan Division did not dip below 10 points after Dec. 26.

title: Pope Francis New Teaching on the Family
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: In The Last Panthers, Old-School Crime Is Breaking Out Across Europe
description: Given that The Last Panthers involves the pursuit of criminals through back alleys and anonymous-looking apartment complexes all over Europe, the most striking thing about it initially is the word that it rarely, if ever, uses: terrorism. Recent headlines might make it seem, at least from the American perspective, as if terror were the only crime Europe deals with. But this intricate six-part mini-series, which starts Wednesday on SundanceTV, is grounded in old-school illegalities.

title: Panel Calls for Major Changes at Texas Jail That Held Sandra Bland
description: HEMPSTEAD, Tex.  A panel reviewing the Texas jail where a 28-year-old black woman, Sandra Bland, was found dead three days after being arrested in July has called for major changes in the treatment and medical screening of inmates.

title: The Donald Trump Rally
description: The faces of the movement.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Graffiti Artist Defaces Fashion Ads, Fashion Embraces Him
description: On any given day in Manhattan, commuters will run into Michael De Feo.

title: North Korea Threatens South Korea Over 13 Defectors
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea on Tuesday accused South Korea of kidnapping 13 of its citizens who had been working in a restaurant in China, and it demanded their repatriation.

title: The Peace Pentagon, an Activist Office in NoHo, Is Forced to Move
description: For decades, members of left-leaning groups have used a pale brick building in Lower Manhattan as a base to work on campaigns and plan protest rallies. But a recent meeting concerned a different sort of logistics.

title: How to Make Sense of the Tribeca Film Festival
description: Like many other 15-year-olds in New York, the Tribeca Film Festival is an unruly, hyperactive creature with an overstuffed schedule. Five main categories including Spotlight (nearly 40 films), Viewpoints (25) and the documentary competition (12), a genre-film mini-fest, filmmaker talks, interactive storytelling experiences, a virtual reality bazaar, a new television section, a street fair  how can you possibly choose what to see?

title: Romanian Ballet Company Loses Its Leading Lights
description: Administrative tumult, a prominent snub on the Bucharest National Operas website and questions over artistic direction have cost the Romanian national ballet company its two biggest stars: Johan Kobborg and Alina Cojocaru. Mr. Kobborg resigned Tuesday as its artistic director and his fiance, the dancer Ms. Cojocaru, said she would not dance under the current management.

title: Bill Clinton Is Wrong About His Crime Bill. So Are the Protesters He Lectured.
description: Last Thursday, at a rally for his wife in Philadelphia, Bill Clinton found himself confronted by Black Lives Matter protesters. Their signs and shouts focused on one of the former presidents own legacies: the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act, which he pushed through Congress in 1994, and which protesters argued helped drive mass incarceration. Clinton, at his lectern, responded to that notion vigorously, over 15 angry minutes of shouts, interruptions and retorts. Because of that bill, he argued, we had a 25-year low in crime, a 33-year low in the murder rate, and because of that and the background-check law, we had a 46-year low in deaths of people by gun violence. As more shouts rose from the audience, he went so far as to tell the protesters, You are defending the people who killed the lives you say matter.

title: Review: Maestra, a Novel of Sex, Murder and Shopping
description: Advances in publishing industry marketing have allowed G. P. Putnams Sons to bring forth Maestra, a pornographic shopathon travelogue thriller that has billionaires, art world scheming and a sociopathic heroine who can unfasten belt buckles with her tongue. It should go without saying that this book is part of a trilogy, is headed for the movies and has created a stir in countries where it has already appeared. As one reader reasonably put it on Amazon.uks website: This books pomposity is unbelievable and the sex is ludicrous. Will sell millions. Right now its sales on that site are sinking, and its selling only decently. But point taken.

title: Asking Whether Coplands Abstruse Works are the Exception or the Rule
description: When Gustavo Dudamel and the Los Angeles Philharmonic visited The Late Show With Stephen Colbert last month, it was only natural that they performed Aaron Coplands Fanfare for the Common Man (1942). Is there any work more emblematic of the dean of American music than the stirring Fanfare, which Mr. Colbert called one of the most powerful American melodies?

title: Review: David Gilmour Lays Claim to Pink Floyd Memories
description: David Gilmour released an album last year, Rattle That Lock, that reached No. 5 on Billboards album chart. But thats not why he could book three big New York City shows: two at Madison Square Garden, where I saw him perform on Monday night, and one at Radio City Music Hall. Mr. Gilmour is the proud custodian of the sound of Pink Floyd, in which he was the guitarist, main lead singer and  after Roger Waters, the main songwriter and bassist before him, left the band in 1985  the full-fledged bandleader.

title: How Horace and Pete Made the Network Suits Look Good
description: Have we been too hard on the soulless network suit?

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Paul Ryan, North Carolina, Equal Pay Day
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Class Divide Shows the Extremes Hypergentrification Creates in a Neighborhood
description: Gentrification is not usually the stuff of vivid, gripping documentaries. The impacts typically arrive too slowly, the changes too incremental to register on the lives they eventually affect.

title: Pepsi-Cola Sign in Queens Gains Landmark Status
description: The Pepsi-Cola sign in Long Island City  a dazzling swirl of red curlicue letters that evokes innocent days of summer, heavy industry in Queens and a spectacular disregard for the waterfront in the mid-20th century  is now an official New York City landmark.

title: In North Carolina and Mississippi, Backlash Grows Over Rights Law
description: When Bruce Springsteen canceled a concert in Greensboro, N.C., last weekend to protest a state law that many said curbed gay and transgender rights, it was only the latest fallout from the measure. Like similar legislation in Mississippi, it has drawn criticism across the country.

title: D.E.A. Employees Facing Trial Seek to Bar Lap-Dance Video
description: It is not often that the government seeks to show a jury a video of lap dances.

title: Oscar Murillo Says Flushing His Passport in Midflight Didnt Start as a Protest
description: Was it art, protest  or both?

title: Steve Earle: The Other Side of Merle Haggard
description: In late 1969 and early 1970, when Okie From Muskogee was blaring from every jukebox in every beer joint, truck stop and restaurant in my hometown, San Antonio, I wanted, sometimes very much, to hate Merle Haggard.

title: Hillary Clinton Puts Racially Charged Skit on Bill de Blasios Shoulders
description: Hillary Clintons response to a racially charged comedy sketch with Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York on Saturday night was simple: Its all his fault.

title: We Shall Overcome Copyright May Be Overcome One Day
description: Last year, a federal judge ruled that the long-claimed copyright to the song Happy Birthday to You was invalid. Now the same could happen for another iconic tune: We Shall Overcome.

title: Hollywood Discovers That It May Be Missing Out on Date Night
description: LOS ANGELES  Behind the big numbers in the Motion Picture Association of Americas annual report on moviegoing  global ticket sales grew 5 percent in 2015, to $38.3 billion  lie some surprising snapshots about who is, and is not, going to the movies.

title: A Loving Look at Hispanic New Mexican Life
description: Soon after arriving in New Mexico in 1981, Kevin Bubriski was entranced by the generations-old culture and traditions of Hispano Nuevomexicanos, whose roots stretch back to the 1500s.

title: Protests Erupt in Macedonia as President Halts Wiretapping Inquiry
description: SKOPJE, Macedonia  The president of Macedonia abruptly ended a far-reaching criminal investigation into corruption and abuse of power throughout the government on Tuesday, plunging the tiny Balkan country into a political crisis.

title: A Clash of Old and New in a Manhattan Real Estate Prairie
description: Stacked on the chipped tile floor of the vestibule at 85 Bowery were 59 boxes, each addressed to John Doe or Jane Doe.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $13.75 million

title: Aid Groups Aim to Put Mental Health on World Agenda
description: Good mental health care is scarce in many parts of the United States, but it is nonexistent in most of the world. In developing countries, the ratio of mental health professionals to citizens is about one in a million  and that vast majority of people with treatable conditions like anxiety and depression are left to their own devices, or to the ministrations of local folk healers.

title: Fords Planned New Headquarters Borrow Some Silicon Valley Sheen
description: Over the past year, Ford Motor has raced to develop self-driving cars, put down roots in Silicon Valley and backed ride-sharing start-ups  all in an effort to be seen as not just a car manufacturer but a mobility company. Its goal is to emulate the likes of Google and Tesla Motors as it aims to shape the future of getting from place to place.

title: Nebraska Legislature Rejects Winner-Take-All Electoral Vote System
description: LINCOLN, Neb.  For at least one more presidential election, this overwhelmingly Republican state will keep a system that allows it to split its Electoral College votes between candidates and parties, after a conservative-backed effort to adopt a winner-take-all system stalled in the Legislature on Tuesday.

title: J. Thomas Rosch, Lawyer, Dies at 76; Fought for and Against Antitrust Actions
description: J. Thomas Rosch, a lawyer who spent years defending corporations from government antitrust actions before taking the other side as a member of the Federal Trade Commission, died on March 30 in Lake Forest, Ill. He was 76.

title: Lower Growth Expectations Cloud World Finance Leaders Forum
description: WASHINGTON  The worlds finance ministers opened their annual spring meeting here on Tuesday facing dampened expectations for global growth and warnings about financial risks and political movements toward nationalism and protectionism  in the United States and abroad.

title: With Blistering Kick, Manchester City Rights a Choppy Season
description: MANCHESTER, England  The coach already knows he will not return. One top player seems to have a foot out the door. Much of the rest of the team are, understandably, unsure who will have a job and who will not come summer. And, with the Premier League title long since out of reach, there has been a palpable turn of the head toward the future for many of those in and around Manchester City during the past few months.

title: A Few Words About Vin Scully, a Storyteller Who Has Seen It All
description: LOS ANGELES  The first baseball game played at 1000 Vin Scully Avenue began on Tuesday with a relay. One by one, hallowed members of the Los Angeles Dodgers passed an autographed ball from the pitchers mound to the plate. Magic Johnson, a co-owner, presented it to Scully, who has spent 67 seasons passing down baseball.

title: Syrias Partial Cease-Fire Shows Signs of Crumbling
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A fragile and partial cease-fire in Syria is coming under new strains, with ground clashes and airstrikes intensifying as the government promises a new offensive and prepares to hold controversial parliamentary elections on Wednesday.

title: National Briefing
description: The Los Angeles Police Commission says the shooting of an unarmed homeless man last year in the Venice area was unjustified. The commission ruled Tuesday that Officer Clifford Proctor violated department policy when he shot 29-year-old Brendon Glenn in the back near the Venice boardwalk in May. Officer Proctor told investigators that Mr. Glenn had grabbed his partners holster as they struggled on the ground, but a report from Police Chief Charlie Beck said surveillance video from a nearby bar contradicted the account. Chief Beck has recommended that the officer face criminal charges  the first time he has made such a recommendation over a deadly officer-involved shooting. Mr. Glenns family is suing over the death. A lawyer for the Glenn family could not be reached for comment. (AP)

title: Bill to Ease Puerto Rico Debt Crisis Introduced in House
description: Legislation to help Puerto Rico restructure its $72 billion in debt was introduced in the House of Representatives on Tuesday, as members sought to address the islands financial crisis quickly without setting a precedent that troubled states might try to follow.

title: National Weather Service: Forecasts Will Stop Yelling at You
description: WASHINGTON  For as long as the federal government has been in the business of forecasting weather, it has done so in capital letters.

title: British Minister Admits Dating Woman in Sex Industry
description: The British minister of culture said on Tuesday that he previously dated a woman who was working in the sex industry and that tabloid newspapers had known her true occupation before he did  raising questions about whether his role as a government minister with oversight of the nations news media had been compromised.

title: Why Mrs. Clinton Needs to Say More About the Crime Bill
description: In 1992, Bill Clinton ran on the promise of two for the price of one: If he was elected, Americans would also get Hillary Clinton, lawyer and activist Democrat, working for them in the White House.

title: Venezuelas Court Deals Another Blow to Opposition Lawmakers
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  When Venezuelas opposition took control of the National Assembly this year, lawmakers vowed to use their powers to steer the country far from the legacy of former President Hugo Chvez.

title: From Hiroshima to a Nuke-Free World
description: What Secretary of State John Kerry called his gut wrenching visit to the Hiroshima war memorial on Monday served several purposes. As the highest-ranking official in an American administration ever to visit the site, he paid respects to the victims of one of the most devastating acts of World War II and reflected on how Japan and the United States have forged a strong alliance over the past 70 years. He also emphasized that war must never be the first resort and urged a continued push for a world free from nuclear weapons.

title: How Stephen Hawking Thought About Humanitys Limits
description: The renowned physicist spoke of transcending humanitys limitations through advanced technology, using robot spacecraft to reach the nearest star system.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If no candidate has the majority on the first ballot, I believe you should only turn to a person who has participated in the primary. Count me out.
