title: Donald Trump, Losing Ground, Tries to Blame the System
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump and his allies are engaged in an aggressive effort to undermine the Republican nominating process by framing it as rigged and corrupt, hoping to compensate for organizational deficiencies that have left Mr. Trump with an increasingly precarious path to the nomination.

title: ISIS Expands Reach Despite Military and Financial Setbacks
description: WASHINGTON  American airstrikes have killed 25,000 Islamic State fighters in Iraq and Syria and incinerated millions of dollars plundered by the militants, according to Pentagon officials.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo Pulls Real Madrid Back From the Brink
description: MADRID  Cristiano Ronaldo led Real Madrid to a remarkable comeback victory in the Champions League, scoring all three goals in a 3-0 win over Wolfsburg on Tuesday that overturned last weeks unexpected 2-0 first-leg defeat in Germany.

title: Sewall-Belmont House, a Center of the Womens Equality Movement, Becomes a National Monument
description: WASHINGTON  The red-brick house on Capitol Hill served for decades as a national headquarters and dormitory for the so-called iron-jawed ladies lobbying for equal rights, even as male members of Congress sought to raze it to make room for offices for themselves.

title: Vladimir Kagan, Designer Whose Furniture Evoked Sensuality, Dies at 88
description: In the hotelier Andr Balazss office in Lower Manhattan, in front of his industrial-looking Charlotte Perriand desk, sits a Vladimir Kagan chair. Upholstered in green leather, it has been used for all the usual purposes, from making phone calls to firing off emails.

title: Affirm Raises $100 Million, Bucking the Down Round Trend
description: Affirm, a San Francisco-based consumer lending company, said on Tuesday that it had raised $100 million in new funding, at a time when start-up fund-raising has become more difficult.

title: Just One More for Curry and Bryant
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  On his way to fulfilling his obligations for a news media maw that included roughly 20 television cameras, Stephen Curry turned to a staff member who was with him during his rookie 2009-10 season. Curry was struck by how much things had changed.

title: Arthur Anderson, Voice of Lucky Charms Cereals Leprechaun, Dies at 93
description: Arthur Anderson, who performed on radio as a teenager with Orson Welless Mercury Theater and appeared on Broadway, in films and on television, but whose most enduring role was as the voice of Lucky Charms cereals leprechaun, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 93.

title: Review: In Exit Strategy, Scrambling Before Schools Out Forever
description: A struggling Chicago high school faces imminent extinction in Exit Strategy, a pointed if sentimental drama by Ike Holter that opened at the Cherry Lane Theater on Tuesday in a vividly acted production from Primary Stages.

title: Place For a Bald-Headed Baby
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Tony Orbach is a silly guy, as anyone who has met him can attest. He has a goofy sense of humor, which I am very fond of, so its no surprise that we get goofy puzzles from him. Thats a good thing. What better to get us over the hump in the week than a crossword theme that is a gigglefest?

title: Man Charged in Fatal Stabbing on Upper East Side
description: A 19-year-old man was arrested on Tuesday on suspicion of fatally stabbing a man during an argument on a Manhattan sidewalk, the authorities said.

title: Success Academy Charter School Network Receives $25 Million Gift
description: Success Academy, the high-performing but polarizing charter school network, said on Tuesday that it had received a $25 million gift, its largest ever, from the hedge fund billionaire Julian H. Robertson.

title: Knicks Finish 32-50: Little Bit Better
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The 2015-16 regular season  or Year One, as the Knicks have been calling it of late  came to a subdued end Tuesday.

title: New York Observer Endorses Donald Trump
description: The New York Observer has endorsed a candidate in the Republican primary, and that candidate is  surprise!  Donald J. Trump.

title: Yankees Show Theyve Turned Calendar With Victory Against Blue Jays
description: TORONTO  When the Yankees returned here to play the Blue Jays on Tuesday there were a few signs that it was no longer last year. There was no frothy capacity crowd, no David Price and no bat-flipping, swaggering runaway train of a team to greet them.

title: Noah Syndergaards Gem Goes for Naught as Mets Offense Falters Again
description: Sitting in the visitors dugout at Citi Field on Tuesday, Barry Bonds succinctly described the nights pitching matchup between the Mets Noah Syndergaard and the Miami Marlins Jose Fernandez.

title: Joe Freeman Britt, Called Americas Deadliest D.A., Dies at 80
description: Joe Freeman Britt, a brash North Carolina prosecutor who was called the nations deadliest D.A. for his success at winning death sentences, died on April 6 in Lumberton, N.C. He was 80.

title: Joe Patten, Theater Caretaker Known as Phantom of the Fox, Dies at 89
description: They called him the Phantom  the Phantom of the Fox.

title: Gang Member Stoked Violence That Led to His Sisters Murder, Prosecutor Says
description: A young man accused of killing a rival who mocked his sisters death in a rap video had stoked the gang war in Harlem that led to her murder, taking part in shootings and posting ugly threats on social media in the months before she was killed, a prosecutor said on Tuesday.

title: Sean Parker, a Facebook and Napster Pioneer, to Start Cancer Immunotherapy Effort
description: LOS ANGELES  Sean Parker was a pioneer in music sharing when he co-founded Napster and in social media as the early president of Facebook. Now he wants to pioneer in a field that is already jumping with activity: cancer immunotherapy.

title: Googles Calendar Now Finds Spare Time and Fills It Up
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Online technologys urgent emails, calendar updates and videoconferences may propel business, but the system at times seems to suck energy from our personal lives.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | tithe
description: tithe  \tith\  noun and verb

title: A Decades-Old Study, Rediscovered, Challenges Advice on Saturated Fat
description: A four-decades-old study  recently discovered in a dusty basement  has raised new questions about longstanding dietary advice and the perils of saturated fat in the American diet.

title: Corrections: April 13, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: What to Watch Wednesday
description: Its an evening of crime, as The Last Panthers and Biutiful burrow into the European criminal underworld. Sylvester Stallone gets behind a new competition pairing female athletes with male trainers. And Lifetime brings its hit UnReal to the very small screen with The Faith Diaries, its first scripted web series.

title: Less Acreage in G.M.O. Crops
description: The total worldwide acreage of genetically modified crops fell slightly in 2015. The United States had the highest acreage, followed by Brazil.

title: Acreage for Genetically Modified Crops Declined in 2015
description: The worlds farmers have increased their use of genetically modified crops steadily and sharply since the technology became broadly commercialized in 1996. Not anymore.

title: Ivanka Trump Proves a Savvy Surrogate for Her Father
description: Ivanka Trump is very, very good.

title: Judge in China Rules Gay Couple Cannot Marry
description: BEIJING  A judge ruled on Wednesday against a gay couple who had sought the right to marry, in Chinas first court case addressing the issue of same-sex unions.

title: A Loving Look at Hispanic New Mexican Life
description: The first photo Kevin Bubriski took after arriving in Santa Fe, N.M., opened a portal to a whole culture, ancient and rich, hiding in plain sight.

title: Summer Jobs for All City High School Students
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio speaks often of narrowing the vast gap that exists between the rich and the poor in New York City. His administration could make a real impact in this area by retooling the citys inadequate summer jobs program so that more high school students get work experiences that put them in position to compete for full-time jobs later on. A new proposal by the Community Service Society, a New York nonprofit group, makes a strong case for a universal summer jobs program that would be open to all high school students.

title: Why Im Supporting Bernie Sanders
description: NO decision we make as Americans more dramatically affects the direction of our country than our choice for president. He or she is more than the manager of the executive branch, commander in chief or appointer of judges. The president reflects, but also helps define, our national values, priorities and direction.

title: Out of Africa
description: Agadez, NIGER  Its Monday and that means its moving day in Agadez, the northern Niger desert crossroad that is the main launching pad for migrants out of West Africa. Fleeing devastated agriculture, overpopulation and unemployment, migrants from a dozen countries gather here in caravans every Monday night and make a mad dash through the Sahara to Libya, hoping to eventually hop across the Mediterranean to Europe.

title: Did Blacks Really Endorse the 1994 Crime Bill?
description: AS political candidates and pundits grapple with the legacy of the 1994 crime bill and the era of mass incarceration that has seen millions of African-Americans locked in the nations prisons, one defense keeps popping up: that black citizens asked for it.

title: No Paul Ryan Means Still More Anger
description: If Paul Ryan really meant what he said, the Republican Party has lost its best chance to take the White House and maintain control of the Senate.

title: By Opposing Obama, the Republicans Created Trump
description: MEMO to Republican legislators biting your nails over the New York primary, wondering if you can finally derail Donald J. Trumps candidacy with, gulp, Ted Cruz: You brought it on yourselves.

title: Peabody Energy, a Coal Giant, Seeks Bankruptcy Protection
description: Peabody Energy, the worlds largest publicly owned coal producer, with mines around the world from Australia to the United States, filed for bankruptcy protection in the United States on Wednesday.

title: Free Speech Isnt the Only Casualty of Erdogans Repression
description: DIYARBAKIR, Turkey  When Turkeys president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, recently paid a visit to Washington, he gave Americans a taste of the kinds of policies he employs at home. His guards reportedly roughed up reporters outside a think tank while an LED-lit van that said Truth + Peace = Erdogan drove around the United States capital.

title: News Qs | Journalist, 9, Responds to Her Critics and Becomes a Media Star
description: The following lesson activities are based on the article Journalist, 9, Responds to Her Critics and Becomes a Media Star.

title: Bernienomics Might Not Be Feasible  But Its Useful
description: Surprisingly, for such an odd and difficult man, Thorstein Veblen represented a high point in American optimism. Veblen was trained in economics but spent much of his career in the margins of the field, preferring instead to look at society more broadly, through the lens of anthropology and Darwinism. Social institutions, he argued, were like species; they evolved, following paths set down by previous generations. The economists of his day, like those of today, argued that wages and prices were determined by the corresponding desires of buyers and sellers to trade. Veblen largely rejected this idea, arguing instead that modern people still carried with them their barbarian past, in which violent warrior kings subjugated peasants. The warrior kings had become aristocrats and businesspeople, while the peasants were, of course, the workers.

title: Questlove Is Feeling the Bern (Kinda)
description: Other musicians have called you a journalist who makes music, and now thats sort of true. You just published a book of interviews with chefs. As a journalist, what would you ask yourself? Why am I comfortable being the student and never the teacher? I used to make people uneasy because I asked too many questions. In the music world, critics and journalists were always the enemy. It took Q-Tip maybe 10 years to just relax and not see me as one of you.

title: Outfits Our Brides Have Worn
description: A selection of wedding-day looks from brides recently featured in our announcements.

title: New Planned Parenthood Center in Queens Says Welcome in Many Ways
description: In many places around the nation, it is a dark time for Planned Parenthood.

title: Is Gigi Gorgeous Americas Next Top Model?
description: LOS ANGELES  On a Tuesday night not long ago, the YouTube star known as Gigi Gorgeous walked into the Nice Guy, the type of restaurant that prides itself on being frequented by Justin Bieber and the Kardashian family.

title: Beating Tragedy and Odds, 10 Earn New York Times College Scholarships
description: When Wilson Zhang learned his father had cancer, he did what any son would do. He took over the household  shopping, cleaning, taking his sister to school.

title: Wheaties Can Wait: Caitlyn Jenner Models for MAC and H&M
description: Gigi Gorgeous may be a pioneer in the world of transgender branding, but she is not a lone one.

title: Mothers of Black Victims Emerge as a Force for Hillary Clinton
description: The Sweet Maple Cafe in Chicago, famous for its grilled cheese sandwiches and sweet milk biscuits, typically closes each day after the lunch rush. But one evening in November, the restaurant opened for an unusual private dinner.

title: What Freedom Looks Like
description: Is it fashions responsibility to ease acceptance of different identities; to foster tolerance and understanding  or to promote a specific aesthetic expression of liberty?

title: Living in Livingston, N.J.
description: Among the attractions of this Essex County community are good schools and an abundance of shopping.

title: Livingston, N.J., for Schools and Shopping
description: After paying rent for 10 years in Jersey City, Simran and Vikas Sekhri, both 37, were looking for a place of their own  and more breathing room. They got a bonus when they moved west last year to Livingston, N.J. They also found taekwondo, piano and tennis lessons for their 7-year-old son.

title: Dispatcher Playing With Cellphone Is Faulted in German Train Crash
description: BERLIN  A railway dispatcher apparently caused the deadly collision of two trains in the German state of Bavaria on Feb. 9 because he was playing a game on his cellphone until just before the accident, according to state prosecutors.

title: Student Question | Do You Want to Be Promposed To?
description: Have you ever seen a promposal, either live or online? Would you like to be either the recipient or the designer of a promposal of your own? Why or why not?

title: Whats a European Liberal to Do?
description: PARIS  On Sunday, Air France will resume regular flights to Tehran. For its female flight attendants and pilots, there is a catch: On arrival, they will be asked to wear not only the most conservative version of their uniform, a pantsuit with a knee-length jacket, but also a head scarf to cover their hair, in line with Iranian law and with other foreign airlines practice. The unions have protested. This is contrary to what I stand for as a woman, an Air France flight attendant complained in Le Figaro Madame. The company quickly gave in. Only those comfortable with the requirements will fly the Paris-Tehran route.

title: Investors Should Get More I.P.O. Data Earlier, British Regulator Says
description: LONDON  Britains markets regulator said on Wednesday that investors should have more information available to them earlier in the initial public offering process. The call came as the regulator considers whether to revamp the system for public listings of stocks in Britain.

title: At the Existentialist Caf, by Sarah Bakewell
description: AT THE EXISTENTIALIST CAFFreedom, Being, and Apricot CocktailsBy Sarah BakewellIllustrated. 439 pp. Other Press. $25.

title: The Lady With the Borzoi: Blanche Knopf, Literary Tastemaker Extraordinaire
description: THE LADY WITH THE BORZOIBlanche Knopf, Literary Tastemaker ExtraordinaireBy Laura ClaridgeIllustrated. 400 pp. Farrar, Straus& Giroux. $30.

title: An Easy Way to Prevent Blisters? Try Tape
description: Exercise science today is exploring countless mysterious, exciting and poetic aspects of human physiology and performance. But sometimes you just wish that someone would tell you how to keep your feet from hurting. A wonderfully practical new study obliges, providing the first reliable, field-tested evidence about how to prevent blisters during prolonged exercise. Anyone running next weeks Boston Marathon, youre welcome.

title: Wheres the Magic in Family Dinner?
description: Like many families, we strive to eat dinner together as often as possible. And when my husband and I meet our tween and her younger sister at the table, we sometimes have worthwhile conversations or manage to crack each other up. But, at least as often, dinner devolves into a failing effort to find out what happened at school or a nag-fest over mealtime manners. After an especially short or harried supper, I can find myself wondering how the family gathering that just transpired could possibly help to raise my daughters grades, improve their psychological well-being or lower their risk of substance abuse.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Verizon, Alpha Centauri, Kobe Bryant
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Tribeca Takes the City
description: Updated, 12:12 p.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Puerto Rico Rescue Bill Introduced in House
description: PUERTO RICO RESCUE BILL INTRODUCED IN HOUSE | On Tuesday, Representative Sean P. Duffy, a Wisconsin Republican, introduced a bill that would give Puerto Rico powers that are normally available only in bankruptcy as the island tries to restructure $72 billion in debt,  Mary Williams Walsh reports in DealBook. The bill would give Puerto Rico the power to discharge debt and to force creditors to accept settlements that are less than what they are seeking. It would also halt most creditors lawsuits against Puerto Rico.

title: Bono Tells Senate That National Security Is Dependent on Foreign Aid
description: In testimony before the State, Foreign Operations and Related Programs Appropriations Subcommittee on Tuesday, the rock star and activist Bono urged the United States to step up foreign aid, saying it was crucial to stem the spread of violent extremism in the Middle East and Africa.

title: Congressional Leaders to Push for Spending Bills Amid Budget Obstacles
description: House and Senate appropriators are set to barrel ahead with spending bills over the next few days, even as House Republican leaders seem unable to win passage of a budget resolution because of opposition from hard-line conservatives.

title: In Verizon Strike, Blue-Collar Stress Hits the Sidewalks
description: The roughly 36,000 Verizon workers who went on strike Wednesday as a contract dispute entered its ninth month have brought into sharp relief one of the most fundamental questions facing the United States: Can an economy in the throes of dizzying technological change be a source of new middle-class jobs for blue-collar workers?

title: How the Verizon Strike Could Affect You
description: About 36,000 Verizon workers went on   strike early Wednesday after the communications company failed to reach an agreement with unions representing workers for its wireline operations.

title: Europisch werden
description: Read in English

title: Hillary Clinton to Speak at Al Sharptons National Action Network Convention
description: Last year, Hillary Clinton called the Rev. Al Sharpton to wish him a happy birthday, a bit of outreach that she did not tell reporters about, though Mr. Sharpton did.

title: Must a Mental Illness Be Revealed on a First Date?
description: I have struggled with mental illness, off and on, for most of my life. It can be debilitating and has resulted in numerous hospitalizations. I also have extensive scarring on my arms from self-harm episodes. But I have a successful career and fully support myself; most people who know me have no idea that I am mentally ill. After ending a decade-long relationship, I am now thinking of dating again. My question is: At what point do I disclose my mental illness, its history and its effects? At what point do I explain my scars? Do I have an obligation to reveal this information on the first or second date, before any attachment forms, so that any potential partner can opt out? Name Withheld

title: The Looming Threat of Avian Flu
description: Even at a distance, it was obvious that there was something odd about the compost pile behind one of Brad Molines long white barns. Moline, 37, tops six feet, but the pile towered above him. It was 30 feet wide and 100 feet long, and the compost was crumbly and rich. But its sloping sides were studded with bones.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Trolling Your Own Wedding
description: Andrew writes: I am very fun, and I earnestly want to Jet-Ski into my wedding ceremony to the tune of The Final Countdown, possibly accompanied by pyrotechnics. I would also like to wear my pet lizard as a boutonniere. My fiance rejects these ideas. Will no fun be had on this special day?

title: Captivated by the Ganges, a River of Souls
description: We started through narrow alleys at 5 a.m., moving past somnolent cows curled against doorways and gaunt dogs on steps and women in saris moving toward us through the gloom, a motorbike vrooming in the distance.

title: News About Obamacare Has Been Bad Lately. How Bad?
description: Ever since passage of the Affordable Care Act, a fierce debate has been waged over whether the law would work as advertised. While advocates promised that the design of new insurance markets would transform the way consumers buy health insurance, critics warned that the new market would never succeed. Reed Abelson and Margot Sanger-Katz have had front-row seats to the debate, and the two reporters took a few minutes to discuss when  and if  the market would stabilize.

title: After Two New York Flops, Cirque du Soleil Bets Big on Broadway
description: The dancer emerges from stage left, in white tails and top hat; from stage right comes a juggler in a black tuxedo. And then begins a choreographic throwdown  the dancer taps, the juggler balances a cane on his nose  a prelude to the best-of-both-worlds spectacle promised behind the Art Deco curtain.

title: So Much for Britains Wage Increase
description: The minimum wage is going up in Britain, from 6.70 pounds an hour ($9.45) to 7.20 this month and 9 by 2020.

title: Real Madrids Emergency Strategy: Leave It to Cristiano Ronaldo
description: LONDON  The word superstar is too loosely used today in regard to team games, but it is impossible to imagine Real Madrid getting out of the hole it had dug for itself in the Champions League without its brightest talent, Cristiano Ronaldo. After losing the first leg in Germany, 2-0, Real Madrid had to beat Wolfsburg by three clear goals Tuesday at Santiago Bernabu stadium in Madrid. Ronaldo, looking like he had ESP, scored all three goals in Reals 3-0 victory.

title: WADA Opens a Door for Athletes Who Tested Positive for Meldonium
description: MOSCOW  The World Anti-Doping Agency issued new guidelines on Wednesday on the length of time the banned drug meldonium takes to leave the body, prompting celebrations from Russian sports officials, who said it seemed to open the way to clearing many of their athletes suspended recently for testing positive for the drug.

title: 1941: Pope Deplores Wars Barbarity
description: Lamenting that the just peace for which he said he had labored seems still far away, Pope Pius XII implored the warring nations today [April 13] to use no weapons more terrible than those thus far employed and admonished military commanders in occupied countries to treat civilians humanely.  New York Herald Tribune, April 14, 1941

title: I.M.F. Warns of Economic Risk of British Exit From E.U.
description: LONDON  A stark warning about the potentially negative economic impact of a British withdrawal from the European Union and a new report on immigration have galvanized debate over the countrys future in the bloc, a little more than two months before a referendum on whether to leave.

title: Europes Privacy Watchdogs Call for Changes to U.S. Data-Transfer Deal
description: Only two months after the European Unions top policy makers agreed to a hard-won data-sharing pact with United States officials, the blocs national privacy regulators said on Wednesday that the deal did not go far enough to safeguard the personal information of Internet users in Europe.

title: Regulators Warn 5 Top Banks They Are Still Too Big to Fail
description: The nations top bank regulators have added an unexpected voice to the growing chorus of critics worried that the biggest American banks, nearly eight years after the financial crisis, are still too big to fail.

title: In Flint, Fears of Showering Bring Desperate Measures
description: FLINT, Mich.  Near the top of the daily challenges that Flint residents face in a city without safe drinking water is how and where to shower.

title: Art Dealer Says Painting Found in French Attic Is a Caravaggio
description: PARIS  It seems almost too good to be true: A long-lost Caravaggio worth millions is discovered languishing in an attic in France, unseen by the family that had lived there for generations.

title: JPMorgan Chase Reports Lower Quarterly Profit
description: With investors expecting a weak first quarter for the banks, JPMorgan Chase delivered results that were slightly better than the forecasts.

title: Tracey McDermott to Leave Financial Conduct Authority in July
description: LONDON  Tracey McDermott, the top executive of the British Financial Conduct Authority, will leave the regulator when Andrew Bailey, its new chief executive, takes over in July, the agency said on Wednesday.

title: Razing Deucalion
description: Dear Diary:

title: Inky the Octopus Escapes From a New Zealand Aquarium
description: It was an audacious nighttime escape.

title: Iranian Parliament Cancels Cash Subsidies to 24 Million People
description: TEHRAN  Irans lame-duck Parliament approved a bill on Wednesday canceling cash subsidies to 24 million Iranians, angering the government of President Hassan Rouhani, local news outlets reported.

title: The Animaniacs Voices Are Reuniting. Yes, Theres a New Verse to Yakkos World.
description: Twenty-three years later  yes, 23 years  Rob Paulsen is still often asked to perform the song that would remain the most memorable bit on Animaniacs, an after-school cartoon favorite for children of the 1990s.

title: Kindle Oasis From Amazon Promises Months and Months of Battery Life
description: SEATTLE  When Amazon introduced Kindle, its pioneering e-reader, in 2007, society was on the cusp of being changed by mobile devices.

title: What You Get for  $1,800,000
description: This weeks properties include a 1900 house in Kentucky, a renovated ranch in Atlanta and an adobe in New Mexico.

title: $1,800,000 Homes in Kentucky, Atlanta and New Mexico
description: ANCHORAGE, KY.

title: Greece Holds Activists as Migrants and Police Clash Anew at Macedonia Border
description: ATHENS  Clashes erupted at Greeces northern border for the second time in three days on Wednesday, with the Macedonian police firing tear gas on scores of migrants as they protested border closings that have left more than 12,000 stranded in a makeshift refugee camp.

title: 50 Years in a Cab: A Long, Winding Trip for One Driver, and His City
description: ROME  From his front-seat perch, Alberto Tomassi, a Roman cabdriver for 50 years, has been both eavesdropper and confessor. He has played impromptu tour guide, thwarted muggings and rushed countless clients to the emergency room.

title: A Six-Bedroom Estate With Water Views
description: The house, with two guest cottages and set on one and a half acres in Warwick Parish, is on the market for $5.65 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Bermuda
description: A SIX-BEDROOM ESTATE IN WARWICK PARISH

title: Arnold Wesker, 83, Writer of Working-Class Dramas, Dies
description: LONDON  Arnold Wesker, a British playwright who came to prominence in the 1950s with stark dramas about working-class life, many of them influenced by his childhood in a leftist Jewish family in East London, died on Tuesday in Brighton, England. He was 83.

title: Bots are Back, and They Might Even Be Welcome
description: Bots have a bad reputation.

title: Finding Online Support for Your Android Device
description: Q. Why does Googles website only seem to offer support for Nexus hardware and not any of the other brands of Android phones and tablets?

title: Police Remove Bail Conditions on 5 Chinese Feminists Detained Last Year
description: BEIJING  The Chinese police lifted bail conditions on Wednesday for five feminists who were detained in Beijing last year on the eve of International Womens Day for planning to distribute leaflets warning of sexual harassment on public transit, according to the women and their lawyers.

title: 12 Monkeys, on Syfy: Its Complicated, but Thats O.K.
description: Adapting a popular film into a television series is always a risky business, especially if that film attained cult status. Fans dont like to have their touchstone cinematic experiences mucked with. But Syfy has navigated this difficult territory adroitly with its series 12 Monkeys, which returns for a second season on Monday night, April 18. The 1995 film of that name, directed by Terry Gilliam and starring Bruce Willis, exploded a lot of moviegoers brains with its story of a time-traveling hero trying to stop a killer virus from destroying humanity. In the TV series, Mr. Williss character is played by Aaron Stanford, and he was put through quite a lot in Season 1, in several different time periods. The new season will include a story arc for Michael Hogan of Battlestar Galactica. In the first season, the writers wove a tale too complex to describe here, but Syfy has an droll primer video on the shows website. In an inspired stroke, its narrated by Madeleine Stowe, who starred with Mr. Willis in the movie.

title: Mozarts Way With Singspiels
description: In Juilliard Operas new production of Mozarts Die Zauberflte (The Magic Flute), the director Mary Birnbaum examines the characters journey to enlightenment from a 21st-century perspective. David Stern conducts the Juilliard Orchestra; sets are inspired by the American artist Joseph Cornell, Carl Jungs alchemical images and the Masonic lodges of New England. (Tuesday, April 19, and Thursday at 7:30 p.m. and Saturday at 2 p.m.; juilliard.edu.)

title: Small Mouth Sounds Returns to New York
description: New Yorkers will again get to (quietly) see Small Mouth Sounds.

title: Gilberto Gil and Caetano Veloso, Touring Again
description: Five decades ago, Gilberto Gil and Caetano Veloso shared quite a bit: They attended college together; pioneered Brazils Tropiclia movement; went to jail at the same time after being labeled subversive by the government; and were forced into exile in London together. They were key in pushing Brazilian music toward the psychedelic and pushing Brazilian politics toward the more tolerant.

title: In The Long Goodbye, Altman Dissects Los Angeles
description: In 1973, the tireless maverick Robert Altman was on a roll. His masterpieces M*A*S*H and McCabe and Mrs. Miller were behind him, and Thieves Like Us, California Split and Nashville lay ahead. It was time to dissect Southern California: its movie history and its casualties. His vehicle was The Long Goodbye, a neo-noir take on Raymond Chandlers novel, coming to the Museum of the Moving Image as part of its series See It Big! Vilmos Zsigmond on Saturday, April 23.

title: Can Donald Trump Win Every Delegate in New York?
description: Unless every poll is wildly wrong, Donald Trump is going to win in New York on Tuesday, and hes going to win big. But exactly how he wins really matters. A few votes here or there could make the difference between a solid or shaky road to the Republican nomination.

title: Why Monetarism Failed
description: Brad DeLong asks why monetarism  broadly defined as the view that monetary policy can and should be used to stabilize economies  has more or less disappeared from the scene, both intellectually and politically. As it happens, I wrote about essentially the same question back in 2010, inspired by the more or less hysterical pushback against quantitative easing. I thought then and think now that this was fated to happen, that Milton Friedmans project was always doomed to failure.

title: Angelin Preljocajs Meditations on Movement
description: As a choreographer, Angelin Preljocaj has two sides. There are his highly theatrical adventures like Spectral Evidence, which he created for New York City Ballet in 2013 and took inspiration from the Salem witchcraft trials. And then there are his more sedate, minimal works that calmly reveal the purity of movement without all the bells and whistles. In Empty moves (Parts I, II & III), Ballet Preljocaj returns to the Joyce Theater to perform, for the first time in New York, all three sections of this spellbinding work, set to a recording of John Cages Empty Words from a 1977 performance in Milan. Not all those in that audience reacted well to Cages reading of Thoreaus journals; yet despite their insults and shouts, he carried on  just as the dancers do in Mr. Preljocajs hypnotic investigation of form. Here the dancers create a world of their own: quietly rigorous, sensuous in its constant flow and meditative. In other words, far from empty. (Wednesday, April 20, through Sunday, 175 Eighth Avenue at 19th Street, Manhattan; 212-242-0077, joyce.org.)

title: Kay WalkingSticks American History
description: Kay WalkingStick: An American Artist, at the National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, is an overdue career survey of a near half-century of work by an artist, now 81, for whom American has multiple and conflicted meanings.

title: Q. and A. With Ellie Kemper: Talking Kimmy Schmidt, Jon Hamm and Tarantulas
description: In Netflixs Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, Ellie Kemper plays the survivor of a doomsday cult who, after being held captive underground in Indiana for 15 years, doggedly reinvents herself in New York City. But in Season 2, not everything goes swimmingly for Kimmy, who discovers that when you close the door on one problem, another opens.

title: Citigroups Living Will Passes Muster but Offers Few Insights
description: Section 165 of the Dodd-Frank Act requires large bank holding companies to submit resolution plans popularly known as living wills  that show how these companies can be resolved if they fail in a bankruptcy court like every other business.

title: Joseph Altuzarras New Collection of Crisp Shirtdresses
description: The designer teamed up with Matches Fashion to offer more of his signature silhouettes.

title: 1966: France Bars Rites for G.I.
description: The French government has refused to permit a memorial ceremony at the Htel des Invalides in tribute to an American soldier mortally wounded in the liberation of Paris. It will be the first time in 20 years that the French Kelly Memorial Committee will not be able to hold the Invalides ceremony for Sgt. Lawrence R. Kelly, of Altoona, Pa., who was shot at the Saint-Cloud bridge, near Paris, on Aug. 25, 1944. The committee described the ceremony as a tribute to all Americans who died fighting in France.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, April 14, 1966

title: Ride-Hailing Start-Ups Compete in Uber for Children Niche
description: The juggle of work, school and myriad extracurricular activities is all too familiar to parents like Kelly Aluise of Los Angeles.

title: Chief Executive for Serpentine Galleries in London Is Named
description: LONDON The Serpentine Galleries, the contemporary art exhibition space in London, said Wednesday that it had appointed Yana Peel as chief executive, a new position for the institution.

title: Curfew Imposed in Jammu and Kashmir, India, After Deadly Clashes
description: NEW DELHI  The authorities in Jammu and Kashmir State imposed a curfew on the northern Indian city of Handwara on Wednesday, a day after Indian soldiers fired on a crowd of angry protesters at an army camp, killing three people, officials said.

title: Delicious Midweek Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Shopping Guide: Pendant Lights
description: A veteran lighting designer offers some tips on finding the right fixture.

title: Stephen Colberts CBS Show Gets a New Showrunner
description: Less than eight months into his tenure as the host of The Late Show, CBSs flagship late-night program, Stephen Colbert is getting a new executive to oversee the show. On Wednesday, the network announced that Chris Licht, the executive producer of CBS This Morning, will become the showrunner and an executive producer at The Late Show, a move that may reflect some discontent with how the program has started off under Mr. Colbert.

title: E.U. Accuses Polish Government of Undermining Democracy
description: WARSAW  The European Parliament accused Polands right-wing government on Wednesday of undermining democracy, overwhelmingly adopting a resolution urging it to respect the decisions of a top Polish court.

title: A Look at the Doctor Strange Teaser Trailer
description: Might I offer you some advice? Forget everything that you think you know. Those words are spoken to the character Stephen Strange in the new teaser for Doctor Strange, which went online Monday night. But could that advice also be given to Hollywood when considering new superhero movies? Marvel is certainly trying out a new direction for the studio with the more metaphysical Doctor Strange, played by Benedict Cumberbatch.

title: Some Online Bargains May Only Look Like One
description: Amazon has some unbelievable bargains on its virtual shelves.

title: Bushwhacking Up Maines Baker Mountain
description: Baker Mountain in Maine doesnt crack the top 100 list of New England peaks. But it certainly has stage presence. A full third taller than the two mountains on either side of it, and twice as wide, Baker looms large on its home turf.

title: Ted Cruz Radio Ad Intensifies Feud With Mayor Bill de Blasio
description: Join us for New York primary live updates.

title: Should a Jail Record Be an Employer's First Impression?
Who Could Save the G.O.P.? Republicans Weigh Some Ideas
description: Speaker Paul D. Ryans categorical disavowal of interest in the presidential race on Tuesday appeared to extinguish a longstanding fantasy of Republican leaders: That Mr. Ryan might ride into the convention in Cleveland as a white knight to unite the fractured party and claim its nomination.

title: The Mad Genius of Superstudio
description: A look back at the collective of rebel Italian students who defined the radical architecture movement of the 60s and 70s but never completed a single building.

title: A Big Science Guy Named Obama Hosts Young Innovators One Last Time
description: President Obama vowed early in his tenure to make science cool and decorated the Oval Office with patent models of groundbreaking American inventions.

title: A 60s Architecture Collective That Made History (but No Buildings)
description: Italys legendary radical design group Superstudio never actually finished a building, and yet its hallucinogenic visions are still making waves.

title: A Meltdown, on Deadline: Reporters Notebook
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Karen Crouse, a sportswriter, describes how she scrambled (on deadline) to cover Jordan Spieths unexpected meltdown at the Masters.

title: Allen Toussaints Final Recordings to Be Released in June
description: The final recordings of Allen Toussaint, the sage New Orleans songwriter, singer and pianist who died in November at age 77, will be released on June 10, in the album American Tunes (Nonesuch).

title: Wall Street Scions Fraud Case Could Be Settled, Lawyer Says
description: Andrew Caspersen, the former Wall Street executive charged by federal prosecutors and securities regulators with defrauding friends, relatives and a charitable foundation closely tied to a large New York hedge fund, is unlikely to face a trial.

title: De Blasio Plays Down Contact With Men at Heart of U.S. Inquiry
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Wednesday that he had conversations over the course of 2014 and into the next year with two financial backers who are now at the center of a federal investigation, acknowledging more extensive contact with the men than he had previously.

title: Thousands of Verizon Employees Strike
description: Close to 36,000 Verizon workers on the East Coast have gone on strike after the company and two unions failed to reach an agreement on Wednesday. This is one of the largest strikes in recent years.

title: Jordan Shuts Down Muslim Brotherhood Headquarters
description: AMMAN, Jordan  The Jordanian police closed down the headquarters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Jordan on Wednesday, the group said in a statement.

title: Bataclan, Site of Terror Attack in Paris, Plans November Reopening
description: The Bataclan, the Paris concert hall where scores of people were killed in the terrorist attack of Nov. 13, on Wednesday announced its first slate of shows since then. The hall has not held a concert since terrorists opened fire during an Eagles of Death Metal concert.

title: New Poll Shows Donald Trump Adding Delegates in Maryland
description: Donald J. Trump has opened a wide lead in Maryland, according to a new poll that shows the leading Republican presidential candidate poised to sweep the states delegates later this month.

title: Chip, Implanted in Brain, Helps Paralyzed Man Regain Control of Hand
description: Five years ago, a college freshman named Ian Burkhart dived into a wave at a beach off the Outer Banks in North Carolina and, in a freakish accident, broke his neck on the sandy floor, permanently losing the feeling in his hands and legs.

title: Wall St. Banks Told to Stand Alone, Without Overseas Help
description: When the next financial crisis hits, big American banks will not be able to rely on their internal lifeboats.

title: A Documentary Grows With Each Mass Shooting
description: A new film about gun violence has a simple concept and a brief running time, but its makers intend it to be nothing less than a living document of the cycle of violence.

title: Hastert Accuser, a Former Wrestler, Is Expected to Testify at Sentencing
description: CHICAGO  A former high school wrestler who has said that J. Dennis Hastert, the former speaker of the House, sexually abused him decades ago is expected to speak at Mr. Hasterts sentencing hearing this month.

title: Alpha Centauri: A Destination for Star-Struck Explorers
description: The Breakthrough Starshot space mission to Alpha Centauri inpsired us to revisit the imagined trips to the star system in books, comics, TV, movies and video games.

title: Teenager Who Used Affluenza Defense Is Sentenced to Jail
description: FORT WORTH  Ethan Couch, the teenager who used an affluenza defense in a drunken-driving crash that killed four people and then violated probation by traveling to Mexico with his mother, was sentenced on Wednesday to nearly two years in jail.

title: Review: An All-Star Jazz Trio Explores Form and Freedom
description: Perfection

title: Families of Germanwings Crash Victims File Suit in U.S.
description: PARIS  Lawyers representing the families of dozens of victims of the crash of a Germanwings airliner in the French Alps last year filed a wrongful-death lawsuit in Phoenix on Wednesday. The lawsuit accuses an Arizona flight school that trained the planes co-pilot of negligence for allowing him to pursue his training, despite what they contend were multiple red flags in his medical records indicating a history of mental illness.

title: On Penalty Kill, Islanders Turn a Weakness Into a Weapon
description: EAST MEADOW, N.Y.  Three years ago, the Islanders inability to kill penalties cost them in the playoffs. Last season, their penalty-kill struggles may have cost them a happier closing of Nassau Coliseum.

title: Milwaukees Appeals, Vibrant and Cheap
description: Full disclosure: I was already sold on Milwaukee before I arrived. Im originally from outside Chicago, and spent some time in Wisconsins largest city around 10 years ago when I was performing in a local theater production. During my time there, I came to appreciate the citys appealing mix of outstanding cultural institutions, fantastic food and dive bars.

title: Is Cheap Oil Contractionary?
description: Low oil prices were supposed to be a big boost for the world economy; but it didnt happen. Maury Obstfeld, my long-time textbook co-author and now chief economist at the IMF, offers an interesting argument about why: he suggests that its because of the zero lower bound. Falling oil leads to falling inflation expectations, and since interest rates cant fall, real rates go up, hurting recovery.

title: How Donald Trump Tweets
description: The exact source of Donald Trumps tweets has long been a matter of speculation. The tweets are so consistent with his persona that its hard to imagine anyone else coming up with them. But where in his busy schedule of making America great again does Mr. Trump find time to tweet?

title: Bernie Sanders Relishes Backing From a Fellow Senator and a Labor Union
description: Bernie Sanders picked up his first endorsement from a fellow United States senator on Wednesday. Senator Jeff Merkley, a Democrat from Oregon, offered his official backing of Mr. Sanders.

title: Our Polarized Politics
description: To the Editor:

title: Dancers in Madonnas Truth or Dare Had Truths of Their Own
description: In footage shot during Madonnas 1990 Blond Ambition tour, the star stops her concert to speak about the death, just a few weeks earlier, of her close friend Keith Haring. He was a man who had the courage to tell the truth, she announces. The truth is, he was gay. The truth is, he had AIDS. And he said so to anybody who would listen.

title: Lies About Combat in Iraq
description: To the Editor:

title: Mario Vargas Llosa on Love, Spectacle and Becoming a Legend
description: WASHINGTON  Four years ago, Mario Vargas Llosa wrote a book that said the world was going to hell. Journalists were sleaze-mongers and politicians hopeless. Civilization had collapsed into spectacle.

title: A Rookie Learns to Fly a Drone
description: LONDON  My wife, Alexa, has made something of a profession out of getting me great birthday presents. Over the years, her gifts have included an old Sports Illustrated with a hologram of Michael Jordan on the cover and a photography tour of a particularly photogenic part of southern China.

title: Megyn Kelly Meets With Donald Trump
description: It was a high-level summit meeting above Midtown Manhattan, the latest twist in a story of public acrimony and private courtship.

title: Corporate Tactics to Avoid Taxes
description: To the Editor:

title: Free Speech in Bangladesh
description: To the Editor:

title: Brooklyn Principal Removed From Post Is Cleared of Charges
description: In a rebuke to the New York City Education Department and its investigative unit, an arbitrator has dismissed all charges against a high school principal who was removed from her post last July, after being accused of inflating the schools graduation rate by giving makeup classes without content.

title: A Trip to Courrgess Workshop in Pau, France  With its New Designers
description: A year into their jobs as the artistic directors of the 55-year-old brand, the young designers Arnaud Vaillant and Sbastien Meyer visit the companys iconic factory.

title: For Courrgess New Designers, a Trip to the Source
description: In the early 1970s, the French fashion designer Andr Courrges returned to his hometown of Pau, at the foot of the Pyrenees, to build his companys manufacturing hub. He was known at the time as the Le Corbusier of Couture  and had introduced a mod look of A-line miniskirts, peg pants and boxy jackets that combined what he learned during his decade as the assistant to Cristbal Balenciaga and his love of all things futuristic, sporty and utilitarian. You dont walk through life anymore. You run. You dance. You drive a car. You take a plane, he said. Clothes must be able to move too.

title: Review: J. D. McClatchys Secret Autobiography, in Quotations
description: The essayist Michel de Montaigne thought that quoting well, in a piece of writing, was akin to arranging other peoples flowers. Its a skill; doing it well takes practice.

title: Election 2016 | Comparing the Candidates on the Issues
His Brothers Keeper: A Ramones Tour of Queens
description: MICKEY LEIGH walked up to a small house on an unremarkable street in Forest Hills, Queens. The teenager who answered the door was unsure what to make of the tall man with salt-and-pepper hair standing before him wearing black jeans, a long black coat and dirty yellow Converse sneakers.

title: Poll Watch: Just How Competitive Is the New York Primary?
description: Tuesday will be the first time in decades that New York will hold two competitive presidential primaries in the same year. Well, it depends on how you define competitive.

title: How to Get Better Returns on Savings
description: Savers were encouraged last year when the Federal Reserve began raising rates. But interest paid on the lowest-risk federally insured accounts remains lackluster.

title: Reducing Child Poverty
description: To the Editor:

title: Chicago Police Accountability Task Force Report
description: A task force assigned by Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago has found racism and systemic failures in the police force, validating complaints made for years by African- American residents.

title: Authorities Raid Law Firm at Center of Panama Papers Leak
description: MEXICO CITY  The Panamanian authorities have raided the offices of Mossack Fonseca, the law firm at the center of the vast leak of documents this month that exposed the global use of offshore tax shelters, and spent at least 16 hours combing through the companys files looking for evidence of possible illegal activities, officials said on Wednesday.

title: To Celebrate Tax Day (Really), 10 Travel Deals
description: In the world of travel, April 18  this years deadline for filing tax returns  is an incentive for hotels to create packages to lure guests who might be feeling flush with extra cash. According to Nancy Millett, the global consumer business tax leader for Deloitte, many taxpayers get a refund because they dont adjust their withholding to take into account their projected deductions and exemptions. As a result, they get money back at the end of the year, she said.

title: Chicago Police Dept. Plagued by Systemic Racism, Task Force Finds
description: CHICAGO  Racism has contributed to a long pattern of institutional failures by the Chicago Police Department in which officers have mistreated people, operated without sufficient oversight, and lost the trust of residents, a task force appointed by Mayor Rahm Emanuel has found.

title: Russian Plane Flew Close to U.S. Ship in Baltic Sea, White House Says
description: WASHINGTON  The White House said on Wednesday that Russia had violated professional military norms over the Baltic Sea when one of its planes flew dangerously close to an American ship and a Polish aircraft.

title: Hillary Clinton Promotes Community Libraries as Crucial Link to Immigrants
description: When Hillary Clinton visited the Queens Library in Flushing a few years ago, she was amazed by the sheer number of immigrants who gathered there for help.

title: Ruling to Dismiss Charges Against Principal
description: An arbitrator ruled that Kathleen Elvin, the former principal of John Dewey High School, should be reinstated after she was accused of improperly giving students credit for courses in which they received no instruction. The arbitrator said that an audit later conducted by the Education Department, which found that the courses met the department's guidelines, effectively exonerated her.

title: City Worker Sold Drugs at Municipal Building in Manhattan, Police Say
description: The Municipal Building in Lower Manhattan, a stately blend of Roman, Italian Renaissance and Classical architecture, would seem an unlikely place for a drug dealer to set up shop. Nearly as unlikely, then, is the man accused of the crime: a New York City employee who worked in the building.

title: Donald Trump Campaign Hires Rick Wiley, an R.N.C. Veteran
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign has hired Rick Wiley, who was the presidential campaign manager for Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, as its national political director as Mr. Trump, the Republican front-runner, expands his team, the campaign confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Court Opens Way for Argentina to End Battle With Hedge Funds
description: The United States Court of Appeals paved the way on Wednesday for Argentina to raise billions of dollars to pay a group of New York hedge funds, bringing it one step closer to re-entering international markets for the first time in 15 years.

title: Now You Can Write the Great American Novel on the Subway
description: IT used to be that when a moment of inspiration struck writers, they would have to rush over to a stone tablet, or find parchment and ink, to record their thoughts. Later, writers had to find paper and a typewriter, or a laptop or desktop computer, to get busy with their storytelling.

title: Loch Ness Monster Is Found! (Kind of. Not Really.)
description: After many decades of folklore and research, the Loch Ness monster has finally been found by an underwater drone.

title: Ryan Roche in Italy
description: Inside the mills, at the Fondazione Prada and atop the Duomo di Milano.

title: Festival Fashion Without Fringe or Feathers
description: The over-the-top marketing of festival fashion may have gotten out of hand, but rock n roll is always in style.

title: Act on the Refugee Crisis
description: To the Editor:

title: In Italy, Ryan Roche Learns About Knitwear
description: Last week, the designer Ryan Roche found herself in the Willy Wonka Chocolate Factory of the textile world, as she describes it: Remmert S.p.A, the 140-year-old Italian company best known for its haute couture accessories like beautiful feathers and lacquered tapes. The looms are massive, she explained by email, and out come the daintiest, fine ribbons. Roche, along with the milliner Gigi Burris and the family behind Orley, also visited Teseo and Maggia (facilities that focus on bio-silks and luxury jersey, respectively) and the Tessitura di Crevacuore mill (where the archive dated back to the 40s and we touched original Chanel, she notes) as participants in the inaugural Fabric Program trip coordinated by the CFDA and the international trade fair Milano Unica. The group took in more than just the crafts heritage: Roche met a septuagenarian knit-master (who presented some of his latest innovations), brushed up on advancements in yarn technology and discovered fiber combinations, treatments and washes that she plans to work into her brands resort offering. Here, she shares exclusively with T photographs from her seven-day sojourn in Italy.

title: Eight Games Into Their Season, Mets Have Something to Prove
description: The video played before games at Citi Field presents a timeline of significant moments in Mets history. Theres Cleon Jones on one knee, catching the final out of the 1969 World Series, and the glories of last years National League championship run.

title: Syrian Parliamentary Elections Highlight Divisions and Uncertainty
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrias president and first lady cast their ballots on Wednesday in front of clapping crowds, as state television captured the moment and set it to a dramatic soundtrack. Across Damascus, government employees were delivered to the polls aboard packed buses. The electricity even stayed on for most of the day in the capital, a rarity in these days of civil war.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: My First Lesson in Motherhood
description: In this weeks episode of the Modern Love Podcast, the actress Connie Britton (Nashville, Friday Night Lights) reads Elizabeth Fitzsimonss 2007 essay, My First Lesson in Motherhood, about a womans almost immediate challenges with a daughter adopted from China.

title: R. Crumbs Art and Beauty
description: A new exhibition at David Zwirner in London includes images from the artists Art & Beauty publication series.

title: Hillary Clinton Gets Tepid Response at Black Activist Conference
description: A week after her husband had a tense encounter with black protesters, Hillary Clinton on Wednesday received a lukewarm response from a gathering of black leaders and voters in New York.

title: An Art-World Prankster Goes Digital
description: The American cartoonist Robert Crumbs first U.K. solo exhibition in over a decade opens to the public in London on Friday  and features pictures from the latest volume of his Art and Beauty magazine series, which has previously seen Crumb faithfully reproduce imagery of women taken from mass media or life studies. Now, he adds cellphone street photos and his fans selfies to his wellsprings of inspiration.

title: Anne Jackson, Stage Star With Her Husband, Eli Wallach, Dies at 90
description: Anne Jackson, a distinguished star of the stage who was half of one of Americas best-known acting couples, sharing much of a long and distinguished career with her husband, Eli Wallach, died on Tuesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 90.

title: JFK Envisions an Operatic Ending for Camelot
description: FORT WORTH  We learn about it. We might relate to it personally, recalling where we were when we heard about it. We could even have a theory about it.

title: Zika Virus Causes Birth Defects, Health Officials Confirm
description: Officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Wednesday that there was now enough evidence to definitively say that the Zika virus could cause unusually small heads and brain damage in infants born to infected mothers.

title: In Photos, ISIS Shows How Brussels Terror Originated in Syria
description: Somewhere, there is a digital archive containing the portraits of the Islamic States network of fighters in Europe. The image of each fighter was stored in this database months before last years attacks in Paris, and after each new terror strike, the group has reached into it and released the photographs. So it was on Wednesday.

title: Atltico Madrid Eliminates Barcelona in Champions League
description: MADRID  Barcelona began the month of April looking, once again, to be the dominant team in Europe. It had comfortably dispatched Arsenal in the round of 16 in the Champions League and held a clear lead in the battle to win La Liga. It was on a 39-match unbeaten run, and Lionel Messi, the No. 1 player on its star-stuffed roster, was on the verge of scoring his 500th goal.

title: Judge Says New York Times Reporter Cant Be Compelled to Testify at Baby Hope Hearing
description: A state judge ruled on Wednesday that a reporter for The New York Times could not be forced to testify at a pretrial hearing about her jailhouse interview with a man accused of killing the toddler known as Baby Hope.

title: Changing of the Guard: The Designer Shakeup at Major Fashion Houses
description: A roundup of some of the designers leaving menswear labels and moving onto others.

title: Why Is the Mens Fashion Industry in Such Turmoil?
description: Lately, the Chicken Littles of fashion are reading dire omens into a cluster of design world shake-ups. Coming soon after changes at the top at Dior, Lanvin and Balenciaga, startling personnel shifts at prominent mens wear brands have left some in the industry wandering around dazed, waiting to be smacked with a piece of falling sky.

title: The Vermont Product Every New Yorker Is Packing
description: Hillary Clintons effort to lash Bernie Sanders to New York gun crimes was days in the making. She finally dropped her bombshell on Monday: Heres what I want you to know. Most of the guns that are used in crimes and violence and killings in New York come from out of state, Mrs. Clinton told a panel in New York.

title: Theranos Under Fire as U.S. Threatens Crippling Sanctions
description: Federal regulators have threatened a series of stiff sanctions against Theranos, the embattled blood-testing company, including closing down its flagship laboratory and potentially barring its chief executive from owning or operating its labs for two years.

title: Party of South Koreas President Loses Majority in Parliament
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korean voters handed President Park Geun-hyes party a surprising setback on Wednesday, stripping it of a majority in Parliament as her government faces a sluggish economy and a growing nuclear threat from North Korea.

title: Ex-President of Argentina Attacks Her Foes at Court Hearing
description: BUENOS AIRES  Former President Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner testified in a Buenos Aires court on Wednesday as part of an investigation into allegations of misdeeds at Argentinas Central Bank during the last months of her administration.

title: Review: Duran Duran, Seriously Light in Brooklyn
description: Simon Le Bon promised a set of politics-free entertainment and just pure fun during Duran Durans concert at Barclays Center in Brooklyn on Tuesday night. But that was after the band had opened the show with Paper Gods, the title song of its 2015 album and an indictment of the power of money and how all the fools in town are ruling today. Lest anyone miss the message amid the dance beat, the video backdrop included lyrics.

title: Blood at the Root Draws Inspiration From the Jena Six Case in Louisiana
description: Dominique Morisseau knows where the truth lies, and it is rarely on solid ground. This fast-rising playwright takes on charged issues, from downsizing to drugs, without ever turning pundit or polemicist. Instead, in plays that include this seasons vibrant Skeleton Crew (which returns in May to the Atlantic Theater Company), she carefully uncovers shades of moral ambiguity among economically beleaguered African-Americans.

title: Review: Indian Dance Amid a Luxury Store Backdrop
description: Where gods go to shop is not the advertising slogan for Brookfield Place, a high-end mall in Lower Manhattan. But the phrase struck me as a possible caption for an incongruous sight there on Tuesday at 5 p.m., when five women in richly colored saris, laden with bangles and jewels, entered the malls vast Winter Garden atrium and waited. Bells on their ankles jingled each time their bare feet slapped the cold marble floor, as they proceeded to dance amid palm trees and otherwise-occupied consumers against the background of luxury stores.

title: Les Arts Florissants Bring Opra-Ballet Back to Life
description: Popular forms of entertainment can fade from view so thoroughly that they are almost never seen again. Masques. Commedia dellarte. Decent Hollywood romantic comedy.

title: Review: A New J Dilla Album Provides Historical Imagination
description: The Diary

title: Review: Cate Le Bon Evokes Pop Outliers
description: Crab Day

title: The Abortion Map Today
description: IN his smart opinion piece last week, A Mason-Dixon Line of Progress, Timothy Egan noted the retreat to bigotry sweeping across the old South as politicians clinging to the past (under the banner of religious freedom) line up to authorize discrimination against gay people. The column prompted me to think about whether the battlegrounds in the never-ending abortion wars display a similar geographic concentration.

title: Review: A Santana Sequel, 45 Years After
description: Santana IV

title: Review: On a MATA Festival Program, Burps, Belches, Paranoia
description: Ive heard contemporary music performed on all manner of instruments. But until Tuesday night at Scandinavia House, in the first full program of the 18th annual MATA Festival, I had never heard a vocalist belch, burp and stutter his way through a fractured recomposition of Im Forever Blowing Bubbles.

title: Boutique Cinemas Offer More than Popcorn and Snacks
description: On a quiet Sunday night in Bushwick, Brooklyn, a few dozen scruffy men and slim women in their 20s gathered inside a converted warehouse, ordering locally brewed pints around a marble-topped bar.

title: For $10, New York City Students See Hamilton and Rap for Lin-Manuel Miranda
description: Hamilton has won acclaim for its fresh take on a familiar chapter of American history: the revolutionary era. But what if the musical were told from the perspective of Hamiltons angry wife or a self-assured King George?

title: A Step Forward on FGM
description: This is an exciting post to write because it concerns a positive milestone in the long, harsh history of the practice widely known as female genital mutilation.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Syria, Verizon, Kobe Bryant
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: HBOs Confirmation Revisits Anita Hill, Clarence Thomas and Drama in the Senate
description: Television is in the midst of a 1990s craze  with a tabloid flair.

title: Lawyers in FIFA Corruption Case Argue Over Possible Trial Date
description: Displaying the significant resources that have been put toward the Justice Departments investigation of corruption in international soccer, eight federal prosecutors and 15 defense lawyers appeared before a judge on Wednesday to discuss bringing the case to trial early next year.

title: As Takata Costs Soar in Airbag Recall, Files Show Early Worries on Financial Toll
description: There is the cold-eyed calculation of the costs of an airbag recall: $100 each, translating to millions of dollars in expenses for Takata, the auto parts supplier.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Sights and Sounds at a Sanders Rally
description: The scene at Senator Bernie Sanderss political rally in New York Citys Washington Square Park.

title: Takata Email: A Cost Savings Issue
description: Hundreds of pages of internal Takata documents and emails examined by The New York Times reveal new details about how economic pressures helped guide the companys handling of its airbag defect, which has been linked to at least 11 deaths and more than 100 injuries.

title: Bernie Sanders in Washington Square Park
The Cost of Replacement Is $100
description: Hundreds of pages of internal Takata documents and emails examined by The New York Times reveal new details about how economic pressures helped guide the companys handling of its airbag defect, which has been linked to at least 11 deaths and more than 100 injuries.

title: Prepare for Warmer Days at a Naadam Cashmere Pop-Up
description: Ready to finally pack away those winter coats? Naadam Cashmere will have a Spring in Mind pop-up from Thursday to Sunday, selling perfect transitional pieces like a summer-weight travel wrap ($340) and limited-edition Margaux for Tome ankle-tie ballet flats ($345). At 230A Mulberry Street.

title: Matthew Keys Gets 2 Years in Prison in Los Angeles Times Hacking Case
description: A California journalist was sentenced on Wednesday to two years in federal prison for helping to hack the website of The Los Angeles Times in 2010.

title: Teacher Tenure Is Challenged Again in a Minnesota Lawsuit
description: Opening a new front in the assault on teacher tenure, a group of parents backed by wealthy philanthropists served notice to defendants on Wednesday in a lawsuit challenging Minnesotas job protections for teachers, as well as the states rules governing which teachers are laid off as a result of budget cuts.

title: Feminist Supports Sanders
description: Marjorie Kramer says she and other self-described feminists are passionate about Bernie Sanders.

title: A Sanders Supporter Speaks Up
description: One man at a New York rally near Washington Square Park explains why he is supporting Bernie Sanders.

title: National Briefing
description: The legislature sent a bill legalizing medical marijuana to the governor on Wednesday after parents of children with debilitating seizures circulated the Capitol urging lawmakers to act. The House vote, 149 to 46, capped several years of door-to-door lobbying by parents. Calling it historic legislation, Gov. Tom Wolf, a Democrat, said he will sign it Sunday. The bill sets standards for tracking plants, certifying physicians and licensing growers, dispensaries and physicians. Patients could take marijuana in pill, oil, vapor or liquid form but would not be able to legally obtain marijuana to smoke or to grow their own. The Pennsylvania Medical Society opposed the bill, and one opponent, Representative Matt Baker, warned that it violates federal drug laws and that the state would see a drastic impact on addiction and abuse. Meanwhile, in Ohio, lawmakers promised to legalize medical marijuana by the summer, before voters get a chance to decide a ballot question in the fall election. Pennsylvania would be the 24th state to legalize a comprehensive medical marijuana program, according to the National Conference of State Legislatures. (AP)

title: Tensions Ease Between Donald Trump and Party Leader as New York Primary Nears
description: Join us for New York primary live updates.

title: Even Million-Dollar Bugattis Get the Recall Blues
description: For those discerning buyers who purchase the Bugatti Veyron, the cars seven-figure price and single-digit fuel efficiency have never been much of an obstacle.

title: Juan Felipe Herrera Named to Second Term as Poet Laureate
description: Juan Felipe Herrera will serve a second term as the United States poet laureate, the Library of Congress announced. The post, which comes with few set responsibilities, is the countrys highest honor in poetry.

title: Richard Emery, Accused of Sexist Remarks, Quits Police Review Board
description: Richard D. Emery, the chairman of the civilian agency that provides oversight of the New York Police Department, resigned abruptly on Wednesday amid complaints from police unions about his public comments and one day after two agency employees filed a lawsuit accusing him of making sexist remarks.

title: Stronger Bond With Mother Helps Texas Star Follow in Her Footsteps
description: Imani Boyette was recently presented with a carousel figurine by her mother, Pamela McGee. McGees mother had given it to her before McGee entered the W.N.B.A. in 1997, when she was the second pick in the leagues first draft.

title: Flophouse Operator Is Arrested in a Scheme to Defraud Medicaid
description: An operator of flophouses catering to addicts, who was the subject of an investigation last year by The New York Times, was arrested on Wednesday on money laundering and Medicaid fraud charges.

title: Treasury Official Urges Quick Action on Puerto Rico Rescue
description: WASHINGTON  Skeptical lawmakers at the House Natural Resources Committee heard testimony Wednesday on a plan to rescue Puerto Rico, as witnesses warned that only quick action by Congress could keep a bad situation from becoming a lost decade.

title: In West Bank, Israel Imposes Pop-Up Checkpoints and Road Closings
description: AWARTA, West Bank  The freshly spray-painted signs in this hamlet outside Nablus are a symbol of the new normal in the West Bank, seven months into a scattershot wave of Palestinian attacks on Israelis.

title: Motivated by the Spirit of Chris Hondros
description: Bryan Denton, who was transformed by his coverage of the Libyan conflict, has been named the recipient of an award honoring his fallen comrade, the photographer Chris Hondros.

title: U.S. Senators Threaten U.N. Over Sex Abuse by Peacekeepers
description: UNITED NATIONS  Lawmakers on Wednesday used a rare hearing in the United States Senate to excoriate the United Nations secretary general for what they called his failure to stanch sexual abuse by his agencys peacekeepers and threatened to withhold crucial funding not only for the United Nations, but also bilateral aid for countries that fail to hold their soldiers accountable.

title: Juror Imperils Conviction of Peter Liang, Ex-Officer, in Brooklyn Killing
description: One of the biggest police misconduct cases in recent New York history, a criminal proceeding that riveted the city this winter and was swept up in the national debate about race and law enforcement, was threatened on Wednesday by an unusual and unexpected question: Did one of the jurors, a retired carpenter, hide his fathers criminal past in order to be a panelist at the trial?

title: U.S.A. Hockey Has No Need for Miracles Anymore
description: The United States opens play at the under-18 world mens hockey championships in Grand Forks, N.D., on Thursday as the two-time defending champion. In a sport usually dominated by their neighbors to the north, the Americans have won six of the last seven tournaments and have a record 13 medals in the events 17-year history.

title: Presidential Debate Stage in Brooklyn Reflects Changing Economy
description: When Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders take the stage in Brooklyn on Thursday for their ninth Democratic presidential primary debate, they will stand amid a shining example of how the American economy has been reshaped in their lifetimes.

title: Warren Beattys Howard Hughes Film Is Almost Here
description: LOS ANGELES  Forty years in the making, Warren Beattys Howard Hughes film, still untitled, almost has a release date.

title: A Fake Interview With Ukraines President Points to Deeper Intrigue
description: The intrigue began last week when The New York Times received a letter on official-looking stationery marked President of Ukraine.

title: U.S.C. Hires Lynn Swann as Athletic Director
description: Southern California, the college football powerhouse, on Wednesday named the Pro Football Hall of Fame wide receiver and U.S.C. alumnus Lynn Swann as its next athletic director. He will replace Pat Haden, who announced in February that he would step down at the end of June.

title: Hillary Clinton-Bernie Sanders Schism Grows on Too Big to Fail Banks
description: Banks, very big ones, undergird the New York City economy.

title: F.B.I. Used Hacking Software Decade Before iPhone Fight
description: WASHINGTON  In early 2003, F.B.I. agents hit a roadblock in a secret investigation, called Operation Trail Mix. For months, agents had been intercepting phone calls and emails belonging to members of an animal welfare group that was believed to be sabotaging operations of a company that was using animals to test drugs. But encryption software had made the emails unreadable.

title: China to Prosecute Taiwanese in Fraud Case Despite Acquittals in Kenya
description: The Chinese government announced on Wednesday that a group of Taiwanese citizens who were deported to China from Kenya would be prosecuted on charges of telecommunications fraud despite having been acquitted of the same charges by a Kenyan court this month.

title: Senate Votes to Ban Imports of Syrian Art and Antiquities
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate voted on Wednesday to ban the import of virtually all ancient art and artifacts from Syria to discourage the looting and trafficking of illicit objects by the Islamic State and other armed groups.

title: Social Club at Harvard Rejects Calls to Admit Women, Citing Risk of Sexual Misconduct
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Members of the oldest all-male club at Harvard have almost never spoken publicly about the organization since its founding in 1791. This week, that silence was broken when an official with the group, the Porcellian Club, said that admitting women could increase the chances of sexual misconduct.

title: House Members Refuse Washington Subway Systems Plea for More Funds
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans told the leaders of the capitals beleaguered subway system on Wednesday that they would not bail you out, soundly rejecting pleas for more federal funds to support it.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Some of those people are probably never going to take a bath or shower again without some level of fear, given their experience.

title: De Blasios Former Campaign Treasurer Involved in Fund-Raising Inquiry
description: In late 2013, when a man named Jona S. Rechnitz bundled more than $40,000 in donations to help elect Bill de Blasio as New York Citys mayor, Mark G. Peters was the campaign treasurer.

title: Prosecutor to Hold News Conference in Battery Case Against Corey Lewandowski
description: The Palm Beach County state attorney will hold a news conference on Thursday in connection with the battery charge filed in Florida against Corey Lewandowski, Donald J. Trumps campaign manager.

title: U.N. Reports Growing Inequality Among Children in Rich Nations
description: The wealthiest nations are failing the most disadvantaged of their children, the United Nations reported Wednesday in a study that showed widening disparities even between the middle and lowest household income levels.

title: Empire Season 2, Episode 13: Of Family Secrets
description: While last weeks resolution to the Camilla and Mimi saga carried the weight of a Shakespearean tragedy, Episode 13 advanced some plot quirks that have been plaguing us for months. We finally get the full story of how Dwight Walker became Lucious Lyon and all the lurid details of his troubled childhood. He tells it in the Boom Boom Boom Boom video at Cookies urging and screens it for the family at her surprise birthday party.

title: Review: Nathan the Wise Brings a Morality Tale to Today
description: Do not give up too early on Nathan the Wise, an 18th-century morality play by the German writer and scholar Gotthold Ephraim Lessing being presented by the Classic Stage Company in a production starring the estimable F. Murray Abraham. Midway through the first act of this drama about clashes of faith and family, set in 12th-century Jerusalem, I found myself listing toward boredom.

title: Summer Amusements
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Its not often that I suggest that you solve with a bucket nearby, but today that might not be a bad idea. Jason Flinn is back and hes left the water running.

title: Obama Reports Gains, and Momentum, Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Wednesday that while the Islamic State could still inflict horrific violence on the innocent, the United States had made substantial gains in combating the group, reducing its forces to the lowest level in two years and squeezing its cash flow.

title: Suicide by Chemicals Investigated in Off-Campus Housing in Austin
