description: Sheldon Silver, the former State Assembly speaker, offered an emotional apology to the judge who will sentence him next month, saying in a letter filed on Wednesday that he had failed the people of New York.

title: #LaughingWhileBlack Wine Train Lawsuit Is Settled
description: When the women in the Sistahs on the Reading Edge book club were thrown off a train touring Napa Valley wineries last August after they were laughing loudly, accusations of racial bias, a hashtag and headlines soon followed. So did a lawsuit, claiming millions in damages. Now the matter has been settled in mediation, and the women want to move on.

title: Coloring Books for Adults Seeking Playtime
description: Kara Lacey, 33, does it after a long day of work, sometimes accompanied by a glass of wine. Its super-relaxing, fun and nostalgic, said Ms. Lacey, a publicist who lives in Hoboken, N.J.

title: Donald Trump, After Difficult Stretch, Shows a Softer Side
description: It has been a rough few weeks for Donald J. Trump and his team: a bruising loss in Wisconsin, a public campaign shake-up, and some high-profile missteps and gaffes, including his reference to the attacks on the World Trade Center as occurring on 7-11.

title: Supreme Court Rules Iran Bank Must Pay for Terrorist Attacks
description: WASHINGTON  Irans central bank must pay nearly $2 billion to victims of terrorist attacks, the Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday.

title: Ted Cruz Scoffs at Donald Trumps Remarkable Win in His Home State
description: HERSHEY, Pa.  The morning after a crushing defeat, Senator Ted Cruz dismissed Donald J. Trumps garnering of about 60 percent of Republican primary votes in New York as the expected spoils of a home-state advantage.

title: No Phones for You! Chic Businesses Are Abandoning Landlines
description: To New Yorkers, greater Mulberry Street is typically considered NoLIta, unless its northern Chinatown, or to those old enough to remember Sinatra at the Paramount, Little Italy.

title: The Loophole That Could Cost Donald Trump the Nomination
description: Pennsylvania, which holds its primary next Tuesday, uses a nonbinding loophole primary  and that could cost Donald Trump the Republican nomination.

title: Foreign Aid and National Security
description: To the Editor:

title: Bank Overdraft Fees Hit Younger Adults Hardest, Pew Says
description: Younger adults are among those hardest hit by bank overdraft fees, a new report from the Pew Charitable Trusts that was released on Wednesday said.

title: 7 Police Officers Guarding Vaccination Team in Pakistan Are Shot Dead
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Seven police officers keeping watch over a polio vaccination campaign were gunned down in two separate attacks in a suburb of Pakistans southern port city of Karachi on Wednesday, government officials said.

title: Israel Says It Has Uncovered Jewish Extremist Cell in West Bank
description: JERUSALEM  Israel said Wednesday that it had uncovered a new network of Jewish extremists in the West Bank that was responsible for several recent attacks against Palestinians, including the attempted arson of at least one home as people slept inside.

title: New Orleans Police Officers Plead Guilty in Shooting of Civilians
description: NEW ORLEANS  A legal journey that was set off more than a decade ago with the shooting of unarmed citizens by police officers in the desperate days after Hurricane Katrina wound toward a close on Wednesday when five former officers pleaded guilty in federal court to conspiracy, obstruction of justice and civil rights charges.

title: The Meaning of the Matzo
description: To the Editor:

title: A Divide Among Blacks
description: To the Editor:

title: Eagles Acquire No. 2 Overall N.F.L. Draft Pick From Browns
description: PHILADELPHIA  The sweepstakes for a top quarterback continues.

title: Before the Stonewall Uprising, There Was the Sip-In
description: On a bright, warm day 50 years ago this week, three young men went out to have a drink that they hoped would make history.

title: A Fundamental Value
description: To the Editor:

title: 10 Deals for Memorial Day  in Europe
description: Europe for Memorial Day?

title: Grieving and Going Forward: How Zaha Hadids Firm Plans to Move On
description: LONDON  White flowers fill the design gallery, with commemorative portraits placed amid undulating furniture of burnished polyurethane and marble. A condolence book rests on a stand, a construction of memories. In the main studios, nearly 400 employees labor away, deadlines pressing.

title: Being a Female Architect in a Male-Dominated Field
description: To the Editor:

title: New Yorkers Favor the Front-Runners
description: To the Editor:

title: In an Age of Terror, an Early Start on the Presidential Transition
description: WASHINGTON  At a luxurious hilltop estate with sweeping vistas of the Hudson River, an adviser to President Obama began meeting on Wednesday with aides to the candidates vying to replace him to make the first, early preparations for the day when Mr. Obama leaves office.

title: Group Backing Hillary Clinton Begins Reserving $125 Million in Ads for the Fall
description: A super PAC supporting Hillary Clinton said on Wednesday that it had collected $11.8 million dollars in March and had $44.7 million in cash on hand.

title: Theranos Under Pressure as Inquiries Mount
description: The news that the blood-testing company Theranos is being investigated by the Justice Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission brings to mind the adage that if something sounds too good to be true, it probably is.

title: Airplanes and Babies: Readers Weigh In
description: An article by Dr. Perri Klass about flying with small children, Fear of Crying: The Problem of Babies and Airplanes, touched a nerve with Well readers. More than 600 readers weighed in, with responses ranging from compassion to indignation. Here is an edited selection.

title: Donald Trump Reaches Out to Gov. Mike Pence Before Indiana Primary
description: Donald J. Trump met privately with Gov. Mike Pence of Indiana at his residence on Wednesday afternoon, two weeks before the primary in a state that Senator Ted Cruzs campaign sees as crucial to its efforts to capture the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Hillary Clinton, With Connecticut Ally, Highlights Gun Control Stance
description: As the primary calendar turns to Connecticut, the Clinton campaign has enlisted a powerful new surrogate who has cut both a 30-second and 60-second ad for the campaign: a daughter of Dawn Hochsprung, the principal killed at Sandy Hook Elementary School.

title: Supreme Court Upholds Arizonas Redrawn Legislative Map
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday unanimously upheld an Arizona state legislative map drawn by an independent redistricting commission, rejecting a challenge from Republicans who said the map was too favorable to Democrats.

title: Mexico Citys Best Cocktail Bars
description: We used to drink mezcal and beer, but now were really into cocktails, says Mafer Tejada, a bartender at Mexico Citys Licorera Limantour, of the trend sweeping her hometown. Following in the footsteps of boundary-pushing chefs like Enrique Olvera of Pujol, the Mexican haute cuisine restaurant that currently occupies the 16th position on the list of the worlds 50 best, mixologists across Mexico City are also making their mark through artful presentations, unusual ingredients and unique bar design. Here, a shortlist of the citys most exceptional places to imbibe.

title: The Democrats Misguided Kasich Strategy
description: As Wednesdayseditorialpredicted,New Yorks presidential primary results brought renewed calls for Bernie Sanders and John Kasich, the Democratic and Republican underdogs, to withdraw from the race.

title: Donald Trumps Jet Is Grounded by the F.A.A.
description: Donald J. Trumps Cessna jet has been grounded.

title: Leader of Syria Rescue Group, Arriving in U.S. for Award, Is Refused Entry
description: UNITED NATIONS  The leader of a Western-backed rescue organization that searches for survivors of bombings in Syria was denied entry into the United States this week, where he was to receive an award recognizing his contributions to humanitarian relief.

title: Down to Lunch Founders Pursue Less-Traveled Path to App Success
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Nikil Viswanathan and Joseph Lau have built the hottest new social app in America. Now the young men have to keep it from getting crushed by an anonymous slander campaign, overwhelmed servers and their urge to personally respond to thousands of messages from users.

title: Katy Pyle and Her Misfits of Ballet
description: Ballet is extreme. Thats exactly why the choreographer Katy Pyle loves it.

title: After Girls, Lil Freckles Raps About Life as a Brooklyn Millennial
description: Name Lil Freckles

title: Review: How Streisand Became a Symbol, by Neal Gabler
description: What a revelation it must have been to see Barbra Streisand for the first time in a nightclub or onstage. Her vowels were nasal, her patois unmistakably Brooklyn; she had a gorgeous, frankly Semitic face. Then she became a movie star. To families stocked with Barbras, including my own, the very sight of her on a huge screen was exhilarating. She represented the way we were.

title: Chinas Smaller Cities Struggle to Cultivate an Interest in Classical Music
description: BEIJING  After more than a decade as the worlds great hope for classical music, China is suffering growing pains.

title: A Math Biopic, With Dev Patel, Applies a Different Calculus
description: As mathematicians go, Srinivasa Ramanujan isnt exactly a household name. But his genius  the ability to divine formulas seemingly from thin air that, a century later, are informing computer development, economics and the study of black holes  has long captivated academics and artists alike.

title: Boko Haram and ISIS Are Collaborating More, U.S. Military Says
description: NDJAMENA, Chad  American military officials say that two of the worlds most feared terrorist groups  the Islamic State and Boko Haram  have begun to collaborate more closely, raising alarm that they are working together to attack American allies in North and Central Africa.

title: For Its Star, Dheepan Was the Role of His Lifetime
description: PARIS  In Dheepan, the latest film by the French director Jacques Audiard, a migrant from a war-torn land borrows a passport and makes his way to France, where he seeks asylum. It is also loosely the story of the films star, Antonythasan Jesuthasan, a writer and former leftist militant from Sri Lanka, who arrived in France in 1993 with a fake French passport, eventually receiving refugee status.

title: Russia Bolsters Its Submarine Fleet, and Tensions With U.S. Rise
description: NAPLES, Italy  Russian attack submarines, the most in two decades, are prowling the coastlines of Scandinavia and Scotland, the Mediterranean Sea and the North Atlantic in what Western military officials say is a significantly increased presence aimed at contesting American and NATO undersea dominance.

title: An Energy Bill in Need of Fixes
description: The Senate voted Wednesday to approve an energy bill that contains provisions encouraging land conservation, renewable energy and improved efficiency. It also includes bad ideas that would harm the environment, particularly a provision that would encourage the burning of trees to generate electricity.

title: Paulette Tavorminas Seizing Beauty
description: The photographers carefully composed images are inspired by  and closely resemble  old master paintings.

title: Vivid Images That Arent Old Masters  but Look Just Like Them
description: The photographer Paulette Tavormina began her professional career working with antiques, food styling and photographing works of art for an auction house. Shes also spent many years collecting bits and pieces  the insects, objects and flowers that fill her studio  from markets and little shops. Her new book Seizing Beauty, out next week, took six years to photograph and brings together all these experiences: It features 65 sumptuous color images inspired by old master still lifes. (The books release coincides with a show at the Academy Art Museum in Easton, Md., which opens April 23.)

title: German Court Rules Antiterrorism Laws Partly Unconstitutional
description: BERLIN  At a time when Europe fears more terrorist attacks and the United States is urging European intelligence services to cooperate more closely, Germanys highest court on Wednesday ruled that critical antiterrorism laws were partly unconstitutional and demanded tighter control over surveillance.

title: Worth the Price of 92 Admissions: Entry Into a Stadium Fan Club
description: The list includes ramshackle old stadiums, scented and scarred with century-old reminders of English soccers storied past, but also the gleaming cathedrals that testify to the Premier Leagues rich new present.

title: Bossy With a Punch: Jackets for the Office Get a Makeover
description: Plus: Workout leggings you can customize, from Alala; a new handbag label you should know about; a Walter Van Beirendonck "watch" that puts a cool spin on bling; and more.

title: 3 Other Mothers, My Intimate Network
description: BEIJING  During the early morning tumult of getting the children ready for school, my gaze falls for a split second on a photograph on the refrigerator of three middle-aged Chinese women who have all helped raise my children over the last 13 years.

title: Katie Holmes, Chlo Sevigny and Plenty of Chanel at Tribeca Film Festival Dinner
description: Were all whores, Chlo Sevigny said Monday night, standing in Balthazar at a dinner Monday night for the Tribeca Film Festival, as she discussed her outfit.

title: Pariss First Concept Pastry Shop
description: Earlier this month, Julie Mathieu and Muriel Tallandier opened a physical extension of their bimonthly French pastry magazine, Fou de Ptisserie: a new, namesake sliver of a shop on the pedestrian rue Montorgueil, where nothing is made on site  the duo has tapped leading chefs all around the city to deliver their best sweets daily. As inconceivable as it may seem that a pastry-dense city like Paris wouldnt already have its own concept store, Fou de Ptisserie boutique is effectively an industry first.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Between the Bars
description: In this weeks episode of the Modern Love Podcast, the actor Joshua Jackson (The Affair, Dawsons Creek) reads Joshua Fattals 2014 essay, Reaching Out Between the Bars. Mr. Fattal was one of three Americans, along with Shane Bauer and Sarah Shourd, who were detained in Iran for 26 months after unknowingly crossing over an unmarked border of Iraqi Kurdistan into Iranian Kurdistan during a hiking trip in 2009.

title: Florida Says Firm Didnt Illegally Try to Influence Attorney General
description: A former Washington law firm and one of its top partners did not violate Floridas lobbying laws when appealing to the state attorney general, Pam Bondi, and her staff on behalf of corporate clients, the Florida Commission on Ethics has concluded after a 16-month investigation.

title: A Legendary Fashion Photographer, Revisited
description: When the photographer Louise Dahl-Wolfe was hired at Harpers Bazaar in 1936, fashion photography as we think of it today hardly existed. As she recalled years later, at the beginning of her career there werent really fashion photographers, just artists like Steichen, who just happened to do fashion photography. Dahl-Wolfe worked as a principal photographer at Bazaar  alongside its editor in chief Carmel Snow, the art director Alexey Brodovich and fashion editor Diana Vreeland  for 22 years, and played a large role in redefining the form: pioneering a shift away from stiff society portraits to a more natural and relaxed style of photography.

title: The Work of Louise Dahl-Wolfe
description: The photographer is the subject of a new book, out with Aperture this month.

title: Proof & Gauge, a Long Island City Bar, Makes Its Own Gin
description: Chris Murillo, 36, was a corporate lawyer and a cocktail connoisseur when, four years ago on New Years Eve, he got the kind of idea that comes only after midnight and a few drinks. I decided to start the first craft distillery in Queens, he said. After sitting in an office for nine years, I finally needed to do something where I worked with my hands and got out and interacted with people.

title: Six of Fou de Ptisseries First Pastries
description: A look at some of the new Paris concept shops early offerings.

title: Eyeing Tonys, Shuffle Along Hopes to Be Classified a Revival
description: The Music Box Theater on Broadway has been packing in the crowds for weeks, with theatergoers eager to see a starry but unfamiliar musical, Shuffle Along, even as that jazz-and-tap show is still being revised in previews.

title: Dont You Forget About Me! The Formerly Irredeemable 80s Return
description: Six nights and two afternoons a week, the synthesizers blare, the lights flash and the strains of Tears for Fears are heard over Broadway.

title: Teenager Sentenced to 14 Years in Chinatown Rape
description: One of three teenagers who slipped out of a group home and raped a woman in a Manhattan stairwell was sentenced to 14 years in prison on Wednesday after he gave a short apology in court.

title: Former Journalist Steps In to Claim His Half of a Pulitzer
description: Dude, wheres my Pulitzer?

title: What Is Sanderss Endgame?
description: Hillary Clintons commanding victory in New York on Tuesday put yet another nail in the coffin of Bernie Sanderss candidacy.

title: Get to Know the Historical Figures on the $5, $10 and $20 Bills
description: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department announced Wednesday that women will be incorporated into new designs for the $5, $10 and $20 bills. Here is a look at the new lineup.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Day After Triumph, Donald Trump Struggles to Stick to a More Refined Message
description: Basking in the glow of an overwhelming victory in his home state, Donald J. Trump on Tuesday night seemed  dare we say it  almost presidential, or at least a bit more refined.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Elizabeth II, Harriet Tubman
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: From Hollywood Son to Dean & DeLuca Investor
description: I cant quite believe Im involved in this, said Charles Finch, standing before a shelf of imported olive oils at Dean & DeLuca in SoHo on a recent evening. He had the beaming face of a kid in a candy store. Or rather, a kid who runs the candy store.

title: 5 Bridal Trends for Spring 2017
description: Victorian-inspired gowns, capelets, trousers, exposed shoulder and more

title: In New Bridal Collections, Designers Look to the Runways
description: This season, bridal designers plucked many of their most arresting ideas from the recent ready-to-wear runways. The spring 2017 collections, shown last week, mirrored a diversity of trends that first made a splash on the catwalks of New York, London, Paris and Milan.

title: Some Good Credit News for the Met Opera
description: The Metropolitan Opera, which has been cutting costs in recent years to address its serious fiscal challenges, got a measure of good news on Wednesday when Standard & Poors affirmed the companys A credit rating and revised its outlook to stable from negative.

title: New York City Ballet Casts a Singular Luster in Jewels
description: New York City Ballet opened its six-week spring season at the David H. Koch Theater with George Balanchines tripartite Jewels on Tuesday evening. Nine of the companys principals took part. The dancing of Tiler Peck and Amar Ramasar (Emeralds) and Sara Mearns, partnered superbly by Tyler Angle, (Diamonds) was lustrous, while that of the smaller-scaled Megan Fairchild and Gonzalo Garcia (Rubies) took them to fresh personal peaks of boldness. Teresa Reichlen, returning to the Rubies soloist role, achieved once more a standard that must make you wonder if the role has been better danced before or will be again.

title: Artists Fight to Get Works Back From Ace Gallery
description: LOS ANGELES  Lawsuits by artists and collectors, seeking the return of consigned works, demanding profits, or both, have never stopped Douglas Chrismas, the founder of Ace Gallery, from doing business. An early champion of trailblazers like Robert Irwin, Richard Serra and Michael Heizer, Mr. Chrismas has spent nearly 50 years helping to start or jump-start the careers of artists here, even as he was scrutinized for sometimes failing to pay when works sold.

title: Review: American Visions, a Graceful Take on Race, Patriotism and Longing
description: American Visions was the title of the concert the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center presented at Alice Tully Hall on Tuesday, the evening of the New York primaries. I dont know if this was a result of shrewd planning or mere coincidence. But the program touched on hotly contested themes like patriotism, race and the legacy of slavery  and did so with a degree of subtlety and grace not often seen in politics.

title: Obama in Saudi Arabia, Exporter of Oil and Bigotry
description: A college senior boarded a flight and excitedly called his family to recount a United Nations event he had attended, but, unfortunately, he was speaking Arabic. Southwest Airlines kicked him off the plane, in the sixth case reported in the United States this year in which a Muslim was ejected from a flight.

title: 2 Stars Rejoin Bucharest Operas Ballet Company After Clash
description: The crisis roiling the ballet company of the Bucharest National Opera in recent weeks rippled not only through the international dance world but through Romanian politics as well. And ultimately it was a government-brokered plan that paved the way for the return on Wednesday of the companys two biggest stars: its artistic director, Johan Kobborg, and the dancer Alina Cojocaru, who both resigned this month after clashing with management over the direction of the company.

title: Review: ASAP Fergs Big Heart Pulses on Always Strive and Prosper
description: Always Strive and Prosper

title: Review: Ralph Peterson Jr. Powers a Runaway Freight Train
description: TriAngular III

title: Review: The Strumbellas Show Off Roots Both Dark and Sunny on Hope
description: Hope

title: Review: Exploring Womens Lives in When I Was a Girl I Used to Scream and Shout
description: The Fallen Angels Theater Companys revival of Sharman Macdonalds 1984 play, When I Was a Girl I Used to Scream and Shout, deep-dives into the psyches of its largely female characters. And while youll feel cleansed by the healing conclusion, getting there requires immersion in a churning sea of teenage sexuality, parental expectations and maternal sacrifice.

title: Observe Earth Day With a Nature Takeover in Times Square
description: On Thursday night, head to Times Square for a nature takeover from 11:30 p.m. to midnight. The electronic billboards will display Jungle-ized, a multisensory art installation directed by Stephan Crasneanscki of Soundwalk Collective and co-produced by the eco-adventurer David de Rothschild that promises to transform the concrete jungle into the heart of the Amazon. Mr. de Rothschild also has some nifty limited-edition items on The Lost Explorer website, including a palm-print market bag ($145) made from a World War II Royal Air force tool bag reworked with end-of-line vintage fabrics. At thelostexplorer.co.

title: Tubmans In. Jacksons Out. Whats It Mean?
description: The United States is adding a few new faces to its currency. Harriet Tubman will appear on the front of a new $20 bill to be unveiled in 2020, and a pair of civil rights scenes, one featuring suffragist leaders, will appear on the backs of redesigned $5 and $10 bills, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.

title: Hearing Aid Prices Under Pressure From Consumer Electronics
description: PHOENIX  At the Audiology Now! convention here last week, visitors stood next to blowing electric fans to experience how a new hearing aid could screen out wind noise. They donned goggles to attend a virtual reality dinner party to learn how new technology made it easier to hear conversations around them.

title: Some Meteorites Are Million-Dollar Finds, Others Are Meteorwrongs
description: This polished sphere was fashioned from a meteorite that crash-landed into a dry riverbed in Russia. On Wednesday it soared again, not through space but at an auction house, snagging $130,000  nine times its asking price.

title: After He Was Beaten, Rikers Inmate Was Sent to the Box
description: Jahmal Lightfoots suffering did not end with a brutal beating at the hands of Rikers Island correction officers who wanted to teach him a lesson.

title: Social Chatter: Tubman on the 20
description: The Treasury announced that instead of a woman replacing Alexander Hamilton on the $10 bill, Harriet Tubman would replace Andrew Jackson on the much more widely circulated $20 bill.

title: Viacoms Woes May Deepen in Standoff With Dish Network
description: On one level, the dispute between Dish Network and Viacom that brought the companies to the brink of a television blackout on Wednesday resembles others that have become relatively routine in the industry and a common annoyance for customers.

title: Curt Schilling, ESPN Analyst, Is Fired Over Offensive Social Media Post
description: Curt Schilling, a former All-Star pitcher and one of the highest-profile baseball analysts on ESPN, was fired from the network Wednesday, a day after he drew intense criticism for promoting offensive commentary on social media.

title: Transgender Students Win on Restroom Rights
description: A federal appellate ruling on Tuesday protecting the right of transgender students to use restrooms according to their gender identity is an important marker in a national debate that has prompted battles in courtrooms and legislatures across the country.

title: 2 New York Detectives Indicted in Beating of Mail Carrier
description: Two New York City police detectives have been charged with beating a uniformed Postal Service employee in Queens in October, according to an indictment released on Wednesday. The mail carrier has said that the police have harassed him since 2014, when he gave street directions to a stranger who then killed two police officers.

title: Official Says Reign of Terror Is Over for the Ninja Burglar
description: He became known as the Ninja Burglar, an elusive figure who stoked fears in some of Staten Islands most affluent neighborhoods by sneaking into homes, usually with his entire body covered, except for his eyes. He would grab jewelry, money and the occasional designer handbag, the authorities said, often while residents were still at home.

title: For the Rangers or Against, Carl Hagelin Plays His Heroic Role
description: Carl Hagelin was apparently too focused on carrying the puck up the ice for the Pittsburgh Penguins in the opening minutes of Tuesdays playoff game at Madison Square Garden to notice that he was being booed  as if he were a villain.

title: Kelly Ripas Absence From Live Points to Rancor at ABC
description: It seemed like an innocent enough announcement: Michael Strahan, the former football player turned television personality, was shifting assignments on ABCs morning lineup, the network said Tuesday. He would leave Live With Kelly and Michael in September to become a co-anchor on Good Morning America.

title: Jackie Carter, Who Pushed for Racial Diversity in Childrens Books, Dies at 62
description: Jackie Carter, a publishing executive who promoted in childrens books the racial diversity she had missed growing up in a mostly white neighborhood, died on April 13 in Manhattan. She was 62.

title: Bernie Sanders Has Trickier, Narrower Road in Democratic Race
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont grappled with tough and narrowing choices about campaign strategy and fund-raising on Wednesday after his crushing loss in the New York primary and with a series of difficult contests ahead.

title: AEG Closer to Seizing New York Concert Industry With Bowery Deal
description: The booming concert industry, already dominated by two corporate powers, is getting even more consolidated.

title: Volkswagen Deal on Emissions Cheating in U.S. Is Expected
description: Volkswagen is close to completing a deal to resolve claims in the United States over its admission that it rigged vehicles to cheat on pollution tests, according to three people involved in the case.

title: Library of Congress Nominee Gets Senate Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  A prominent Obama administration nominee was extended a courtesy Wednesday that has become increasingly rare this election year: a Senate hearing.

title: National Briefing
description: Plans to build a $3.3 billion natural gas pipeline from New York into New England through western Massachusetts and southern New Hampshire have been suspended. Kinder Morgan Inc. of Houston announced Wednesday it had decided to stop work on the project, citing a lack of contracts with gas distribution companies. It also said New England states have not established needed regulatory procedures to allow it to move forward. The company said that given the market conditions, continuing to develop the pipeline is an unacceptable use of its shareholder funds. The project has been met with skepticism and opposition, both from residents along the proposed path of the pipeline and from environmental groups that welcomed Wednesdays decision to halt work.(AP)

title: Survivors of the Armenian Genocide
description: Nazik Armenakyan has made it her mission to document the dwindling number of people who survived the Armenian genocide a century ago.

title: C.I.A. to Pay Death Benefits to Relatives of Terror Victims
description: WASHINGTON  For almost two years, the family of Glen Doherty, a C.I.A. contractor and former Navy SEAL who was among four Americans killed in the 2012 terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya, has fought to claim the government death benefits they believe Mr. Doherty deserved.

title: Pearl Washington, 52, Dies; Dazzling Guard Put Syracuse on Basketball Map
description: Dwayne Washington, better known as Pearl, a charismatic point guard who achieved legend status as a Brooklyn schoolboy before moving upstate, where he helped lift Syracuse University to national prominence in basketball, died on Wednesday in the Bronx. He was 52.

title: A Guard Out of Brooklyn Inspired Wonder and Fond Memories
description: Elmer Anderson got the news early Wednesday morning. His former high school teammate, soul mate and friend, Dwayne Washington  known far and wide as Pearl  had died.

title: Trending at Halftime: N.B.A. Players Checking Their Phones
description: The professional sports locker room is a sanctuary, a place that is supposed to be free of outside distractions. At halftime of an N.B.A. game, for instance, players sit attentively, absorbing the coachs instructions. They rehydrate, and maybe even change into a fresh uniform. Their focus for those 15 minutes rests entirely on what must be done in the second half to win the game.

title: Senators Consider Funding Plan to Address Zika Threat
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate may be nearing an agreement on emergency funding to respond to the growing threat from the Zika virus, marking a potential reversal by Republicans who had been reluctant to approve more aid.

title: Speed Hurts: Jeff Passan Talks About Baseballs Arm Troubles
description: Tommy John first pitched in the major leagues when he was 20. He retired at 46, having won 288 games, the seventh-highest total for a left-handed pitcher in baseball history. But hes a household name today not for what he did on the mound, but for what was done to him on an operating table. In 1974, he underwent what is now known as Tommy John surgery, an experimental (at the time) procedure to repair his ulnar collateral ligament (UCL). The elbow injury is now so common that about a quarter of big-league pitchers have had the surgery  some returning from it more successfully than others.

title: Who Controls the New York State Senate? Its Complicated.
description: ALBANY  Democrats awoke on Wednesday tantalizingly close to having a numerical majority in the State Senate, claiming victory in the Long Island district vacated by Dean G. Skelos, the former Republican majority leader convicted of federal corruption charges in December.

title: M.T.A. Spending Plan Restores Funding for 2nd Ave. Subway
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys board approved a new version of its long-delayed capital plan on Wednesday, allocating money for system upgrades and expansion projects and restoring funding for the next phase of the Second Avenue subway line.

title: New York Attorney General Opens Inquiry Into Primary Day Complaints
description: The New York State attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, announced on Wednesday that his office was opening an investigation into potential voting irregularities during the presidential primary on Tuesday, when New York Citys Board of Elections found itself besieged by complaints that it had dropped thousands of Democratic voters from the rolls in Brooklyn, among other issues.

title: Not Sold on TV
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  The English language is quirky, to say the least, especially when it comes to pronunciation. Todays puzzle by Alex Bajcz highlights how forgiving it can be as well.

title: Iran Not Seeking Entry to U.S. Financial System, Envoy Says
description: Irans foreign minister on Wednesday disputed suggestions that Iran now wanted access to the American financial system as part of the nuclear accord, which has not yet yielded the economic infusion that Iranians foresaw after the deal took effect in January.

title: William M. Gray, Hurricane Predictor and Climate Change Skeptic, Dies at 86
description: William M. Gray, whose pioneering research helped him make hurricane predictions for three decades and allowed the East Coast and the Caribbean to gird for their fury, died on Saturday in Fort Collins, Colo. He was 86.

title: Circuitous Path Leads to a Higher Ground
description: We think of the opt-out clause as an escape hatch, a way for a free agent to break one lucrative contract and seek another. At Class AAA, though, the opt-out clause is a ticket to opportunity  a lottery ticket, really, a gamble with uncertain odds.

title: Frederick Mayer, Jew Who Spied on Nazis After Fleeing Germany, Dies at 94
description: Frederick Mayer, who as a German Jew fled Nazi Germany for Brooklyn as a teenager in 1938, only to parachute back into Nazi-controlled Austria seven years later as an American spy on an improbable secret mission, died on April 15 in Charles Town, W.Va. He was 94.

title: The Americans Season 4, Episode 6: Can Anyone Be Trusted?
description: The Americans gave us what we wanted on Wednesday night  well, what a lot of us wanted, I suspect. The episode, The Rat, was the apotheosis of Martha Hanson. (Until next week, anyway.) The mousy secretary was the most important person onscreen. The F.B.I. sent bulletins across the country because of her while the Rezidentura prepared a sudden exfiltration to Moscow. She was so important, it turned out, that Arkady couldnt even tell his people what shed been doing. (Will the disaffected Oleg get involved, one way or another, in Marthas fate?)

title: Late Base-Running Blunder Adds to Yankees Frustrations on Offense
description: Nathan Eovaldi witnessed a series of unlikely events Wednesday at Yankee Stadium during his third start of the season, but one increasingly common occurrence  the Yankees failing to produce with runners in scoring position  left him on the wrong side of a 5-2 loss to the Oakland Athletics.

title: Panthers Tie Series as Defensemans Goal Decides Game
description: The Islanders came into Game 4 with a chance to go up by three games to one on the Florida Panthers, a postseason situation the franchise has not experienced since 1993.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We are not quite back in a Cold War. But I sure can see one from where Im standing.

title: In Extras for the First Time This Season, the Mets Bullpen Falters
description: It took 14 games for the Mets to encounter extra innings this season and when they did, on Wednesday night, the result was not a happy one. They lost, 5-4, in Philadelphia, with reliever Hansel Robles surrendering the winning run in the bottom of the 11th on a two-out infield hit by Peter Bourjos.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | jabber
description: jabber  \ja-br\  verb and noun

title: Timberwolves Hire Tom Thibodeau as Coach
description: Tom Thibodeau, who spent the past season on a basketball sabbatical, agreed Wednesday to become the coach and president of basketball operations of the Minnesota Timberwolves, a team with one of the N.B.A.s more intriguing and precocious cores.

title: Corrections: April 21, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats On Thursday
description: Inside Amy Schumer goes gutsy  and patriotic  as Ms. Schumer raps for Lin-Manuel Miranda. Pras Michel, of the Fugees, helps his friend Michel Martelly win election as president of Haiti. And take your pick of swoonworthy leading men in dueling versions of Pride and Prejudice.

title: E.C.B. Stands Pat at Meeting, but It Explores Next Options
description: FRANKFURT  The European Central Bank left its main interest rates and stimulus tools unchanged at its meeting on Thursday, with its president forcefully arguing that the banks aggressive monetary policy moves had bolstered economic growth and warded off negative inflation in the eurozone.

title: Behind Mitsubishis Faked Data, Fierce Competition
description: TOKYO  In most of the world, few consumers even know microcars exist. But in Japan, the tiny vehicles, whose fuel consumption is as small as their price tags, are a crucial battleground for domestic automakers.

title: Survivors of the Armenian Genocide
description: Nazik Armenakyan has spent the last decade in a desperate race against death: She has been scouring Armenia searching for survivors of the Armenian genocide. She is determined to photograph them and provide an enduring document of their experiences a century ago.

title: Why Mass Incarceration Doesnt Pay
description: Washington  THE growth in the nations prison population has been nothing short of staggering. The United States incarceration rate is now more than four times the world average, with about 2.2 million people in prisons and jails. Of those, roughly 200,000 are federal inmates, double the number from 20 years ago. This substantial increase occurred even as violent crime was falling sharply.

title: Overtime Pay: A Lifeline for the Overworked American
description: THIS summer the Department of Labor is expected to introduce new rules to restore overtime pay to millions of Americans  rules that require no congressional approval. From the fearful protests coming from Republican leadership, youd think the sky was falling. This mandate on employers will hurt the lowest paid American workers the most, by reducing their opportunities for a promotion or a better job, said Senator Lamar Alexander of Tennessee, the chairman of the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee.

title: The Democrats After Sanders
description: Before the Bernie Sanders crusade, whose dream of victory was extinguished in New Yorks primary on Tuesday, the future of the Democratic Party seemed likely to resemble the final six years of the Obama era, only more so: a party increasingly ideological and left-wing on social issues and more incrementalist and technocratic in the economic realm.

title: The Pentagon Insults Its Afghan Victims
description: The American military has often put a price on the lives of civilians it has killed in Iraq and Afghanistan. By making so-called condolence payments  which range from a few hundred dollars to tens of thousands  commanders have sought to compensate victims families for dead relatives, injuries and damaged property.

title: How Donald Trump Could Win the Nomination Outright
description: After a forceful win in New York, Donald Trump has a narrow but real path to 1,237 delegates, the number required to avoid a contested convention.

title: Bankers in the Age of Bernie: Do They Need Camouflage?
description: He came, he lost, but his rhetoric continues.

title: Fractured: A First Date
description: I was going out. I deserved it. Id had lunch  one Diet Coke, two Marlboro Lights and a Chefs Signature Lean Cuisine. Id even done two luxurious miles in 24 minutes on the treadmill at the gym down the block. My stomach growled, angry for being empty, but I felt thin and attractive. Theres nothing more dangerous than a girl who feels thin and attractive.

title: News Qs | Women Sweep Redesigns of $5, $10 and $20 Bills
description: The following lesson activity is based on the article Change for a $20: Tubman Ousts Jackson.

title: If Police Stairwell Shooting Was Accidental, Circumstances Around It Were Not
description: As Akai Gurley left his girlfriends apartment in a Brooklyn housing project one November night two years ago, he tried to take an elevator to the street, but found that it was broken. Had it been working, Mr. Gurley might never have set foot into the stairwell where he died.

title: A Move to East Flatbush, Brooklyn
description: Five years ago, when Sara Grace Rimensnyder met Dan Cast, she was living in a small one-bedroom apartment on the fifth floor of a walk-up building on the Lower East Side of Manhattan.

title: How Hillary Clinton Became a Hawk
description: Hillary Clinton sat in the hideaway study off her ceremonial office in the State Department, sipping tea and taking stock of her first year on the job. The study was more like a den  cozy and wood-paneled, lined with bookshelves that displayed mementos from Clintons three decades in the public eye: a statue of her heroine, Eleanor Roosevelt; a baseball signed by the Chicago Cubs star Ernie Banks; a carved wooden figure of a pregnant African woman. The intimate setting lent itself to a less-formal interview than the usual locale, her imposing outer office, with its marble fireplace, heavy drapes, crystal chandelier and ornate wall sconces. On the morning of Feb. 26, 2010, however, Clinton was talking about something more sensitive than mere foreign affairs: her relationship with Barack Obama. To say she chose her words carefully doesnt do justice to the delicacy of the exercise. She was like a bomb-squad technician, deciding which color wire to snip without blowing up her relationship with the White House.

title: With Seattle Shelter Effort, Amazon Shows Glimmers of a Good Neighbor
description: SEATTLE  Amazons new urban headquarters  more than 30 office buildings and three towers that, once completed, will dominate a low-slung section of the city  are a gleaming symbol of boom times here. The tech giant has added 20,000 new jobs in Seattle and attracted other tech companies that want to rub elbows. Google plans to expand here as well, with four new buildings and perhaps 4,000 workers. Smaller start-ups dot old brick neighborhoods like Pioneer Square, and newer developments like South Lake Union, where Amazon is building.

title: Vancouver Prescriptions for Addicts Gain Attention as Heroin and Opioid Use Rises
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  Dave Napio started doing heroin over four decades ago, at 11 years old. Like many addicts these days, he heads to Vancouvers gritty Downtown Eastside neighborhood when he needs a fix.

title: Student Question | Is It Ethical to Genetically Engineer Animals?
description: New technologies have made genetically engineering animals relatively easy to accomplish. Salmon can be modified to grow faster. Mosquito genes can be edited to combat diseases like malaria and the Zika virus. Pigs can be altered so their organs might some day be transplanted to humans.

title: Chinas President, Xi Jinping, Gains a New Title: Commander in Chief
description: HONG KONG  A camouflage-clad President Xi Jinping appeared on Wednesday at the joint battle command center of Chinas Central Military Commission, where he urged officers to build a command system that was capable of winning wars, according to state news reports.

title: Tracy Chevaliers At the Edge of the Orchard and Jane Hamiltons The Excellent Lombards
description: It cant be great, even for a best-selling author, to find out that a second best-selling author has also written a new novel about a familys obsession with its apple orchard. Think of the potential for confusion. Or all the weak how do you like them apples jokes that might have to be endured at readings. But the latest Tracy Chevalier and Jane Hamilton novels, stylistically distinct, respectively, as plot-heavy historical fiction and leisurely evocative contemporary literature, form a complementary double feature. Paired, they make the case that the beautiful lunacy of trying to earn a living from the land hasnt changed all that much in the last two centuries.

title: Dodgers, by Bill Beverly
description: DODGERSBy Bill Beverly290 pp. Crown Publishers. $26.

title: Ask Well: The Best Way to Put Babies to Sleep
description: Question:

title: New York Today: Celebrating Irish History
description: Updated, 7:45 a.m.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Donald Trump, Harriet Tubman, Queen Elizabeth II
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Obama Reassures Persian Gulf Allies About Security
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  President Obama said on Thursday that the United States would continue to enhance security cooperation with its allies in the Persian Gulf, while encouraging them to carry out domestic reforms and bolster their ability to defend themselves.

title: Hillary Clinton to Discuss Gun Violence in Connecticut With Sandy Hook Families
description: Hillary Clintons focus on gun control will continue on Thursday when she heads to Connecticut to meet with families of victims of the Sandy Hook shooting before the states primary next week.

title: A World of Flavor, Stuffed Into Tacos at El Molcajete
description: At El Molcajete, the tacos look like bouquets, brimming with cilantro, loosely bundled in paper sleeves twisted tight at one end and gaping at the mouth. They are heavy with meat: hanks of shredded barbacoa, dark and caramelly cecina, cabeza more a stage of melt than flesh.

title: Morning Agenda: Global Stock Rally
description: GLOBAL STOCK RALLY  | Stock, oil and steel prices were all on their way up for a fourth day on Thursday, as Bloomberg reports. European shares were up slightly ahead of the European Central Bank policy meeting, while Asia shares reached a four-month high.

title: Why Do Girls Tend to Have More Anxiety Than Boys?
description: The laid-back, underachieving boy; the hyperachieving, anxious girl. Over the three decades since I graduated from medical school, and especially over the past 10 years, this pattern has become increasingly common in my practice.

title: Chyna, Pro Wrestler Turned Reality TV Star, Is Dead at 46
description: Joanie Laurer, who studied Spanish literature and trained with the Peace Corps before gaining fame as the professional wrestler Chyna and as a reality-television star, was found dead on Wednesday at her home in Redondo Beach, Calif. She was 46.

title: Andy Cohen: By the Book
description: The talk-show host, producer and author of The Andy Cohen Diaries is a Fountainhead fan: I like to think of myself as a Howard Roark type, but then I realize Im the Housewives guy.

title: Letter of Recommendation: AstroTurf
description: On a lawn drawn long by sunset, who is not intoxicated? That cut-grass scent, cis-3-hexanol, is called leaf alcohol. You dont need to name it to know it, the wooziness of air strewn by a mower. Still, I love a lawn overgrown and skimmed by the wind. Liminal hours are the best to enjoy it: dawn, dusk. A great green floor, pinned by dandelion clocks.

title: What Chatbots Reveal About Our Own Shortcomings
description: Every so often, an idea comes along that mesmerizes Silicon Valley and convinces the most powerful people there that this innovation will irrevocably alter the course of humankind. Outsize proclamations are made, lavish events are held and millions of dollars in venture money are funneled into young, unproven companies. Right now, that fixation has landed on chatbots, little artificial-intelligence programs that work like personalized assistants.

title: How (and Where) to Celebrate the Queens 90th Birthday
description: London is a popular destination anytime, but this year there is even more of a reason to visit: the 90th birthday of Queen Elizabeth II. Though her birth date is April 21, the city is celebrating the occasion with events starting in May.

title: Cindy Sherman Takes On Aging (Her Own)
description: Tell me what to do, Cindy Sherman said, asking the photographer for guidance as she sat for her portrait. Her words seem almost comic, since she is posing in her own New York studio, staring out at her camera and the mirror she keeps perched beside it, and the one thing she has proved, across a career that turned 40 this year, is that she has known what to do in this setting.

title: How to Travel the Earth And Protect It, Too
description: We asked leading environmentalists how to plan a trip that wont wreck the earth. Here is what they told us.

title: Donald Trumps Campaign Evolution Might Take Some Time
description: Forcing change in Donald J. Trumps message, as his new advisers are trying to do, is likely to take some time.

title: First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  A Challenger Expresses His Gratitude
Chinas Dangerous Love Campaign, Warning of Spies, Is Met With Shrugs
description: BEIJING  Clutching a bouquet of red roses from the auburn-haired foreigner who has also showered her with wine and compliments, Ms. Li thinks to herself, Having a handsome, romantic, talented foreign boyfriend is pretty nice!

title: Brexits Threat to the Special Relationship
description: WASHINGTON  On June 23, Britons will go to the polls in a nationwide referendum on a single question: Should their country remain in the European Union or leave it? Their answer will determine government policy.

title: Leaders Roll Up Sleeves on Climate, but Experts Say Plans Dont Pack a Wallop
description: An airport hangar outside Paris shook with cheers, toasts and foot-stomping in December as diplomats ushered a landmark climate agreement into existence. On Friday morning, world leaders will gather again at the United Nations for a grand ceremony to sign the document.

title: North Korea Proposes Having 13 Defectors to the South Meet With Relatives
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea proposed on Thursday to send family members to meet with 13 North Korean restaurant workers who arrived in South Korea this month in what was described by the South as a rare group defection.

title: Pay Disparity in U.S. Soccer? Its Complicated
description: The United States womens national team sued U.S. Soccer for gender discrimination in federal court in March 2019, citing what the players said were pervasive inequalities in the treatment of their team and the mens national team. On Friday, a judge dismissed the players equal pay claims. This primer, from 2016, explains in broad terms (and using numbers from that time) the differing pay structures under which the teams are paid by U.S. Soccer.

title: Norman the Street Man
description: Dear Diary:

title: No Anonymity for Plaintiffs Suing Ashley Madison Over Hack, Judge Rules
description: Plaintiffs suing Ashley Madison, a popular online dating service, over a computer hacking attack that stole the personal data of millions of users will have to be publicly identified to proceed with the case, a federal judge ruled.

title: Fierce Bidding War Erupts for French Retailer Darty
description: LONDON  A frantic bidding war for the French electronics and appliance retailer Darty erupted on Thursday as the French unit of Steinhoff International Holdings and the French retailer Groupe Fnac both announced a series of sweetened offers for the company.

title: Buddy Check on 22! Veterans Use Social Media to Fight Suicide
description: Buddy check on 22! Where are my warriors?! That was how E. Michael Davis, a former Army sergeant, greeted his Facebook friends one afternoon last month.

title: Blackstone Profit Plummets in First Quarter
description: The Blackstone Group, the private equity giant, suffered a sharp 77 percent decline in its net income for the first quarter, as volatile market conditions kept the firm from unloading assets and cashing in rich performance fees.

title: Ted Cruz Was Wrong on Murders in New York, but Perception Is Hard to Shake
description: Ted Cruzs campaign was wrong last week in saying that New York City murders were up 10 percent. But it wasnt the first time, and surely wont be the last, that crime statistics for the city and elsewhere are misunderstood and misrepresented.

title: Lazards Revenue Declines in Quarter
description: Last years record in mergers and acquisitions may not yet be trickling into the coffers of advisory shops.

title: Damien Hirsts Art May Have Leaked Formaldehyde Fumes, Study Says
description: LONDON  The British artist Damien Hirst shot to fame, in part, through works that displayed sharks and other animals suspended in formaldehyde. Now, a report from a British scientific journal has found that some of those works may have leaked formaldehyde fumes at levels much higher than allowed.

title: Young Panthers, and Their Veteran Leader, Are on the Ascent
description: The first bus was to depart Barclays Center in 20 minutes late Wednesday night, but Jaromir Jagr lingered at his locker. The Florida Panthers were not leaving without him, and besides, he had something else he wanted to say.

title: Ownership Dispute Postpones Exhibitions of Nazi-era Dealers Art
description: BERLIN  Exhibitions at two museums of artworks amassed by a Nazi-era art dealer planned for later this year have been postponed because of a continuing legal dispute over the ownership of the 1,500-piece collection.

title: A Canopy Where Les Halles Once Reigned Gets Parisian Welcome
description: PARIS  Paris has never quite gotten over the destruction of Les Halles.

title: Biden Looks Back, Aspirations Intact
description: Having passed on the 2016 presidential race, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. watches the fight for the Democratic nomination with a mixture of longing and restlessness.

title: A Hot App Discovers Virality, and Its Downsides
description: Automating friendship may be a laudable goal, but that doesnt mean its going to be pretty.

title: Moving PDFs to a PC From an iPad
description: Q. Id like to move all the PDFs on my iPad over to my Windows computer. How would I do that?

title: Ecuadorean President on Quake Recovery
description: President Rafael Correa warned that the recovery from this weekend's earthquake would take years, calling it the country's worst natural disaster since the 1949 earthquake in Ambato.

title: Chinese Designers Haven
description: Han Fengs apartment is in the famous Jin Jiang Hotel complex, one of Shanghais premier residential addresses.

title: 1916: India Loyal to King-Emperor
description: LONDON  Of all the miscalculations the Germans have made in the present war, none could have been more egregious than their conviction that India would seize the opportunity of Britains involvement in a European war to rise in revolt against the British Raj; no disappointment greater than the realization that the Indians, on the contrary, should prove so magnificently loyal to their King-Emperor.The New York Herald, European Edition, April 22, 1916

title: Truth and Reconciliation in Indonesia
description: Indonesias symposium this week to discuss the mass killings that took place during anti-Communist purges in 1965 and 1966 marked an important first step toward national healing. The government of President Joko Widodo deserves praise for its willingness, at last, to confront the past. What needs to follow is a process that will bring the guilty to justice, encourage national reconciliation and ensure that such horrors never again occur.

title: Utahs War on Pornography Finds Skeptics
description: The governor of Utah signed two pieces of legislation in recent weeks in an effort to portray pornography as a public health crisis akin to alcohol and tobacco.

title: Ruling on Pension Fund Debt Could Shake Up Private Equity Industry
description: Libby Lewis is a journalist who has written about the private equity industry for the Edmond J. Safra Center for Ethics at Harvard.

title: Tribeca Interview: Tom Hiddleston
description: If youre looking for a project with Tom Hiddleston in it at the moment, you dont have to look far. Currently on the big screen, hes playing Hank Williams in the biopic I Saw the Light. Currently on the small screen, he plays the hotel manager Jonathan Pine in the mini-series adaptation of John le Carrs The Night Manager. And coming to screens both big and small, hes playing Dr. Robert Laing in the film adaptation of the satirical J. G. Ballard Novel High-Rise. That film, which imagines an apartment building where the wealthy get the best views and services and the poor are relegated to lower floors, is at the Tribeca Film Festival now, and will be on demand April 28 and in theaters May 13.

title: Anohni: Embracing a New Name, and Sound
description: Anohni  the songwriter and singer formerly known as Antony Hegarty  decided a few years ago to utterly transform the sound and message of her music. She had built an international career in the realm of art-pop as the leader of Antony and the Johnsons, singing sustained, vulnerable, imagistic chamber-pop ballads to an audience that hung on every vulnerable word. But in six years between studio albums, she not only renamed herself with what she calls her spirit name but also set herself on a stark new artistic course.

title: Metropolitan Museum of Art Plans Job Cuts and Restructuring
description: The last couple of years have been ambitious ones for the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Perhaps too ambitious.

title: Wondering What Caused the Cancer
description: But what caused it? my patient asked, referring to the failure of her bone marrow to make the blood cells the rest of her organs craved. She was profoundly anemic and seemed to tire from even asking the question.

title: SunEdison Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Protection
description: SunEdison, which started out making chemicals and components for solar modules but grew into a giant of renewable energy, has filed for bankruptcy protection, the company said on Thursday. The filing, under Chapter 11 in the Southern District of New York, brings to an end the companys ambition to become the worlds leading renewable energy development business.

title: Conor McGregor Says He Isnt Retiring From the U.F.C. After All
description: Actually, Conor McGregor has not retired.

title: Quiz: Is Your Shakespeare Sharper Than a Serpent's Tooth?
description: Shakespeare shuffled off his mortal coil 400 years ago this weekend. As the world prepares to celebrate the anniversary, test your knowledge of the Bard with this quiz.

title: In Spain, Catching Up With Cervantes
description: MADRID  Two giants of Western literature, William Shakespeare and Miguel de Cervantes, are being honored this weekend in their native countries on the 400th anniversaries of their deaths.

title: A Marriage Gone Bad: Walgreens Struggles to Shake Off Theranos
description: Many boldface names enabled the stratospheric rise of the blood-testing start-up Theranos: two former secretaries of state, a former secretary of defense, two former senators, a retired admiral, venture capitalists, scientific luminaries and a prestigious clinic.

title: In Pennsylvania, Obscure Job of G.O.P. Delegate Is Suddenly a Hot Ticket
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.  In any other election year, it would be a lot of trouble for very little payoff.

title: Tinkering With Nature: Weighing the Benefits and Risks of Genetically Engineering Animals
description: Within the past few years scientists have revolutionized genetic engineering techniques so that now, with relative ease, they can precisely edit the genetic coding of animals more-or-less on demand. What once took decades or longer through selective breeding is now nearly instantaneous. Researchers have already produced salmon that grow faster and beef cattle with larger muscles (and therefore more meat).

title: 20 Wines Under $20
description: Eric Asimov picks 20 spring bottles, all under $20.

title: 20 Wines for Under $20: The Spring Edition
description: Few things are more important to wine drinkers than value, but value can mean different things to different people.

title: Donald Trump Says Transgender People Should Use the Bathroom They Want
description: Donald J. Trump said Thursday that transgender people should be allowed to use whatever bathroom they feel most comfortable with  including at Trump Tower in New York.

title: 1966: Artificial Heart Works
description: HOUSTON  Dr. Michael DeBakey today [April 21] successfully implanted an artificial heart in a 65-year-old coal miner near death and gave him a chance for life in a medical triumph. The famed surgeon resorted to hand massage of the exposed heart of Marcel L. De Rudder when his heart suddenly failed during the six-hour ordeal. A standard heart-lung machine also was used as technicians battled to adjust the flow of blood through the artificial heart. The patient was wheeled from the operating room with the artificial heart still working. Physicians said it could remain in him a week or a month. The operation went much as I hoped and planned, Dr. DeBakey said afterward. He looked tired in his white surgical smock. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, April 22, 1966

title: 1968 | We Need a Jewish Mother in the White House
description: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine was not the first political leader to briefly persuade The New York Times that he was who he wasnt. In 2008, for instance, Mayor Bertrand Delano of Paris had a letter published in The Times.

title: Foxes That Endure Despite a Lack of Genetic Diversity
description: The Channel Islands, off the coast of Southern California, are a natural laboratory for a particularly adorable experiment in evolution.

title: $10 Billion Loan to Saudi Arabia Carries Risks
description: Bankers should be punching the air. Saudi Arabia is close to agreeing to terms on a $10 billion loan with a syndicate of banks including JPMorgan, HSBC and Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi. Normally, getting the nod to lend to Saudi Arabia, the Middle Easts largest holder of crude oil reserves, for the first time in 25 years would be easy money. But banks may be ignoring the risks.

title: Volkswagen Reaches Deal in U.S. Over Emissions Scandal
description: Volkswagen agreed on Thursday to fix or buy back nearly 500,000 diesel cars in the United States that are equipped with illegal emissions software.

title: Whole Foods Says Customer Faked Anti-Gay Cake Slur
description: A public feud between Whole Foods and a customer who accused the store of scrawling an anti-gay slur on his cake escalated this week with dueling lawsuits, inspiring hundreds of online sleuths to debate the clues in security footage and in the hand-lettered icing.

title: Dish Network and Viacom Sign a Deal, Ending a Standoff
description: Dish Network wanted its MTV after all.

title: Video Review: After Some Mud Wrestling, the Best S.U.V.s Emerge
description: Thinking about buying a sport utility vehicle or crossover? Get in line. According to IHS Automotive, the segment outsold sedans in the United States last year. Now, you could buy a station wagon (they handle more like sports sedans because of their lower center of gravity) or a minivan, but buyers have voted for crossovers with their checkbooks. Cheap gas helps.

title: Drug-Smuggling Tunnel, Found in San Diego, Is Longest Yet
description: For all the talk about a wall between the United States and Mexico, the problem with border security continues to be as much below ground as above. On Wednesday, officials in San Diego announced the discovery of another cross-border tunnel built by drug smugglers  the longest one found yet, at about half a mile.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | The Meddler
description: Lorene Scafaria narrates a sequence from her film featuring Susan Sarandon and Rose Byrne.

title: Wall St. Regulators Propose Stricter Pay Rules for Bankers
description: Regulators released long-awaited rules on Thursday morning that aim to restrict how big financial institutions can pay their top executives.

title: Never Too Old to Hurt From Parents Divorce
description: In the room that would be the scene of Lisa Georges divorce in 2012, Ms. George, now 59, was seated on the same side of the table as her about-to-be-ex-husband. Each of their divorce lawyers slid into seats across from them.

title: How Do You Say Caucus in Spanish?
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this article, Elias E. Lopez, editorial director of The New York Times en Espaol, explains how his team in Mexico City translates United States politics for a Latin American and Spanish audience.

title: The Woman in Her Mirror
description: Geri Taylor didn't recognize the face looking back at her. It was just one sign that something was going wrong.

title: Lorene Scafaria Narrates a Scene From The Meddler
description: The writer and director Lorene Scafaria tapped into her real-life relationship with her mother for the comedy The Meddler, starring Susan Sarandon as Marnie, a widow who moves to Los Angeles to be closer to her daughter (Rose Byrne). In this comic scene, the mother crosses one too many of the daughters boundaries. During a recent interview in New York, Ms. Scafaria explained how her relationship with her mother led to the film. Here are edited excerpts from that conversation.

title: Online Media Is Tested When Social Platforms Come to Town
description: Online media companies are, once again, bracing for change. Now, the prospect facing them is audiences that dont just start on social media platforms  they never have to leave them.

title: Review: Casting Nina Was Controversial, but Is It a Good Movie?
description: One night, Nina Simone, the great jazz singer, composer and pianist, now semiretired on the French Riviera, calls up her old friend Richard Pryor. Its the 1990s, and both of them have seen better days. His first words to her are Can you imagine?, and while hes referring to his own struggles with addiction and illness, his question haunts Nina, a sincere and spectacularly misbegotten new biopic.

title: A Bittersweet Passover: Cancer, Remission and Change
description: Despite good news about my cancer treatment, it has been a hard winter, so I am looking forward to Passover. By retelling the story of the Jewish peoples escape from slavery in Egypt, the Haggadah  the text recited at the annual Seder  celebrates deliverance and springtime renewal. How would its rituals and prayers resonate for me this year, when cancer concerns were unexpectedly supplanted by other tribulations?

title: Two Rising Chefs Enjoy a Busy Reunion at Houseman
description: A Prune reunion took place downtown on Wednesday.

title: A Revival in Pueblo, Colo.
description: To the Editor:

title: Iran Accuses U.S. of Theft in $2 Billion Court Ruling for Terror Victims
description: Iran reacted furiously on Thursday to a United States Supreme Court ruling that Irans central bank must pay nearly $2 billion to American victims of terrorist attacks, calling the ruling thievery and a new threat to any improvement in relations.

title: Virgin Mary Statue, Intact Among Ecuadors Quake Ruins, Becomes a Beacon of Hope
description: MONTECRISTI, Ecuador  The earth shook and the steeple fell, taking most of the bell tower with it. A white facade gave way, leaving the pews open to the street.

title: At Last, Jeremy Lin Settles Into Identity of His Own Making
description: MIAMI  Over the past five years, Jeremy Lin has felt multiple disparate identities foisted upon him: undrafted underdog, franchise savior, overpaid mercenary. None quite fit.

title: Newly Appointed N.J. Transit Chief Wont Take the Job
description: Nearly two weeks after New Jersey Transit named a new executive director, state officials said on Thursday that the appointee, a former Amtrak official, had decided not to take the job.

title: My Mothers Make-Believe Boyfriend
description: My mothers brain has been melting since she had a serious stroke a year and a half ago, and if I had to map it, Id say the major territories now are pastrami, kittens, egg rolls and, lately, a man in her nursing home unit well call Sam.

title: Speed Reading Does Work
description: To the Editor:

title: Prince, an Artist Who Defied Genre, Is Dead at 57
description: Prince, the songwriter, singer, producer, one-man studio band and consummate showman, died on Thursday at his home, Paisley Park, in Chanhassen, Minn. He was 57.

title: Donald Trumps Team Courts Members of Congress
description: Donald J. Trumps campaign continued its outreach to Congress on Thursday, promising that the Republican candidate would become more presidential and organized as he lurches closer to the nomination.

title: A Welcome and Overdue Change to the $20 Bill
description: The Treasury Departments new plan to place a portrait of Harriet Tubman on the new $20 bill and keep Alexander Hamilton on the $10 bill is the right call. Now it needs to make sure the change happens as quickly as feasible. The country has waited long enough to have a woman on the currency.

title: A Wifes Own Success
description: To the Editor:

title: On Factory Farms, Chickens and Workers Alike Suffer
description: To the Editor:

title: Hillary Clinton Enjoys Commanding Lead in Maryland, Poll Shows
description: Hillary Clinton is well positioned to win Marylands Democratic primary election next week, according to a new poll that shows her holding big leads with every voting group in the state.

title: Sleek, Simple Backpacks for Spring
description: New carryalls in caramel and tan that are light enough for the season.

title: Museum of Modern Art Receives $100 Million From David Geffen
description: David Geffen has again reached into his ample coffers to bestow $100 million on a cultural institution  this time the Museum of Modern Art for its $440 million expansion and renovation project  in a gift announced on Thursday.

title: Shakespeares Deleted Scenes
description: To mark the 400th anniversary of Shakespeares death, The New York Times asked four contemporary writers to envision lost and rebooted scenes from some of the playwrights works.

title: Kurds and Syrian Forces Clash, Adding Wrinkle to War
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Amid renewed fighting across Syria on Thursday, clashes broke out between Kurdish militias and Syrian government forces, potentially opening a new front in the already complex conflict.

title: With Uncertainty at Top of Ticket, Republicans Back Off in Some States
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla.  The Republican National Committee is scaling back its financial commitments to some of the most hotly contested states because of flagging fund-raising, the most concrete evidence yet of how the partys divisive and protracted presidential race is threatening the partys entire ticket in November.

title: A High-Fat Diet May Lead to Daytime Sleepiness
description: Eating a high-fat diet may lead to daytime sleepiness, a new study concludes.

title: Role Reversal
description: Jim Taylor onstage in Henri. He regarded the performance as a play, not a preview of what was to come for his wife.

title: A Salutary Diversion
description: While Ms. Taylor was in Las Vegas, she escaped its rocket-fueled pace by visiting the Hoover Dam.

title: The Specter of Memory Loss
description: Ms. Taylor speaks on her fear of forgetting names and faces, and the heartache it will cause her family.

title: Prince: In Memoriam
Koch-Backed Group Breaks Up Its Intelligence Unit
description: The conservative political network created by the billionaire brothers Charles G. and David H. Koch has broken up its opposition-research unit in the last few weeks, a spokesman for the group confirmed on Thursday, describing it as an efficiency measure.

title: Share Your Memories of Prince
description: What was your favorite Prince concert? Which of his songs cycles through your playlists?

title: Empire Season 2, Episode 14: Lucious the Schemer
description: Empire is beginning to address some of its biggest mysteries in the second half of Season 2. Last week dramatized the transformation of the innocent young Dwight Walker into the ruthless orphan tycoon Lucious Lyon, and this week we find out that this mother didnt die as weve been led to believe. This is probably very bad news for Lucious, who is coasting into the hearts of the ASA voting board off the strength of a touching video about her death. We find out she is alive when Luciouss henchman Thirsty Rawlings pays her nursing home a visit. Is Lucious keeping tabs to keep a lie about her death under wraps?

title: Long Primary Carries Costs for Hillary Clinton: Money and Time
description: Hillary Clinton has burned through tens of millions of dollars to counter Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont in states that are unlikely to be general election battlegrounds, delaying any pivot to the general election and shrinking her potential financial advantage over the eventual Republican nominee.

title: Prince, Onstage and On the Town
description: Prince was known for his larger-than-life presence.

title: Prince in The Times
description: Prince was a prolific artist with a career that began in the late 1970s with the release of the album For You. He shattered stereotypes on race and sexuality throughout his career.

title: New York Hospital to Pay $2.2 Million Over Unauthorized Filming of 2 Patients
description: NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital has agreed to pay a $2.2 million penalty to federal regulators for allowing television crews to film two patients without their consent  one who was dying, the other in significant distress. Regulators said on Thursday that the hospital allowed filming to continue even after a medical professional asked that it stop.

title: An Ode to the Purple One: Princes Most Memorable Albums
description: Prince released music steadily from 1978 on, making for one of the most daring, radical and inventive catalogs in all of pop. Here are five of his finest albums, released at turning-point moments in his career, that show the artist, who was found dead, at 57, on Thursday, in his fullness: a cunning vocalist, a fiery musician, and a peerless songwriter and producer.

title: The Key Players in Climate Change
description: World leaders are gathering Friday to sign the Paris Agreement on climate change. Heres a status report on the key players and their efforts to slow greenhouse gas emissions.

title: A Shakespeare Anniversary Brings Pomp and Plays to Stratford-upon-Avon
description: STRATFORD-UPON-AVON, England  George Bernard Shaw once mocked what he called bardolatry, but worship of William Shakespeare is in full swing here, as well it should be, since this pretty town pretty much exists on the Shakespeare industry.

title: Muslims, Christians and Mozart: Seeking Harmony at the Met Opera
description: When the curtain goes up on Mozarts Die Entfhrung aus dem Serail (The Abduction From the Seraglio), we are on the Mediterranean coast in the Ottoman Empire, at a palace where European captives are being held as slaves by a Muslim pasha. When the Ottoman Turkish overseer, Osmin, enters and sings about his rage against the Christian prisoners, he fantasizes about hanging them, impaling them on hot stakes and beheading them.

title: Veep and Game of Thrones Echo Our Politics, as Farce and Tragedy
description: In Sundays season premiere of HBOs Veep, Selina Meyer (Julia Louis-Dreyfus) is locked in a cliffhanger electoral-college tie, girding for a recount in Nevada and facing the possibility that Congress may give the presidency to her running mate and frenemy, Tom James (Hugh Laurie). But her more immediate problem is appearing in public with an enormous stress pimple on her face.

title: Global Warming Feels Quite Pleasant
description: CHRISTMAS in New York was lovely this year  especially for those who prefer to spend the day working on their tans. It was the citys warmest ever, with temperatures peaking at 66 degrees.

title: Periods in Space Are Not That Different, Though a Bit More Complicated
description: With more than 50 women having flown in space over the last 50 years and the ranks of women astronauts growing, one might assume that a basic physiological question has been answered: Whats the best approach to manage menstrual cycles in space?

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Behind the Wall of Candy

title: Pete Voelkers Political Photos
description: The photographer has traveled the country photographing small, human moments amid big, charged events, like activist rallies and campaign stops.

title: How Officials Distorted Flints Water Testing
description: Officials used flawed testing methods, making the levels of lead in the water supply appear far less dangerous than they were.

title: Review: Knausgaard Becomes a Writer in a Sick, Crooked World
description: Some writers, like locksmiths, wield a master key with which they attempt to open lifes mysteries. The Norwegian writer Karl Ove Knausgaard seems instead to carry a million tiny keys on a chain that does not oppress him. Patiently, with no pretense, he unlocks one safe deposit box of memory and emotion after another  safe deposit boxes youd forgotten youd owned.

title: A Photographer Who Captures the Humanity in Politics
description: The photographer Pete Voelker has a widely diverse portfolio: Hes shot everything from portraits of musicians to still lifes to reportage, and his most recent work has taken him all over the country documenting political rallies and the presidential campaign trail. Photography acts as a vessel for me, Voelker says. When I was younger, it was the only excuse I had to pack up and drive across the country or go on any sort of aimless adventure to see something new. Taking photographs is always the objective, but the journey to create photographs and the conversations with people along the way are what drive me as a photographer.

title: Womens Portraits on Our Currency
description: To the Editor:

title: Comedy Listings for April 22-28
description: A selected guide to stand-up, improv and comedy shows in New York City.

title: Movie Listings for April 22-28
description: A guide to movies playing at theaters in the New York City area, as well as select festivals and film series.

title: Four Days in Japan With the Designer Gabriela Hearst
description: She feted her latest offering at Barneys and stopped by local shops.

title: A (Very Quick) Trip to Tokyo With Gabriela Hearst
description: When the designer Gabriela Hearst first went to Tokyo in 2007, she says she felt immediately at home.
